Review: you always have be careful the first official studio release out of the gate each year they are obviously films for the studios have no great hopes having missed both the deadline for academy award eligibility and the big boxoffice holiday season combine that howie longs first starring action role and you have got doozy of movie that while not as bad as it could have been is not very good howie stars as an ace smokejumper firefighter who parachutes into forest fires unreachable from the ground in the slightly contrived opening scenes we witness his heroism in action as he and his mentor played scott glenn attempt rescue small girl and her dog from an oncoming forest fire william forsythe plays the bad guy mass murderer who has several million dollars tucked away help fund his jailbreak he and five convict cohorts manages get selected for firefighting duty when woodland blaze just happens ignite nearby his escape plan bets lot on the laxity of the guards but since there must be movie luck is him soon the nowescaped convicts are masquerading as canadian firefighters why canadian who knows eh along the way they pick up pretty birdwatcher suzy amis be their hostage enter howie long he is called in help fight the blaze and when he spots the group of ground pounders apparently lost he parachutes in help when he discovers their true identity he is the only thing standing between them and escape and the only hope of help for the hostage longs acting talents are above those of say steven seagal but not much although his delivery is mostly flat and wooden he is likeable hero and there are some hints here and there that he may get better the script does not help him out any however all too often it veers into the realm of the unintentionally funny the dialogue is strictly bmovie material and the plotting relies too heavily on coincidences be believable longs costars are mixed bag at least they are all comfortable in their respective roles forsythe has the scenerychewing villain down cold down cold and scott glenn is always enjoyable watch even when he does not seem be stretching his talents as is definitely the case here suzy amis plays peril pretty well but is not given much more do some of the nature and wildfire shots are interesting but many are rather bland you would think that the director dean semler former cinematographer would at least produce interesting visuals that is not the case there is lack of originality nearly all the sequences we have seen this stuff before it is not the most auspicious start but it could have been worse just think back debut biodome however after month of oscarcaliber pictures movie like firestorm at least gives you some perspective on how good those movies really were in fact there is good chance that some of them are still playing near you

synopsis easilyangered chainsmoking architect david encounters his homicidal first wife diedre five years after their divorce diedre easily cons davids notsobright new wife molly into believing she is child psychologist so that she can influence molly and davids quicktempered son michael diedre at the same time murders bunch of people comments the ex is very bad movie have not seen turkey of this magnitude in quite while kept vacillating however between giving the ex one star for its sheer awfulness and three stars for its campy humor ultimately decided split the difference and give it two stars as summarized briefly in the synopsis this is yet another spurnedpsycholovergetsherrevenge type movie am not sure how many films have been produced since fatal attraction use this tired storyline but it seems like the ex however though following many of the standard cliches of this thriller subgenre differs slightly from the norm in that at least it does not take itself too seriously like so many other duds do malicious and stalked are two examples come mind those involved in the movie realize they are in turkey apparently and turn in hammy performances compliment the ludicrous dialogue contained within the script the exs storyline as said incorporates many cliches predominant in films of its nature however the plot is so overwrought and unbelievable that after while the viewer must accept that logic does not operate in the realm of the movie diedre davids first wife kills and kills and kills for example without ever having worry about police investigations and the like it is not as though she is bright enough not leave fingerprints at the scene of the crime david and his new wife molly have an incredibly difficult time understanding why michael their son has emotional problems specifically his inability control his anger though david smokes like tomorrow will never come and blows up at people every other minute in the movie the connection between him and his son is not made molly is easily swayed diedre into believing she is child psychologist and allows the demented woman spend time her son time and time again things do not add up in this movie if viewer cannot accept this fact then he will definately not like the ex if on the other hand he can appreciate the movie for its campiness then he will probably like it much better do not mean necessarily suggest however that the ex is memorable exercise in camp even when viewed from an it issobadit isgood angle this movie is not all that successful the ex does have its moments though almost all of involve yancy butler the psychotic diedre and nick mancuso david these two actors turn in decidedly hammy performances oftentimes elicit chuckles from the audience the truly awful lines written for them help this humor along butler gets the larger portion of bad dialogue every time her character kills someone she has punchline that is unbelievably inane when she murders tenant of an apartment she wishes use spy on david for example diedre whacks the elderly lady crowbar and states am so sorry your lease is terminated or how about when diedre takes out her therapist in another ridiculous scene diedres therapist wishes have her recommitted so she decides visit diedre alone in her new apartment never realizing of course that it is not hers therapists typically are catatonically braindead in these movies having successfully snuffed the woman out diedre looks at the body and says what was it that you always said me at the end of each session dr jones oh that is right am sorry but your time is up this is what passes for humor in the the audience does not necessarily laugh but groan the type of groan that suggests the audience cannot believe they are watching this crap although watching it they are nick mancuso as chainsmoking nervouswreck character does not have the cheesy lines that butlers character delivers but his ridiculously overdone performance provides for some better comic relief in between drags off his cigarette for instance in one of the movies best scenes david tries explain his lawyer what creep his exwife is in exaggerated exasperation he nearly shouts the woman is cuckoobird trust me it is funny in context and so the movie continues until its painfully obvious conclusion will not reveal the ending specifically though anyone remotely familiar thrillers of this type could probably guess the ending just from this review but will say that the ex has one of the biggest fire hazards appearing recently in molly and david own cabin that becomes engulfed flames in approximately three seconds molly at one point in the notsobrilliantly observes after discovering diedre has moved into an apartment across from her familys spy upon them that she is crazy you would be pretty crazy too if you would rented this turkey would avoid it unless it is on tv and you come across it if you do you may want watch it groan at the bad punchlines and stupid plot and feel good that you did not spend money renting it

the blues brothers was wonderful hilarious comedy packed good music it cried out for sequel but john belushis untimely death seemed eliminate the idea however eighteen years have passed and the long dormant sequel has finally emerged unfortunately it is sequel not worthy of the original the starts exactly eighteen years after the first one ended elwood blues dan aykroyd is just getting out of jail his brother jake having recently died as in the first he first visits mother mary stigmata kathleen freeman and then sets about getting the band back together john belushis absence leaves terrible hole in the and although three new characters are created fill the void it is still very noticeable first there is cabel joe morton the illegitimate son of elwoods stepfather played cab calloway in the first movie cabel is reluctant join his destiny and spends most of the movie as an illinois sheriff chasing the blues brothers band next there is mighty mack john goodman bartender who becomes the new lead singer of the band finally there is buster evan bonifant ten year old orphan who tags along elwood and eventually joins the band the plotting of the is hardly original it seems be almost clone of the original elwood has go reluctantly retrieve each member of the band they then travel while being pursued the police and perform at several odd stops until they finally reach the big concert finale the first had neonazis as the random element this time around the russian mafia and militia group fill their role in fact the duplication of the plot is so ridiculously complete that certain scenes are practically identical the original remember the classic performance at country bobs where they like both types of music country and western from the first movie well this movie has performance at country fair where the band is expected play bluegrass music there is the massive police car pileup although this time the gag falls completely flat there is even an exact replica of the conversion scene in the church of reverend cleophus james brown there are plenty of recurring characters too in addition mother stigmata and reverend cleophus aretha franklin reprises her role as mrs murphy frank oz prison guard in the first makes an appearance here as the prison warden as the stars the new blues brothers do not live up their legacy aykroyd is more loquacious yet much flatter as elwood john goodman barely has character as mighty mack joe morton has the deepest character but not terribly interesting one as cab and what is the deal the orphan it plays like desperate gimmick that does not mesh at all the rest of the at least bonifant is not as precocious as he could have been in the role but the true star and the only saving grace of the is the music and the is packed it even during and after the ending credits although there are no brilliant mergers of comedy and song as in the originals rawhidestand your man medley the music is very much enjoyable top it off the is packed the gills cameo musician appearances b king blues traveler eric clapton travis tritt wilson pickett erykah badu bo diddley and steve winwood are just sampling of the multitude of stars that make an appearance here and there unfortunately the music pauses here and there allow in the familiar plot if simply copying the original blues brothers was not bad enough writers aykroyd and john landis dumb it down removing any memorable characters and replacing them flashy but unbelievable magical gimmicks it is shame buy the soundtrack and avoid the better yet rewatch the original you will have much better time

michael crichton has had long career of writing novels many of are science fiction the most profitable adaptation of any novel was an adaptation of michael crichton science fiction novel so in the logic of the industry good way make profitable would be make bigbudget adaptation of another crichton science fiction novel congo failed and am afraid that sphere is probably not going fare whole lot better it little better than just okay novel and it makes that is not even that good the is expensive over one hundred million dollars is long minutes has terrific cast including dustin hoffman samuel jackson and sharon stone but has little that is really original and less that is exciting several years ago dr norman goodman played dustin hoffman was asked write up set of procedures for the government follow if an alien entity was actually encountered the plan he wrote was only semiserious but did explicitly define team of experts who should investigate the alien now that team has been assembled mysterious team leader named barnes peter coyote study spacecraft almost half mile in length that apparently dropped into the pacific ocean in the early suddenly normans less than serious procedure has become an action plan for dealing real alien spacecraft included in the team investigate are mathematician harry adams samuel jackson biologist beth halperin sharon stone and astrophysicist ted fielding liev schreiber together they travel the deep pacific spaceship understand its secrets one major secret is the meaning of the huge sphere of goldtoned liquid metal at the heart of this spaceship what is disappointing about this is that it does not have really effective performances director barry levinson is at his best good actors rather than good special effects the problem here is he is making bigbudget science fiction it has some effects but the most intriguing effect he shows only as an outline on radar screen the technique is suggest rather than show and let the actors and the viewers imagination carry the as robert wise did the haunting that could be reasonable approach in lowbudget but that requires creating much more atmosphere than levinson can manage muster it requires the actors give really compelling performances and simply put they do not hoffmans acting seems muted jackson seems laid back we do not feel for these characters and do not get inside their heads levinson paid big bucks for his actors and does not really get price performance and why we have queen latifah as minor functionary on the expedition is anybodys guess cast of unknowns could have delivered as much emotional impact at fraction of the price look how much more powerful like alien was only moderate actors most science fiction spectaculars these days have secondtier actors and firsttier special effects levinson tries secondtier effects and firsttier actors but never makes that exchange pay off for the viewer perhaps scifi spectaculars are just not an actors medium the result gets on the scale and on the scale

american pie is filled laughs but they are mostly cheap ones built primarily upon sexual degradation and adolescent humor more fit for locker room than movie theater am no prude and admit laughing along everyone else at the preview screening this sequel the hit comedy but the laughs are built on discomfort and embarrassment not on any intrinsic humor from within the story itself what separates american pie from its predecessor is heart of the original noted it was warm pleasant outing about the travails of growing up well the quartet of chums jim jason biggs oz chris klein kevin thomas ian nicholas and finch eddie kaye thomas have grown up at least they are year older but do not seem any wiser fresh from their first year of college the quartet along the obnoxious stifler seann william scott rent summer house the lake in order attract girls in an attempt score as usual nothing goes right until the last reel but what we are left is five guys spending nearly two hours drooling over various young women and american pie is rather degrading women for the most part they are not shown as individuals they are nothing more than potential recipients of overactive raging hormones it is telling that the most normal couple oz and heather mena suvari spend the bulk of the trying have phone sex she is overseas on an exchange student program despite having been college jim is still klutzy and awkward unsure of himself around the opposite sex most of the pratfalls and humiliations are heaped upon him including painful episode involving an instant gluelike substance also uncomfortable watch is sequence involving three of the lads two young women roommates whom the boys suspect of being lesbians it is offensive and plays upon outdated adolescent stereotypes generate laughs the first despite some raunchy moments had an innocent charm it the sequel is more cynical it knows what its predominantly male audience members want and unabashedly gives it them the many mentions of finchs encounter stiflers mom becomes tiresome running gag throughout as does eugene levys return as jims wellmeaning tryingtobehip dad the only performer who is actually given some new fresh material is alyson hannigan as michelle the band geek from the original in the sequel she imbues her character vulnerability wisdom and maturity american pie is presold commodity that will earn several million at the box office it is shame though that in its rush rake in some bucks screenwriter adam herz who also penned the original could not have set his sights higher american pie is funny but it is still comedown as well as letdown

well what are you going expect it is movie about big snake that eats people that is what should have been thinking when viewed this because maybe then would have enjoyed myself more instead ended up wishing giant snake would come along and eat me too anaconda is about documentary crew sailing down south american river led anthropologists dr steven cale eric stolz and terri flores jennifer lopez the crew is attempting locate lost tribe of natives along the way they find poacher paul sarone jon voight and become unwillingly embroiled in his quest capture the elusive anaconda simply say that this is the worlds largest snake would not be doing it justice since the anaconda in this movie is at least two feet wide if this is not good reason avoid picking up hitchhikers do not know what is at the beginning of anaconda we find that flores and cale have had some kind of relationship in the past but that seems be more or less over now expected that fact play key part somewhere down the line but it ended up being setup for nothing cale chokes on deadly wasp do not ask me how that happens do not know and is put out of action relegated being the person whom the rest of the crew must get back civilization for medical help this minimally helps add sense of urgency for the plot since this goal now comes in direct conflict sarones plan capture the snake however this is negated the fact that cale seems get better himself about halfway through the and in any event still results in zero payoff from the relationship angle most bad characters are either annoying or stupid in this movie they are both since this description applies all the characters except sarone it is hard find someone root for you are supposed back the good guys but you really end up cheering for sarone because he is smarter than everyone else or maybe he is just not as dumb as everyone else at times almost found myself rooting for the snake there are no standout performances here everyone seems be reciting lines written for stock characters even voight appears be doing his best impression of christopher walken for some reason no matter as in most monster movies the snake is supposed be the real star anyway in most of the scenes the snake is computer generated and the effects crew did decent job of making it look real however the realism is thrown off some pretty unrealistic occurrences sometimes for example the snake just moves too fast it catches guy jumping off of waterfall for crying out loud then there is another scene where the snake eats one of the characters and we see the snakes skin drawn so tightly over its prey that we can see the victims pained expression from within the snakes belly absolutely ridiculous testimony the films bad direction is the inclusion of scene early on the in the where we get see just how dangerous the mighty anaconda is in scene totally unrelated anything else we are witness the big snake winning showdown panther the anaconda wraps itself around the powerful feline as if it were stuffed animal and squeezes it so hard one of the panthers eyeballs pops out eeeewwwww above and beyond the sick factor however this scene surprised me because it actually showed the face of the snake before quarter of the movie had even passed in films like these sense of mystery surrounding the monster must be maintained if the characters are reacting something they fear more than see we as an audience must experience that feeling along them show us the monster early on is let us in on something the characters do not know about and therefore allow us get used the danger before the pivotal moment when man and beast have their climactic showdown in case like that the showdown just ends up being letdown when saw the snake for the first time decided give the the benefit of the doubt and assume that the snake saw was not the real danger this one was just decoy and there was actually bigger snake waiting make its appearance just when everyone thought they were safe no such luck okay maybe anaconda is actually decoy and there is really better movie waiting make its debut
this is extraordinarily horrendous and am not going waste any more words on it

midway through anaconda documentary filmmaker terri flores jennifer lopez turns coworker and says thought this movie would be my first big break instead it is turned into disaster truer words have never been spoken anaconda is monster movie lousy monster it is suspense that is utterly predictable it is mess the does manage drum up some scares but only in the most elementary way like jackinthebox as you turn the crank you are totally aware that the damn clown is going pop up but somehow it is still mildly startling when it happens the main difference between the giant snake in anaconda and the clown in jackinthebox is that the clown is more realistic anaconda boasts some of the worst special effects appear onscreen in years animatronic shots of the snake look as phony as any of those cringe inducing robots you have endured at disney world but it is the computer animated scenes that truly expand the meaning of the word lame in one shot character tries flee from the monster diving from tree near waterfall but the giant snake springs out and loops around its hapless victim in mid air the scene if done well would have been jaw dropper here the horribly bad digital effects look less convincing than saturday morning cartoon what is really amazing is that the filmmakers were so proud of this dreadful shot that they actually included it in the promotional trailers for the movie but enough about the phony snakes now it is time talk about the lousy story heroic and very pale anthropologist eric stoltz leads documentary crew down brazilian river in search of the shirishama indians legendary tribe that supposedly lives in the boondocks of the rain forest stoltz tells his crew pray that you did not forget your bug spray apparently the female crew members bathed in the stuff because they spend most of the wearing skimpy tops and short shorts no ill effect along the way the group rescues whackedout lapsed priest jon voight who claims know how find the shirishama within minutes they throw away all their plans and follow voight down tributary into the land of creepiness from that point on the is hodgepodge of scenes and shots ripped off from jaws and dead calm one of the oddest structural points of the is the handling of eric stoltz early in the story his character gets knocked into coma river insect and spends virtually the rest of the movie unconscious so why did they hire an actor of the caliber of stoltz for what amounts cameo appearance also why did stoltz who generally selects his roles great care agree appear in this crap ah the mysteries of the remaining crew members are basically just snake food waiting happen jonathan hyde is mildly diverting as pompous englishman hired narrate the documentary but lopez and ice cube manage rise above their cardboard characters lopez who starred in selena is an enormously appealing performer possessing vibrancy that makes even the most trite lines seem credible ice cube has special charisma an ability look like macho adult and frightened boy simultaneously there is also special twinkle in his eyes as if he is gently mocking his own toughguy posturing but the movie really centers around the outrageously hammy performance of jon voight obsessed capturing one of the giant anacondas voight plays the villain in thick accent series of leers and hisses spouting the kind of dialogue usually heard only in episodes of jonny quest at one point he looms over the crew and says the anaconda is the perfect killing machine it strikes wraps around you holds you tighter than your true love and you get the privilege of hearing your bones break before the power of its embrace causes your veins explode that moment is so highcamp that it almost made the tolerable almost fans of the horror genre may be tempted check out anaconda do not there are lots of horror films scheduled for release this summer including another alien sequel wait for them rent jaws in the meantime and do not throw away your money and time on drivel like this

if the nostalgia did not make you feel old the nostalgia is bound one of the latter set the wedding singer seems be written someone who did not experience the directly but only read about them in an article in parade magazine the wacky fashions are here and the music and references aplenty celebrities and signs of the times but it all seems tediouslyand too obviouslyinserted for the did notwedressfunnybackthen chuckle the plot is standard romantic comedy nothing original robbie adam sandler is wedding singer julia drew barrymore waits tables at weddings both are engaged however robbies fiance angela featherstone dumps him at the altar and julias fiance matthew glave is skirtchasing speculator in junk bonds robbie and julia go through the expected upsanddowns as they realize they were meant be together will fess upi have never found adam sandler funny whatever his appeal is have missed it other comedians do not get include pauly shore and pee wee hermanmake your own judgments the stupidity and artificiality of the whole project is summarized in cameo billy idol as himself idol looks like hell and the ravages of his lifestyle are barely concealed thick makeup he is mocked photo of his younger self on rolling stone cover in the same scene we are not supposed notice that and we are not supposed notice how silly it is that billy idol suddenly appears play fairy godmother robbie other cameos steve buscemi and jon lovitz provide the only real laughs in the movie lovitz is especially good playing rival wedding singer plotting the mania of bond villain take advantage of robbies postbreakup depression

synopsis nice girl susanne has sex her boyfriend daniel in his car visits daniels rich family during thanksgiving at their mansion in the middle of nowhere and has sex daniel again in the basement susanne and daniel must then decide where hide from evil art thieves who shoot everyone else in the mansion steal paintings brace yourself for one of those painfully obvious surprise endings comments thanksgiving for most it is time be your loved ones and enjoy good homecooked meal for the makers of body count however thanksgiving is time for multiple murders violence profanity family dysfunction and sex boy do feel all the more better having sat through this crap alyssa milano the former child star of who is the boss matures madeforvideo sludge like this movie someone somewhere thought it would be great idea pair her rapper icet who has since gueststarred in the madeforthescifichannel series welcome paradox this is not exactly winning combination outside of permanently ruining holiday for me what else may be said for this turkey well it teaches us that beautiful attractive women who look strikingly like alyssa milano fall in love nerds who drive down long winding roads their eyes closed and complain about being english teachers it presents us heartwarming thanksgiving dinner attended alcoholic stuckup rich white people waited on black servants it shows us that old guys try not laugh sit around and talk about the appeal of postmodernism during their free time and it proves that you can have sex in your parents basement when they have dozen or so guests over and no one will notice before go any further if any young male reading this has hopes of seeing alyssa naked forget it the filmmakers cleverly shoot the simulated sex scenes in manner that makes sure you do not see any of milanos attributes they do however inexplicably throw in scene where icet whistles jingle bells after killing people for whatever that is worth this was originally titled below utopia perhaps they should have renamed it hell avoid this clunker

well lets see am not quite sure how review this based on its laughter factor well yeah can it is not funny ok so laughed one time warranted the star but other than that sat in my seat wondering when this pos would be over at running time of minutes seemed like forever in fact this could be the unfunniest movie have seen in long time if not the unfunniest let me be the first say ready rumble is huge disappointment long time wrestling lovers david and scott dream of making it the wcw and watching jimmy king wrestle that is their hero of course whom is kicked out of the wcw well here is where the plot thickens lol the two wish rescue the king and put him back into the wcw but not that easily because they are being tampered many people who are out get them while davids father wants him become police officer and scott is loser who has the help of david clean out johnny on the spots what plot eh ready rumble is one of those films that tries be funny but sadly fails miserably everything in the is imcomprehinsable and even the trailer was not funny the actors are dull the script awful and the plot there is not much of really annoying am not quite sure how great actors like these and very funny actors too are given such lame script and directed in such childish manner that wonder if is ever gonna make good films these days this review is not going be very long because of the fact that there is not much going for the if anything at all only one big laugh is in the is not all that hilarious sat in my chair wondering this minute comedy was going be over and sadly it went on forever am not sure if anything could have saved this from being such total waste but believe me you it is reviewed brandon herring for more reviews please visit movie review central at http www geocities commoviefanmoviereviewcentral html

years ago national lampoon introduced us new family the griswolds in the griswolds embarked on crosscountry journey the destination of wally world worldrenowned theme park in california we laughed our heads off as we shared the wild and crazy mishaps the family endured two years later we watched again as they went europe and four years after that we shared christmas them now eight more years have passed and the laughs have done more than die they have been cremated vegas vacation brings back chevy chase as clark griswold the good intentioned but illfated father of two the premise is basically the same clark has wonderful idea take his family on bonding vacation this time las vegas his wife ellen beverly dangelo and teenage kids rusty and audrey always played different actors this time around ethan embry and marisol nichols respectively join him and they soon find themselves in sin city where casinos will make the backdrop for ninety minutes of slapstick of course vacation movie would not be complete without good ole eddie reprised randy quaid the misfit cousin showing up at all the wrong times there is not too much of plot here when it comes right down it it is really just skit movie there are couple of ways define skit movie is not real term as far as know the first would be movie that basically has one running gag for two hours therefore coming off like two hour skit the second would be movie that seems comprised of about twenty shorter skits each lasting about five minutes vegas vacation comes off like the first good example of the latter would be last years black sheep the problem this format is that it becomes old fast and it does not really fit into movie mold in these cases plot is generally very thin is used either as shameless filler between scenes or simply add convenience the gags e have good vegas joke make vegas movie such is the case this movies miniplots clark gets gambling fever and begins spending all of the griswolds money ellen is on the verge of an affair wayne newton rusty has fake id and is using it his gambling advantage and audrey is desperate for fun and winds up joining her cousin vickie shae dlyn as an exotic dancer the simple fact is this movie is not funny at first did find myself chuckling heartily at couple of little jokes but when the movie got rolling my interest suddenly stopped chase plays clark griswold really well he made the character and he is the character dangelo be quite honest never was too impressive as ellen and this movie does not show any signs of redemption as for the two new griswold kids the word blah comes mind the vacation series seems out prove that anybody can play these two characters the simple reason being that there is nothing them they are so generic you will expect the credits read girl as audrey griswold vegas vacation differs from the first three in the series more than just laugh factor yes it is true that vegas vacation is not even close being close being as funny as the others were actually pretty fun in their own doofy ways but there are couple of other things that set this one negatively apart first off why did they leave off the national lampoons heading on the title could not find any reasons why but maybe the fact is even national lampoon did not want be associated such lame that is saying lot especially when you look at what else the company has proudly presented loaded weapon pcu etc if they expected this be another hit you would assume they would be proud tack on the notorious header but for reasons only we can guess at like the movie sucking they did not there is another difference here that makes an obvious impact the first three films in the vacation series were written john hughes talented writer who is behind several popular films of the including mr mom sixteen candles the breakfast club weird science pretty in pink ferris buellers day off planes trains and automobiles and uncle buck wowzers what r sum looking at the names you would think this guy wrote everything that now stands as movie icon for the well that is not all this guy also brought us hits including the home alone series the remake of dalmatians dennis the menace and the current flubber vegas vacation however did not have john hughes behind it and the loss is very obvious this time around the script is in the hands of elisa bell whose only credits thus far include four madefortv movies vegas vacation plays very much like one and it would actually work much better as madefortv sequel if this sounds like wild idea it is not revenge of the nerds third and fourth installments were both television movies and they seemed like it vegas vacation would fit in well on the fox network as a sunday morning movie but as silver screen major motion picture it is quite out of place stephen kesslers jejune direction does not help things either he only makes the even more tvmovieish each consecutive vacation movie has suffered drop in directing power we started the series off harold ramis who also directed caddyshack and groundhog day as well as cowriting ghostbusters not too bad then we had national lampoons european vacation being directed amy heckerling who would go on direct the hits look who is talking and clueless as well as having already directed the infamous fast times at ridgemont high lastly we had national lampoons christmas vacation directed jeremiah chechik who went on direct the charming benny joon kessler so far has one title under his belt the short birch street gym received an oscar nomination in granted that this was his first attempt at feature length we can allow for some amateurish quality but instead we get movie straight from the text book boring bland and deeply unoriginal if you loved the vacation movies and know some of us did there still is not anything here worth seeing if you loved them do not ruin your good impressions of the series indulging in this tragic example of cinema ala carte if you never did like the series why the need confirm why

plunkett macleane marks the directing debut of jake scott brother of ridley and tony naturally this got me worried would jakes talent be inherited from ridley or tony if it was from ridley than the movie would be thoughtful suspensor action thrown in if it was from tony it would be wham bang drivel unfortunately the latter is true for this worthless picture little charm carlyle and miller are the titular highwaymen plunkett carlyle who is poor and unruly and captain james macleane miller clean cut gentleman as the tagline clearly wants make known they rob the rich and nothing else the basically follows the rowdy hold ups the two stage along romantic interludes lady rebecca tyler hot on both their tails is mr chance ken stott who wants see them both dead plunkett macleane is an annoying little that serves little purpose although undoubtedly slick and fast paced there is very little merit contained in the carlyle and miller are fun enough as the foul mouthed pair although their characters are criminally undeveloped it appears that much of the money has been spent on the expensive looking sets and costumes but not on the script the five screenwriters three credited have produced an still born movie there is very little development in the story also major events such as mr cash finding out who plunkett and macleane really are are so rushed that they barely happened the story is bit of mess frankly the performances are not bad carlyle and miller are typical lads but liv tyler is huge disappointment as the love interest her irritable stilted performance sticks out like sore thumb and was quite unsure on what accent she was trying put on she looks nice though more interesting is alan cummings as the campy lord rochester and although his character amounts nothing more than two dimensional comedy gay character he hams it up well ken stott is suitably evil as chance but again he is nothing but flat character did not particularly care when the predictable death sequence arrived although disappointment in writing and minor success in acting the certainly look lavish good costumes and wonderful sets but production design alone cannot save movie especially movie as bad as this mess jake scott would be more suited directing music video rather than this failed update of period drama the only update seems be the fact that everyone must talk dirty ck this and stand and cking deliver splattered all over the place the mtv editing and direction are flash enough but in the end decidedly empty plunkett macleane is massive disappointment although somewhat enjoyable during parts it is so light it could float off the screen if it was not just images on reel there is no thought no development no plot just series of manic edits and quirky camera angles make this appeal genxers although it is great idea update period drama the mtv generation it is execution is awful and would more likely bore than excite sloppy and occasionally off puttingly tasteless it is hard recommend plunkett macleane as movie but easy recommend it as overlong music video give it miss

capsule silly and inane adaptation of gibsons short story is nowhere in sight gibsons script only adds insult injury johnny mnemonic is an awesomely bad movie say awesomely because it is one thing fail but another thing entirely fail so completely that even the chances for camp value are sabotaged keanur reeves who is terrible stars as johnny an information courier who can carry dozens of gigabytes of data in his head he is given one last job whenever you are in movie and you hear those words run involves him shoving so much data into his cranium that it could be lethal one of the neater touches that the movie brings in is that the only way he could make such an arrangement work was ditching all of his childhood memories but it is only followed up on in token fashion for his trouble johnny gets chased the yakuza who seem be the new bad guys in all the hightech thrillers what is funny is that if you watch gangster movies made in japan there are whole gobs of details about genuine yakuza behavior and ethics but of course there is no room in this movie for any of that the yakuza are simply used point guns wave swords flaunt tattoos and grimace menacingly could go on about how gangsters and criminals of many other ethnicities have gotten thoughtful examinations in the movies bound honor sugar hill and american me come mind when asians remain perpetually stereotyped but that is another essay anyway johnny runs and eventually winds up in newark why newark maybe because it was cheaper fake future newark than future new york that is why there he meets an assortment of odd characters icet dolph lundgren and henry rollins play whole gallery of weirdos the script deals them all the depth of pieces of furniture it turns out what else that the data in johnnys head could save lot of people but of course johnny only wants it out of his head so it does not kill him handled right this could have been absorbing but the script manages mangle any chance of real sympathy for johnny at every opportunity the details about the look and feel of the future are all phoned in from other better movies blade runner and brazil come mind everything looks rundown and scummy everyone dresses like they are punk rockers and videophones are commonplace snore the only really interesting flourish is an extended depiction of the way the internet might work in the future complete vr goggles and feedback gloves but kept thinking that it was more like what some relatively untechnical fellow would think it would look and behave like hacker of johnnys caliber would be blasting away one commandline function after another instead of wasting all this time twiddling holograms but of course that is not cinematic whatever what went wrong this movie gibson wrote his own screenplay guess is part of the problem what works as short story does not work in movie his ear for dialogue is terrible and the plot does not advance it convulses from the script on out it was probably all downhill renting the movie make fun of it is sort of pointless there is no fun in kicking wounded dog is there

i did not hate the big hit even though it is stupefyingly terrible for the entirety of its running time my eyes were attached the screen and never once got bored found the interesting because of its unique awfulness this is such confused disaster of that it is entertaining watch it in the same way that it is entertaining witness thirty car pileup on freeway spaghetti bowl as narrative the big hit is pure garbage never truly deciding its genre and constantly crossing all kinds of boundaries it reminded me lot of grosse pointe blank is similar that fails in lot of the same ways it is fine mix genres if the makers know what they are doing unfortunately writer ben ramsey and director kirk wong do not seem know how handle the material and the result is an action that wants be comedy the biggest problem the amalgamation in this case is that the is absurd and the comedy is out of place but it sure is fascinating failure marky er mark wahlberg stars as melvin surley hitman he is good hitman apparently although his tactics seem bit rambunctious he does not snipe or make clean killshe just kicks the door down and shoots everything he works few other hitmencisco lou diamond phillips crunch bokeem woodbine and vinnie antonio sabbato jr they are nice bunch of muscular guys who stand around in the locker room after working out and compare masturbation sex they all work for man named paris avery brooks who is rich powerful and in constant need of four sloppy hitmen it is very important that they never go beyond their boss and do work on their own this of course is where the plot comes in they decide kidnap young japanese girl named keiko china chow who has rich father when they do this it turns out she is paris goddaughter it is very bad have paris against you the story is standard action stuff it is nothing new and nothing particularly offensive but certainly not the slightest bit compelling clearly the major selling point of the big hit is that it is john wootype of action mixed in some really hip comedy it is true that lot of the action sequences resemble recent films that go for the same idea such as faceoff and the replacement killers are both far superior there are stunts that are fun watch the opening sequence has melvin and two of his partners going in kill some guy who has nothing do the story they use night vision goggles and really powerful handguns melvin is also very good at breakdancing and uses this talent avoid bullets and knives like said it is not boring most disasters are not what makes it so bad is its genreshifting madness it seems start out as quirkybutrealistic action comedy as melvin is seen transporting bags of human remains then as soon as they go their first hit it turns into music video bodies and bullets flying everywhere then somewhere in between it turns back into comedy keiko turns out be spunky little girl in one amusing scene she is forced read letter out loud indicating that she has been kidnapped but the letter is littered grammatical errors that skew the meaning of the words and scenes like this work alone but wong applies this goofy tone scenes that should be more serious or not be in the at all one of the most irritating moments has paris ordering cisco come up his office after he learns that keiko has been kidnapped when cisco gets there paris and his men are standing around as if they knew cisco did it but they let him out of there telling him find the perpetrator the scene is played for laughs but it is not funny and since it does not quite work as comedy it tries fall back on the action also fails this is where people fly fifteen feet backwards when shot handgun cars land on tree branches and are supported them characters betray each other without second thought grenades are thrown in tight places people jump out of tall buildings and survive people outrun tumbling cars and get out of the way of falling objects in small fractions of seconds most frustrating of all though is the films definition of hit man these guys are anything but subtle quiet and skilled individuals they are more like socially depraved militia men melvin has an extensive collection of firearms in his garage including missile launchers and handheld machineguns the characters each have one trait that distinguishes them from the rest this obviously does not make for deep or interesting people watch the acting is kind of fun thoughwahlberg is good actor and his innocuous presence in this is charming in silly sort of way phillips certainly has fun his psychotic character while christina applegate who plays melvins fianc is convincingly airheaded the big hit is an action that unknowingly spoofs itself in trying be funny the funniest parts are supplied the actors and not the numerous failed attempts at sight gags and oneliners it is true disaster one that makes me believe that the goofy and unrealistic tone is completely unintentional despite all this though must reiterate the entertainment value here you can cherish the awfulness of like this if you embrace the big hit for the catastrophe that it is you just might enjoy yourself

when the features richard lynch in the role of chief villain you know that you can expect nothing more than b grade action movie however since this also featured michael madsen more than capable character actor this time in the role of protagonist the author of this review decided give the some benefit of the doubt however the very first scenes show clear grade action credentials madsen plays richard montana tough policeman who raids drug warehouse and make life miserable for local crime lord mario gio played lynch however the raid was only partially successful and montana is getting the rap so he begins his own private war against gio trying penetrate his organisation pretending be corrupt in the process he meets gios mistress gina zamora played rosie vela and starts relationship her too although it does not stink like many of the similar films can inside edge is mostly forgettable grade action routine nobody in this actually puts much effort including madsen or lynch and this is especially case uninspired screenwriter william tannen or director warren clarke the only not so forgettable element in this is presence of former supermodel rosie vela who apart from showing her more than impressive looks shows some of the singing talent too however this is not reason enough for viewers spend hour and half watching that they would in most likelihood forget the next day

what are the warning signs of terrible movie making it is debut at the dollar theater locally chairman of the board did just that having the annoying prop comic scott thompson better known as carrot top in the lead role chairman of the board once again how about an overly exhausted paper thin plot approached utter incompetence did somebody say chairman of the board that is right carrot tops long dreaded major motion picture debut at least for starring role is poking up in handful of theaters across the country chairman of the board stars the obnoxious wannabezany king of redheaded standup comics as lazy but creative inventive but uneventful generation er named edison living pair of surfer dudes in small rented house edison bounces from job job always squandering away the money on his eccentric say the least inventions and ignoring crucial responsibilities such as rent this has the crabby landlady ms krubavitch estelle harris best known as george constanzas mother on seinfeld threatening an eviction if past due expenses are not furnished post haste as luck would have it edison soon meets armand mcmillan jack warden an old surfer dude who just so happens be president of the multimillion dollar mcmillan industries sharing passion for more than just riding waves armand is deeply impacted the young inventors notebook of dreams and ideas and when the old man dies soon afterward edison learns he is named benefactor in armands will predictably edison acquires the entire corporation and has maintain productivity absolutely no knowledge of the business world predictably there is bitter nephew larry miller whose lesser inheritance fuels resentment that will lead an elaborate sabotage plot predictably there is an attractive employee courtney thornesmith whose initial repulsion will transform into love for our doofy protagonist predictably the man who knows nothing will fight against the odds and give the company it is most profitable and successful turnaround ever all because he ran things common sense and not greed it is as though writers turi meyer al septien and alex zamm meyer and septien also wrote leprechaun together pulled plot out of hat and worked carrot top into it the jokes the surprises the developments all of them run such predictable path it may only be carrot tops signature brazen red hairdo that sets this one apart from the myriad of similar films movie this bad speaks for itself what is left say when every element the movie possesses is shameful retread of movies past the script is recycled the direction is hokey and the acting is absolutely horrible it is only thornesmith who seems take her job seriously an accomplishment surely deserves the medal of honor she certainly went beyond the call of duty she has kiss carrot top barf bag please movies like this give the audience nothing do but ponder just how many synonyms for bad there really are chairman of the board without doubt deserves each and every one the only way this will not end up on everybodys bottom ten of the year list is if they were lucky enough never have seen it just because you cannot miss his outlandish fiery mane do not skimp on avoiding this abhorrent feature

you do not look at ren magritte painting and search for deeper meaning you likewise do not look at one for minutes straight surrealist works are notable for their quirks and they are fun but looking at one quirk for an hour and half is exhausting that was my experience woke up early the day died surrealistic hyperactive comedy no dialogue it is not silent movie there is lots of atmospheric music occasional screams and weird sound effects but nobody ever utters an audible word though the is distinctive its unique style wore thin after about minutes and as it progressed watching became chore the only reason the script ever got filmed is because it was written the pseudolegendary ed wood the man behind such classics as plan from outer space and night of the ghouls the joke of course is that his films are so bad they are good so humorous in their inanity that they become hits woke up early the day died unfortunatly is so bad that it is really bad it stars billy zane titanic as dangerous lunatic who overpowers nurse escapes from mental hospital and proceeds wonder around stealing car clothes and load of money our thief reaches cemetery where he witnesses bizarre ritual he falls asleep and finds himself literally in hole his money gone for whatever reason he is bent on getting his hardunearned cash back considering how easily he stole it the first time why did not he just go steal some more he comes upon list of the people who were at the mysterious ceremony and commences seek out each of them and kill them if they do not have what he is looking for do not think either director aris iliopulos nor ed wood realized that this would have made glorious minute short the subject and the style seem have been made for it unfortunately twenty minutes worth of material is stretched out more than four times that length and the simply overstays its already dubious welcome it grabbed my attention in the beginning and gradually lost it as it went on up the point where halfway through was already weary it might seem odd that as furiously paced as this one can be so tedious but the surprise will wear off when you consider how repetitive it is woke up early the day died is comedy guess though it could have fooled me unlike most ed wood films this one tries be funny and fails instead of the other way around there is nothing inherently wrong that in fact think it would only make sense for someone who has been so good at making unintentional comedies take stab at real one whether wood actually went for comedy in his script we will never know but in either case this is failure jonathan taylor thomas christina ricci summer phoenix john ritter and others show up for short and pointless cameos ricci for example plays prostitute her role consists of dancing around zane in his motel room and then being thrown out thomas is an astonished onlooker as woman gets thrown off cliff was the home improvement teen heartthrob really that desperate for work zane meanwhile occupies himself making weird faces at the camera when he is not called upon run around wildly and beat people up lack of dialogue makes him the ultimate caricature the carnival sideshow climax manages demonstrate everything that is wrong this nobudget production it is desperately unfunny but thinks it is the funniest thing since plan it is so spontaneously surrealistic it makes your head spin all while being confusing enough make your head spin twice as fast in the other direction hope another is made from an ed wood screenplay for woke up early the day died is not fitting sendoff eugene novikov

well as check my score card for what have done this holiday weekend it reads good ideas and dumb ideas do not know what was thinking when decided watch this movie but in my defense can only say that it was someone else who urged me see this him the that am talking about is a night at the roxbury one of those offerings based on saturday night live skit wayne and garth these two are not rather we meet doug and steve butabi the actors names are not worth mentioning two eternal partyers whose greatest ambitions in life seem be finding way get into the hottest night club in the city the roxbury driving in their dads bmw and donning metallic disco suits right out of miami vice they try bribe the bouncer get into the club have you met my friend washington and his friend roosevelt they confidently say as they pull out spare pocket change their second greatest ambition seems be oozing out as many silly pickup lines as is humanly possible in order start conversation girl let me see that label just as thought made in heaven says one of the brothers and like the losers that they are they fail do either for much of the however as fate would have it an accidental meeting whateverhappenedto richard grieco gives them the allimportant ticket get in their sad lives take on whole new direction they make an important contact the club owner who believes that these two brothers have uncanny insight into the club scene and they are mistaken as rich swingers two voluptuous young women but their newfound popularity does not impress their father who has other plans for them the unfortunate thing about this is that this is onejoke movie and the brothers are the joke actually there is about mintues worth of tolerable stuff alas too long for tv and way too short for featurelength thus there just is not enough material sustain the minute movie there is no plot be found and everything that these two do seem culminate in an opportunity execute their trademark move of snapping their heads in unison the funky beat of haddaways europop song what is love was amazed that none of the two suffered from whiplash take up more time there is subplot involving the daughter of the businessman next door who wants marry doug this creates not only friction between the brothers but their unlikely pairing will also agitate audience members as well she is educated and forebearing witch meanwhile doug is complete loser how did these two ever get together suppose that if can ever figure out the answer that question will have figured out why decided go and see this movie if you are looking for entertainment you will not find it at the roxbury

terrence malick made an excellent minute adaptation of james jones world war ii novel unfortunately he buried it within an overlong and overreaching hour long pseudoepic this is shame because the features an outstanding performance nick nolte the best scene is when nick noltes character lt col tall is forced deal the direct refusal capt staros elias koteas execute an order noltes reaction and transformation may be the best work of his career had terrence malick concentrated on the great performances of nolte and koteas as well as those sean penn woody harrelson and john cusack he could have made truly great instead malick saddled the plodding pacing unnecessary flashbacks and voiceover narration all designed telegraph the great philosophical underpinnings of the story the narration was especially annoying as much of it sounded like very bad high school poetry lot of editing the core story could be transformed into truly classic war hopefully the dvd version of this will feature options suppress the narration and perhaps will even provide for an alternate shorter version of the give this

i cried during _babe_ admit it the special effects the story the great dialogue were woven together so delicately and successfully that my mind lost track that this was childrens so much so that yes got little overly sentimental such my friend is the power of cinema when word came out that they were using this newly developed fx for doctor dolittle update in eddie murphy plays the title character and many great comic actors supply the voices my anticipation rose great expectations they cannot possibly drop the ball on this one cannot miss cannot possibly miss they missed what went wrong after much thought supply three general rules do not let television actressturnedcomedy movie director near an urbanite script e penny marshalls dreadful preachers wife betty thomas worked wonders the brady bunch movie but the same sitcomairiness does not quite work here it is as if she lifted generic sitcom and iced it light doses of modern rb take away the black cast take away the atrocious soundtrack and you have the residue of some mids kirk cameron show the greater the cast the less the individual castmember has do e con air it is great have the comic voices of jenna elfman garry schandling john leguizimo ellen degeneres and gilbert godfried in your lineup but they have nothing do but improvise their underdeveloped stereotyped characters onelineatatime it is even worse because sometimes their voices are so unrecognizable that you do not get the satisfaction of linking the voice the comedian until the credits now there are three character actors who do get special treatment albert brooks brings dignity nearly every project he is in and the scenes as depressed tiger do resonate certain poignancy norm mcdonald fares nearly as well as stray dog who learns bond dolittle but there is little humor here that rests on the shoulders of chris rock sorely miscast and unfunny as the voice of their wiseass guinea pig even the mouth is illsynched do not let the special effects technicians walk away the script there is certain timing that is mandatory in comedy have this timing usurped the brilliancy of computer generated mouths or lifelike creations of jim hensons creature shop is travesty this is not say that special effects filled comedies or muppet movies are not welltimed laughfests the right director they can be and have here betty thomas is clearly over her head wish could commend the special effects but they are merely average count the number of times where the animals mouth is turned away from the camera or too far notice or illsynched this is less babe and more of look who is barking clone you may be wondering how does eddie murphy fare well he came back the exceptional nutty professor and do not doubt he can come back again here he is tied into straight man and given little do the exceptions are when he fears he is going crazy far cry from his smarterthanyou would expect routine that he is more adept at it is unfortunate that he is where richard pryor was ten years ago making lame comedies without the same bite he had given in his early years after all this what is left butt jokes _lot_ of butt jokes guess for kids that may be funny but was stonefaced if there is lesson the may be telling us is that animals have feelings too and they care way too much for your butt

saw an advanced screening of the movie sniper last night and have say was not too impressed this is about an expert marine sniper played tom berenger who is teamed hotshotyoungnoexperienceneverkilledaman new partner take out some drugkingpins and military strong men in panama sound cliche that is only the beginning billy zane memphis belle played the rookie and never seemed get handle on his character he was so contrary and pigheaded in the beginning you just wanted smack him then he goes crazy from the pressure but seems immediately snap out of it am not sure if the blame should lie the directing editing scriptwriting or acting but it did not all come together think berenger is pretty good actor and he looked great in the part covered in camo face painted stalking through the jungle his highpower rifle but once again his character was given some pretty bad dialogue and did not react too logically many of the situations there was very little logical development in these characters my biggest problem this was it is tendency put these two snipers in as many inchesfromdeath situations as possible they began resemble i joes the greatest american hero and of course their almost supernatural accuracy their guns was called upon get them out of far too many close calls now lot of movies are stamped out of this mold in fact that is what made die hard so much fun the superhero avenger type so some will enjoy the action hero heroics but did not think it fit the nice tension that was built up in the earlier scenes and the real life feel of covert operations in panama word must be said on the camera work much of it was very nice the jungles of panama or their standins in this case formed very picturesque background and the drama of speeding bullets was captured using some nice trick photography many have seen the slowed down bulletcam following the projectile its target this was used well in the beginning show the feverish nightmares berenger gets when remembering the moment of the kill it was dramatic when used in flashback but it seems the director liked the technique so much he started inserting these shots pardon the pun into the real time action then it just seemed silly all in all not real dog there is some nice action good atmosphere and pretty photography but the plot is pretty lame the acting did not form cohesive whole and far too much thisclosefromdeath heroics

an foothigh footlong dragon is the computergenerated co star of this strictlybythenumbers sword sorcery flick as voiced sean connery draco is surprisingly expressive creation who is welldeserving of his minutes of screen time he walks talks flies fries and even fakes his own death all the help of computeraided animators too bad that ilm industrial light and magic could not spare some special effects for dragonhearts human costars bearded black hole exists where dennis quaid should be he is neartotal loss as he growls glumly through his role of disillusioned knight david thewlis evil king has high hiss factor hf though he is more of mumbling oddity than anything else oh and there is some redhead in s wig who runs around either screaming or scowling depending upon if the particular scene has her playing the woman in peril or the put upon peasant the fringe flourishes include pete postlethwaite as wandering monk literary ambitions julie christie as the good queen mother band of mercenaries that appear dressed for ye olde heavymetal concert and believe or it not the speaking spirit of king arthur bring out your dead unfortunately when we add it all together draco fringe bits quaid thewlis the sum total amounts zero dragonheart is well too much of too little director rob cohen dragon the bruce lee story has made big expensive movie that while ambitiously plotted is both murky and predictable and overscored and selfimportant and the list goes on must ask did screenwriter charles edward pogue intend that every character be stabbed lanced or sliced at least once keep that man away from the knife drawer the last five minutes of this movie are the worst some silly celestial nonsense that would be laughed out of any planetarium light show much less summer movie save your money

s major league was delightful surprise did not expect much of it when decided watch it on cable but it proved be fresh and funny however when the appeal of movie is its freshness the sequels are virtually guaranteed be stale that is certainly true of major league ii and the most recent entry major league back the minors the title is of course contradiction should not it be minor league that contradiction suggests the lengths writerdirector john warren has gone squeeze third movie out of the formula established the first movie original stars charlie sheen and tom berenger who returned for major league ii are not around leaving corbin bernsen the only original headliner make the third movie the other veterans who return dennis haysbert as voodooinspired batter cerrano and takaaki ishibashi as tanaka who was introduced in league ii seem be around just lend legitimacy the enterprise the only returning cast member who produces any laughs is bob uecker as radio announcer harry doyle inexplicably broadcasting the games of minor league team far from his home turf the protagonist this time around is retiring pitcher gus cantrell scott bakula who is hired minnesota twins owner roger dorn bernsen manage the twins aaa team the buzz you can write the movie from here he finds group of misfits who need learn how play together as team in order win there is future superstar whose ego keeps him from growing walton goggins an exballet dancer kenneth johnson brokendown old timer thom barry twin outfielders both named juan the difilippo triplets and couple pitchers throwing problems judson mills and peter mackenzie along the way gus picks up cerrano and tanaka gus is supposedly an old teammate of theirs even though he was not in either of the preceding films sum total none the entire enterprise is artificial and the cast is not ready for the majors gus antagonist is twins manager leonard huff ted mcginley leonard is slimy sniveling little egotist and the twins are lazy spoiled and full of themselves even watching the first movie wondered why any reallife team would lend itself being caricatured in this manner gus challenges leonard match the buzz vs the twins wanna guess who wins back the minors is movie that has no reason exist there is hardly laugh in it the cast is weak and the first movie left no room for even one sequel

the following review contains some harsh language but what did you expect when you clicked on this title cast kristen holly smith danica sheridan alex boling michael dotson sonya hensley janet krajeski sabrina lu dionysius burbano calvin grant jeff harmon written and directed jeff harmon running time minutes the thought of losing you makes me all vomity inside blatz balinski danica sheridan laments the fact that her lesbian lover april kristen holly smith has just received telegram from her exfiance isle of lesbos is an incredibly offensive musical comedy about april pfferpot smith resident of the small town of bumfuck arkansas who is about get married high school sweetheart and football hero dick dickson michael dotson when april gets extreme cold feet she runs home sticks gun in her mouth and pulls the trigger instead of killing herself she is magically transported through her mirror into the isle of lesbos an alternate dimension where lesbians rule and no men are allowed except for lance the homosexual toilet cleanerslave april loves her new home and friends but dick and her parents are not so ready give her up mr and ms pfferpot director jeff harmon and janet krajeski decide they need medical help so they enlist the aid of dr sigmoid colon also jeff harmon who claims he can cure homosexuality in actuality dr colon is homosexual as well and begins his special treatment on dick dickson unbeknownst dick when april turns down dicks demand for her return bumfuck he decides take matters in his own hands and attack the isle of lesbos rambostyle instead of leveling the place he falls in love lance alex boling and the two of them along april and her lover blatz get married note the filmmaker why did the character of lance make asides the camera followed silence that am assuming was inserted for the purpose of waiting until the laughter of the audience had subsided aprils parents feeling like there is no recourse call in favor president clinton and send nuclear bomb whose circuitry inexplicably is made up of homosexual performer their way the bomb is dud thanks the work of the circuitry and they rewire it and send it back washington c destroying it mr and ms pfferpot give up trying get their daughter back and instead decide join her as they have some alternative sexual practices of their own am not sure if writerdirectorcostar jeff harmon was purposely trying offend people because he believes in some of the ideas his movie presents or if he was just going for cheap laughs either way he manages present some of the most offensive material have ever seen in movie the opens preacher running small africanamerican child out of town and then later moves on the hanging of michael jackson impersonator the ku klux klan during jaunty musical number preceded remarks about gays and straights finally being able put their differences behind them and work together hate others such as the jews if harmon was merely trying point out how idiotic society can be then apologize for being so harsh on elements of his but it is presented so mean spiritedly that cannot help but feel like he had some serious intent as for the entire central theme of the movie am afraid that it is one that just do not get tried keep an open mind while watching it but the homosexual elements were just too prevalent for my tastes it was hard enough watch them bash other races and sexes without them preaching about the virtues of being homosexual and accepted society how does one expect be accepted if they are just as guilty of nonacceptance am not prone judging anyone and believe that people should be free explore whatever avenues they wish free from the scornful eye of society but do not force your particular rhetoric down my throat if you are not going show the same respect for my preferences that you wish from me again maybe am missing the satirical point that harmon is trying make but if so think it could have been handled little more tactfully as far as musical comedies go isle of lesbos is no trey parker and matt stone musical but good portion of the songs are maddeningly catchy despite the disturbing visuals mom and apple pie stuck me for the rest of the day speaking of disturbing visuals wedding bells as not ringing could have been decent song but the accompanying visuals of spousal abuse are more harrowing than this should be displaying am lesbian is touted in the press release as being particularly popular is also pretty good but good portion of that could be due the stellar singing voice of ms smith it is mainly on her excellent vocals that my rating of this is based the other performers are decent save for the rosie odonnell like performance given danica sheridan have no inherent problem her character it is just her singing voice that leaves little be desired one particular musical number lesbian rock was one of the lowest points have ever experienced in my filmgoing life thanks strained and lackluster vocal job sheridan the ends about twenty minutes before the credits actually roll the remainder of the running time is padded out few more songs lesbian rock included and the ridiculously presented antinukes message tacked on the end for no reason other than make it feature length once the isle of lesbos reprise was reached felt the story had already been wrapped up well enough end it all why was the needlessly stretched out past its obvious end isle of lesbos is available on videocassette from www indieunderground com the transfer is pretty clean and all the detail of the wrinkled cloth and paint backdrops are readily apparent and the is letterboxed at approximately in many respects isle of lesbos has incredible cult potential like rocky horror for the new millennium this is no means my cup of tea but know there are those out there who will enjoy it if you think it might be for you then all means seek it out on the other hand will be cleansing my palette good action like gladiator wait are not gladiator films considered be oh never mind

one of the indicator of badness in is the hype being remembered more than itself such was the case boxing helena directorial debut of jennifer chambers lynch daughter of the great david lynch made in the dying years of posttwin peaks lynch craze among movie snobs it was hyped as another warped twisted masterpiece of lynch clan kim basinger also provided extra publicity quitting the lead role and being sued for the breech of contract but the result was extremely disappointing quickly sank into welldeserved oblivion the movie protagonist is nick cavanaugh played julian sands talented surgeon who is getting obsessed helena sherilyn fenn beautiful woman who ditched him after brief affair cavanaugh stalks her and uses every opportunity for the pathetic attempts reestablish the relationship during one of such occasions helena is hit car and nick quickly takes the role of her personal physician in order have his way her after she wakes up helena discovers not only that she is prisoner in cavanaughs stylish residence but also that cavanaugh amputated her legs in order prevent her from escaping she is still trying escape so cavanaugh takes off her arms apart from casting sherilyn fenn audrey horne in twin peaks and small cameo in wild at heart and the use of twisted characters and their perverse fantasies this ms lynch has not got anything in common the works of directors more talented father despite rather bizarre subject the style of this is conventional and setting is light characters are beautiful but the result at the end is quite sterile and the in the end looks too artificial for dark sexual fantasy it was supposed portray jennifer lynch obviously lacks talents in directing and it becomes painfully obvious in the scenes that are supposed erotic its banal artificiality is even bellow the standards of playboy videos the actors are not good either julian sands is terribly miscast as emotionally disturbed man this actors is best either when he plays charismatic protagonists or villains being neurotic does not suit him bill paxton was better for this role but his presence was wasted in forgettable and unnecessary subplot dealing helenas boyfriend sherilyn fenn contributed this mostly her looks but even the her greater effort in acting could not help this the screenplay on the other hand is awful at least for someone who had made bestseller laura palmers diary the events in this movie are implausible characters come and go without purpose and many unnecessary subplots only slow down the and add the total confusion one of those subplots involves character of cavanaughs regular girlfriend played betsy clarke the twist at the end although unpredictable is unbelievable and the viewers who had the stomach endure entire would feel cheated all in all boxing helena is disorganised quasiartistic mess of movie that should be remembered as nothing more than one of the wiser decisions in kim basingers career

let us get this one over as quickly as possible if there was possibility receive refund this review would not be forthcoming but as it is godzilla is without doubt the loudest longest and ultimately most amateurishly written ever released through major studio producer dean devlin and director roland emmerich should be ashamed of themselves and as penance be forced return school watch last year at merienbad until they can grasp the idea of content and plot no amount of hype no amount of money can hide the fact that these filmmakers are the equivalent william beaudine billy the kid vs dracula godzilla opens stock footage of the bikini atoll nuclear tests interspersed footage of iguanas playfully swimming and nuzzling their eggs we are then introduced the crew of japanese fish canning ship questionable enterprise considering that tuna processing is supposed be supervised eliminate the netting of dolphins well the ship is attacked and sunk an unseen creature later group of frenchmen led philippe roache jean reno interview the sole survivor in state of shock the only thing the man can utter is the word gojira the japanese name of the famed beast we are then introduced dr nick
