tatopoulos matthew broderick moniker obviously taken from the effects designer of the he is currently studying the effects that the chernobyl disaster has had on the local earthworm population he is immediately drafted the s military and taken panama where he is shown the huge footprints of creature in short amount of time another fishing boat loaded canned tuna from the s and korea for some reason is found grounded in jamaica well it seems that whatever is eating these ships is headed for new york when the beast finally appears he tears up one building stomps couple of trucks and makes life hell for the incumbent mayor ebert thumbs up for new york the military dr tatopouloss help have two tons of fresh fish dumped in the middle of new york lure the beast out of its hiding place in the new york subway system it finally comes crashing through the city streets and has cute face face dr tatopoulos who snaps the beasts picture the monster eats the fish the military starts shooting and the chase is on the army causing of the ensuing damage working from hunch as why godzilla has decided come the big apple dr totopoulos buys few home pregnancy kits from local drugstore that has chosen remain open even though new york has been evacuated well the test proves that the monster is hermaphrodite and is pregnant needless say no one believes the good doctor about his discovery so he must join up the renegade french secret service agents and find the monsters nesting site and destroy the eggs before the mayor starts letting the populous back into the city even though the monster is not dead yet sincerely hope that have completely spoiled any interest anyone might have of seeing this gave away the relevant plot so that could spare those of you courageous or foolish enough drop down an hours wage on this tripe everything about godzilla reeks almost as bad as the piles of rotting fish used trap the beast the script and let us be clear here devlin and emmerich is so full of plot holes and non characters as be sure be the recipient of next years razzie award the dialogue between maria pitillo as audrey timmonds dr tatopoulos estranged girlfriend and mr broderick is so adolescent it makes teenagers giggle in disbelief as happened during the screening witnessed the could be enjoyably campy if it did not take itself so damn seriously but what end as there is no commentary on humanities foibles against nature nor is there any reference about godzilla being some sort of retaliation against mankind no godzilla is just big dummy that got knocked up some french immigrants and decided let the state of new york pay for it the is bleak and ugly looking taking place at night during rain storm the movie has little or no depth everything is ugly and dark new york has never looked so inhospitable since death wish in an attempt give the some color audrey timmonds carries bright red umbrella is unique in that everyone else in the carries the standard gray issue the only moment of composition and color is during the brief scenes on jamaica where dr tatopoulos finds himself standing in giant footprint the scene is nicely photographed but poorly set up you know from the outset that nick is standing in footprint for scientist this is very poor observation let us look at some of the more interesting plot holes in the this activity is becoming almost as popular as the kevin bacon game why does the french nuclear tests only affect one clutch of iguana eggs and how do those eggs fuse into one beast why would cold blooded creature choose cold climate such as new york nest do not think iguanas have habit of migrating how can godzilla crawl through the new york subway system slice submarine in half yet be unable extricate himself from some thin in comparison steel cable on the brooklyn bridge the brooklyn bridge is the only suspension bridge in existence that does not need it is suspension cables did godzilla carry all two hundred eggs in her belly if so then radioactive mutations surely are wondrous creatures note each egg is feet tall and almost as wide godzilla would have be over feet tall carry them all godzilla can crush ships and eat helicopters but new york cabs are made of stronger steel godzilla can out maneuver helicopters bullets torpedoes and missiles but cannot catch you on foot taxis can out maneuver godzilla godzilla can burrow through the subway system but cannot tear through the park avenue tunnel why was nothing else mutated the nuclear test as quickly as godzilla maybe giant hermit crab in the sequel galapagos iguanas actually live in the french polynesian islands why was dr tatopoulos brought in the military if they were not going listen him anyway how did they evacuate new york island in less than day and how did they convince those new yorkers go new jersey new york television stations use vhs tape for both filming and broadcasting new yorkers hate beta cam could go on and on but that would only serve make the seem more enjoyable than it is do not be fooled this has less gray matter than any episode of americas funniest home videos the performances in the are singularly bland not one performance belays any awe or fear in the face of this two hundred foot tall terror the characters in the midst of the onslaught have time stop and discuss the lack of good coffee failed relationships career choices the only common occurrence that does not take place here is having one of the characters have bowel movement but then that would have made them believable godzilla for the most part is okay the design of the beast is funky if not very memorable one thing that comes mind the major redirection of godzilla in this is remove his most familiar trademark namely his atomic breath now for one cannot quite fathom how you can call this monster godzilla without that little trait good comparison would be make superman and eliminate his ability fly there is so much wrong this that cannot really recall anything recently that has left me this cold hearted except for my divorce any that can have two ton lizard slipping on gum balls has got be envisioned under the influence of prozac the addition of the baby raptors ah meant godzillas are nothing but direct rip off of jurassic park but none of that films suspense or tension suffice say that godzilla is without doubt the most brain dead motion picture of the decade this is that needed the hype the current level of writing and directing nothing else about the succeeds if you have seen the trailers you have seen the best parts my only suggestion for mr and mr is that they could always go back selling shoes this could be the next rocky horror only it is not funny

woody allen is one of the most successful artistdirectors in but he is becoming less and less reliable as filmmaker in his early years of filmmaking he mastered the simple comedy from there he went into second phase and took risks experimenting different approaches and styles some of these work better than others zelig and crimes and misdemeanors are the work of creative and intelligent artist deconstructing harry goes the other extreme and is bizarre experiment demanding more of the viewer than it gives back harry block allen has in his life only two drives he wants have sex as many women as possible and when he makes mess of his life and those of his lovers he wants retreat into his writing the story of this static and highly unsympathetic character is told number of often clumsy stylistic experiments perhaps the most irritating device is express the disjointedness of harrys life editing harrys scenes putting in cuts in the middle as if show missing time something edited out as writer harry puts his friends into his books in the thinnest of disguises the dramatizes incidents from these supposed books and cuts between his real story line and fragments from harrys books different actors playing the real and fictional people in harrys life these fragments are frustrating in their lack of completion but even more frustrating is the bringing of the characters out of the fragments into scenes the real characters it is up the viewer keep track not just who is fictional and who is real but also keep straight who is the fictional doppelganger of real person if that sounds complicated it is then as another device in one of the stories an actor seems have the peculiar property that he has gone out of focus and can only be seen in blurry image harry sees this as metaphor for his own condition and himself goes blurry for short time as if these touches did not create sufficient confusion the story is told out of chronological order if allen were giving the audience story that was worth decoding any and all of these stylistic touches could be excusable but allen puts the audience through all of this give us portrait of harry block who is selfish manipulator who is not worth the effort understand deconstructing harry is set at time when harrys old college the one that expelled him when he attended it wants now honor him for lifetime of writing achievement harry is searching among his friends find one who will go him just why someone who is so unwilling commit relationship anyone suddenly needs the support of someone else is unclear harry tries his current girl friend fay elizabeth shue only find that she is about marry harrys old friend larry billy crystal block would like his son hilly eric lloyd accompany him but hillys mother previously first harrys psychiatrist and more recently his wife refuses let her son see his father another friend richard bob balaban would go but has health problems harry also considers bringing prostitute cookie hazel goodman it is interesting that allen should introduce another likable prostitute so soon after mighty aphrodite but cookie is considerably differentblack and lot brighter than mira sorvinos character in the previous while the comedy sequences are never complete few are elaborate and some quite funny the centerpiece of the is journey into hell allen playing sort of orpheus rescuing fay from the clutches of the devil who looks lot like larry that story also is left uncompleted perhaps show harrys unwillingness commit even telling story the linchpin that was needed tie together the stylistic quirks of this was central character who changes and who gives us something about care that character is patently not the one allen creates in harry block and not the characters around harry as seen through his acerbic eyes allen can do much better than deconstructing harry rate it on the scale and on the scale

heres rarity childrens that attempts tackle weighty subject is there god done well it could have been gem among the wasteland of modern childrens cinema unfortunately it is not jumbled messages and an unclear audience wide awake was better left asleep fifth grader joshua beal joseph cross is in the middle of moral crisis his beloved grandfather robert loggia has died and joshua has begun quest he wants find god discover why bad things happen this religious quest is slightly disturbing for his parents dana delany and denis leary but they do their best cope their son as he explores different religious faiths at his catholic school his favorite teacher sister terry rosie odonnell tries give him guidance but this is journey he must make on his own meanwhile he is having the most momentous year of his life he has several adventures his daredevil best friend dave timothy reifsnyder he gets his first crush and begins wake up the world around him while he is on his spiritual journey it is somewhat confusing as what the real audience for wide awake is expected be on its surface it appears be kids however it deals serious issues and is likely be boring for todays instantgratification kids and while it might seem heartening see that someone is trying produce something thoughtful for the kidvid audience wide awake asks serious questions but only delivers cheap gimmick for an answer if there were bit more meat in the story adults on nostalgic bent might get kick out of the movie the actors who might have created great cast odonnell leary and delany are wasted in roles that amount little more than cameos the nostalgic elements best friend favorite teacher first crush etc have been done much better in other movies and actually seem more like filler here the films strongest scenes are some touching flashbacks depicting joshuas relationship his grandfather they show more depth than is present anywhere else in the movie maybe the would have been better if instead of playing the relationship through flashbacks it were set entirely during joshuas last year his grandpa it certainly would have been more entertaining wide awake can best be described as failed experiment it starts out noble aspirations but never delivers on its promise parents who do take their children see this one ought be prepared answer some tough questions that is if their kids are not bored death first

there is no reason doubt that donnie brasco is based as its opening credits proclaim on true story but if it is an accurate picture of life on americas mean streets than cinematic depictions of organised crime have had much stronger basis in reality than would have previously thought for from the films outset when group of hoods jocularly trade differing opinions on the merits of various automobiles not unlike number of movie lowlifes who recently gave madonna song close reading donnie brasco resembles more than passingly few gangster flicks once believed be works of fiction our eponymous hero johnny depp is not the cheap crook he first appears be brasco is joseph pistone an undercover fbi agent who has the task of chummingup lefty al pacino seasoned hood who tutors pistone in the art of being wiseguy regrettably pistone learns his lessons all too well his concern for lefty who is burdened heroin addicted son exacerbates his own family troubles his children resent his lengthy absences and his wife fears that her husbands gangster persona is becoming little too convincing true the focus on pistones family life does deviate from the typical gangsterflick formula but this subplot never rises above its television drama origins the unhappy couple trade predictable lines and engage in drawnout domestic squabbles including an illadvised marriage guidance routine that slow the down unnecessarily the biggest problem donnie brasco however is that its wiseguy attitude and style lacks the flair of its many predecessors the awkward use of an occasional disco tune momentarily reminds us its the but not the consistent and blindingly tacky style loved those fluoro coloured suits of scorces costume drama casino more importantly pacinos presence triggers memories of his earlier movie triumphs in similar territory was covered far more effectively donnie brascos take on american values for instance is feeble and obvious lefty rambles out dreams of material betterment the accompaniment of grating inspirational music inexplicably leftys horatio alger inspired gush is supposed move us it does not any more than his family troubles do are dealt in the same saccharine and obvious manner as pistones just think minute on how these themes were explored in the godfather movies and scarface in these pictures pacinos dedication peculiar and bloody hypercapitalism was twisted and confronting while his dogged application of macho wiseguy procedure meant that his relations friends and family was intriguingly dark neither were spared bloody retribution for breaching wiseguy regulations donnie brascos tawdry little crime therefore is not so much its repetition of familiar gangster themes but the shameless way in it sanitises them oh and the way forgot mention that the script also sports startling subplot pipstones superiors are obstructive incompetents who are infuriated his constant insubordination is that damn you mcbain hear from springfield way so the movie is cliched big deal what do you expect from gangsterflick well you expect quality action sequences and bravado performances in abundance if its going be decent example of the genre donnie brasco fails on both counts the action scenes never rise above the ordinary and depps woeful performance tends smother the goodwork of his comrades admittedly pacino does nothing new and michael madsen sonny simply smirks his way through the picture like slightly subdued mr white but both possess an unmistakable sly charm depp usually exhibits bit of class himself but regrettably being in the presence of one of his betters must have left him starstruck for he is completely hellbent on mimicking pacinos wellearned high style the consequences are painful watch its no exaggeration say that the films credibility is seriously strained the sight of the pistone familys uncanny ability keep straight face in front of their breadwinners phony brooklyn accent perhaps we should take pity on the makers of donnie brasco maybe scrupulous adherence pinpoint accuracy demanded tiered dialogue and scenarios weakly reminiscent of classic gangster flicks if this is indeed the case surely the makers of donnie brasco could have explored the fascinating possibility that americas underworld is committed emulating albeit in heavily attenuated form their movie namesakes depp could have poignantly played simple cop who becomes hideous parody once he is forced mimic bigscreen gangster greats who knows what insights into the criminal psyche could have arisen but then again perhaps donnie brasco is not so true after all

these days the lack of originality in reflects itself in the deluge of remakes but only few years ago before wes craven publicly made fun of the practice sequels had been more popular among producers sequels also used be popular among directors and movie stars whose careers went south the way regain popularity and prestige they thought was the use the same formulas characters and story lines that brought them success in the first place one of such celebrity was eddie murphy black comedian of whose career was in big decline during the first part of this decade in order return the spotlight he chose resurrect the franchise created his most popular beverly hills cop action comedy that had already spawned the sequel in seven years later for the third instalment he used the directorial service of john landis another fading star whom he successfully collaborated twice in trading places and coming america this time however third time was not the charm and beverly hills iii was failure eddie murphy had wait few more years for real comeback eddie murphy here plays axel foley fasttalking streetwise detroit policeman who raids illegal chop shop the routine police action ends in tragedy when the criminals kill foleys boss determined bring the killers justice foley realises that their leader is ellis de wald timothy carhart when it turns out that de wald happens be security chief for wonderland theme park in los angeles foley goes back los angeles there the help of his old friend local policeman rosewood judge rheinhold foley would clash money counterfeit ring ten years has passed since the original and times are definitely different in this decade the contrast between blue collar detroit and yuppie beverly hills provided lot of gags in simply does not work screenwriter steven de souza provides another conflict this time between the childish sillyness of the good guys and businesslike professionalism of the bad guys since foley belongs the former his character had watch his language and the tone of the in general is more infantile unfortunately this still belongs action movie genre and there is too much violence for little children nice example is the humorous scene in the beginning turns into standard ramboesque bloodbath unlike donner the lethal weapon series landis simply cannot balance the comedy regular action and the result is that fails in both aspects action scenes are sometimes interesting but not too spectacular at the end scenery of wonderland is more fascinating than the action itself humour on the other hand falls flat make even worse some minor characters from gets unnecessary and sometimes irritating overexposure especially art expert turned into arms dealer played bronson pinchot in the end although the provided some entertainment viewers at least critical ones would probably be happy know that there are not any plans for beverly hills iv

i have never been so confused after watching movie meet joe black is probably one of the most visually satisfying films of this year cinematography music and cast that will dazzle most of us at the same time it is probably the most boring and ridiculous experience hat you will have this season at first you marvel at the elegant direction graceful cinematography and sensual musical score then you will wait for something happen for half an hour but when you finally understand what is going on you will wonder what are actors such as anthony hopkins brad pitt and claire forlani are doing in like this the script is simply silly and unresolved story is artificially stretched into three hour long motion picture it feels like an eternity most of the time it is pompous soap opera filled empty dialogue that the actors deliver in high pitched voice and meaningful winks the is based on alberto caesellas play death takes holiday the story concentrates around bill anthony hopkins who lives fulfilled life as successful business man but sometimes he wakes up in the middle of the night and hears voice that is saying yes soon he meets young elegant gentlemen brad pitt who introduces himself as death it is bills time but death has other plans it has come down us simple mortals find out what it means be alive our bill is chosen be deaths guide and in exchange he gets time bill introduces death as joe black who immediately becomes the center of everyones attention bills business partners speculate about why joe is constantly at bills side lives in his house and resides at his office that is not all however bills youngest daughter susan claire forlani falls in love the mysterious stranger and joe falls in love her this relationship is bound have some serious consequences it would not be fair say that this did not have some interesting moments such as the scene where joe is invited join bills family for dinner when joe starts enjoying peanut butter and later falls in love the experience is somewhat different it is obvious that story like this story is very difficult structure it is one thing say would not it be fun have death take human form and come down earth create motion picture out of this is another four screenwriters have worked on script that lacks drive and logic it is overlong and too primitive pass as serious on the other hand it demonstrates incredible performances and very decent direction martin brest scent of woman hopkins looks great in any role and no matter how shallow or hollow it is he will complete it his talent and charisma are needed here more than any where else since it actually saves the from complete embarrassment but pitt is the one that got one of the most difficult roles of recent time how can you play death in human form me it seems that death and life are not something that can be associated earthly matters they are not creatures but phenomenas saying that death takes human form would be the same as suggest that eternity would take human form handling such ridiculous task is incredibly difficult and pitt deserves some credit for his work speaking in calm soft voice portraying death as lonely distant and powerful guy that is unfamiliar practical earthly matters he looks and acts more like an angel of death rather than demon or redeyed executioner claire forlani and others are also fine stretching their stereotypical characters their limits unfortunately their performances are not enough rescue this from its self inflicted misery in other words this is not what expected from the director of scent of woman it could and should be better such cast and crew in the end it seems as if they have all been intensively working on ravishingly looking soap opera

this is crap but honestly what older american audience is going be able resist seeing jack lemmon and james garner as bicker ing expresidents especially when their supporting players in clude dan aykroyd as the current commander in chief lauren bacall as former first lady and john heard as the dan quayleish vice president yup you are talkin presold property here and for warner brothers the perfect fit into their nowritual grumpy old men holiday slot for the nondiscriminating viewer my fellow americans is fine the raw star power alone will have audiences applauding this atrocious political thriller roadcomedy they did in mine heaven help us for the rest of us the movie is immediately tiresome the tone is terrible and the banter is worse forget wit lemmon and garner merely exchange profanities through most of the movie has anyone counted the number of first penis references sure some of the bits are absurdly funny including mens room macarena joke the appearance of an elvis impersonator on trainload of tarheels and an all dorothy marching band performing over the rainbow at gay mens march the get there from here though you have submit one of the most offensively overbearing musical scores of all time judas priest is there single moment of silence in this even the dialogue gets drowned out what waste

keep cool chinese directed semiaccomplished filmmaker yimou zhang was one of the kickoff films for this years hawaii international festival on the day it premiered lines of eager moviegoers stretched around the block some anticipants having queued up well in advance get good seat in the theater they need not have wasted their time the movie is billed as comedy but is surprisingly bereft of humor there are noticeable attempts at laughs but very few tries actually click wondered if there were jokes that was not getting because am not from china but unfortunately my conclusion was that this lack of humor could not be attributed the cultural barrier either keep cool just is not very funny the prelude the was visit keep cools producer who the help of an interpreter regaled us of how in order get the print the festival in time an assistant hand carried it on the plane from china hawaii although the print made it the assistants luggage was lost too bad that story was not in the movie because it got big laugh qu ying the films female lead was also on hand give few comments however whereas the producer politely made regular pauses in his dialog so the interpreter could bring us up speed ms ying saw fit say everything she had say in one fastpaced incredibly long tirade it was dizzying good foreshadowing for the you see keep cool is filmed almost totally camera handheld man bad case of the shakes at least that is the way it seems since the camera is constantly moving cinema verite is one thing but panning and shaking around until your audience has headache is another although some might consider it form helps give the viewer an idea of the anarchic state into chinese youth is slowly growing found it thoroughly distracting and after while quite annoying headache as said the is about young bookseller wen jiang who is after young woman qu ying they used be romantically involved but the woman grew tired of him and left the relationship the first half of the is about the young mans plan win her back of course the thing is she does not want be won back and has nightclub owner friend of hers rough him up bit in the fight the young man grabs laptop computer belonging bystander and attempts use it fend off his attacker but only ends up smashing it against lamppost we later find out that the laptop belongs an older man who wishes get his damaged computer replaced there is funny scene the only one in the where the young man tries use some twisted logic in order get the older man seek out the nightclub owner baotian li in order recoup his losses there is no sense be made out of the young womans behavior cold one minute caring the next so we feel no sympathy for her character the bookseller would be better off without her although the second half of the causes us lose lot of sympathy for the young bookseller as well who is obsessed chopping off the nightclub owners hand as revenge for the beating he took it also offers us some nice interaction between the bookseller and the older man while the bookseller is blinded his thirst for revenge the older man is the voice of reason and tries rationalize each situation his quest end the dispute peacefully and equitably is the one we identify but it is frustrating see that he seems be talking brick wall half the time friendship develops between the two men but it occurs too late in the for the audience appreciate although only an hour and half in length keep cool contains extraneous material the whole plot of how the bookseller is after the young woman could have been taken out since we do not see her from the midpoint on case of mistaken identity or some other device could have served as the point of conflict between the bookseller and the nightclub owner and would have saved us from the booksellers boring pursuit during the first half but of course this would have shortened the movie less than an hour there are few things that keep cool does right as mentioned before the interaction between the bookseller and the older man is generally pretty good although it grows tiresome the reasoning the unreasonable is nice exercise in logic and represents the differences in thinking between generations in one scene for example the bookseller quotes confucius get his point across but the older man claims the quote was misinterpreted and that it means something entirely different also effective is the way zhang sets up tension within scene such as when the bookseller is getting ready cut off the hand of the unwitting nightclub owner the nightclub owner is counting out money slapping each bundle of currency on the table every shot of his hand we can hardly stand the interminable wait before the bookseller is going pull out his cleaver and exact his revenge unfortunately these crumbs are not enough overcome the rest of the films shortcomings and were not enough prevent that headache from lingering after left the theater

although had not been viewer of the rugrats television series went into their first animated feature the rugrats movie positive attitude the trailer looked cute enough after all after seeing it think the words in my recent antz review in stated that it was the worst of its type since the pebble and the penguin were bit premature the rugrats movie is bottomofthebarrel childrens fare at its worst and starts make antz look good in comparison as in the show the rugrats movie is about group of very little friends ranging from babies threeyearold the head of the group tommy pickles g daily becomes distraught when his mother has newborn baby named dill get it dill pickles hardeeharhar and is informed his threeyearold cousin anjelica cheryl chase that the new babies always take all of the attention away from the other children when the other children chuckie and twins lil and phil suggest taking dill back the hospital tommy goes along it but on their way there they crash in the forest and become lost running into wolves and circus monkeys among other things the rugrats movie judging from the idea of being lost in the woods could have been potentially fun family and there were many different things that could have been done the story so what did the writers choose do why they set up protracted cliched scene where the children almost go over waterfall of course for the youngest of children ages the rugrats movie may very well entertain them judging from the audience saw this of course if you looked around at all of the older kids and their parents they were all desperately struggling stay awake and that included me for an adult the rugrats movie is piece of garbage the plotline is unoriginal and the writing has absolutely no wit or charm there is not one laugh be had in the nor is there any excitement if anything is even marginally good in the picture it is the bright animation style so it is especially unfortunate that it was not service more quality the rugrats movie is doa from the start am all for worthwhile family movie but sometimes an animated comes along that is simply awful as said before young children may like it but even they deserve better than this for adults it is nearly unbearable excruciating chore sit through as for me the rugrats movie is not the worst of the year nor is it the most deeply hated but it is the most boring parents do yourselves favor and take your kids see the rerelease of the wizard of oz that is picture that contains great deal of magic and wonder two things of the rugrats movie is completely missing

plunkett macleane is period piece mired down modern mtv pretentions have nothing against the mtv approach filmmaking used properly it can save movie see stigmata but it ruins this one making muddled incoherent mess out of potentially interesting premise there are certain genres that just do not go together the opens sequence that still do not understand it involves some sort of prison outbreak robbery and gem that keeps being eaten in any case the caper whatever it may be brings together plunkett and macleane robert carlyle and johnny lee miller respectively two happygolucky brits no way make living they make pact steal money from the rich and give it themselves until they earn enough money buy ticket america their first heist involves young debutante named lady rebecca liv tyler woman macleane was especially friendly at party just earlier his decorum when stripping her of her valuables earns our two crooks the name gentleman highwaymen lady rebecca also happens be the niece of the lord chief justice glaringly arrogant man nearing the end of his political career he demands that the robbers be caught and punished immediately leaving the job in the hands of the devious chance ken stott who has few more things on his mind than catching criminals meanwhile macleane falls in love rebecca infuriating the businesslike plunkett who does not want his plans be foiled his partners mindless romantic travails director jake scott son of ridley scott alien blade runner has his fathers knack for setting up atmospheric shots but none of his skill in actually moving the camera most of the action scenes are filmed in such rapid jerky way that it is impossible comprehend what is going on the camerawork is even more nauseating than in the purposefully dizzying the blair witch project due its lack of fluidity instead of utilizing panning shots impress upon us the scope of the events scott uses attentiondeficitdisorder edits he barely ever holds shot for more than ten seconds and during the faster scenes it seems more like couple frames between each cut the weird almost defiant lack of dialogue there are no no conversations lasting over say seconds undermines character definition and our two protagonists come off as ciphers rather than characters the love affair between macleane and rebecca is no different emotionless and unrealistic when the script calls for macleane decide between going america and going meet his lover there is no reason for us believe it would be worth it for him abandon his goal he and rebecca barely even speak each other throughout the plunkett and macleane wants desperately be triumph of style over substance but since its style quite frankly blows the has no hope of succeeding on any level wanted appreciate this movie on the basis of its admittedly kinetic pace but could not it was so kinetic it gave me headache

this review contains spoilers as most of her films director amy heckerlings latest loser seesaws between unpleasant and artificial and is sometimes both at once when she tackles big issues such as abortion in fast times at ridgemont high it is impossible tell whether she is being matteroffact or glib about them they carry an almost documentary starkness but whatever the case she continually refuses comment politically such is the sitcom tendency of her work jeopardize the innocence of her characters and then hit the reset button this fear of drama soured me on fast times look who is talking clueless and now loser in ms heckerling also demonstrates for the first time zero affinity for the milieu has anyone for instance ever met girl in the stylistic vein of mena suvaris dora attired in black thrift her eye shadow smeared racoon chic and her bangy red hair barely contained girlish clips she accepts the label of goth but no selfrespecting goth girl ever admitted digging as dora does those geriatric rockers everclear nor willingly went anywhere sixpackwielding fratboy stranger the mechanics of losers tired old introvertboyfallsforextrovertgirl plot drive its protagonists into cultural nonspecificity so that they become even less than stereotypes they become walking wardrobes smalltown transplant paul strangely static jason biggs our eponymous hero always wears his woolly hunters cap flaps covering the ears and beneath it rests parted moptop that could not scream shemp the lame stooge wig louder he has three smuglooking roommates the onedimensional trio is not supposed be brothers but they share similar facial features including and especially mouths and their fashion sense is incomprehensibly glam though they are not overtly transvestites heckerling seems be equating flamboyance villainy how very cruising of her the dormies conspire evict paul and regularly molest women they have drugged dora ignorantly downs one of their date rape potions unfortunately either heckerling or the studio is too cowardly admit if she was subsequently violated when paul rescues dora from said narcotic scare he learns that she is dating their unctuous european lit professor edward alcott superb greg kinnear although pauls already in love dora this point as is bound happen losers when pretty girls address them name he gets altruistic and pretends the flowers he bought her are actually from alcott she is thrilled but nevertheless spends few days at pauls recuperate the two bond over emergency kitten surgery and broadway play cabaret and just when pauls got in his head that she is starting love him back in that nonfriendly way she decides become alcotts livein girlfriend cue precious hommage the graduate shots of paul drifting around berkeleyer aside simon garfunkels parsley sage rosemary thyme should never have been allowed in another motion picture heckerling has lot in common nora you have got mail ephron the only other prominent chick directing comedies today in that neither has any use for strongwilled women men continue trod on dora until the bitter end in the final scene she gives paul big smooch after he blurts out his feelings in what amounts creepy ultimatum and dora ultimately shrugs off being drugged against her willmere hours after paul hints her that she was poisoned she is cheerily redecorating his apartment heckerling is so laissezfaire about the issue in general that she reserves the comeuppance of the wouldbe rapists for jokey epilogue titles goth veneer aside there are an awful lot of girls out there who behave as erratically as dora and enough angry young dude filmmakers make movies about them heckerling misses her shot at having dora transform herself into role model and while such arcs may not be heckerlings social responsibility it is privilege would have taken advantage of if were in her shoes consider too that dora is the films sole female principal not that loser is worth contemplating this seriouslygod knows heckerling did not that is her hallmark for more firstrun dvd and booksaboutmovies reviews plus contests and the proverbial more visit freak central http filmfreakcentral net

fantastically over hyped godzila finally lumbers onto the big screen the opens footage of nuclear testing on the french polynesian islands then an attack on boat from some beast and finally we join dr nick tatopoulos broderick looking about years old doing some research in chernobyl some shady s government guys appear and ask him come an island where they have massive footprints from what looks like giant lizard and what is more this beast is heading for new york gulp although godzilla should be non stop roller coaster ride and at some points it is there is something curiously uninvolving and unexciting about this movie the main faults lie the acting and writing common problems summer blockbuster movies broderick is pretty useless as the hero no humour or tough guy image while emmerichs previous summer flick independence day had wisecracks and action from jeff goldblum and will smith this has neither also maria pitillo as brodericks former girlfriend is just as useless chronic disability in acting she is incapable of showing emotion speaks every line in the same way and basically she is total crap it is up french actor jean reno save the day and indeed he does turning in campy performance as french secret agent shame he has such little screen time in such overlong hank azaria also turns up as crazy cameraman named animal and he adds little life the picture also making an appearance is harry shearer probably best know for doing voices in the simpsons as slimy news reporter k so the acting is not up par but it never is in these movies but what about the script well that is not up par either emmerich and screenwriting pal dean devlin seem so caught in the destruction of new york city that they forgot write script the dialogue is banal broderick looks at lot of fish and utters that is lot of fish and the character development is non existent reno plays the typical frenchman no croissant broderick forever remains geeky scientist also the is seriously lacking sense of humour the jokes that are uttered are pathetic and there is an hilarious running gag about siskel and ebert the mayor is mayor ebert and is assistant is called gene ha ha ha ha the plot is dire and in the end just rips off jurassic park having lots of baby godzillas e velicorapters running around new york right so the script and acting suck but what about the special effects thankfully they are are quite good godzilla is an impressive piece of cgi although we do not see much of him because the movie is so dark the destruction of new york is pretty well done aswell but although they are impressive they cannot save godzilla from being an hugely disappointing and boring movie the movie goes on for far too long aswell and it cannot seem decide on ending and of course the ending itself leaves possibility for sequel let us just hope one never arrives

movie concepts are often pitched producers mathematical formulas involving successful films of the past so undoubtedly one day someone said evolution it is ghostbusters plus men in black plus tremors and so it is sum total none the alienbusting begins when meteor lands in glen canyon arizona community college science profs ira kane david duchovny and harry block orlando jones take some samples from the meteor and discover that onecelled organisms from inside it are evolving rapidly doing in hours what took millions of years for life on earth just about the time was wondering hey does not the government usually come in and take over the whole area in these movies the government came in and took over the whole area the leader of the pack gen woodman ted levine turns out be an old nemesis of iras and ira and harry are blocked from doing further research meanwhile the organisms continue grow until they are large enough start attacking people this time ira and harry have gained friend in dr allison reed julianne moore of the center for disease control country club poolboy wayne green seann william scott has also attached himself the merry band but can they find the means stop the aliens in time director ivan reitman seems be revisiting his biggest hit ghostbusters but evolution falls miserably short one reason is readily apparent ghostbusters had three really funny guys as its scientists bill murray dan aykroyd and harold ramis but evolution has one really funny guy orlando jones who can adlib and milk the comic potential of lines that prove useless in anyone elses hands for good measure ghostbusters had the comic talents of rick moranis evolution offers seann william scott who was much funnier in american pie and road trip than he is here scott has one amusing scene where he sings you are so beautiful me dragonlike alien draw it into trap other than that scott seems unable make much of the thin material the writers gave him an actor in search of forte david duchovny looked for his gritty action hero side in playing god and his romantic side in return me now he wants find his wacky comedic talent what we all find is that he does not have any look for him be back on tv in five years or so another sad case is julianne moore who needs be more selective about the offers she accepts she is talented actress an impressive list of credits and award nominations so why is she trying do slapstick comedy her character has tendency trip over and bump into things but the trait comes off as pathetic plea for laughs the sole saving grace of the is jones he is at the center of the movies funniest scene where an alien bug invades harrys body and has be pulled out through his ass jones is the only cast member who can take the comedic ball and run it but he cannot carry the whole movie himself he found himself in similar situation in the replacements where he was also the only comic talent in an ensemble cast jones will eventually find the project that will make him major comedy star but this is not it

well arnold has completed the seemingly impossible task he has made three consecutive unsatisfactory action films in domain that he owns it is very surprising that this goliath of an action star can not tell good action script from bad one eraser back in was confused that made no attempt at all make sense batman and robin in was the black sheep of the batman series ridiculous acting idiotic action scenes and painfully flashy costumes now in end of days not the end of days is the third strike in tough at bat for arnold is this the end of powerful action stars longlived career will arnold ever give us another unforgettable performance in another unforgettable classic like those in the past terminator terminator judgement day predator or an unforgettable performance in great guilty pleasure like those in the past commando red sonja true lies it does not look that way end of days begins the birth of baby girl in who inexorably due the formation of the stars on that night will be the carrier of satans baby the hour before new years of fortunately for the movies sake the girl grows up and now resides in manhattan skyscrapers subway trains in dark tunnels and myriad of inept nypd officers it is an action films dream come true when the director is given tons of cool stuff blow up imagine if the girl had lived in anytown usa where the only thing destroy is dairy queen and post office arnold schwarzenegger jericho cane in series of boring events finds himself in the middle of religious battle between the church who is trying hide the girl or in some cases trying kill her and satan gabriel byrne who is trying make her pregnant if the devil is successful the world will no longer exist as we know it jericho feels it is his duty protect the girl from everyone because he once had faith but no longer does and his wife and daughter were killed and he feels responsible for it jericho cane is your cliched bythenumbers hero right up his name arnold fittingly plays the character as cliched as he can he shouts at everyone from cops priests the devil in one truly hilarious scene was supposed be the ultimate dramatic high point jericho screams the devil you are choir boy you are choir boy those two lines marked the high points of this movie can still be enjoyable when the supporting cast is more effective than the main actor end of days fails contain any memorable performances the exception of gabriel byrne byrne playing man who has been made the manifestation of the devil seems be the only one who is having fun in this whole movie he wonderfully plays manipulative villain the power control everyone at any time the annoying thing about his character however is that he has the power kill any human simple punch in the face yet he finds it impossible seriously hurt jericho can not count the number of times he could have killed jericho and taken the girl from his custody the other actors in the give very weak and unconvincing performances kevin pollak who plays the partner and close friend of jericho is the supposedly funny character in the every action movie has one the one problem is that pollak does not deliver one funny line robin tunney plays the chosen mother of satans baby extreme annoyance she gets no sympathy from any of the characters in the except arnold who pretends she is his wife and daughter or any of the viewers in the audience in one unnecessary scene tunney walks out of her room and takes her top off is this her job in the the actors are not blame entirely because the script is terrible you can tell script is terrible when you are able predict what will happen minutes before it does this little prediction game is very fun exception trying sit through this nonsense of movie in last attempt make this movie good special effects are used try entertain the audience but without memorable action scene in the whole the director has not done his job successfully this would have gotten c if arnold stood in front of camera and shouted you are choir boy for two hours

whether or not would be considered trekker probably depends on whom you would ask have been fan of both the original series and its recently retired followup as well as the even numbered entries in the series however have never been one of those folks who store away trek minutiae and get into debates over the relative merits of spock vs data somewhere along the line the star trek series began seem more and more directed at those in the latter category and star trek generations may be the natural conclusion of this direction its production values may be high but the writing is frequently appalling and instead of script has collection of references injokes and illdefined characters generations opens in the late rd century where members of the original enterprise crew including captain james kirk william shatner are present for the christening of the latest ship bear that name no sooner is it out on its maiden voyage than distress signal brings them the nexus mysterious ribbon of energy among those rescued from the nexus is longlived alien dr soran malcolm mcdowell but he is nonetoopleased at being back in the real world seventyeight years later soran is still trying get back the nexus and again encounters an enterprise this one led captain jeanluc picard patrick stewart sorans plan involves destroying star an inhabited planet and the only hope for saving million people is the historic meeting of two enterprise captains do not think it is an insult fans of star trek suggest that certain extent the particulars of plot are not really the most important elements in trek it is about chance visit old friends and if they are involved in truly interesting story it can be considered gravy but even that interpretation assumes that characterization has be consistent and in generations that just does not happen data brent spiner is particularly victimized this sloppy writing in the films major subplot data decides use chip will give him human emotions chip he has had in his possession for over year what is his motivation for taking this drastic and perhaps dangerous step he does not get joke once the chip is in place spiner gets have lot of fun datas new emotions but the point is that he is no longer the data we know if the rest of the next generation cast fares any better it is only because they are on the screen so little that they are simply window dressing but then again this story is not really about the new crew it is about kirk and picard the cowboy and the politician sharing the screen the huge surprise is that william shatner blows patrick stewart away perhaps because he knows this is his last goround in the part that made him legend shatner looks like he is having the time of his life stewart on the other hand borders on the deferrential and is saddled the same lackluster motivations as everyone else in the cast stewarts edginess is indicative of what may be very bad sign for paramounts hopes turn the new cast into the same kind of franchise the original cast was these are clearly the not ready for big screen players contrast the prologue features scotty james doohan and chekhov walter koenig is the highlight of the these characters have become part of the popular mythology and when they take over the enterprise in moment of distress it is moment of high energy only thirty years of history can create moment like that and that is time this new crew does not have it certainly does not help that the plot they are stuck in is so convoluted and badly constructed that you need leave trail of bread crumbs find your way out again it is also loaded little gags all aimed at those who are familiar enough the series turn all their friends in shared nudge of recognition wonder whether anyone who is coming in cold the trek universe at this point would be anything but baffled and bored what is going on and what waste of malcolm mcdowell who could have been great monomanical villain but should have been given much more compelling reason for his obsession there are plenty of details both scientific and of continuity pick at but do so would be ignore generations major flaws however would like make one recommendation seatbelts not just for the enterprise crew although you would think the th century space travel would not involve rolling around on the floor during battle no think the audience might need them more this journey is one bumpy ride

they should have stuck the promise emblazoned on the original movies poster no sequel scary movie is nowhere near as funny as its predecessor and it is not because the wayans brothers shawn and marlon doing the writing and keenen ivory behind the camera do not try what defeats them is the genre they have chosen spoof the first movie an outrageous lowbrow savage satire of teen slasher flicks such as scream and know what you did last summer succeeded because of its takenoprisoners attitude toward type of that was in vogue familiar and popular in scary movie the filmmakers take on the haunted houseghost story format if you look at the grosses for such recent lame offerings as the respective remakes of the haunting and house on haunted hill did not draw audiences nor enter the cultural psyche as did the various teen slasher series scary movie does start off promising wonderful spoof of the exorcist featuring james wood in the max von sydow role and veronica cartwright lampooning ellen burstyn of course split pea soup is the punch line an overabundant amount offers the hope that the rest of the movie will be just as tasteless and excessive but this precredit sequence has nothing at all do the main action features the cast members from the original signing up spend weekend at creepy haunted mansion as part of university class project some of the jokes are as scatological and offensive as in the original but they lack that takenoprisoners bite that raised scary movie the heights of burlesque scary movie merely lurches from one lame sendup another offering weak spoofs of that nike shoe ad in everyone does acrobatics basketball and the films what lies beneath and hannibal features that only faired adequately at the box office john woos mission impossible and charlies angels it is as if the wayans and their team of writers at least seven are credited just threw ideas in blender and hoped they would coalesce they do not while the pace of the original left you breathless the sequel moves the speed of an wheeler carrying two tons of concrete up steep mountain road you can almost hear the reels panting scary movie tries very hard live up its original but it falls very short it is dissatisfying spectacle very weak sister of very good movie the really scary aspect of this sequel is how disappointing it really is

vikings bears no this is not the lineup for monday night football rather these are the two opposing forces that will battle the death in the th warrior that is as dramatically flat as it is gratuitously gory based on michael crichtons book eaters of the dead this viking saga tries evoke the mysticism of fabled norsemen and the glorious battles that they fought their strength and honor would eventually etch their place in history among the greatest warriors that ever picked up sword luckily for the vikings however their warring abilities were not as clumsy as this antonio bandaras is ahmed travelling ambassador accompanied his friend omar shariff in cameo they eventually come across small viking village we see that the vikings are an extremely proud group whose greatest strength is their fortitude they laugh heartily revel in their arrogance and sing songs of battles won but their festivities are about be halted when messenger boy arrives tell the village leader that great evil is threatening their land help is needed quickly an elderly fortunetelling witch arrives after brief incantation she proclaims that warriors and one more not of norse blood are needed ensure victory personally always wonder why people believe these oracles when they look so haggardly and on the brink of insanity nonetheless men eagerly accept their place while ahmed becomes the pivotal th the group then sets out do the greatest battle of their lives of course during their ride ahmed becomes the target of fun for the other burly viking warriors but he ably shows that it is not the size of the dog in the fight but rather the size of the fight in the dog he is able overcome the proud arrogance of the vikings but will his skills and that of the group be enough defeat whatever evil is menacing the countryside it does not look promising these creatures resembling bears are strong and have high morale they are fearless and display desire for decapitating the heads of their enemies they attack the hundreds and the next strike will come soon the warriors prepare their defenses and pray their gods they are ready sacrifice their lives this is good way die says one of the fallen warriors despite the largerthanlife battle sequences was unmoved the entire experience at many points was even confused for example somewhere in the middle of the subplot creeps up involving the prince of the threatened land he seems have an agenda elevate himself greater power during this crisis however the subplot never fully materializes and we are left scratching our heads as the purpose of its inclusion there are other questions that had but the real problem was that the story little of it that there was offered no characters love or hate the leader of the viking warriors had the most charisma however banderass role is completely underwritten and it is unclear why being the th warrior makes him so special an entire rewrite of the ahmed character is in order also much of the action takes place during torrential downpours or at night made battles very difficult follow would have preferred more time looking at the viking culture and how their beliefs shaped their decision do battle against the enemy as it stands the manages more confusion than intensity it would make thor cry

apparently when crap calls jim carrey answers here he is mugging it up in countless unfunny ways for the fifth time his second goaround in the role of pet detective ace ventura that means more talking asscracks penis jokes and cries of alllllllllllrighty then it all adds up sequel that makes the original resemble schindlers list in terms of dramatic merit or lack of granted there are few laughs amid the constant barrage of preschool humor but anyone who appreciates good comedy will bang their head against the wall ten times for every minor chuckle it is painful experience for anyone brain ace is distraught after accidentally dropping racoon into canyon in parody of the opening scene of sylvester stallones cliffhanger jim carrey being the only person who can make stallone look like college professor in terms of intellect or lack of and decides retire the mountains of tibet gain higher level of consciousness or in his case level of consciousness but he is pulled out of retirement the tune of retrieve sacred white bat for an african tribe why africa so carrey can disguise himself nude inside fake rhino and later climb out the rear end as tourist family watches look the rhinos about give birth if that seems like heehaw humor you all means see the movie if not claim your place in human civilization the rest of us obviously there are quite few nonmembers of civilization who made this movie like the first ace ventura use the word only because it was filmed not because there is any level of artistic merit huge success in fact carrey only has career because of the decline of intelligence in our culture you may say me but andrew look at jerry lewis he was born negative q and look how popular he was thirty years ago maybe but still say jerry lewis is notch or two up on the comedic ladder because he never actually did an impression in movie of rabid bulldog biting off mans testicles lewis at least had the dignity save that performance for when company came over

one of my favorite songs the stranglers includes the lyric you would better watch out for the skin deep would like extend the same warning watch out for skin deep but whatever you do do not watch skin deep skin deep is tedious and uneven comedy written and directed blake edwards john ritter stars as zach dried up writer and insatiable womanizer bigtime drinking problem never saw edwards comedy the man who loved women but have wonder whether skin deep is remake you see put it mildly zach goes bed just about each and every woman he meets as the movie opens zachs wife alex catches him not only his mistress but also his mistress hairdresser like any sensible wife alex kicks zach out of the house and divorces him in response zach goes on spiritual journey of drinking womanizing psychotherapy and selfdiscovery if you are turned on the idea of watching ritter drink get arrested have sex drink crash his mercedes have more sex drink get arrested again drink and sing horrendously at the piano then skin deep should be right up your alley skin deep makes the fatal mistake of inflicting on us unbelievable and unsympathetic characters zach is rich l version of ritters jack tripper character from threes company like jack zach is clumsy and inept he is the type of guy whose bad aim makes him accidently squirt breath freshener into his eye zach is supposed be charming and charismatic but failed see even one redeeming virtue in him consequently never felt the least bit of sympathy or pity for the philandering alcoholic during his moments of crisis in fact when zach crashes his exwifes wedding in desperate attempt stop her from remarrying actually rooted for her go through the ceremony add insult injury edwards gives his large supporting cast nothing but stereotypes work for instance vincent gardenias talents are wasted in his role as the fatherly bartender of all the women in the filmand there are manyalyson reed alone stands out as zachs wife reed brings intelligence and sensitivity the role because we do not care the slightest bit about anyone in skin deep the films few feeble attempts at drama inevitably fail the comedy in skin deep does not fare much better most of the jokes are dumb predictable and sitcomish about every ten minutes however edwards does manage come up good line or novel sightgag the most effective of involves pair of dueling condoms overall the laughs in skin deep are just too infrequent and the characters just too shallow for the stay afloat my final criticism of the lies in its glamorous depiction of alcohol and alcoholism zachs excessive drinking is clearly ruining his life but nevertheless it seems give him more pleasure than pain zachs drinking binges never have any truly serious or lasting consequences if he crashes his mercedes he gets new one if he gets arrested his lawyer bails him out of jail if his wife leaves him she will eventually decide give him second chance if he will clean up his act the tone in skin deep is all wrong edwards treats very serious issue far too lightly making joke out of problem that is no joking matter perhaps edwards should have studied dudley moore in arthur or better yet michael keaton in clean and sober before making skin deep

this movie about two dysfunctional families never really gets off the ground despite some good performances from basically competent cast eddie sean penn and maureen robin wright penn are notsohappily married couple down on their luck living in rented rooms in the seedier part of an unnamed city they spend what little income they have at the local bar owned shorty stanton eddies best friend and his wife georgie mazar maureen and eddie share an odd relationship marked eddies frequent disappearances on his return he promises her the world and professes his undying love their manic reunions all too soon lead new lows as eddie disappears again like junky craving the next high maureen suffers through the lows reach the next high their relationship is further complicated maureens pregnancy she wants the baby and the father but deep down seems sense the inevitability of losing the latter during one of eddies absences maureen is attacked kiefer her neighbor who gets her drunk her cooperation and then insists on intimacy she leaves badly bruised and in fear of what eddie might do not her but kiefer she lies about what happens ensure that no harm will come eddie as the result of his inevitable rage he lashes out as she expects and ends up in an institution for what he believes be months but in reality is years during this decade maureen divorces eddie and remarries more solid and reliable individual joey travolta in small role her life falls apart again when eddie is released from the institution and comes find her joey insists on bringing eddie into his home and making his wife choose between her husband and father of two children and stability joey makes good living drives cadillac and they live in large house in the suburbs and the love of her previous life she chooses her past and sacrifices not only her new life but her old giving up her and eddies daughter joey but the eddie that she knew is gone replaced mere shell of the man he was maureen is herself mere shell more an automaton than woman as if she had gone through whatever therapy and treatment eddie was given along him perhaps these two really do need each other and can find happiness or maybe the lack of sadness together but the movies denouement was not convincing

michael richards leaves his spot as kramer on the infamous seinfeld tv sitcom for stint as lanky goofy best friend jeff daniels lawyer character in this illfated and unfunny comedy plot richard the actor richards has take the place of charles the lawyer daniels in real court case after charles is left unintelligible from night of heavy drinking at his bachelor party the follows the antics of the two men as they try get away their tomfoolery critique this movie did not make me laugh once perhaps it was because was tired when watched it perhaps perhaps it was because had seen richards perform most of the same schtick thousand times on seinfeld perhaps perhaps it was because the movie just was not funny absolutely the lack of humour was not the only issue that had this either the movie attempts weave couple of love stories through its vision but unfortunately they are also lacking in conviction believability and credibility they are contrived and appear be placed into the story for convenience sake the actors were all adequate enough in their roles but the problem did not lie in the acting wish could find one good reason for you see this waste of time but cannot unless of course you need something playing on your tv set while you waste some time around the house overall this movie stinks on the good side charlize theron is darn cute and the movie is no longer then minutes on the bad side this movie is not funny interesting or enjoyable in any way possible person would not even enjoy his nachos while watching this emptiness please skip it little known facts jonathan lynn earned degree in law from cambridge before becoming an actordirector charlize theron grew up on farm outside benoni south africa as the only child at the age of her mother made her go los angeles try career in the movie industry she came la without knowing anyone in the city but after two weeks when she was standing in line on boulevard an agent gave her his card after eight months in la she got her first part since then she has taken acting lessons and her career has skyrocketed specifically in devils advocate charlize was narrowly beat out elizabeth berkley for the lead role in the movie showgirls she was quoted as saying it was like had some guardian angel

jackie chan kicks his way into van damme territory twin dragons an embarrassingly bland action comedy of mistaken identities chan plays separatedatbirths boomer and john ma whose drastically different paths aw forget the plot description it is not even worth the space but let us face it no one goes jackie chan movies for the plot anyway the scenes where nothing happens in chans films have always been little more than glue thriftily spread hold the action sequences together in the case of twin dragons however the tiresome plotdriving scenes fritter away so much of the movie that you almost want shout at the risk of demeaning the artistic value of cinema get the good part already most of the is devoted showing the brothers efforts hide the others existence from their own acquaintances why it is necessary do this is not satisfactorily explained but neither are lot of aspects of the plot the twins love interests demure clubsinger barbara chanfilm regular maggie cheung and lusty bridehopeful tammy nina li chi get disoriented in all the brouhaha yet strangely seem not mind that they are not sure brother they are in love the scenes describing the boys bumbling antics get stretched so thin we stop caring who chan is supposed be in any given shot in several shots in fact even the makeup and hair people seem forget brother is even chans socornyit isfunny humor is offkilter in this outing some of the gags are so carefully innocuous they are annoying case in point whenever anyone sees the brothers together they fall the ground in dead faint are we laughing yet as usual the final showdown is the films jewel tour de force display of chan agility and grace never mind that it is not clear how the brothers end up fighting suited bad guys inside an automobile crashtesting facility it is all good fun but too little too late perhaps chans next movie should just be collection of the last fight sequences of all of his movies they could call it jackie chans the final fight scenes and everybody would go home happy reviewed april at loews theaters white marsh white marsh md

the generals daughter will probably be the cleverest stupid we will see this year or perhaps the stupidest clever it is confusing critic when so much knuckleheaded plotting and ostentatious direction shares the screen so much snappy dialogue and crisp character interaction that however is what happens when legendary screenwriter william goldman takes pass at an otherwise brutally predictable conspiracy thriller the punchedup punch lines are ever on the verge of convincing you the generals daughter has brain in its head even as the remaining of the narrative punches you in the face its lack of common sense our hero is warrant officer paul brenner brash investigator for the s armys criminal investigation division his latest case is the murder of captain elisabeth campbell leslie stefanson at georgia base the victim found tied the ground after an apparent sexual assault and strangulation complicating the case is the fact that capt campbell is the daughter of general joe campbell james cromwell war hero and potential vicepresidential nominee general campbell wants keep the case out of the press gives brenner only the hours before the fbi steps in teamed rape investigator sarah sunhill madeleine stowe who coincidentally enough once had romantic relationship brenner brenner begins uncovering dark secrets from the late captains past that make the case ever more sordid if only the sordidness were the worst of the generals daughters problems scenes of sexual degredation do linger much longer than necessary their negligible dramatic value overwhelmed filteredlight sleaze director simon west likely thinks he is covered himself juxtaposing these images of violence sweet flowers but all he does is prove himself dependent on visual cliches is the films fatal flaw it is trend he continues for two hours taking the storys few virtues and slapping coat of moronproof obviousness over them characters who may wink wink turn out be villains are photographed in ominous shadow cutaway inserts of the captain campbells stillliving face after the corpse is uncovered insure against fiveminute attention spans west just cannot help himself from overdirecting every minute of the generals daughter he even turns scene of footage shown on cnn into an excuse for slowfade edits bubbling up from this overcooked stew are enough tasty lines distract you from its smell the slickest scene finds brenner squaring off captain campbells mentor psychological warfare expert named moore james woods there is something invigorating about watching two smart actors playing smart characters firing honesty at one another indeed travolta gets sink his teeth into dozens of choice lines based on his delight at provoking authority figures the local sheriff of the georgia county should not you be out nightsticking the colored folk even the lame device of brenner and sunhills sexual history provides few winning zingers goldmans dialogue can serve up bigger laugh than you will find in most socalled comedies dialogue unfortunately just is not enough make quality script it is difficult take movie about criminal investigation seriously when the investigators are both too stupid solve it sooner an idiotic inability recognize the nature of the crime scene and too lucky for it last any longer not one but two occasions where brenner catches vital piece of evidence out of the corner of his eye the time the generals daughter wanders towards its overwrought psychointherain finale wests heavy hand has obliterated most of what made the occasionally fun it is silly and pretentious filmmaking but at least it provides giggle or five goldman should tear the decent pages out of this script and turn them into standup routine

cradle will rock is the latest effort from directoractor tim robbins while he may have had an oscar worthy back in dead man walking he gets little overconfident and sloppy here the story is confusing and filled many subplots so will try my best and explain it as simply as possible the is based on mostly true story about federal theater in the that produced play the cradle will rock that apparently was offensive some so the government shuts it down it is during the time of the depression and all this theater wants do is entertain and cheer up those who do not have jobs or are poor between this conflict lies what seems like subplots about those who work in theater or those associated also along the way are some other messages mashed together create an even more overwhelming experience tim robbins just keeps piling on political views and characters that we just give up on the or in some cases walk out for robbins it may be nice achievement but me it seemed more like friendly get together slightly more sophisticated dialogue and fancy outfits thought the main reason for seeing the would be for the outstanding cast unfortunately are all uninteresting except for few let me recap what each important character does so please bear me it is the least you can do especially if you were considering seeing this will begin those involved the play there is orson welles angus macfadyen who of course is the director of the play the producer john houseman cary elwes marc blitzstein hank azaria the writer of the play emily watson woman who gets her break playing the main part in cradle will rock outside the play there is the ventriloquist bill murray who wants relationship federal theater clerk joan cusack another subplot involving painter diego rivera ruben blades who is unhappy that his painting is too be destroyed nelson rockefeller because he feels it be an outrage john cusack there is few other actresses and actors who have their own stories susan sarandon philip baker hall too name few but those that mentioned were the most significant the story anyway most of these talented stars were completely wasted except for emily watson who does another great job and one of my personal favorite actors john cusack who always delivers through thick and thin now although most of the was weak say the least there were some nice moments and some involving subjects but all this is overblown sure the free speech segment was nice feature but not when it becomes repetitive the whole is like this and it is basically nothing but headache on the brighter side tim robbins direction was masterful his camera direction seemed reminiscent the works of paul thomas andersons latest magnolia only smoother in my opinion but even that cannot make movie that much better although it has it is moments not many of them but they are there cradle will rock stays true it is title because the cradle rocked too far and tipped over

disillusioned and trying find the spice of life richard leonardo dicaprio sets off for thailand there he meets crazed man the name of daffy robert carlyle who gives him map beach secret utopia then commits suicide richard sets off for this beach his neighbors from this hotel tienne guillaume canet and fran oise virginie ledoyen once they get there the three discover secret society existing on this beach there richard falls for fran oise this covers about half two thirds of the movie and aside from the romantic element is solely creation of seems hold the original novel the cinematography and general beauty of this part of the movie is breathtaking do not think anyone can argue that this movie is visually stunning but that is were many things go wrong darius khondji has totally outdone himself in doing the cinematography though the script and the interpretation of the novel are quite lacking the plot of the movie moves along at decent pace for about half of the movie or there abouts this is where the movie has some great potential then the three travelers get the island and there is turn for the better yes folks said better now up about two thirds of this movie its actually pretty good nothing spectacular aside from the cinematography but it still has promise this is where things start degenerate something that becomes almost unwatchable there is even video game style sequence that borders on the disgusting it does not make sense for the movie and just looks dumb in my opinion and am hoping many other peoples am hoping that in my little rant have made it abundantly
