clear that the movie is lacking quite seriously in plot and uneven pacing so if you go see it and you do not like it because of this do not blame me the character development was not up par either found the character of richard be nothing more than spoiled child although there is feeble attempt make this whole story profound it fails and richard leos character comes off as wannabe philosopher the character seems be underdeveloped from the get go and seems just do things for no apparent reason granted some people are like this myself included but nor anyone know that is fairly random would ever do things of the sort this character does the next point is that some of the really interesting characters are simply not developed enough richard is obviously obsessed fran oise at the early stages of the story yet there is actually very little development along this story line this am sure contributes the movies lack of core plot and being unfocused now shall move onto something little better about the movie for all you cynics out there the movie did have few good things about it the cast and acting was passable at the very least and think that leonardo dicaprio actually did pretty well in the role of richard mind you think the rest of the cast that had some had reasonably sized roles did equally well if not better begs the question why is leonardo paid so much think this is topic all on its own so will not get into it but like the fact that there was an international cast used had only and american cast been used can see this movie being horrible the international flavor added more global feel the movie that made it that much more bearable not mention the movie is set in thailand and global cast makes more sense when all is said and done liked the movie for the most part but the gaping inadequacies of the plot are unforgivable would not recommend this movie anyone the fact that liked it has lot do the cinematography and the sheer beauty of the movie not its plot or story as it is the story tries be much too philosophical and fails at its attempt if you do end up going see this movie be forewarned about its shortcomings

kate jennifer aniston is having some problems it appears the twentyeight year old is not happy her slow progression up the company ladder and her love life apparently leaves something be desired she learns that her problems are related as the owner of her advertising agency mr mercer kevin dunn explains her that her single status does not bode well the company her freedom would make her more likely leave the company taking clients her solution presents itself in nick jay mohr wedding videographer who kate meets through coincidence and gets photographed kates boss darcy illeana douglas uses the photograph fabricate wedding engagement between kate and nick kate is at first repulsed the idea but after getting immediate positive results she pursues it her first task is convince nick go along her plan the actual plan consists of nick pretending be her fianc at dinner kates bosses he will provoke fight and they will break up she meets nick propose the plan he accepts kates new status brings unexpected results in other areas the office bad boy sam kevin bacon who would not give kate the time of day now does now that she is engaged he pursues an affair her as doing so would destroy her good girl image hence sams sudden interest things start fall apart for kate as it becomes apparent that nick really likes her and does not wish break up her after some provoking nick does oblige but problems continue for kate it appears sam is no longer interested now that she is available or maybe kate does like nick but reconciliation will force her admit her lies her employer adding her mess is the constant prying of her mother olympia dukakis who wants her get married and settle down there is scene in this movie where jennifer aniston is from the waist up only wearing bra it made me chuckle because it is the only time in the movie when she actually wears one there is enough cleavage in this movie satisfy russ meyer it is like the director said well we know the story is formulaic and the performances are not that great so what the heck let us show jennifers assets as often and as uncovered as humanly possible keep the pg rating quite frankly it is insulting do not think aniston is competent enough actress carry movie she did decent enough job in ed burns she is the one because it was smaller and supporting role and she just does not deliver the goods effectively in this movie her performance was not convincing unfortunately as far as romantic comedies go this movie adds nothing new the standard formula for these types of movies the is similar my best friends wedding in sense that the leading female character is actually quite vindictive and due her actions gets no sympathy from me when things go awry did not care for how quickly kate puts down nicks profession explaining that videotaping weddings was not glamorous enough for her coworkers at least my best friends wedding changed the formula bit and had somewhat surprise ending no such luck picture perfect every plot occurrence can be spotted mile away including couple that really made no sense after everything kate had done prove her loyalty her company why would she blindly throw it all away when she should have made sure that nick would even talk her first let alone consider relationship was quitting her job prerequisite making amends nick throw in the fact that do not think nick and kate spent enough time together even warrant that rash of decision believe that kate liked him but liked him so intensely that she was willing throw her career away doubt it and what of the ending scene at wedding where the entire congregation feels it necessary stop everything and stare at the couple are mass groups of people simultaneously that interested in total strangers well guess of the congregation consists of movie extras and the strangers are the movies two lead stars then that would make sense picture perfect directed glenn gordon caron kate jennifer aniston nick jay mohr sam kevin bacon mercer kevin dunn darcy illeana douglas rita olympia dukakis written randy turgeon february visit my movie reviews www xtdl comcanran

name is frank is not nice guy he describes his torture the demons fondly as the ultimate pleasure and pain since at that level there is no difference between the two somehow do not see getting torn apart fish and meathooks lot of fun this guy is so bad how bad is he so bad that the rats cower in corner in fear for good reason too he crucifies two of them for fun and carves third while the nymphos horsing around hubby anyway hubbys daughter who if course is not wifes daughter starts suspect something is wrong after she sees wife going into the attic one of her johns and the ensuing screams the dumb bimbo meets scumball and is not impressed she manages escape the chinese puzzle and brings out the demons at any rate the demons are pissed off that they screwed up their cleanup they are normally quite meticulous about that type of thing the story boils down the demons trying correct their mistake the demons are not however the good guys the dumb bimbos the good guy she somehow not only gets them take care of frank but also banishes them hell or oblivion we are not too sure not too shabby for someone singledigit iq this is basically bad jinn story it is an awful movie awful canned unrealistic story is soso but the impact is lost long long before the ends do think the rat acting was quite good have never seen rats look afraid they should get nominated for an award really have you ever heard the one about movie so bad that it made guy run out of the theatre screaming obviously the producers at columbia tristar did not think that we suffered enough from the first installment and so finish us utterly they have now released urban legends final cut this is another scream like feature consisting merely from the recycled materials of ripoffs from the most pointless movies of all time amy jennifer morrison is student who is attending school filled uninspired students who do not have clue about what do but just as she reaches the halfway mark of her final semester at prestigious universitys program where each years best thesis production takes the coveted hitchcock prize virtual oneway ticket success she has chance encounter campus security guard reese loretta devine whose tale of series of murders based on urban legends at another university inspires amy try her hand at fictional thriller organized along similar lines soon enough fake and real blood starts flow and amy is being chased around scary killer while her cast and crew get slain one one is the culprit the original urban legends murderer just some random psycho member of the faculty one of her competitors for the hitchcock or is there something even more stupid going on this is another one of those tiring pointless teen slasher flicks neither scary funny or interesting it simply lacks the ability and the story entertain the body counts and screams continue grow as the weak level of intelligence sinks rapidly in fact watching films like that after having watched scary movie is impossible keeping serious face several times tried prevent myself from laughing without succeeding and then realized that practically the whole theatre was laughing it is the same thing that has been told and told and told over and over again as if it was the revelation of the century how many times must we tolerate the same clich that have haunted the slasher genre since its birth it has been so many films about masked killers that most of us have developed an allergy for them they are the most stupid meaningless predictable and soulless films in existence however director john ottman manages make urban legends final cut into one of the worst achievements of this godforsaken genre what was done sense of redemption for past failures and irony in scream ottman takes seriously for that reason alone it is worth look just realize how bad movie can be it is tough find comparisons for such an achievement and we have dig in ancient history find movie that would match its intellect even movies like lost in space and mission mars seem spectacular in its shadow we have not seen such waste of ime and resources since showgirls no matter how hard tried find positive elements in this so called production came up nothing except the way the killer was dressed here feel that have compliment the costume designers trysha bakker and mariesylvie deveu that have wisely replaced the well known screammask very elegant fencing mask jennifer morrison stir of echoes is all right and the other actors best achievement is keeping straight face when pronouncing the words from the script in fact the only thing that is terrifying about this the exception of its screenplay is its portray of schools if these graduates will be the directors of the future then hollywoods golden days are over rumors are already spreading through the internet that columbia tristar is already developing third installment let us just hope and pray that it is just an urban legend

we are grateful that we have the songs of grace chan comfort us starring lee kangsheng yang kueimei directed tsai mingliang written tsai and yang pingying cinematography liao pengjung taiwan the millenium approaches an incessant downpour batters an unnamed city sectors of the city are being sealed quarantined due the onset of mysterious virus the virus causes people act like insects they crawl about on all fours hide from bright lights huddle in damp corners the water supply the quarantined zones will be cut off in weeks time residents are advised evacuate the area asap this premisekafka way of cronenbergis the background for the hole could have been great movie but sadly ends up as waste of good ideas the quick sketch above suggests dark absurd hallucinatory nearfuture parable of life in the late th century in execution however it is nothing like that the virus the evacuation the visual possiblities of the deluge these are all relegated the background instead the hole focuses on the livesfor want of better wordof man lee kangsheng and woman yang kueimei who live in the same apartment building and who have no personalities the entire movie taks place in settings that are uniformly ugly and sterile the charmless rooms and corridors of postindustrial apartment complex photographed look as dim and dingy as possible it is vivid setting but an unappealing one especially the monotonous hiss of falling rain and the gurgle of drainage pipes in the background the man lives in the apartment directly above the womans one day repairman investigating leak leaves small hole in the floor of the mans living room opening into the ceiling of the womans living room this holesymbol of the solitary opening in the characters lonely compartmented livesallows them interact in unusual and mostly nonverbal ways example the man suffering from the onset of the virus or so assumeeverything is obscure in this movie vomits through the hole the woman wandering around in the dark accidentally puts her hand on his vomit and then cleans it up this is what passes for meaningful communication and they say romance is dead much of the does not even focus on their interactions such as they are there is almost no dialogue and we learn next nothing about these people they are ciphers instead we are treated long takes in we witness their miserable lives we watch for instance as the woman boils some water pours it onto some noodles then eats the noodles this is as fascinating as it sounds offered as counterpointor perhaps reliefto these dreary sequences are series of musical numbers fantasies in the woman lipsynchs pop songs grace chan popular so am told in china she prances around in grimy hallways and grungy stairwells incronguously lit cheerfully bright spotlights sometimes in these fantasies she is joined the man these scenes are presumably intended be bright and fanciful sharply contrasting the dreariness of reality but they fail when the man and the woman dance it seems halfhearted and listless astaire and rogers this is not even in imagination these people are numb weary boring the hole is part of the collection series group of films commissioned french tv station la sept arte on the subject of the millenium others include canadas last night brazils midnight and american hal hartleys the book of life the book of life is the only other one that have seen and it is infinitely superior the taiwanese entry witty energetic humane it makes the the hole seem ahem empty american movies nothing say try disguise their lack of content flashy movements quick cuts superficial emotions foreign movies nothing say do what the hole does they point the camera at something of minimal interest for unbelievably long periods of time and call it art the hole is selfevidently about alienation and perhaps director tsai mingliang wants the audience share in his characters alienation if so he succeeds perhaps it is challenge he dares us enjoy this movie despite his best attempts ensure that we do not if it was challenge was not up for it

what happens when you put martin lawrence in fat suit in real life you get martin lawrence in coma the comedian thought he was getting fat so he put on numerous layers of heavy clothing and went jogging in degree heat ending up in coma so what happens when you put martin lawrence in fat suit in the movies you get an audience in coma in big mommas house lawrence plays fbi agent who is master of disguises when naughty naughty man escapes from jail and seeks out his former girlfriend the very sexy nia long the only thing worth looking at in this movie she flees georgia stay her rather large southern aunt big momma ella mitchell the fbi follows her in order recover the large sum of money stolen in the bank robbery that sent the naughty man jail however big momma is called away on an emergency sensing that they could lose their only chance capture the criminal lawrence goes undercover as big momma and let the comedy begin big mommas house is the definition of gimmick movie if there ever was one the plot can basically be summed up as martin lawrence dresses up as fat woman and even that description is too wordy you can just see this script plotted out on chalkboard martin lawrencefat woman in the middle of the board big circle around it and all sorts of clich humorous situations pointing it fat woman plays basketball fat woman takes dump fat woman kung fu well they left one off the board movie critic slips into coma paul giamatti private parts the negotiator plays lawrences partner and as much as enjoy his work even he cannot inject life into this lifeless comedy hell the greatest performers on the planet could not make this material work it is just that awful

blatantly borrowing elements from like water for chocolate and the butchers wife simply irresistible attempts be whimsical romantic comedy but more often than not comes off as laughable leaving you wonder why rising star sarah michelle gellar v buffy the vampire slayer would choose such an obviously inept project waste her time on things get off bad start right from the onset as amanda sarah michelle gellar young woman who runs her late familys struggling new york restaurant runs into mystery man who forces bushel of crabs on her and then vansihes into thin air while out shopping she also meets tom sean patrick flanery charming handsome man who happens be planning ritzy restaurant for the department store he works for and later when he decides drop her dive called southern cross for lunch she somehow makes delicious crab dish for him even though she is known not be very good chef suddenly amanda finds her restaurant on the edge of foreclosure rejuvenate life as customer begin swarm for her food strangely causes everyone immediate jubilation when it hits their mouths are amanda and tom destined be together and is it not just because of the magical food but because they really truly like each other and what exactly is going on the food she is making does it have anything do that pesky crab she got that sits on the shelf in the kitchen somehow assisting her in her food preparation simply irresistible is ridiculous and just plain goofy romantic fantasy that is as flimsy as slice of bologna it takes one jokethat people who eat the food are taken aback it in most unusual waysand recycles it over and over again until the has reached an appropriate running time of minutes add in music montage every ten minutes these are actually the best scenes in the movie certainly tells you something about the itself and what you have got is an utterly empty if not necessarily boring excursion the cast of simply irresistible is fairly good but it is the supporting characters who are the most interesting patricia clarkson high art in she played druggedout lesbian is standout as toms colleague and is thankfully given few funny lines of dialogue also of note is larry gilliard jr as amandas cooking assistant and buddy who is allowed create seemingly full character out of only handful of scenes of the main stars sarah michelle gellar is fine but really does often look like she is struggling through the unmistakably clumsy material and if sean patrick flanery plans on keeping career in the future he has certainly got pick better projects than this the bottom line is that simply irresistible is the exact opposite of its deprophesized title and when the movie got the point where the characters began float in midair an unamusing plot device that was repeated in the stupid last scene my mind checked out from the characters and the romance when think about it in hindsight should have checked out in the very first scene where the point of the action was for gellar crawl under tables looking for runaway mechanical crab now that certainly is what would call magical

i wont even pretend that have seen the other alien films saw glimpses of alien and aliens and fragments of alien but have no means actually sat down and watched any of them so take my opinion from an unbiased and impartial perspective alien resurrection is not worth the large bag of lollies was munching into after hard days work didnt just dislike it so much because the plot was awful most of the acting was very average or the special effects got tiresome after minutes of painful viewing but also the fact that every tedious ingredient thrown in attempts give this pointless dribble some meaning sigourney weaver whos role in alien earned her an academy award nomination plays the character of ripley who died fighting against extraterrestrial scum in alien years later scientists use sample of blood found at the site of her death recreate ripley including the alien that was stuck inside her in no time they remove the alien from her body and separate the two yet ripley is now not completely human possessing strange amounts of strength and being able withhold greater pain than normal being im sure someone can explain exactly why this is so but for now well just ignore it and move on why you ask would ripley and the alien inside her be recreated well the smart little lab researchers believed that they would be able discover many advancements in science from studying the alien creature these were the same people who said they could control the alien and that their was no danger in their research they yawn were wrong it doesnt take genius figure out that the rest of the is continuous cat and mouse chase between the humans who die off one one and the aliens who open their mouths on every possible occasion show off their frightfully scary unflossed teeth theres little saying that goes something like this if youre going make bad do it well have seen plenty of disappointing and underachieving movies but they are not the ones that really bother me alien resurrection good example of that really gets up my nose is not so much discouraging experience but an off putting one there is no way describe why the australian ma rating was given this other than unnecessary and repulsive gore attempts distract us from the wanderingbutnotgoinganywhere plot in one scene my stomach churned as witnessed mawkish looking alien put its hand on characters head and literally ripped most of his face off another one featured ripley sticking knife through her hand just impress someone she was talking fair enough if it were in horror or even if it bared any significance the story but this is unfortunately not the case and this sort of bizarre gore is inexcusable if you think im struggling find one good aspect about the then you thought right one exciting scene is credit and the only part remotely worth seeing the in an alien chases two men one cripple up tall ladder interesting results but of course after that thrilling scene alien resurrection had no problem in returning its pathetically low standard and ends up crashing into the shores of movie dullness more often than japanese kamikaze jet fighters fall off their skis so in where the one liners come as bad as earth man what shit hole and the primary means for one mans strategic attack is bounce bullets off walls hit an opponent its no wonder why alien resurrection turned out be as off putting and clumsy as it is oh and in case youre wondering about my bag of lollies the less enjoy the more eat so all the lollies were gone in minutes but however empty the bag turned out be it was still long way ahead of the movie

synopsis lifelong friends rafe affleck and danny hartnett join the us air force and are stationed at pearl harbor hawaii rafe goes england fight alongside british pilots and is seemingly killed in action danny falls in love rafes girlfriend evelyn beckinsale but rafe survives and returns confront his former friend meanwhile the japanese sneak attack is imminent review pearl harbor is perfect example of movies as product rather than as art it is little more than crasslycalculated attempt woo the masses enticing them big stars big effects and big setting but no heart it is difficult criticise the actors because they do everything the movie demands of them sadly this amounts barely more than reciting dialogue of such sheer banality that it makes one eager see the script randall wallace wrote his right hand at the same time as he was writing pearl harbor his left the plot here is pure cliche and the wartime setting simply convenient backdrop there is no genuine exploration of what pearl harbor meant the united states and no insight into its vital role in inciting that country join world war ii instead there is just an assemblyline love triangle some empty patriotic rhetoric and laughable attempt placate japanese viewers via the inclusion of some reticent imperial commanders when one intones fear all we have done is awaken sleeping giant nearly fell out of my seat the movies credit it does include fantastic portrayal of the attack itself an exciting and dizzying hour plunges viewers into the war if only the remaining two hours had been crafted such skill perhaps this memorial day nonevent would have been worth watching

this is that was inclined like at the outset the two main characters had been involved the fine television drama st elsewhere for several years and had understood that the directorscreenwriter had written for the show on occasion also am sorry report that the results were not up my expectations nor were they satisfactory if had list reason why but that would be getting ahead of myself besides it is not immediately clear as there are so many problems the adam arkin plays gradeschool teacher who is sardonic cynical and somewhat abrasive but good teacher he spends his lunches playing basketball himself on nearby court one day he meets drifter david morse who plays jack morrison on st elsewhere in the park and inveigles him in game of oneonone basketball morse turns out be good and friendship slowly develops between the two as their respective professions progress on the screenarkins teaching and morses selling of paper flowers passing motorists so far my major complaint would be the lack of dialogue and the constant intrusion of the musical soundtrack good music be sure but it does not replace the dialogue for setting the mood or telling the storyit makes the somewhat minimalistic technique rarely admire suddenly their friendship is interrupted morses introduction fellow teacher of arkins woman arkin has long admired from afar but it too reticent approach it appears that she begins admire morse who enjoys here attentions but is not sure what do about itshe does not realize that he is drifter and knows nothing about his past and this causes friction between arkin and almost everyone else until then had only vague dissatisfaction the the conclusion is where it begins evolve into fullfledged failure the woman at least me appeared be fairly shallow did not realize how shallow until her final scene arkin where she reveals that she has been trying make arkin jealous her attentions morse somehow this is made appear as if it is arkins fault and it is left him feeling somehow victorious that he is gotten such find of girlfriend frankly dropping her on the spot would have seemed the most civilized action arkin could make punching her in the mouth not the least after this the childish confrontation between morse and arkin at the end seems almost natural if had summarize major gripe it is that this is story spread too thin that creates semilikable characters at the outset and then suddenly jerks them into being yearolds at the last moment it might be truetolife some people but that does not mean have like it do not avoid

opposite of what movie should be hurried poorly written and acted movie one goal make money disney ever since the lion king have lost their magic touch but this dross just shows how far disney have
