the two lead characters do near the end of the movie down the toilet

i looked at the internet movie database awards section for this and found that this was nominated for golden globe for best picture drama anyone who is seen this can back me up on this this is the worst of the great disaster films and that is not really saying lot for this earthquake is basically notable because it originally included some theatre thing where the theatre shook when the big earthquake occured on video it is bland and slowmoving gives us bunch of different characters the disaster requisite then brings them together in the struggle against the big disaster while this worked in say the towering inferno it does not here for one single reason we do not care about any of the characters the gives us charlton heston in one of many crap films he made including skyjacked and that classic soylent green as rich man married ava gardner who is having little affair young single mom genieveve bujold renegade police officer on suspension george kennedy in his least humored performance in the second weirdest subplot motorcycle stuntman richard roundtree right after his shaft thing whose big stunt is he goes on little track that goes upside down yea snore and the weirdest subplot military manbag boy at grocery store who has little thing for buxom victoria principal and eventually gets vengeance on those guys who made fun of his hair in smaller subplots there is pointless bit about people who are flying over a the city in the the way one who is playing cards and married boring nonacting husband you think this one can go nowhere guess again he gets interested in the final frames there is genieveve bujolds moron son who has little adventure wires and for some muchneeded comedy there is walter matthau billed as walter mutha the only laugh in the as wild drunkard who is big moment is dance he does at critical time as for the actual earthquake it is rather letdown there is full hour of charactersetups none of is interesting then about minutes of shaking crumbling and bit where house almost falls on bujold narrowly missing this needed that whole theatreshaking they needed wake everybody up because they were so bored there is little suspense following the quake although this tries for it there is an adventure in crumbling highrise office building the wires the kid and the movement of people who are all injured but none of these are alltoo suspenseful the finale the hestongardnerbujold love triangle is ended in basic flipofthecoin bit brings out big letdown and there is no real finale even volcano ended nicely and that movie really sucked not only is it hokey but you do not care about any character who cares if heston dies who cares if he choses bujold or gardner although would have chosen gardner mainly on the basis that she can actually act who cares if richard roundtree makes money on his stupid stunt who cares if that idiot kid falls his death on some wires and who cares about that whole plane spiel if anything earthquake is worth viewing for the same reason glen or glenda is mean laughed at this more than did at bio dome but that is another story and review in short earthquake gives disaster pics bad name

the formula is simple trap varied group of people on an isolated location then pop in seemingly unstoppable monster kill them one one these have been the successful ingredients for many good films the thing alien aliens and tremors name few so why is it that so many films following this recipe end up pathetically bad see the relic for particularly putrid example perhaps it is simply too easy forget the necessary binding ingredient effort and ideas deep rising meets these two requirements part way but not enough salvage the treat williams is finnegan the leader of small boat crew who hire out their services and their boat for any activity no questions asked this time however they may have gone too far their passengers led the ominous wes studi are the type of multinational terrorist squads usually only seen in die hard films and their cargo let us just say it has very high explosive potential what is the target of these thieves why the argonauticus of course high tech luxury cruise yacht on its maiden voyage but something else is hunting the argonauticus something ancient and deadly the time the thieves arrive nearly everyone on board the ship has been killed and now the creature senses fresh meat so you have the thieves and their mercenary boat crew joining forces the surviving passengers including the ship owner canton anthony heald and thief less lofty goals trillian famke janssen against the terror from the deep and the monster gets pick them off one one fortunately for the creature this particular band of criminals happens be the dumbest the world can offer why else would they indulge in petty squabbling while they watch their friends become fish food if there is more clarion call for unity do not know what it might be it is pretty easy guess who will get killed off when there are no surprises in that the most interesting characters seem last until the end for the most part the watery tentacles seem be acting on the audiences impulses get rid of the most boring characters first although wonder if the filmmakers might have extended djimon hounsous life bit if they knew this would be released so soon after his acclaim for amistad treat williams is passable hero and famke janssen does her best julia roberts impersonation but while wes studi and anthony heald are particularly slimy very little of the rest of the company stand out in any way the biggest treat in the however has be pantucci kevin oconnors whining engineboy under finnegans employ his constant quips may be bit overwritten but they manage capture the same vein of nerveaddled humor that bill paxton delivered as hudson in aliens or todd graff as hippie in the abyss for that matter it is just stock part the comicrelief character but it almost makes this tired alien clone bearable as far as the monster goes although the cgi is done well the creature has no logical consistency think back the great or even just good movie monsters they all had set of rules about what they could do and how and why they would do it part of the joy of those films was slowly discovering along the heroes just what those rules are the tentacle monster in deep rising does not have set of rules or if it does not very good one it merely eats or drinks as the case may be and there is no rhyme or reason for what it does in order do so the never explains why the argonauticus is attacked in the first place it simply happens the action scenes are decent but few are noteworthy the definitely does suffer from its proximity titanic deep risings peril in the water scenes pale next camerons but can you really blame them unfortunately deep risings efforts are more on par speed on the plus side however the films closing image shows some promise for potentially interesting but unlikely sequel perhaps you would be better off waiting for that one

the thirteenth floor is bland obligatory exercise in genre filmmaking if had not recently watched the matrix and open your eyes both of are similar but far superior might have been little nicer this picture craig bierko makes an adequate hero as douglas hall the rich cocreator of perfect human world simulation who is suddenly blamed for the murder of his boss armin muellerstahl everything that was subtle and smart about the previously mentioned films is battered over our heads in this one and characters stare at each other for maddeninglylong periods of time and refuse communicate on any realistic level the acting is okay but the suffers from every logical flaw one could think of and features script copenned director josef rusnak loaded cliches and stock characters there are individual scenes and ideas that work like the thought of sentient computer program but none of the films strengths are recognized any meaningful degree producer roland emmerich based on this and his previous directorial efforts seems hellbent on bringing us the ultimate standard in mediocre sciencefiction

my giant begins monologue that is more funny than not and distinctive princess bride medieval fairytaleinthe feel was pleasantly surprised how sharp the comedy was very funny scenes occurring on movie set in romania where talent agent sammy billy crystal is visiting client and in the monastery where sammy ends up after being mysteriously saved when he accidentally plunges his car into stream and when sammy meets max his giant mysterious savior played gheorghe muresan there is magic in the air albeit it bit goofy loved every minute of it the of course plays on the size difference between the two and at times you would almost swear it must be special effects particularly enjoyed shot of sammy dangling his legs from maxsized chair as the two face each over an enormous table and eat from oversized bowls and spoons also liked jere burns from tvs something so right performance as the director of the in romania at this point the primary flaw in the is that gheorghe muresan is incredibly hard understand particularly during his fastpaced first scene it is unfortunate that the script required him speak quickly right out of the gate as did understand him more as the continued and became accustomed his speech however about the time muresan becomes coherent the characters head new york and the takes dive off the high board suddenly we are expected believe sammy is dowhateverittakes slime ball up until this point he was pursuing his own interests be sure but he did not come off as desperate jerk if he had the first scenes could never have been so lighthearted and magical but now in new york we are further introduced his neglected wife and son and his character is desperate enough involve max in disturbing giant vs midgets wrestling match found quite unpleasant and jarring within the framework of the indeed many scenes stuck out of this like incorrectly placed puzzle pieces this includes the scenes featuring steven seagal when sammy gets max role in big movie filming in las vegas while enjoyed seeing seagal poke fun at himself the scenes appeared exist solely because of his participation rather than because the demanded it and the audience is required take huge leap believe that max would win the role based on his quotations of shakespeare at this point found myself thinking we are supposed believe that someone would cast this guy in then realized he was and was watching it in the final third the undergoes another transformation this time unbridled sentimentality note major plot points are revealed in this and the final paragraph max went america because sammy promised reunited him his childhood love lillianna who has not seen him since he was normalsized kid her refusal see max unbeknownst him leads us an awkward ends justify the means scene as sammys wife serena played nicely kathleen quinlan poses as lillianna found this scene offensive not only did it rely on deception induce warm fuzzy feelings from the audience it reduced max someone we should pity and coddle thought was quite undeserved think max could have handled the truth gratuitous illness and all late in the we learn max and in fact all giants have heart condition shortens their lives considerably this could be an enlightening revelation but the seemingly presents it only justify sammys transformation into caring sensitive guy and hey great dad and husband too my giant suffers from poorly constructed story line and undeveloped characters whose actions are determined plot points rather than their own internal persuasions stronger story more room for character growth might have been possible if the focus was on maxs struggle be accepted and cast in movies instead of sammys struggles get money and become better person in this scenario maxs illness could have been integral part of the not story motivator sentiment and emotion would have followed naturally instead we are apparently not supposed like sammy until the end but we are not allowed focus on max crystal and muresan give adequate and at times enjoyable performances but in the end my giant left me feeling like would been fed gruel from giant spoon

alexandre dumas meets hong kong action newcomer justin chambers reprising the oftplayed character of dashing swordsman dartagnon in director peter hyams adventure the musketeer for some reason that may figure out later do not know why the time money and effort were put into the making of the musketeer it may be that someone had the clever idea of combining the dumas characters and story the current enamor the action work of hong kong imports like this films xinxin xiong once upon time in china and yuen wooping from crouching tiger hidden dragon the result is mix of genres that do not mesh well elements of the ritz brothersstyle comedy for those few who remember that comedic troupe from the the three musketeers the man no name from fistful of dollars dartagnan demands that the bad guys apologize his horse in direct ref the clint eastwood spaghetti western and hong kong action choreography are all utilized in the original script gene quintano the result is an action flick that bears little resemblance its source material while it makes contemporary that material in an effort grab the matrix crowd alexandre dumas may well be rolling in his grave if he knows what was done his classic oeuvre and characters the real problem the the musketeer lies in the casting of the two lead romantically intertwined characters dartagnan and francesca mena suvari chambers has the boyishly handsome good looks for the character la chris odonnell but lacks any onscreen charisma suvari has the doeeyed pretty looks as the chambermaid who has the ear of the queen but she too does not have the chemistry command the screen if the musketeer makes them any money they should invest in acting lessons stronger performers may have helped raise the bar on this one the supporting cast is on the surface impressive catherine denueve plays the queen of france and lends her character an air of royalty dignity and humor especially when she plays off of dartagnans mentor planchet jeanpierre castaldi who reminds of andre the giant in the princess bride stephen rea looks good in the part of the conniving usurper cardinal richelieu but is given very little help flesh out his character tim roth is the kind of bad guy you love hate as the cardinals chief henchman febre he is so bad he makes simon legree look like boy scout the rest of the players particularly the three musketeers aramis nick moran lock stock and two smoking barrels porthos steve spiers and athos jan gregor kremp are background fodder whose role is come dartagnans aid when needed peter hyams does double duty as director and cinematography and may be too stretched do both well stronger hand at the helm could have helped the mediocre performances of the leads and better utilized his veteran thesps photography is straightforward action fare that goes through all the appropriate action flick motions dartagnan takes on tavern full of thugs and bests them singlehanded he fights gang of febres henchmen aboard speeding coach protect the queen the obligatory branches hanging over the road he goes one on one his lifelong enemy febre who murdered dartagnans folks years before it is all routine stuff the renowned wire work developed the hong kong action masters is used artificial effect as the players leap defying gravity up walls and from horse horse it works in scifi like the matrix or in classical fantasy like crouching tiger hidden dragon but just calls attention itself in the musketeer at one point could swear saw the stunt wire being used it did not make me believer and am very disappointed run time of minutes it should have been more like and give it d

i think maybe it is time for the batman series be put rest not only has the first two films unsettling insight into what it would really take for someone make himself into superhero been abandoned but this one throws any lingering realism out the window and goes for allout camp few traces of the selfmocking restraint of the relatively lighthearted third installment let me give you an example in the first scene of the movie batman george clooney and robin chris odonnell are summoned museum that has been literally turned ice mr freeze arnold schwarzenegger in an attempt steal diamond mr freezes thugs are armed none other than hockey sticks but this is no problem for our heroes automatic skates shoot out of their shoes at point robin manages get hold of hockey stick grabs the diamond and stickhandles it through the museum might have expected this from an airplanestyle farce but do not think that is what this movie is supposed be after all the previous three batman movies were actually fairly realistic the standards of the superheroaction genre and kept the corny deathdefying stunts minimum while playing the obligatory cheesiness at least some amount of irony not any more the list goes on and on in this one robin holds onto the outside of flying rocket ship feet high in the atmosphere climbing in the door save batman mr freeze and poison ivy uma thurman leap from skyscraper and survive landing in small pond world dominating mad scientist lives in fortress that seems have been stolen from the old heman cartoons my very favorite example is the scene in batgirl alicia silverstone gets in race motorcycle thugs during they come up the clever notion of dousing the road gasoline and setting it on fire distract her not bad but would not the police or maybe batman notice if the road was on fire knew gotham city was this crazy anarchic place but it also seems that the creators of the batman movies are obeying some unwritten rule that there have be more main characters and plot lines in each successive installment as if three protagonists and two villains were not enough batman and robin further weighs itself down an underdeveloped side story of the failing health of bruce waynes butler alfred michael gough might have seemed poignant if it was not surrounded so much silliness as well as several scenes elle macpherson as bruces girlfriend serve no purpose other than remind us that she is in the movie all this might be semiexcusable if the story were interesting and entertaining but it is not in fact it is kind of boring mr freeze and poison ivy pale in comparison as villains past baddies such as jack nicholsons joker and danny devitos penguin their evil plot is as predictable schwarzenegger actually pronounces the words today gotham city tomorrow the world as it is lamebrained did not it ever occur poison ivy that freezing the entire world would kill her precious plants too and robins constant challenging of batman mostly just makes him look bullheaded and stupid and makes us wonder why batman ever would have taken him on as partner in the first place strip away the stars the fancy set design and the status as batman movie and all you have here is another barely passable summer action flick

in my opinion movie reviewers most important task is offer an explanation for his opinion but soul survivors am so full of critical rage that this review is liable turn into venomous uncontrollable rant obligations damned however protocol forces me do otherwise soul survivors tells the story of four collegebound friends cassandra melissa sagemiller is sweet and innocent party girl annabel eliza dushku of bring it on is dating worldweary harvard student matt wes bentley matt still has feelings for cassie who is now dating sean casey affleck driving back from creepy gothic party the quartet gets into horrific car crash sean dies leaving cassie crestfallen and guilty made worse because sean saw matt kiss cassie just minutes after sean revealed his love for her as cassie mopes through her classes she sees the ghost of sean all over the place urging her follow him along being plagued other ghastly visions cassie is also followed thugs from that strange party annabel and matt try calming her down but no one shares casss visions she has figure out this purgatory all herself rarely have seen director so thoroughly mishandle material in his directorial debut steve carpenter does nothing provoke the audience into feeling any emotion when the movies camerawork is not pedestrian it is clich carpenters need for closeups his camera following sagemiller from behind drain the movie of any anticipation we already know what look for so why should we be surprised and the sense of scary atmosphere was recently done so well in the others is nowhere be found here carpenters script relies on random twists and turns minimum of logic and loads of laziness this is movie where the ending features one character providing an explanation about the plot another character is one of the lamest screenwriting devices around the second lamest device of course is the oh it was all dream resolution and guess what this movie has both not that the main body of the has sagemiller constantly running in fear or having nervous breakdown is anything worthwhile since there is no captivating dialogue no character chemistry exists anywhere that is huge problem since the four main characters are supposed be couples carpenter cannot even get the smutty scenes right are becoming more prevalent in pg movies like bring it on and get over it the was recently recut from an rating get more kids in the seats ed when sagemiller and dushku dance together at club he rarely shows them in full shot and he never keeps the camera on them for longer than second before relating some michael baystyle quick cuts and when sagemiller and dushku take shower together after getting covered in paint they are fully clothed regardless any sexiness in that scene is undercut its stupidity why would not they wash the clothes in the sink or in the washing machine why would they shower in their clothes what if they were not covered in latex paint the cast will see better material in the future would be wise leave this one off their resumes felt sorry for affleck who have liked in other movies and bentley who was great in american beauty dushku who possesses an alluring femme fetale quality has got stop taking roles belonging rose mcgowan as for sagemiller star of the aforementioned get over it want see her in movie where she plays person and not an object for gawking and am not even getting into luke wilsons role as priest at least he is friends wes anderson bottom line soul survivors is so awful feel compelled knock on doors and warn people about it

reading the cast and director for the new mobster comedy analyze this asked myself how could this miss robert de niro taxi driver raging bull billy crystal city slickers lisa kudrow the opposite of sex and director harold ramis national lampoons vacation these are usually reliable filmmakers well okay crystal has been in sizable slump lately and tellingly the first halfhour of analyze this was very funny unfortunately as the running time ticked away began think that the first thirty minutes had unbeknownst me been rewound and were being replayed another twoandahalf times the has obtained clever premise but does not have any idea what do it as it progressively becomes more and more repetitive until finally stopped enjoying or caring about what was happening on the screen middleaged psychoanalyst ben sobels billy crystal life is finally going very well although he has never gotten along his own uncaring parents especially his father who is also psychiatrist ben has an easygoing teenage son kyle sabihy and is about travel down miami get married his tv news reporter girlfriend laura lisa kudrow in little but flash however ben suddenly sees his plans ruined when he accidentally hits the car of the mob and subsequently gets paid visit from famed mafia guy paul vitti robert de niro who desperately wants counseling even though he himself will not even admit having anxiety attacks ben tries help paul mostly so he will get him off his back but the plot gets more complicated when paul follows ben his wedding ends man dropping eight stories his death it seems ben that no matter what he does paul vitti will not go away and the more they become involved the more bens potentially happy life gets into danger analyze this has few laughs sprinkled throughout mostly in the first half but always had the nagging thought that what director ramis and writers peter tolan ramis and kenneth lonergan had done was thought of one joke robert de niro lightly spoofing his serious past mafia roles while terrorizing and becoming buddies comic billy crystal and then tiresomely recycled it for the duration of the minute running time admittedly de niro is very funny here and cannot remember the last time you could use that adjective describe him and crystal is in topform but the whole movie is weighed down directly on their shoulders nothing else support them including substantial plotline since analyze this bills not one not two but three writers you would think that they would have been able work together fix the noticably large flaws but they must have all been on autopilot one of the most disappointing and wasted opportunities in the is the way the movie deals the supporting characters all of have next nothing do and are not even given multidimensional characters attempt develop coming off of her oscarcaliber work in two of last years best films clockwatchers and the opposite of sex lisa kudrows throwaway girlfriend role is an incredible step down sure kudrows fellow friend jennifer aniston did the same thing two weeks ago in office space but at least we got spend little time aniston kudrow meanwhile mostly just stands around no doubt wondering why she agreed appear in this in the first place chazz palminteri as rival gangster primo fares even worse in role that plays more like an afterthought than an actual character finally molly shannon rising star and cast member on saturday night live has rousingly hilarious onescene cameo right at the beginning as one of crystals patients and then completely disappears too bad considering that the supporting actors surely have proven that they have the abilities support de niro and crystal once analyze this approached its second wedding scene leaving kudrows laura standing alone at the altar once again had become thoroughly annoyed where the story had gone and had mostly lost respect for the character we were supposed sympathize the most ben afterwards the climactic scene ben posing as fellow mob boss in place of the depressed paul became real laughfree deadzone losing its last remaining comic punches analyze this proves that talent can certainly help any out but when the written material is not up their level what we are virtually left is vacuum of thin air

as we see the terrible events that unfold before our eyes in the middle east at the moment does not loose the oppertunity get involved telling stories and expressing opinions this centers on relationship forged throughout the adult lifetimes of two marine colonels hays hodges tommy lee jones and terry childers samuel jackson they fought side side in vietnam where childers saved hodges life shooting an unarmed pow that is against the rules of war but understandable in this story anyway under the specific circumstances certainly hodges is not complaining years pass hodges whose wounds make him unfit for action gets law degree and becomes marine lawyer childers is now respected and muchdecorated hero that has served his country his life and sould because of his excellent record childers is sent yemen rescue the american ambassador ben kingsley cowering in the embassy under assault from violent demonstrators and snipers blasting from rooftops childers does what he has do evacuate the family and protect the men under his command after three marines die and the colonel thinks he sees ground fire he orders his troops shoot into the firing crowd more than yemeni men women and children are mowed down childers is immediately accused of ordering his men fire on crowd and murder of unarmed civilians he persuades his old friend hodges represent him in the courtroom drama that occupies the second half of the did childers violate authorized s military rules of engagement or are there simply no rules in war the answers these stereotypical questions are obvious but the inconsistent plot immediately raises all sorts of other questions the murder of innocent civilians has result into something greater than simple trial in the s where is the accusations from the arab leaders where is the n the ends without even telling the most interesting story what happens on the international arena this in way akin films such as few good men has already been accused of breaking the rules of morality and ethics and even of racism these accusations are pretty heavy but also unfair what director william friedklin truly broke was the rules of decent filmmaking one of the earliest apparent problems rules of engagement is its lack of credibility the entire operation in yemen may remind us about what happens in the middle east right now but is overdone contrived and unrealistic as if chain of events had happen in particular manner in order for the plot proceed lot of it is so cheesy that no one could possibly accept it as reality that is precisely why it is not offensive it is completely unobjective many stories are started and never finished many questions are asked but never answered lot of parallels are referring nothing it seems that neither the director producers or the screenwriter can make up their minds about the contents of their is it about arab mentality americas foreign policies americas role in the world corruption in the higher circles it goes on and on it consists of countless stories but not definable plot it tries be everything for everyone and ends up being nothing for no one think that it is ironic because director william friedkins probably most acclaimed was the exorcist had silly story but became rather effective in this case you have strong story many possibilities and the result is silly though several scenes bare the mark of professionalism such as the impressive battle scenes his latest does simply not engage believe that friedklin is director that is absolutely depended on great scripts and talented producers in order succeed it is obvious that he has neither and the result is therefore catastrophe the characters feel designed unreal merely shadows no life outside the conflict even the actors can not save this from going under though both jackson and jones act admirably performances that are as good as you get script like this it is not something that these great actors can boast of they have roles that they could play blindfolded their hand on the back jackson is gray and jones uninteresting the rest of the cast including ben kingsly blair underwood and guy pearce are simply waiting for their paychecks the time has come for the verdict on the charges of complete lack of objectivity find this guilty on the charges of breaking the rules of reasonable filmmaking find it guilty but on the charges of racism find this not guilty because of it is inconclusive and often silly plot that lacks objectivity everywhere not only when concerning the arab population must admit that the is dangerously near the line of being racially offensive and do think that screenwriter stephen gaghan went bit too far portraying the yemeni people almost as stereotypical badguys this is very sad since in time like this it is crucial not lose objectivity and proclaim the truth however it is absolutely necessary remember that the muslim terrorists are responsible for most of the terrorist activity in and outside the united states and that it is not coincidence that s residents in the middle east including yemen are on constant maximum alert

from dusk till dawn directoreditor robert rodriguez screenwriters quentin tarantinorobert kurtzman story cinematographer guillermo navarro cast quentin tarantino richie gecko george clooney seth gecko juliette lewis kate fuller harvey keitel jacob fuller ernest liu scott fuller salma hayek santanico pandemonium tom savini sex machine fred williamson frost cheech marin border guardchet pussycarlos michael parks texas ranger brenda hillhouse hostage gloria runtime dimension films reviewed dennis schwartz it is love it or hate it simply hated it on its menu for fun is violent feast served up as charm and done in tongueandcheek manner it is serial killerhorror farce of nonstop overthetop action and sleaze involving decapitations vampires biker fights extended gun play and an array of gore that has be seen be believed that regales in its vulgarity and campiness for bloodandgore as it goes out of its way gloss over the clich of the conventional bfilms it is geared only for the cult crowd and will make its mark there one way or the other the plot involves two psychopath brothers the older professional bank robber and killer seth gecko clooney and the perverted psychopath killer richie tarantino who kills for pleasure and is also rapist they escape jail and go on killing spree in wichita and then flee liquor store in small texas border town they have just robbed bank and killed number of cops they have also taken middleaged bank teller as hostage in the liquor store they kill texas ranger and the store clerk and burn down the store stopping off in flophouse motel richie rapes and slaughters the hostage these scenes are all done an eye for comedy and parody if that is possible on the tv news it says they have killed so far and most are texas rangers the brothers plan get mexico and meet carlos cheech who will give them place of sanctuary for thirty percent of their illegal take road blocks and car searches at the border the brothers commandeer motor home of vacationing family who stopped at their motel so that the father could sleep in real bed there is the father jacob fuller keitel who just resigned as minister because he lost faith ever since his wife died in car accident his sexy yearold innocent daughter kate lewis and her shy brother scott liu it is not explained how he happens be chinese the story really becomes bizarre when they get across the border and get ready meet carlos in barwhorehouse for truckers and bikers called the titty twister the place is open from dawn dusk thus the films title heres where rodriguez has chance throw convention out the window and have some absurd fun as the place turns out be vampire hangout it sells sex its patrons and has exotic stripper santanico pandemonium hayek do her alluring strip before turning into vampire the brothers and their hostages have fight their way out of the place as the vampires keep coming and the killings become the films staple this supposedly clever script did nothing but turn me off though there were few funny moments in that was dripping special effects and spent most of its script in finding novel ways showcase its killings will take pass on this one it is just not my style of the characters were as empty as the story and the was an easy one forget

plot little boy born in east germany named hansel loves the american music one day he gets the opportunity meet and marry an american i but first he must get sex change enter hedwig once married the two move the states but quickly thereafter get divorce at that point hedwig starts writing music and meets another confused boy who soon turns into star that boy also turns his back on hedwig and it is not long before hedwig puts together hisher own band and tours the states via seafood restaurants this is the story of hisher life told via flashbacks and musical numbers critique an artsyfartsy musical great songs and superb performance john cameron mitchell does not really come together as whole overthetop symbolism incoherence and too much pretension retain my interest all the whole way through in fact this is not so much of realistic articulate behindthescenes look at the rise of rock roll star as it is an ambiguous overly poetic and incomprehensible struggle of man his sexuality and his identity as whole person on this planet guess that was expecting the former going in the is somewhat interesting point but was personally never able involve myself too much as the basic symbolic and incongruent nature of the left me feeling cold and distant but it is definitely tuned certain type of audience chances are that if you are fan of the wall the rocky horror picture show or even priscilla queen of the desert the elements tangled in this movie will likely strike your fancy some of the characters in this even ask the audience sing along at some point and provide the lyrics of their song onscreen well personally do not care for those films and did not really get into the whole show atmosphere of this movie either guess might have looked at it all too literally but like said earlier just did not care enough about the characters delve into the so the butterfly represents his freedom side of things all know is that the left me many questions unanswered and did not make me feel any more fulfilled what was hedwigs relationship that other member of his band the beard what happened hedwig and tommy gnosis at the end of the movie was that an actual sequence or fantasy what ever happened the lawsuit and more all of were part of the and interested me somewhat if the only idea behind the was for the main character uncover hisher sexuality then that is one thing but as many of the relationships and situations presented themselves in this movie wanted some resolution those pieces as well did not get it the films humor also did not tickle my funny bone either then again have seen many in these arthouse theatres in patrons are rolling down the aisles laughter while all see is tiny bit of whimsy on the screen some of these films are also better enjoyed the added atmosphere of plant called marijuana and can certainly see how this movie ingrains within itself some nifty visual elements in order jazz up that experience but being sober as was and expecting coherent funny musical transsexual twist did not leave the theater very satisfied came out having watched an existential story of confused man caught up in musical lifestyle wrapped in metaphors dramatics and more questions than answers will on the other hand definitely hand some props out the lead in this john cameron mitchell who is also the man who wrote directed and created the play on this movie is based and the tunes will likely be enjoyed anyone who digs the sex pistols david bowie and the whole glamrock scene note btw it seems as though pretty much every single mainstream critic in the united states loved this movie from top bottom and thought that it was really funny boot so you might want take that into consideration yourself but having said that the main reason that started this dinky website in the first place was because films like this would sometimes be uniformly applauded the official critics while a regular joblo in the audience just would not get what all the fuss was about this movie is perfect example of why continue write movie reviews where is joblo coming from moulin rouge grease everyone says love you the opposite of sex dancer in the dark brother where art thou loves labours lost

mm is not going enlighten your day it is dark grimy and disturbing portrait of underworld snuff films and filled excessive violence not only do you need the stomach make it through this bloated mess you will require lot of patience as well nicolas cage seems be doing quite bit of overacting as of late he wore bizarre getup and did lot of yelling in the terminally awful snake eyes and here he attempts performance that can relate someone completely losing their grip on reality cage plays private investigator tom welles praised for his secrecy and reliability at home welles is family man wife catherine keener and small daughter take care of his new assignment is bizarre one the wife of formally deceased millionaire has hired him solve mystery regarding found in her husbands safe the appears be some kind of cheap pornography involving teenage girl and masked man until the girl is brutally murdered or so it seems welles of course begins burrow deeper and deeper uncover the truth and the more he becomes involved in this disturbing case the more he gets in over his head he hires an adult book store clerk named max california joaquin phoenix be his guide through the ugly underworld of pornography max knows what welles is getting himself into and explains you dance the devil the devil do not change the devil changes you these turn out be very wise words mm has premise that begs for better execution the setup is slick and well played as cage uncovers the identity of the girl and travels locate her this is where everything goes awry although director joel schumacher succeeds in frightening us his grotesque portrait of the real world he forgot inject any interest or excitement the formula everything about the movie becomes dull and lifeless repelling the viewer like the effect of bug spray insects although it had enormous potential the third act of mm is total bust leaving intrigued audiences in baffling state of extreme disappointment as the proceedings spiral out of control cage is the films sole flame of energy his performance is actually believable but soon the directors demands start weigh heavily on his shoulder and he begins stumbling along in desperation still you have got give him credit for holding this project together as long as he did for that is no easy feat when you consider the problems at hand welles trail soon leads him bizarre filmmaker played convincingly peter stormare who is notorious for the hardesthitting snuff films in the industry this is where cage goes over the edge into serial killerlike phase in he must take revenge on all those who murdered the innocent girl in the he tracks down the masked man responsible for the killing chris bauer and they have bloody brawl in the local cemetery fight sequence that would look more at home in schwarzenegger movie written andrew kevin walker mm dissipates into poor mans seven all the violence but little of the effectiveness that made the latter such chilling masterpiece furthermore what has become of joel schumacher the director has recently experienced major drought slumming in the depths of dismal flop after flop batman and robin anyone this putrid thriller is certainly not going revive his career so perhaps schumacher should start exploring his lighter side

synopsis original jurassic park survivor alan grant neill is tricked paul and amanda kirby macy and leoni into leading an expedition an island overrun dinosaur rescue their stranded son grants team is picked off one one as they encounter dinosaurs both new and familiar and grant grows realise that some breeds are more intelligent than he previously thought review there is one reason why jurassic park iii is better than its immediate predecessor the lost world jurassic park the latter wasted minutes of my life the former only the first park was marvellous full of aweinspiring sights interesting characters and genuine thrills its two successors have been pale imitations amounting hundredmilliondollar bgrade horror movies at least this third entry realises it whereas the lost world tried justify its existence ludicrous and overextended plot jurassic park iii simply sticks its characters on an island bunch of dinosaurs and lets the mayhem begin there is desperate sense of deja vu presiding over this movie the computeranimated dinos are no longer novel or exciting and even the firsttime presence of aerial lizards scarcely improves the situation remember that wondrous first trolley ride through the park in the original movie nothing in this rehash even comes close add in execrable dialogue from screenwriters buchman payne and taylor and phonedin performances the normally capable macy and leoni and it is difficult recommend the anyone but dino enthusiasts at least neill makes some effort retain the dignity of his character and there is much less gore than in the lost world making this installment more suitable for children

the characters in jonathan lynns the whole nine yards yet another in an endless recent string of mob comedies analyze this and mickey blue eyes gun shy are rarely ever written as real people but merely as onedimensional caricatures when an added layer one of their personalities is revealed it is not service the character development or naturally offer up instinctive characterizations but accommodate the convoluted plot in lightweight comedy you might say it is not required have perfectly realized figures just as long as they get the job done unfortunately for comedy work it has at least succeed at being funny and if there was laughometer available would guess that it briefly ascended around of the time for me suffice say the comedy in the whole nine yards works about as well as the brokendown lawnmower in my backyard and when giggle surprisingly arises every twenty thirty minutes it is sheer luck nicholas oz oseransky matthew perry is an amateur dentist living in the quiet suburbs of quebec trapped in hateful marriage the conniving sophie rosanna arquette delightfully hamming it up clearly artificial frenchcanadian accent one day oz sees that someone is moving into the house nextdoor walking over greet him he is horrified discover it is jimmy the tulip tudeski bruce willis former contract killer for the mafia who has just been released from prison once getting know him and becoming his friend oz is more comfortable his identity but for sophie it means possible hitman do away oz in her scheme sophie sends oz chicago cash in informing his old mob boss kevin pollak about jimmys whereabouts but in the process he falls in love jimmys wife cynthia natasha henstridge who is being held hostage upon return quebec and one contrivance after the next ozs dental assistant jill amanda peet is overjoyed discover that he lives beside the tulip and forces him set up meeting since jills dream in life turns out being contract killer herself have you got all that because there is more much much more and this is movie that without credits is little over minutes and feels only like an hour the whole nine yards is an ultimately unsatisfying and emptyheaded excursion into wellworn terrain already set far superior pictures how the cast most of are respectable actors got caught up in such cliched deficient remains mystery unless they thought it might aspire match the congenial screwball zaniness of director lynns comedy classic clue the movie going into the theater preliminary comparisons between the two movies were unavoidable but the twentyminute mark when had chuckled once and laughed nary single time it was clear this production was in serious trouble since the entire running time depends on the mechanisms of the plot and the screenplay inauspiciously written mitchell kapner collapses every failing comedy bit the is an inevitable dead zone in the way of substance and frequently entertainment value the whole nine yards is neither facetious nor aside from the subplot about jills shocking eagerness become professional hitwoman inventive and more often than not just lies there the spinning drearily around and around in the projector but never igniting any sort of spark few select actors do what they can the material while others make no impact at all on the mediocre side are actually those playing the two central characters matthew perry and bruce willis perry innocuously enjoyable on tvs friends plays the same exact sitcomstyle character in all of his movies from fools rush in three tango and it has become crushing bore meanwhile willis makes next no impression and because of the limited guise of his jimmy the tulip tudeski oftentimes disappears into the background their three female counterparts fare noticeably better best of all is natasha henstridge far more radiant than in the exploitative species movies who adds unanticipated depth and emotion cynthia henstridge has the talent for sure break out of these countless throwaway roles but first she must fire her agent amanda peet has lot of fun as the quirkily straightforward and giddy jill and seems know more about the art of comedic payoff than even perry who thus far has strived on career based solely on comedy it is too bad then that peet is unnecessarily asked disrobe in climactic scene the obvious sole purpose being show off her breasts finally rosanna arquette is awful as sophie but something tells me that was her purpose and her clear overacting only aids in brightening up her limited screen time also popping up is michael clarke duncan fresh off an oscar nomination for his role in the green mile as jimmys largely built friend and fellow killer frankie figs when the whole nine yards eventually sputters its underwhelming conclusion one is left pondering how such ever got greenlit great deal of movies of this type have been made in the past and this one is nothing but duplication of better films so what was the point without passable screenplay or any notable technical accomplishments the whole nine yards rests solely on the presumed charm of the cast and half of the actors are not charming at all now what does that tell you

take two old and dying men lifetime of regrets house full of sins thoroughly despicable man enough lies insecurities and other character defects keep team of psychiatrists gainfully employed then add inexplicable meteorological and amphibianbased phenomenon and you will have summed up magnolia the newest from paul thomas anderson boogie nights the movie tells multiple stories weaving them together or overlapping them during the course of its three hour running time would that the stories were worth the telling earl partridge jason robards thousand acres is dying of cancer bedridden in much pain it is obvious that his time is growing short his much younger wife played julianne moore an ideal husband is surprised find herself struggling his impending death having married for money she discovers that she has actually fallen in love the old guy and regrets having cheated and lied earl regrets having cheated on his first wife and estranging himself from his only son tom cruise eyes wide shut now misogynist selfhelp guru who teaches men how seduce and destroy his sexual and vulgar perspective on malefemale relationships is so overthetop as be utterly unbelievable meanwhile jimmy gator philip baker hall the insider is also dying of cancer not as physically incapacitated as earl jimmy is still able perform his duties as the lovable host of longrunning quiz show pits adults against children the current whizquizkid is stanley spector jeremy blackman in his debut who is tired of the pressure of performing and is willing call it quits on the other hand quiz kid donnie smith william macy mystery men would like nothing more than return the spotlight when he was somebody his pathetic life is souring as he can no longer capitalize on his brief minutes of fame stanley is all too eager relinquish jimmy has his own family crisis as his drugaddict daughter melora walters boogie nights refuses have anything do him for reasons are not disclosed us until the end of the grabbing at one last attempt at happiness she reaches out softhearted cop john reilly never been kissed even as she tries push herself away from him because she deems herself not worthy of his affection this dysfunctional group carries on for what seems be an interminable twothirds of the movie and then it gets worse literally raining frogs yes frogs assuming it be an intended deusexmachina device it is an ineffective one because it does not seem faze the characters much oh they may step gingerly around the splattered frog corpses littering the streets but otherwise the frog shower did not seem change their behavior or pattern of living or dying there is simply too much going on in this movie and most of it is distasteful watch mr anderson further obscures the incorporating loud and intrusive sound track that often drowned out the dialogue character who apparently rapped significant clue plot development was completely unintelligble and heavy handed segment of historical occurances containing ironic twists set up absolutely nothing one of the recurring themes is found in line donnie quotes we may be done the past but the past is not done us this is an absolute lie god is in the forgiveness business in fact as we humbly ask for forgiveness and repent or change our offending mindset gods word says that he not only forgives he also forgets even am he that blotteth out thy transgressions for mine own sake and will not remember thy sins isaiah kjv the spiritual one who keeps bringing up our unrighteous past is the same one who wants keep us in state of condemnation do not let him next time your spiritual adversary reminds you of your past take great pleasure in reminding him of his future he hates that

so much for sweet returns after smart horror films were starting be made again after the exploitative slasher movies starting scream and followed scream urban legend and the original know what you did last summer like still know what you did last summer was bound be made sooner or late it is perfect example of the exact reason why horror films temporarily burned out and that is because they reached for the lowestcommondenominator in filmmaking favoring nonstop deaths and gore for suspense and trading in fleshed out likable characters for onedimensional nitwits it has been exactly one year since julie james jennifer love hewitt suffered through the ordeal of being terrorized ben willis psychopathic fisherman whom her friends and she accidentally hit in the middle of the road and then thinking he was dead dumped him into the ocean since then julie has relocated boston university and although often paranoid and haunted bad dreams she has been able put her life back together when julies friend karla brandy is called up radio station and answers correctly what the capital of brazil is she wins vacation the bahamas for four people also includes karlas horny boyfriend tyrell mekhi phifer and will matthew settle who karla sets julie up after her own boyfriend ray freddie prinze jr also returning from the original does not show up when they reach the secluded island they discover it is the last day of the open season and will be stranded there for the th of july weekend few employees fend off violent storm headed for them of course julie her friends and the workers are not the only ones there as the murderous ben willis dressed in fisherman garb returns seek revenge on julie once and for all it is sad state of affairs when movie like still know what you did last summer is made am very big fan of horror movies and so it is especially disheartening find out that this sequel ikwydls am fan of is almost an exact replica of friday the th movie while the original focused more on the story and characters as well as genuinely suspenseful moments thanks the screenplay kevin williamson who did not return write the sequel and it shows still know has no story speak of and is so vacuous of ideas that the filmmakers were forced have murder occur every five minutes just keep the audience interested also gone are any signs of character development and since every single character died before got know them all was left was stare at the screen indifferent what was going on while cared about the fates of the characters in the original it made no difference me in this sequel who lived and died they were all paperthin and pointless except become victims the lethal hook of the fisherman another element that made the original so memorable were some superbly crafted setpieces like the store sequence sarah michelle gellar but there are none speak of in this sequel although they do come close at one moment brandy since so many people were killed every couple minutes the suspense and scares evaporated faster than salt in water also of note is the mystery of the second killer and accomplice ben but it is obvious from the first frame who it is and so could not even have fun at that like did in the scream movies and urban legend it figures that just as slasher films were starting get some recognition again would come along and ruin it for everyone else maybe the people who made still know what you did last summer should have realized that in order make good movie you must have screenplayor at least one that is not such black hole for thoughts and ideas the ending of the inevitably leaves the door wide open for third part but judging from this amazingly lackluster first sequel everyone involved should have quit while they were still ahead

really is not much of in fact the plot what there is bad guy trying destroy the ancient never before seen pokemon lugia is about it except the fact that ash kethcum the worlds best pokemon trainer must try and stop him before he destroys this one pokemon forever well there you go of course ash is followed his friends misty brock gary and his pokemon friends pikachu squirtle charizard the usual even though the first movie was not great it was definately an enjoyable wellmade movie an actual thin storyline this new movie however is nothing but garbage there is nothing good it storywise and its stupid little movie that trys be clever and sophisticated yet trys bit too hard the voices of woody allen gene hackman jennifer lopez sylvester stallone and sharon stone this computeranimated yakfest think toy story filled used merchandising is one for the anteaters the main story is the independence of worker named allen he wants more life than just digging away underground for the colony when he finds out about insectopia mythical place where all insects can run free along his colonys princess stone journey out into the world find meaning for life about minutes into the picture began wonder what the point of the was halfway through still did not have an answer the end credits just gave up and ran out antz is mindless mess of poor writing and even poorer voiceovers allen is nonchalant while would have guessed if had not seen her in the mighty and basic instinct stone cannot act even in cartoon this is one for the bugs unfunny and extremely dull hey bugs life may have good time doing antz in

military pulls him off this three year project and assigns him figure out what godzilla is and boy does he find out and boy does godzilla suck hate use such word in review something that is supposed his team of talentchallenged imbeciles would never have had clue as how the creature should look let me give you few examples of this terrible attempt at filmmaking plan on giving some things away gray hair and thick glasses his name is mayor ebert his assistant is named gene gene gives ebert thumbs down at the end of the could not make this up if tried folks stay me on this one ok godzilla can produced

after the recent animated debacles of rugrats movie and bugs life am seriously considering raising my highly negative rating on dreamworks other insect from october antz hated that movie and yet it is so much better than these latest two excursions bugs life is the second animated insect in the last two months and hoped for the best considering it was done in the wonderful style of pixars last toy story but in no way does bugs life even remotely match up that flik david foley an ant who along his many comrades has the job every year of gathering up the seasonal harvest only have give half of it away the dominating grasshoppers led hopper kevin spacey flik however feels all alone and unwanted in the world especially after he accidentally loses all of their food and the ants are threated hopper gather up whole other seasons load the time the last summer leaf falls from the trees banished from ant island flik leaves the colony in search of some strong reinforcement help out but through misunderstanding returns handful of helpless circus bugs including walking stick david hyde pierce dung beetle brad garrett gypsy moth madeline kahn male ladybug denis leary and caterpillar joe ranft bugs life has one thing going for it only one thing its glorious bright colors the computergenerated animation is spectacle look at the itself unfortunately is lifeless unamusing contraption without any of the flair or excitement of toy story the characters in bugs life are an assortment of either unlikable or dull insects without any charm or personality other than stand around and recite arbitrary and thoroughly unfunny oneliners the thin story was also stretched out nearly unbearable minutes and it often felt as if they ran out of ideas throughout and so they made up pointless scenes pass as timefiller after giving such scathing reviews the animated films from this year was beginning think that had simply outgrown them but then realized this is just not so still adore almost all of the older disney films and many of the newer ones such as the little mermaid beauty and the beast the nightmare before christmas and yes toy story maybe this has just been bad year for childrens films and hopefully the upcoming the prince of egypt will not be disappointment as for bugs life did not enjoy anything about it not the story not the characters and not even the voiceover work was far more lively in antz bugs life goes down as yet another failure for disney and it is sad state of affairs when their best in the last two years has been the minor jonathan taylor thomas picture will be home for christmas

once upon time jeanclaude van damme was decent action hero the muscles from brussels bursted into the market mindless adventure films boasting his spectacular martialarts ability some of these excursions were fun but now it seems like watching van damme movie has become painful chore no rewards but the virtually guaranteed helping of mindnumbing action and when the action goes sour what is there left enjoy will explain knock off is about pair of counterfeit jeans salesmen working out of an office in hong kong marcus ray van damme babemagnet and stylish dresser heads up the company an annoying weasel of partner rob schneider they become part of plot involving microbombs implanted in counterfeit jeans seemingly mole in the business am going reveal about everything in the next paragraph so if you want review devoid of spoilers skip onto the next one am not quite sure who gives crap but will issue warning anyhow tommy is really working the cia his boss very hammy and flat paul sorvino is the mole and he wants cause carnage these tiny but immensely powerful super weapons he even stoops so low put them into childrens toys if you thought this plot outline sounded intriguing then you probably will enjoy knock off if you think that this ridiculous setup could not even fill five minutes of screen time without causing you roll over laughing this might not be your cup of tea knock off sucks it stoops ridiculous levels that most individuals could only conjure up in horrific nightmares it amazes me how far these producers will go sell something simply because van damme is the star the plot is pathetic garbage strung together inane action sequences that will baffle your mind the performances are so wooden you could use them row canoe and the action itself is an absolute catastrophe director tsui hark who teamed van damme in the superior but still lamebrained double team is at the helm and he would rather attempt dazzle us fantastic camera angles than engage us the plot suppose enjoyed some of the camera work but the incessant desperation of it all made me rather nauseous the picture freezes in the middle of an action sequence speeds are altered consistently and the camera tricks mostly apply traveling up gun barrels as the weapons are fired it all sounds very cool trust me it is not as much as it scars me say this har har van damme is terrible sure he does lots of fancy kickboxing moves and dodges giant crates the greatest of ease he looks like he is doing bad impersonation of jackie chan and his performance is stiff and tired hate say it but perhaps it is time for mr van damme give up his day job it is really test of endurance watching knock off suppose there is some enjoyment derived from schneiders character who is extremely annoying but provides the films better moments and what is the beautiful lela rochon doing in this movie hopefully she grabbed her paycheck and then fled the premises like an olympic sprinter knock off does not even stand strong as mindless but entertaining action like handful of van dammes others no this movie is an embarrassment the entire action genre of modern filmmaking and considering how low has stooped as of late in that department that is certainly not saying much note self avoid universal soldier the return upon release in august

the year is barely week old and there is already candidate for the worst of the relic wouldbe chiller that is more successful at making the audience laugh than scream in this ridiculous from uberhack peter hyams whose last two pictures were dreadful jeanclaude van damme vehicles creature that feeds on the hypothalamuses hypothalamii of humans and animals goes on killing spree in chicago museum how did this creature come into existence and why does it feed on hormones the scientific explanation cooked up the fouryes fourcredited screenwriters amy holden jones john raffo rick jaffa and amanda silver takes suspension of disbelief new heights even monster movie standards but as cockamamie as the science is in the it is not quite as hard swallow as the casting of the clueless penelope ann miller as brilliant molecular biologist who specializes in evolutionary genetics miller acts as if she wants an oscar nomination turning every scene that requires the slightest display of emotion into an overblown oscar clip complete piercing wails and glycerine tears give it up penelopeit is _monster_movie_ on the flip side tom sizemore just phones in his performance as police lieutenant but his role is so thankless that it is hard imagine it being played any more effectively it is quite funny see indulge the straightest of faces in all those cheesy horror movie cliches that wes craven lampooned so well and so recently in scream for example in one early scene museum security guard goes into bathroom stall late at night ok we all know what is coming but as if we did not need any more confirmation he pulls out joint and starts puffing away everyone knows what happens people who do drugs in scary movie and later miller frantically runs out of museum exhibit after she hears some suspicious heavy breathing does she make beeline for the front door of course notshe runs into the ladies room and cowers in stall all the cliches it is only fitting the films climax offers what is perhaps the most overused one in recent that of someone outrunning fireball if the relic is truly the next evolution in terror as the poster states then the horror filmand humanityis in even worse shape than we thought

susan grangers review of two can play that game screen gems since the success of waiting exhale there have been several romantic comedies about africanamerican professionals this female revenge fantasy vivica fox plays shante smith stunning ad exec who seems have reached the pinnacle of success mansion sporty car and an idyllic relationship hunky hotshot lawyer morris chestnut she is at point in her life when she dispenses advice her grateful girlfriends monique wendy racquel robinson tamala jones when your man messes up no matter how small it is she smugly decrees yuh gots punish him so when she catches her hot man dancing at bar smart and sexy rival gabrielle union she devises her own version of the rules day tough love emotionally punishing plan get him back unfortunately writerdirector mark brown how be player breaks the cardinal rule of romantic comedy you have like the protagonist and shrill selfcongratulatory shante smith is smirking superficial spiteful shrew who does not realize that rational rules cannot always be applied love having her talk directly into the camera gets stale very quickly and the day one day two titlecard device underscores the tedium comic anthony anderson scores as chestnuts boisterous bestfriend and singer bobby brown does cameo as scuzzy mechanic who is given smooth makeover ms robinson but the outtakes over the closing credits contain more humor than the itself on the granger movie gauge of two can play that game is smarmy if slick filled misogynistic attitude and blatant product placements cocacola miller genuine draft but little else in this rrated for explicit sexual language pseudohip battle of the sexes the audience loses

susan grangers review of glitter th centuryfox there is less here than meets the eye or put it this way if you thought madonna was awful in shanghai surprise mariah careys worse in this reworking of star is born she plays billie frank who despite being abandoned her singeralcoholic mother valerie pettiford believes she is destined for greatness because everyone tells her she is you have got this amazing gift and you gotta use it her roommate says your voice it is incredible says another singer as not never met anyone like you proclaims julian dice black max beesley the hot new york dj who becomes her svengalilike producerlover problem is her signature song did not mean turn you on is wretched and when she fumes out of filming her first music video because the director wants exploit her having her wear bikini the audience bursts into laughter exploit mariah carey who chooses wear as little as the law will allow come on writer kate laniers script is fatuous and director vondie curtishall does not have clue how handle the glitzy pop diva and as result of their incompetence whisperyvoiced ms carey seems be embarrassed onscreen she almost cringes when the camera comes in for closeup pursing her lips and averting her glassy eyes talented british musician max beesley appears equally inept and as cinematographer geoffrey simpson pans around the manhattan skyline there is an audible audience groan when the twin towers of the world trade center come into view perhaps one of the reasons ms carey suffered her highlypublicized nervous breakdown this summer is because she saw preview of this clunker on the granger movie gauge of glitter is pathetic right now it is tops on my list of the worst of

the ads make hanging up seem like an upbeat comedy about rascally father and his three daughters anyone who went the movie expecting that left disappointed all of the movies funny scenes were included in the ad so what do we get eve marks meg ryan just put her father lou mozell walter matthau into hospital once upon time lou was screenwriter who collaborated his nowestranged wife his one great moment in life was writing for john wayne who gave him giant bulletshaped trophy now lou is senile and deteriorating rapidly eve tries convince her sisters georgia diane keaton and maddy lisa kudrow that their father is dying and needs them both are slow show concern so devoted eve stands vigil over her father who constantly asks for his favorite daughter georgia while running her own business planning special events and caring for her son jesse james some comic relief comes when maddy also drops off her ailing st bernard for eve care for the tension builds until all three sisters are finally in one room at one of eves events where georgia is the keynote speaker there is superficial resemblance shakespeares king lear senile king three daughters one devoted saint and two selfish bitches but the material is apparently drawn from life sister screenwriters delia and nora ephron had parents who were successful writing team henry and phoebe ephron collaborated on screenplays including desk set and there is no business like show business delias novel the basis for the is dedicated henry surprisingly the script is as thin as an anorexics wet dream the virtue of semiautobiographical project would seem be the wealth of material available yet the ephrons provide only the barest minimum of information about their characters also the spaces they inhabit seem artificial eve lives in house that looks like magazine layout no matter how putupon she is we cannot feel sorry for anyone whose house is so pristine on any given day georgia is famous magazine editor and in her brief scenes while she chats on cell phone eve seem like the photo spread for profile when we first meet maddy she is fishing at picturesque mountain stream expected see the credit cinematography vanity fair and yes diane keaton is literally old enough be lisa kudrows mother her credit though she looks young enough pull it off the one redeeming aspect of hanging up is that at its core is truth about siblings there is always one on everyone else in the family relies freeing the others be selfish and emotionally distant my wife is the reliable child in her family for better or worse my brother has the role in mine being selfish and emotionally distant may not be fulfilling but it is lot less work if you have nothing better do than watch this movie look for powerful cameo cloris leachman as the sisters mother pat in devastating scene eve discovers that her mother does not love her although leachman is best known for comedies like young frankenstein and the mary tyler moore show her performance here reminded me of the considerable dramatic talent she displayed in the last picture show bottom line everyone involved has lived in so long they do not recognize real life anymore

this is the worst movie have seen since the so bad walked out on it jingle all the way it is crap on toast made of crap baked in an oven fueled crap it is crap through and through nothing works in this as be expected from joel schumacher who has made only one watchable in his entire career that being cousins heres man who admits he is medicore director rather charmingly selfeffacing statement but truth be told he is much worse than mediocre not all scorn should be heaped on schumacher though akiva goldsman should not be allowed write ever again there is no plot anywhere and the dialogue is unrelentingly shallow preposterous and boring they set up mr freeze as tragic figure trying cure his cryogenically frozen wife then completely sabotage his character giving him the lamest oneliners it turns him into stock maniacal villain who thoroughly enjoys his villainy instead of brooding scientist who has spent much of his life bringing his wife from the brink of death but that is par for course nothing in this makes any sense including half of arnold schwarzeneggers lines as mr freeze arnold is given way too much dialogue spit out at once this is the same problem he had in jingle all the way and it seems that his austrian accent is getting thicker and more unintelligible as the days pass personally think that he has more pull the directors and does not retake scenes make him understandable compare his dialogue in the terminator series the load of nonsense that streams forth in batman robin apparently james cameron knows how get competent performance out of arnold uma thurman is not as bad but nothing resembling good either her poison ivy vamps around terribly chewing up scenery left and right and her pamela isley scenes are marred subsnl standard acting as if she is reading off cue cards and is about laugh at any given moment given the script it is wonder it did not happen more frequently there is no redeeming feature in this not george clooney as batman chris odonnell as robin nor alicia silverstone as batgirl michael gough is eerily sickly looking as alfred as if the conceit of his illness was prompted his cadaverous appearance in fact there was something unsettling about his appearance seems have been accomplished without any makeup tricks looking as if it were scenes from documentary about dying man unfortunately every scene about alfreds sickness is bungled such incompetence that there is absolutely no emotional resonance they just go through the motions losing whatever impact the scenes were supposed impart the movie is rife poorly choreographed fights scenes that never give any sense of big battle you know there is bunch of people but instead of melee schumacher decided focus on foot or fist there is never moment of awe wonder or mayhem the only interesting part of the battles scenes are the freezing effects are impressive and probably expensive even then the fights are so full of camp and stupidity that they become unwatchable the hockey team from hell not even the tv series got that stupid at least not on the grand scale of stupidity that batman robin showcases frustrating too are the various supporting characters that walk on and off nothing say or do blink and you will miss elle macpherson as julie madison vivica fox as why is she even in the vamp in freezes lair all of two lines and pat hingle as the most ineffectual commissioner gordan the batman series ever had and in what almost seems like an effort save on costs vendela kirsebom has no lines as mrs fries she is not even filmed well enough look good trust me she is quite attractive outside of this dreck and as if the were not bad enough limp along bad direction bad dialogue bad performances and bad fight scenes there are inconsistencies and illogic galore know it is nitpicky ask where the hundreds of feet of cable are stored in the batarangs why the characters arms are not ripped out of their sockets when they accomplish onearmed batarang save after falling hundreds of feet while holding on another person no less or where the moisture comes from when freezes weapon creates tons if ice that is all traditional comic book stuff but why does batman spring trap for freeze at public charity event that endanger the lives of hundreds of bystanders why is there big switch clearly marked heat in mr freezes lair why do countless bumbling police officers even try take on mr freeze hand hand why does alfred encourage silverstone become batgirl and even go so far as have suit made for her why do batman robin take minutes bicker before leaving the batcave in response an emergency and since it established early on that ivy is using pheromones why do not they wear masks filter it out could go on and on batman robin is braindead pointless garish loud that should still reign as the worst of the year the time rolls along note warner bros if you are going make another batman please replace schumacher nearly anyone because it could actually get worse than this what schumacher does not understand is that comic book does not automatically equal unbearable idiocy the true equation seems be schumacher batman unbearable idiocy

when ponder childhood memories past one of the things that always springs immediately mind is watching the inspector gadget tv show my older brother truth be told we were rabid fanatics our version of cowboys and indians was chasing each other around our coffee table the theme tune alternating who would get be gadget and who would be stuck playing the part of dr claw the inspectors arch nemesis was never biggie on nostalgia but you just cannot help but have fond memories of something like that sometimes even find myself up at am watching reruns of my favorite episodes trying recapture some of that sense of wonder felt as kid at the very least was expecting the new version of the classic television series have at least some kind of similar effect on me despite how horrid may be the simple
