task of rekindling even slight feeling of nostalgia is pretty tough screw up so back sat minimum expectations of what the movie would deliver let us face it exactly how good can liveaction disney really be was wise enough steer clear from the likes of mr magoo and george of the jungle two previous disney adaptations and wish god that had been sharp enough skip gadget as well rarely has movie left me such an utter feeling of emptiness as everyone else was getting up exit the screening room after the movie had completed its assault on mankind was left sitting there absolutely speechless and totally dumbfounded at what had just seen can something this awful truly exist in such an evolved world right from the beginning knew was in trouble in the opening scenes each character is introduced as if their sole purpose is just be simply serve as reallife duplicates of their cartoon clones when referring them people almost yell in fear that the audience will not catch on as who certain character is supposed be oh hi penny is brain you creating onedimensional replicas is one thing having mere names take the place of them is quite another the plot shall we call it stays fairly in tune the original series matthew broderick stars as john brown how creative is that security guard who is horribly injured pack of ruthless businessmen headed scolex why rupert everett for the love of god why who himself is transformed into claw an unfortunate chain of events brown is then rescued and used as prototype for new lawenforcement technology wherein he is joined various machine parts and some nifty gadgets form drumroll please inspector gadget from here on out the movie becomes hodgepodge of stupid dialog and confusing situations although be fair my confusion could have been caused the virtual concussion the was inflicting upon my fragile mind there is something about an evil gadget taking over the city his first crime must have been swiping matt dillons dentures from there is something about mary and it all ends what else bunch of postcredit nonsense and cameo don adams himself be honest was not much paying attention these treats was just glad that it was over

perhaps if the impostors did not have so much going for it it would not have been such tremendous disappointment written directed and produced one of its two stars stanley tucci whose last picture was the indie smash hit big night the impostors almost never catches fire sputtering like twoday old campfire the story plays like an adlib sketch that was never polished or completed the films other star oliver platt was hilarious as the senators aide in bulworth the bloated supporting cast is veritable cornucopia of acting talent including woody allen steve buscemi hope davis alfred molina campbell scott lili taylor and tony shalhoub all are wasted save allen who plays theatrical director who stares in disbelief at the bad acting before his eyes the audience will easily identify allens sentiments the exception of single original joke involving mirrorimaged subtitles the movie engenders little genuine laughter the stale humor is so embarrassingly bad that you will find yourself laughing sporadically at the picture rather than it the plot for the movie involves two starving actors maurice oliver platt and arthur stanley tucci who accidentally end up on cruise ship in order escape an angry shakespearean actor alfred molina who is chasing them they dress up as ships stewards the overthetop script has the subtlety of sledgehammer when the leads hide from their pursuers arthur covers maurices mouth as he suffers an unending sneeze at other times we have the typical zany comedy routine where everyone chases everyone else while darting in and out of staterooms the films chapters introduced like placards at vaudeville stage it is clear the movie wants be taken as farce the press notes describes how everyone that came on the set remarked at what good time all of the actors were having too bad they were not more concerned the audiences potential enjoyment the jokes frequently framed in silence fall like stones such intensity that one can almost hear them hitting the ground one wonders if anyone ever viewed the films dailies surely if they had they would have realized what leaden results they were producing it is tricky having good actors play bad ones but if they could not pull it off they should have just given up the show is over for this fella steve buscemis character says towards the end the mystery is why they did not all give up in the beginning there must have been better script somewhere for such wonderful cast the impostors runs it is rated for little profanity and would be fine for kids around and up

this was the last carry on movie if you discount carry on columbus as carry on movie and was made new production company based in central london this movie is about the attempts emmanuelle prevert suzanne danielle bed her husband emile the french ambassador kenneth williams when he seems unwilling she is given his permission bed anyone she likes such as the prime minister and the s ambassador her antics get her into trouble and the british press spread these rumours all over their front pages she is invited talk on television set the record straight but only confirms the rumours instead meanwhile theodore valentine larry dann is in love emmannuelle after chance encounter in the toilet of the concorde and is determined marry her however she is only interested in restoring her husbands ardour seems little difficult after emiles accident church spire this is the second worst carry on movie the worst being carry on england it is embarassing see some of the remaining regulars struggle through this diabolical script lance peters and try pull off some of the crude and tasteless jokes that he has written newcomers suzanne danielle and beryl reid as mrs valentine are mildly funny but larry dann as theodore is excruciatingly bad kenneth williams only appears in few scenes and his lacklustre performance is warranted given the script the small parts for jack douglas as lyons the butler joan sims as mrs dangle kenneth connor as leyland the chauffeur and peter butterworth as richmond are worthless and embarassing in fact all four parts are surplus requirements however the only humourous scene in the is when the four of them and emmannuelle talk about their most amourous escapades an awful script terrible collection of jokes very poor production values especially the scene where emmannuelle takes her clothes off at st james palace ludicrous and cringeworthy musical score and nonexistent plot or storyline its just succession of awful set pieces about who emmannuelle will bed next jack douglas is not so annoying but is more boring joan sims and peter butterworth are wasted and kenneth connor and kenneth williams put in some poor performances as leyland and emile complete waste of time this movie was trying catch up the new sexually permissive seventies it was certificate but there was little interest in this kind of and it flopped at the box office and was only given its premiere on uk terrestrial television in april avoid at all costs

if you are debating whether or not see _breakfast_of_champions_ ask yourself one simple question do you want see nick nolte in lingerie the only people who would get much enjoyment from alan rudolphs chaotic adaptation of the kurt vonnegut novel is the crosssection of the population the unhealthy urge see that unpleasant sight everyone elseand am hoping that is most peoplewould be wise steer clear of this excrutiatingly unfunny mess actually though the sight of nolte in high heels is one of the more amusing things about this muddle focuses dwayne hoover bruce willis the owner of dwayne hoovers exit motor village in midland city not only is he huge success as businessman he is also something of celebrity his face made recognizable an ongoing series of television commercials nice home and family boot dwayne appears have it all the ingredients be happyyet he is not his wife celia barbara hershey is perpetually in pillinduced haze his son george lukas haas is flamboyant lounge singer who goes the stage name bunny not only that the environmental protection agency is on dwaynes ass over building development project it is enough send dwayne on nervous breakdownthat is if he does not succeed in blowing his brains out first meanwhile midland city is about host fine arts festival and the guest of honor is one kilgore trout albert finney writer who is far from the renowned author the festivals organizer buck henry was led believein fact he is penniless hack who writes secondrate scifi that appears in porn magazines his trek midland city is also spiritual journey one that reaches its apex after meeting dwayne who for some reason thinks that trout will hold for him all of lifes answers the above is already longer plot synopsis than usually give in my reviews but ironically have barely scratched the surface have not yet mentioned wayne hoobler omar epps an excon an obsessive admiration for the similarlynamed dwayne then there is the matter of francine glenne headly dwaynes devoted secretary not mention dwaynes employee and old friend harry lesabre nolte the one the secret penchant for crossdressing and so on the is essentially dwaynes story but too often rudolph goes on distracting tangents the eccentric peripheral players that one often wonders what the point is rudolph does arrive at point more on that later but it is blunted and obscured his hyperactive approach the material the surreal visual style complete printed words flying through the air and into dwaynes ears is obviously meant convey sense of madness but its bludgeoning nature is likely make viewers mad the actors are called on act accordingly resulting in some of the worst most overdone work all of them have ever turned in willis fares best of allbut that is because his frozen expression of befuddled bewilderment mirrors that of the audience such an aggressively outrageous atmosphere for nearly all of its running time it comes as shock when things suddenly turn serious and rudolph tries make statement unlike _american_beauty_ that _breakfast_ resembles in more than few ways its great detriment there is not any palpably earnest undercurrent that would prepare the audience for the big shift as such the cartoony characters fail win sympathy that needs be earned and the attempts no avail reach profundity that it does not deserve vonneguts original novel is considered classic but it had been called unfilmablethe same that was said of hunter thompsons _fear_and_loathing_in_las_vegas_ was disastrously committed last year terry gilliam the similar failure of _breakfast_of_champions_ will ever learn that books labeled unfilmable inevitably results in that is unwatchable likely not

suicide is pointless everyone should know that so what is this movie like you guessed it pointless the virgin suicides focuses on the lives of the five lisbon sisters from the perspective of the teenage boys who are fascinated them when the youngest lisbon sister commits suicide it sets in motion series of events that will change the lives of many people forever that is what the press materials for the probably say now heres what say the virgin suicides is huge waste of time boring arty pretentious junk that is about as entertaining as well as committing suicide the movie lost me early on immediately following the scene where the younger daughter jumps her death from her bedroom window the girls father james woods holds her lifeless body in his arms as their horrified family looks on then as the scene ends the lawn sprinklers come on is that joke is that supposed be amusing in some way from then on the movie failed draw me back in performances are the only saving grace of the virgin suicides woods plays the only character who would actually interest me when he came onscreen but the performance of kirsten dunst as the next youngest daughter lux is worth mentioning as well dunst has the potential be big star if she chooses her projects well and while this is awful she manages come away from it virtually unscathed there are also few cameos in the here and there only frustrate the audience as they leave you wanting more as result they all seem rather pointless although there is brief role given michael pare from eddie and the cruisers turns out be his best role since well since eddie and the cruisers perhaps the virgin suicides would have worked had the story not been told from the point of view of people who had very little access the main characters we never get any significant insight into the girls and why they might be feeling what they are feeling all we really know is that mrs lisbon kathleen turner is strict and keeps them on short leash what mother does not it is certainly no reason commit suicide the godfather part iii sofia coppola proved that she had no business being in front of the camera the virgin suicides she proves she has no business behind it either having family connections does not entitle you be allowed make movies so attention directors stop letting your daughters pout their way into the industry just because they share your dna does not mean they share your talent r

the realm of science fiction has always been an allegory of political and or moral sensibilities the best tales of the genre deal mankinds struggle for survival or knowledge such popular and noteworthy tomes as stranger in strange land robert heinlein childhoods end arthur clarke and man in the high castle and do androids dream of electric sheep philip dick all deal mans need for identity and struggle for self worth has regularly adapted the milieu if not the message of science fiction since it is beginnings most films just created fancy pulp tales no more thought that the escapism they achieved it really was not until producer george pal took charge of robert heinleins novel rocketship galileo and crafted the destination moon that scifi as it is commonly referred came into it is own from there such diverse filmmakers as roger corman stanley kubrick have sought express ideas through the medium of the genre the release of touchstone pictures mission mars we have an unabashedly nonchalant scifi for those who read the national enquirer and the globe the opens on summer barbecue as phil ohlmyer jerry oconnell woos young female his tales of space glory and the upcoming mission woody blake tim robbins and his wife terri connie nielsen commit his coming authority on the mission and luc goddard don cheadle consoles his son entering the party is jim mcconnell gary sinise who gave up command of the mission due the untimely death of his wife maggie kim delaney luc consoles jim woodys assistance the three men are friends and carry fine bond of trust and caring between them but jim still longs set foot on the red planet the mission is in earnest as luc and his team land in the cydonia region of mars they send out the rover investigate the area and discover what seems be water or ice under the surface going out investigate luc and his team approach the famed face on mars strange noise emanates from the rock as the team tries scan through the rock radar violent wind storm erupts creating vortex that kills all members of the team save for luc back on the space station orbiting earth woody and jim receive the information that the mars landing team is missing lucs interference laden emergency message urges the two men attempt second mission the red planet in the hopes of rescuing the previous team the second journey the martian world is fraught danger meteorite showers explosions and rescues all come into play as the intrepid heroes make there way the planets surface the big question is is there now or has there ever been intelligent life on mars and if so what is its relationship us now for the bad news the entire plot of mission mars is based almost wholeheartedly on outdated and preposterous national enquirer type martian civilization tripe the famed face on mars becomes the centerpiece of the revealing some of the most harebrained scifi pabulum the screen has witnessed borrowing ideas from such films as robinson crusoe on mars quatermass and the pit space odyssey and even mario bavas planet of the vampires terrore nello spazio mission mars is hodgepodge of ideas that do not add up satisfying whole while some sequences are wonderfully handled and executed the remains flat and uninvolving so much time is giving establishing the lead characters in the but no good use the performances are all workmen like only don cheadle as luc carrying any sort of real chemistry gary sinise is wasted in role that requires him look as if he is experiencing sleep depravation and the mistaken idea of having jerry oconnell as phil ohlmyer play his part for comic relief is just too painful excuse and the less said about tim robbins called in from home performance the better he is just having too much fun here give damn the script has few lapses namely that after discovering several breaches in the hull of the ship caused meteorite shower no one thinks of checking the fuel tanks or the remainder of the ship for damage this of course leads our heroes having abandon their rescue ship also when one character sacrifices himself the character takes on religious demeanor that is completely at odds the situation but the biggest offence in the is the horrid intrusive score ennio morricone subtlety is nonexistent here in fact in some scenes the music becomes so extravagant that dialogue is almost drowned out the only sequence in the score almost works is during the protracted meteorite shower the pacing of the is very leisurely after the opening introduction of the characters lasts full minutes we are finally dropped onto the martian surface then there is another long pause in the plot for more character development including an elaborate dance sequence in zero gravity the could lose about minutes and actually gain some momentum there are so many scenes of talking heads discussing what we already know is going happen that it drags the dead stop the good news is that the is absolutely sumptuous look at the vistas of the planet mars are majestic and awe inspiring the design of the numerous spacecraft and suits are all expertly drafted level of realism that has not been seen since space odyssey the visual effects are just stunning from the space walk sequences the visualization of evolution on earth the only fault come the martians themselves look more like something out of plastic model kit than something from another world director de palma stages some wonderfully creative scenes through out the the opening sequence alone in seemingly uninterrupted cut lasting almost minutes an homage hitchcocks rope as we are introduced all of the characters scenes in the rescue ship its rotating centrifuge are just amazing in their execution but the nagging question is the final explanation worth all of this sturm und drang sadly it is not director brian de palma has crafted an extravagant production the set design and visual effects are all arresting but it is the comic strip denouncement that ruin what might have been fine return good adventurous thought provoking science fiction disappointing but one that might still entertain if you can settle for the visuals

back in february at the monthly los angeles comic book and science fiction convention new line cinema put on lavish presentation for its bigscreen update of the cult scifi tv show lost in space complete inperson appearances cast members mimi rogers matt leblanc lacey chabert jack johnson and even gary oldman that should have set off my warning alarmsthe last time such an extravagant presentation took place at the convention was nearly five years ago when none other than arnold schwarzenegger made an inperson cameo peddle last action hero but no like millions of others bought into the hype and got lost if only had gotten lostliterallyon the way theatre and spared myself the tedium of this sloppily slappedtogether blockbuster wannabe you may find yourself wondering if director stephen hopkins and screenwriter akiva goldsman were lost themselves when they made the at the convention goldsman claimed be rabid fan of the original television series and if that really is the case would hate see what he does concepts he only has mild interest in say that his script lacks narrative cohesion is imply that there is narrative begin withwhich there most certainly is not after the setup in the robinson familyfather john william hurt looking and sounding as spaced out as he does in interviews mother maureen rogers wasted daughters judy heather graham ditto and penny heavily madeup chabert looking like junior version of neve campbell in wild things and son will young newcomer johnson making the best of it and pilot don west leblanc doing bad han solo impression find themselves lost in space after their ship is sabotaged evil stowaway dr smith watereddown but stilllively oldman cashing paycheck and loving every minute the scripts stream of events becomes so fragmented and random that it seems be made up as it goes alongand hopkins does little make what does go on the slightest bit interesting they encounter another ship they board it alien spiders attack them they return their ship the other one explodes they land on deserted planet and so on an attempt at plot involving time travel occurs in the third act but goldsman does not seem understand the rules that come using such story device when one characters past self dies the future incarnation inexplicably lives on the look and effects should be lost in spaces aceinthehole but hopkins even manages botch that for bigbudget the visual effects are incredibly shoddy in one composite background shot could see the blue outline around oldman the various digital effects for the space battle scenes look like digital effects but nothing in those shots is as jawdroppingly unconvincing as blawp monkeylike space creature that becomes pennys pet entirely computergenerated and every inch showing it blawp looks like it was lifted directly from sony playstation game apparently hopkins thought the same and tried desperately hide it how else can one explain the graininess of blawps composite shots the human actors but in doing so the seams are that much more obvious you have be severely visually impaired not be distracted when grainy shot of penny and blawp is immediately followed crystalclear solo reaction shot of judy new line is hoping lost in space will become big franchise much like the longrunning star trek cash cow at paramount do not think so in few years the lost in space movie will likely live on not as series but as the obscure answer trivia question what ended titanics week reign at the top of the weekend box office

the working title for no looking back was long time nothing new and rarely has there been more apt name for motion picture even though this movie clocks in at relatively skinny minutes it seems run long enough engulf two titanics writerdirector edward burns has trotted out hackneyed storyline the trajectory of will be instantly recognizable anyone who has not spent their life in seclusion instead of tweaking the formula little invigorate the proceedings burns is content allow the ramble aimlessly towards its irritatingly predictable conclusion offering precious few momentary pleasures along the way no looking back is dominated three very dislikable characters whose constant presence on the screen is painful the most appropriate ending would have been triple suicide and the sooner the better alas that is not the case and those who stick this for its entire length will be forced endure the prolonged company of this wretched trio and further depress audiences burns has shot the entire on cold rainy days in gray new york state beach town peeks of sunshine are few and far between no wonder the characters are all so miserable first of all we have charlie burns generation slacker who abandoned his girlfriend three years ago after she had an abortion then spent some time bumming around in california before deciding come home that girlfriend is claudia lauren holly and after picking up the pieces of her life following charlies departure she has moved on shacking up one of charlies old school buddies mike jon bon jovi the two have comfortable relationship but it is apparent even blind person that they are not right for each other claudia years for some spice in her life mike wants settle down and have children then charlie reenters the mix so who if anyone will claudia end up who cares no looking back goes extraordinary lengths make sure that we are not especially interested in the outcome of the romantic triangle so what if no one finds happiness these characters do not deserve it anyway especially after wasting minutes of our time they are not real people they are writers construct stumbling through tooobvious storyline they should know the ending as well as we do and burns should have given his audience more credit and presented them plot that at least offered surprise or two another frustrating thing about no looking back is that burns has populated the group of potentiallyinteresting supporting characters blythe danner is solid as claudias housebound mother connie britton is suitably highstrung as claudias neurotic sister and jennifer esposito is eyecatching as bartender in search of little romance sadly all we get is quick glimpses into their lives although movie about any of them would have been far more intriguing than the story burns has chosen tell none of the lead performers are going wow critics their thespian attributes edward burns is pushing the edge of his limited range here jon bon jovi shows more acting ability than one might reasonably expect from singer branching into different career but he could still use little polish the worst case is lauren holly who presents completely bland claudia as portrayed here she is hardly the kind of woman who would inspire even moments interest not mention undying love burns ex the monumentally untalented maxine bahns would have been hardpressed do less inspired job when he released the brothers mcmullen edward burns was revered as the wunderkind of the sundance festival robert redford has apparently stuck him the aging actordirector executive produced this mess two films and three short years later the luster has faded some movie makers have only one good in them back toback duds like she is the one and no looking back follow the delightful brothers burns is beginning look like member of that undistinguished club

the job of the critic is see movie and write review of it that tells you what it is about and why it is good or bad feel kind of embarrassed admit this but after having seen get carter really cannot tell you what it is about although could go on and on about how and why it is bad movie get carter falls into that category of movies that continue be made for reasons unknown anyone outside of executive board room you might call them the steven seagalmickey rourkejeanclaude van dammewesley snipes school of mediocre actioncrime thrillers you know the potboilers that are heavy on fistfights shootouts and car chases but really light on plot and character development they have stories where the socalled hero just keeps running into characters who have some connection one of the other characters who are all antagonists without reason for being in the movie other than give the protagonist someone fight chase or shoot at sylvester stallone stars as jack carter las vegasbased mob enforcer who returns home for his brothers funeral he believes his brother richie was taken out and did not die from dwi accident carters one of the most cliche badasses ever captured on celluloid his face alone is pretty intimidating and there is quite few scenes in he leans on both regular citizens and criminal lowlives simply staring them down and speaking confidence in his ramboontestosteronetherapy voice stallones performance in this movie is so forced and unnatural he does not realize he is mocking himself the actual story involves carters investigation into his brother richies death he is in town that is not his but somehow the local top dogs know him very well mickey rourke costars as one of these characters sort of crime boss who has something do running porno web site and blackmailing young internet tycoon played alan cummings looking and acting lot like pee wee herman there is also another plot involving richies mistress secret cdrom some convicting and disturbing evidence on it and something terrible involving one of carters stillliving relatives am rolling my eyes just thinking about trying critique all this in way that could be remotely comprehendible could just rip the screenplay shreds plus the direction or the editing or the production values but that would require discussion of nearly every scene in order explain it all do not like put spoliers in my reviews either intentionally or accidentally yes get carter is just that complicated and complex and what is worse is that it is not this intricate make it seem smart like the usual suspects for example just the opposite you get the feeling whoever wrote this script did it in short intervals spaced far apart and they probably did not remember what had already happened and did not figure out how each scene would lead in the next one or how the major plot points would work towards the climax all you really need know is that most of the is just scenes of carter tracking down one scumbag or supposed witness after another asking them what they know getting information and then realizing that if he was not complete idiot he could have figured it out in the first five minutes although the supporting characters are equally stupid themselves since they tell him everything comes back haunt them in one violent way or another making movie entirely about criminals does not necessarily mean they have be unlikable and cliche cutout characters mel gibson starred in payback few years ago that had story not unlike this one but had such good screenplay you could not help but like him even though he was just as bad guy as jack carter so ultimately get carter fails for pretty much every selling point it has carter is not likable character and you really do not care if he gets revenge or not the action sequences are not at all exciting or original the enemies and their massive conspiracy are not threatening at all cmon you know who is going win every brawl and shootout and car chase in the end you do not feel nearly satisfied the results the filmmakers did good job in doing everything as unoriginal as possible the city is never mentioned name but assume it is seattle since all the cars have washington license plates and it is always raining

i have got admit it am huge jim carrey fan loved the first ace ventura as well as the mask and dumb and dumberand even in batman forever was pretty awful movie carrey was one of the few people come off looking reasonably good until saw ace ventura had no idea how people could find the guy annoying sadly ace ventura shows just how irritating and annoying carrey can be carrey goes through the same schtick he went through in the first ace movie but this time it is no longer funnyit is just rehash of many of the same jokes used in ace the plot sees pet detective ace ventura retiring after failing save raccoon in reasonable cliffhanger spoof soon he is called out of retirement find bat was kidnapped and if not returned in four days will cause two warring african tribes destroy each other once again it is up ace save the day using his uncanny detective skills those who have been disappointed carreys more restrained roles in the films following the first ace ventura may be glad see him overacting the best of his ability but some may be disappointed the fact that this sequel does not capture the feel of the original the original benefited from what looked be carreys constant hypedup improv sequences were hysterically funny here however the tighter script is reminiscent of the old disney telemovies takes the improvised material from the first and shamelessly recycles it in the new movie giving carrey little chance improvise instead his extremely funny manner has been reduced just walking around stupidly but one of the biggest problems had was the character of ventura himself in the first movie he was always cool and one step ahead of every one elseperfect for carreys offthewall approach but here ventura is made look lot stupider and is often made out as the straight guya role is definitely not carreys style there are definitely some very funny moments but they are few and far between they are also nowhere near as funny as anything carrey did in the first ace ventura or even dumb and dumber

for about twenty minutes into mission impossible director john woo the killer hard boiled face off appears have made an exciting elegant charming spy thriller kind of post millennium james bond adventure strapping american read unsophisticated hero more willing drop kick villains than out fox them sadly as the picture progresses the final product begins bear closer resemblance souped up twohour long episode of magyuver and not particularly good one at that what went wrong mi begins flashily enough that initial flash leading us believe that it will soon give way something of plot but it only gives way more flash then digresses further into presumably unintentional parody of itself much slo mo posturing and countless action set pieces wherein bad guys seem deliberately leap into the way of tom cruises firing gun just so they can die really cool early on during car chase between soon be lovers ethan hunt tom cruise and nyah nordoffhall thandie newton woo works some of his trademark magic in one hypnotic though completely inexplicable sequence the director slows the action down languid semistall as cruise and his stunning opponent stare into one and others eyes come hither sexuality just as their respective cars smash and spin in accordance coming ever so close toppling over neighboring cliff prior this we see the famed trailer opener of cruise climbing steep mountain sans scaffolding then leaping from one jagged rock formation another why have not the foggiest doubt even john woo could provide you logical reply mi woo has become slave the summer movie machine the one that jettisons logic for gravity defying effects and story for more gravity defying effects it is possible that these spies could be adrenaline junkies climbing mountains and crashing into each other as means get off though of course this is never explored the scenes have described are really only included titillate not give any insight into character god forbid woo certainly knows how make each set piece energetic but they remain individual set pieces never connecting form anything more than splices of beer commerciallike visuals still in terms of crackerjack eye candy the opening has much cherish cruise and newton first meet during vigorous flamenco dance featuring several welcome woo devices the graceful slow mo artistry of synchronized movement juxtaposed against the stage romance of two attractive individuals discovering how attractive the other is between the frantic dancing woo trains his camera on cruise and newton as they make some sensuous eye contact the scene is little over the top in bon jovi music video circa kind of way yet it has style and something of soul and woo casts bit of spell on us sure it is all smoke and mirrors but we can see that there happens be talented maestro behind this particular product thandie and cruise later meet in bathtub in scene that is about half as playfully charming as the jennifer lopez george cloony trunk meeting in out of sight they flirt and exchange obvious double entendres newton bats her eyes flirtatiously cruise grins little too slyly the cruise character ethan hunt has been drastically altered since the first here cruise plays him more as hip sexual dynamo than the square jawed robot he impersonated in part he is cool and dashing is precisely the kind of role we want see cruise in after watching him sleep walk through eyes wide shut might just be the longest episode of red show diaries ever committed and blustered his way through magnolia quite possibly the most overrated performance of the sadly as the progresses we see less of cruises initial am the man charm and more slomo closeups of his preening mug mi falls apart on nearly every level during its repetitious third act is essentially one hour long action sequence that just will not stop the whole thing commences an utterly generic gun battle the first gun fight in the really should be unheard of in john woo but alas this particular battle could have been staged anyone from renny harlin joseph merhi of course excepting the symbolic pigeons who seem find their way into every john woo picture we have all seen guys slide across the floor in slo mo while firing gun in each hand it is not done any differently here the action is pure hard target broken arrow theatrics nothing propel it but the apparent need see tom cruise drop kick face less villains while his hair whips stylishly in the wind he is cool for sure but he is made be as empty as the movie the actor is not used so much for his boyish appeal as for his chiseled looks he smiles narcissistically into the camera at literally any moment be it during gunfight before one or after one when he is not beaming away he is staring into the lens cold eyes trying look mad as hell but woos editing seriously undermines the effort he fetishizes cruises angular face such glee that it turns into naked gun style spoof half expected cruise peel off his facemask and reveal that he is really austin powers in classic woo action moment ethan hunt struts past fiery doorway glaring at the baddies within its frame like pinup boy angel of death the gunfight turns into daring escape turns into reckless mission turns into motorcycle attack in bad guys seem angle directly for cruise kill them like some kind of mass suicide ritual one dumb bastard even jumps his bike over the gun toting cruise basically inviting our handsome hero shoot him in mid air he does the lead bad guy played the appropriately british dougray scott and cruise face off in mentally deficient game of chicken on motorcycles though instead of jumping off the side at the last moment the two grown men leap directly into the other giving each other mid air bear hug only fly about hundred feet still in bear hug position land on beach below and begin manoemano fist fight that ends the bad guy pulling so you thought was dead not worry cruise takes care of the problem without even breaking sweat what hero you may have noticed that opted not describe an iota of mis plot my reasoning is simple am not sure of any good it would do the itself has absolutely no concern story only hurtling forth the next special effect was not kidding when told friend of mine that mi has less plot than the average aerosmith video nobody will go this for the plot and if they do they will surely regret it as summer movies evolve or devolve character and plot have become increasingly whittled down nearly nothing in mi the plot seemed be built around brian de palmas that films director stylistic flourishes while in mi the plot only serves give us an intermittent breather from woos nonstop masturbatory pandemonium it is irrelevant in every sense as is character all that ultimately matters are those pesky smoke and mirrors

every now and then reviewers are faced the films that are hard be properly reviewed most of the time it happens films that leave so overwhelming impact either good or bad that in the end reviewers must work hard express his thoughts or feelings but sometimes it can happen for rather trivial reasons love trouble happened be one of such occasions for the author of this review the impression left the was not overwhelming on the contrary there were hardly any impression at all since had real trouble keeping myself awake while watching it surprise me this day because the movie theatre was full was close sound speakers the show was not late and did not lack sleep before the show such things happen very rarely me and after many years the closest thing solution this mystery is probably the quality of the itself the plot revolves around two rival chicago reporters old peter brackett nick nolte and young aspiring sabrina peterson julia roberts two of them are assigned cover the train collision as soon as they meet they start scooping each other but during the process they both discover sinister plot involving cancerogenic milk and also the romantic feelings they have for each other the plot in this is rather secondary its real raison tre romantic pairing reminiscent of classical screwball comedies starring spencer tracy and katharine hepburn movie author director and screenwriter charles shyer who had some experiences turning the screwball spirit into modern setting father of the bride tries again this time pairing old nick nolte young julia roberts however although there is some chemistry between the two soon it stops arouse any interest it probably happens due poorly executed genre mix that collides lighthearted romantic comedy rather uninteresting plot suitable pure action thrillers shyer as director fails make the proper transition between the two and fails in both areas making the story cliched and predictable the end result is rather forgettable effort convinced me not watch movie again will give it the benefit of the doubt though

the only two really good things that can say about tarzan and the lost city are as follows jane march was very cute as jane and the movie was thankfully under minutes in length if you have not already figured it out did not like this movie very much the plot was boring and contrived the extreme tarzan casper van dien has now left the jungle and living in civilized society he is just days away from his impending marriage jane played the aptly named jane march back in his former home of africa group of looters has found the key locating lost city mind you never really figured out why they actually wanted find this city anyway tarzans old jungle friend appears him in vision tarzan realizes that he must return africa help stop the bad guys from finding the lost city he leaves jane his first mistake in my opinion and travels africa of course jane is hot on her ape mans heals the two of them are reunited in africa where they do battle the bad guys sound like dumb explanation of the plot it is actually an improvement over the real thing the acting is just plain awful am not quite sure what casper van dien was doing in this but it was not acting jane march was not heck of lot better but at least she is easy on the eyes compounding the bad acting was the fact that in many places the dialogue had obviously been rerecorded and have seen better dubbing in some old bruce lee movies added the sound problems was the cinematography this was filled beautiful african scenery but the panoramic scenery shots looked overexposed me quite frankly think you could probably do better job capturing the beauty of africa camcorder than this bunch did professional equipment then we have the special effects special effects in tarzan movie you are no doubt asking yourself yes friends the writers injected some very out of place supernatural elements into the story probably for the sake of using cgi since it did nothing but hurt the story in most parts they were not bad just nothing special but they were more than little on the hokey side except of course when we got the ridiculous climax of this movie the grand finales special effects went right into the toilet at that point it almost looked like they had run out of money these effects were of noticeably lower quality than those in the rest of the and looked like something in an amateur video production took one lesson away from watching tarzan and the lost city ape men and bones that morph into skeletal warriors do not mix stay far away from this version of tarzan

losing job is not an all too uncommon thing reacting such personal setback taking group of small children hostage is bit more rare while we all might feel the desire blow someones head off shotgun when they do not seem grasp our point of view actually threatening them one is usually something we avoid this is not the case sam baily john travoltas slightly askew averagejoe persona in mad city do not think people listen guys like me sam laments during an exclusive interview from behind the walls of museum just few days ago sam was guard at this same museum but when cutbacks led the elimination of his security position sams apprehension resulted in brash decision in an effort get his exboss museum director mrs banks blythe danner just listen he barges into the museum one day equipped fully loaded shotgun taking the uncooperative banks and group of school children hostage sams overall concern is valid enough if he loses his job his paycheck his benefits etc his wife and two children will not be provided for he is not lunatic or hottempered madman he is somewhat like child panicky compulsive and running on emotion and his naive intentions are not helped any the fact that banks was not overly compassionate the let go overall he is just like you and me except that he has the capacity view the line we would deem far enough as the starting mark of some crazy race meanwhile television reporter max brackett dustin hoffman is also on the scene covering fluff story for the evening news concerning the museum cutbacks max suddenly finds himself in the middle of the biggestbreaking news story he ever could have hoped for having been demoted from network newsman smalltime affiliate reporting max is anxious turn this into his and only his story max immediately bonds sam max even coaches sam thru hostage negotiations and writes scripts for him use the police over the phone at first maxs intentions do not stretch beyond high ratings and good boost the ole pride factor but as he gets know sam more personally he begins sympathize and even become somewhat of an advocate for him the media however is creating frenzy that leaves the fickle public shifting gears as often as diesel truck moving downhill the accidental shooting of exco worker cliff bill nunn black security guard becomes one of the main factors in the controversy over sams honest ambitions also involved in this are robert prosky as lou potts head of the news department of the station max falls directly under and alan alda as the nationally famed reporter kevin hollander who uses his network power try and outshine max alda and prosky both turn in fine performances that fit like gloves on their acting abilities then there is mia kirshner who plays the young tv station intern laurie she falls under maxs wings only become student taught too well in the way of sensationalistic reporting kirshners credits are relatively small for now including roles in films like exotica and the forgettable sequel the crow still kirshners character transformation shows that she has shining ability play both good girl and kindabitchyinareservedway roles would not mind seeing her in some more prevalent parts where perhaps her talent will be able blossom more fully onscreen while the viewpoint of the media as greedy selfrighteous monster has indeed been tackled before mad city provides solid two hours of enjoyability hoffman and travolta are both excellent actors and seeing them together is real treat they both do great job at smoothly and naturally becoming their characters and they provide enough chemistry for us genuinely care for both there is quite bit of humor in this and without it it could have fallen into drab cliched social statement more likely garner sleep from the audience than applause this is not flick that will grip at both your funny bone and your heart but it will lightly touch both making for recommendable movie if for nothing more than the opportunity watch both hoffman and travolta at the same time urge you check this one out

as much as wanted like this as went into it the more pleased was when left first getting through all the usual lines of newspaper glitz if you liked scream you will love wild things campbell gives stunning performance this twisty plot will have you dazzled for days oh yeah the day newspaper uses these is the day neve campbell falls in love me now onto more serious stuff and this mean that in nearly sarcastic way wild things has singlehandedly broken down the rules surrounding the rating from the mpaa am not saying that in bad way but when you see this you may be shocked what you see however perhaps the mpaa was pleased the films charming cast and tricky plot that they let the slide an rating being mormon am bound hear an uproar from religious zealots warning me not see the trouble is have already seen it and like it wild things is noir of the filled sensibilities and yet breaking the rules and modernday taboos of culture the style in it is filmed is rich in color the actors are all gorgeous people seemingly drawn from the same gene pool and placed into this sure it is all too good be true but as not it fun watch when movies like this come along sort of better version of basic instinct there is bound be people who either love it or hate it there will be people who do not want admit liking what they see but tell you most anyone who sees this will like it wild things begins at blue bay high school the one high school in the world that any teenager would love get into it is almost as if students are put through entrance exams just for admittance totally based on looks alone of course there are those select few who may look slightly ugly but compared the average person they are gorgeous immediately the finds its tone and the audience settles in for an enjoyable time we can turn off our brains right wrong while you may be expecting one thing happen it certainly does not turn out that way the begins in classroom nearly all the main characters present there is sam lombardo matt dillon counselor for the students he is heading the class discussion there is also kelly van ryan denise richards snobby rich teen who has fallen in love sam teaching the class however are two policemen ray duquette kevin bacon and gloria perez daphne rubinvega who want talk about sex cheers crimes boos what is sex crime ray asks not gettin any one student responds this pretty much sets the tone of the we are about watch however upon hearing this one student suzie toller neve campbell stands up and leaves the room commenting that they can both kiss part of her body and so wild things sets into motion quickly kelly begins hitting on sam but sam does not want anything do her advances kelly is stubborn and continues pursue him she even pleads him let her wash his jeep surprisingly that is really all can tell you about the plot any more would give away one of the many crucial plot twists and what is more these plot twists are actually unpredictable going along the way of scream wild things maintains that films surprises and then adds even more them there are more plot twists in this than probably any have ever seen and even though you think you may get tired of them the surprises are so genuine that it is rather pleasing going back over them in my mind nearly all of them work though some stretch the boundaries of belief thankfully the convoluted plot does not give us much time think about each one pouncing yet another twist on us before the shock of the previous one has worn off as for the critics who complain that the is trashywell it is this is pretty much just one trashy however it is the kind of trashy that is not hard watch it is good trash in sense one the screenplay knows that it is not be taken seriously and it includes lot of humor and satire into the story this varies everywhere from kellys mother theresa russell who is more of caricature of rich people all the way an ambulancechasing lawyer bill murray who wears neckbrace cover an insurance scam he is running bill murray also provides the best character in the and most of the genuine laughs and two the sex is more than gratuitous although not unwelcomed wild things is supposed have sex in it what that title would not and this movie breaks the boundaries instead of having heterosexual sex scenes it also includes lesbian scenes between denise richards and neve campbell do not worry it is not as graphic as you might think the heterosexual scenes are quite graphic but the surprise shocker is kevin bacons fullfrontal nude scene it is very brief so if you blink you may miss ahem it and for as long as can remember do not think have seen an rrated show an erect one before it is not completely but judging from the audiences reaction it was more than they expected too also during one scene late in the there seemed be relationship brewing between bacon and dillons characters but nothing came of it makes you wonder if the director had cut it in order for the rating or if the actors refused do it what first made me want see wild things was its cast neve campbell of course has been one of my favorite actresses since the scream films were released here however she turns every typical role she has done on its head and plays gothic pothead the closest role this was her performance in the craft though even in that she was nice girl campbell is probably the best in the and shows her wide range of talent you can tell she will be around for long time denise richards will also be around for long time although she may be limited the roles without much range here she gets express more emotions than in her stiff yet effective performance in starship troopers hopefully one day she will land very good role that can display her ability and then there is daphne rubinvega newcomer the movies she gives very good performance although her character is mostly left the background for the first hour and half towards the end she does get bigger part on the male side matt dillon is probably the best giving subtle performance that surprises every twist kevin bacon has slightly wooden character but he makes the most of it you must have admiration though for what he did on screen and judging from many of the womens reactions in the theater that shot they have grown deeper appreciation for bacon yeah right and then there is bill murray his performance is the comic relief and he nearly steals the as whole the entire cast works wondrously together and they seem at home even when doing the menage troi director john mcnaughton who has previously done the critically acclaimed henry portrait of serial killer has constructed wonderfully twisty plot that works his direction is smooth and stylish the visuals are striking filled rich colors and almost so realistic that we can actually breathe the humidity in the air however he seems more at home when the actors are not talking his flyby shots of the swampy areas are brilliant and his photography of denise richards climbing out of the pool is highlight the cinematography is gorgeous in its details its not often that you see like this and we should watch it just see how the camera can take pictures then there is the music this was probably the most obvious thing me as it set the perfect mood for the it is hard describe in words so just see the and listen it it is wonderfully composed and presented and be sure stick around during the closing credits mcnaughton has finally put the ending credits good use while most comedies use it for outtakes he has included some small scenes help explain the preceding events some may say that these are lame attempts explain the convoluted plot but it is an entertaining way finish the plus there are some shocking moments in these ending credits just add the fun wild things is appropriately rated for strong sexuality nudity language and violence again the nudity is rather unnecessary but let us face itpeople want see it so why not give it them neve campbell admirably has nonudity clause in her contract and the most you see of her is from behind as she takes her top off way go neve the sex scenes are graphic especially the first one we see between the mother and one of her deck hands one almost wonders how they got away the rating the language is quite harsh too ranging from sexual innuendo your average everyday profanity and cannot stress it enough do not allow kids under see this the target age for the movie is the range and that is who should see it it is definitely not for those under did mention that this is rated however for those that do get chance watch it you will probably more likely be pleased and may even take friends see it the next time

the postman delivers but not first class the postman review michael redman copyright michael redman warning my opinion of this is definitely in the minority of reviewers perhaps because it hits so many of my cinematic buttons postapocalypse stories hope in desperate situation grassroots uprisings and kevin costner even worse thought that waterworld was watchable read the following those particular grains of salt it is the year and things have fallen apart due world war in the late nineties the resulting threeyear winter and devastating plague life in the former united states has been reduced isolated primitive fiefdoms although this is the future it looks like western as the opens kevin costner his characters name is never revealed is wandering the utah wastelands only his mule bill for company giving extraordinarily bad shakespearean performances in exchange for food and lodging costner is an outsider in land of outsiders running into even worse luck he is forcibly conscripted into the racially pure holnist army of general bethlehem will patton the ragtag retrofuturistic cavalry is the descendent of militia groups and is even called the clan after brutal boot camp he and you can see this coming mile away escapes taking shelter in wrecked postal truck he liberates the uniform and mail bag from the skeleton in the cab who no longer has use for either once he reaches oregon land of beautiful women bright youngsters and rock and roll he pretends be representative from the restored congress of the united states of america this scam gets him inside the walled towns where the promise of mail delivery renews optimism in the hearts of the inhabitants food and other opportunities come his way in the form of spirited abby olivia williams who wants him father child because her husband is sterile shortly her husband is killed bethlehem and she and the postman as costner is referred for the rest of the become reluctant item although the postman knows he is running fraud the concept of renewed communications sets the kids imagination afire especially ford lincoln mercury larenz tate his secondincommand and they form new pony express dedicated getting the mail through the revived postal service doubles as an army fight the holnists tyranny the postman has become symbol for hope in rube goldberg manner although the movie appeals my sensibilities there are so many things wrong it that they can hardly be counted it is derivitive of costners own waterworld and clint eastwood westerns there is little here that we have not seen dozens of times before the is often downright corny scene where the postman is on horseback and grabs letter from the hands of brighteyed child is embarrassing in its slowmotion banality the films final few minutes should have been left on the cutting room floor despite the films excessive three hour length several things are never explained what was the war about how did civilization change so rapidly everyone has horses where did all they come from the law of eights that bethlehem lives seems have its origins somewhere beyond the but where are we believe that the rest of the world is in the same shape and has not made their way west help or conquer there is some jumbled symbolism here that does not appear make sense the tale is obviously saying that communication can defeat evil in much the same way that the internet has the potential topple governments but beyond that there are some oddities the evil army is called holnists sounds coincidentally like the new age holism but why is it another coincidence that it takes place in just one year after many ancient prophesies including the ending of the mayan calendar predict new world for mankind why is the general named bethlehem there seems be some reason for that but what sometimes the movie feels like joke an army of postal workers armed guns considering the headlines of recent years it takes tremendous leap of faith cheer for these guys it is even more difficult accept those repowering the federal government as the heroes given the current climate of the country and the distrust of big government it is asking lot for the audience get behind the films nationalism even its numerous flaws the movie all comes together if only for those who have the same weaknesses that have it is doubtful that the postman is going find much of an audience but few of us are going have good time besides we are all awaiting the fall of civilization caused the year millennium computer bug michael redman has written this column for over years and would like announce that the michael redman arrested near indianapolis last week for accepting an illicit package from federal express is the best of his knowledge not him perhaps this similarlynamed person should have used kevin costners postal service

there are certain people in the world who have some talent that very few people have but they chose not take advantage of this for some personal reason good will hunting is about one of those people the will hunting of the horrible title let us face it this would be bitch title played cowriter matt damon is mathematical genius he can do almost any mathematical connundrum in about the time it takes brew cup of irish cream cappuccino and he works at mit as the janitor one day the professor of one of the most challenging courses proffessor lambeau breaking the waves stellan skarsg rd puts big problem on the board for his students attempt complete the next day it is already done on the board but no one in his class claims have done it so lambeau puts another problem on the board this time one that took he and his colleagues over two years prove and duh it is done again of course they catch the guy who did it red handed will before lambeau can find will again he ran away when he caught him will has gotten into fight bunch of punks on basketball court and struck police officer so lambeau gets him out on probation two agreements he work him on math and he get some therapy after going through some therapists whom he psyches out in one way or another for hypnotist he fakes being under his spell then launches into an impromptu performance of the classic afternoon delight finally lambeaus old college roomate sean mcguire robin williams psych professor agrees treat him and the two begin rocky relationship as sean tries get will open up turns out will had rough childhood being abandoned and placed in foster homes and what not it also turns out that will does not want do simple mathematics all his life he wants challenge and that is hang out his buds including the other cowriter ben affleck and do honorable jobs like construction is it right make this genius follow in the footsteps of einstein and kasinsky should this guy be forced do something he does not want do this appears be one of the million questions in this is jampacked greatness but does not have the totally brilliant whole it should am not saying good will hunting is bad at all it is very enjoyable tons of great moments and lots of great things about it the acting is amazing two oscarnominationworthy performances from damon and williams who have amazing chemistry together we also get some great support from stellan skarsg rd great name ben affleck and from minnie driver who plays wills love interest skylar there are tons of individual moments that adored loved all the comedy in the especially scene where damon proves schmuck out of college student who is quoting historian impress some chicks his various attempts at therapy and of course my favorite scene in the entire the one where he delivers long exstensive rant some nsa agents about the downside of working for them liked the relationship between some of the people like will and skylar will and sean sean and lambeau and will and his friends there are scenes between them are just amazing watch and there are even moments in the are so honest in their portrayal that felt rightfully uncomfortable like the breakup scene between will and skylar will and seans first meeting bar scene between sean and lambeau and scene where sean tells in detail how he does not regret meeting his first wife who would later suffer slow painful death and leave him lonely and slightly bitter however the main flaw of the is there is too much of everything and not enough of it either the tries for deeper relations between the characters but they are sometimes either overwritten or underwritten take for example the relationship between sean and will the gets an interesting fatherson as well as doctorpatient relationship going out any problems but when it tries show them as equals it falls on its face we hear how they went the same town and there are even scenes where the shows how hypocritical both of them are at times but this never takes off like the other parts of their relationship do also wills relationship his best friend chuckie affleck has nice climax but not enough rising action we see them joking around but when chuckie arrives at decision between the two of them it seems more like superficial reasoning than more selected one their relationship never goes beyond just best friends and his decision just seems be generalization of any two best friends instead of something more human maybe it was just me and it also goes for parallelism the relationship between sean and lambeau but that again is underwritten and of course as in most films like this the girlboy relationship is pretty underwritten we never understand what they see in each other so when skylar confesses that she loves him it seems more like it is there for plot details that anything else minnie driver is interesting though and breathes life into her character the writing is bit at fault here but what makes all this worthwhile is the little moments in the where it acheives true awesomeness sure it feels overstuffed but it is extremely enjoyable the dialogue that affleck and damon have written is amazingly fresh and seems extremely human think that they should get nomination for their script chiefly because of the dialogue is amazing while this is probably director gus van sants most conservative you would hardly know it is the same director of die for the only van sant have seen really it is still pretty remarkable albeit tad overrated what is this best picture deal and if puts smile on my face despite posessing lot of flaws have no problem reccomending it anyone

i guess it is credit jackie chan and the general likeability of the franchise that rush hour could not be ruined even the nauseating comedy of chris tucker am fan of jackie chan in just about any medium and this movie lets him not only do his impressiveasever martial arts schtick but show off his comic timing as well it would have worked better if he was the only name above the title the plot is your basic martial arts flick clothesline for stunts and special effects this time around the evil smugglers are led ricky tan john lone who makes his fortune shipping counterfeit money into the united states am still not sure how you can make fortune doing that is there place where one can exchange fake bills for real ones the only way tell the phony money from the genuine article is set it on fire and see what color it burns of course it is up hong kong detective lee chan and trashtalking lapd detective james carter tucker take the bad guys out and the authorities the extent that they even exist stay out of their way rush hour turns the tables on the first in that here it is carter who gets the two of them into trouble and lee who winds up having get them out guarantee that my rating would have been at least half of grade higher had anyone other than chris tucker been cast as the foil for jackie chan he refuses shut up not only did his voice feel like jackhammer on my head but his jokes just are not funny pathetic mixture of subpar eddie murphy fasttalking blather and wannabe chris rock whitemanblackman jokes that wind up being more offensive than funny realize that in movie like this some of the biggest laughs come from letting the actors ad lib beyond what the script dictates but did not anyone realize how irritating tuckers incessant ranting and raving was if this is all the comedian has offer then do not care see any more of his films fortunately chan makes for marvelous straight man and he redeems the fledgling comedy completely it is not often that one actor can so completely save movie but there is no other name for what he does whenever he is on screen rush hour comes nearly breathtaking often hilarious life much of it hinges on the dubious value of how cute it is watch chan try be player but who cares can think of few high concepts that are funnier the movie ends outtakes that as usual show that chan is not perfect and that it does indeed take him few tries get some of his incredible stunts look seamless chris tucker botches some lines as well and his mistakes are funnier than anything he says in the whole movie lot of people have pointed out rush hour is not very different from its predecessor in tone or style but liked the original and like the sequel though certain sidekick seems have done his best ruin it director brett ratner the family man keeps it moving at an entertaining pace and manages keep the laughs coming despite the fairly miserable hit miss ratio of the jokes guess sometimes the shotgun approach works it is not great jackie chan but it is jackie chan and that is enough up next jay and silent bob strike back

some critics including siskel ebert are on the record stating that martin scorseses raging bull the story of boxer jake la motta is the best of the since there are still number of films that have not seen do not feel qualified make such judgment but will say this without hesitation raging bull is great motion picture and would be surprised if more than handful of films released between january and december come close its level biopics often fall into one of two categories overblown hero worship or dry dull textbook account it is rare that movie the moniker based on the life of comes across as anything more than sporadically energetic and marginally entertaining raging bull is the perfect counterexample and brilliant argument for makers continue work in this genre the picture takes the life of boxer jake la motta middleweight icon from the and and develops one of the most compelling character studies ever reach the big screen for all minutes director martin scorsese and actor robert de niro in the title role have us mesmerized this individual who is turns sympathetic sad and horrifying historically raging bull is said be mostly accurately the lions share of the details culled from la mottas own autobiography was cowritten joseph carter and peter savage however although la motta is credited as the movies consultant he was reportedly unhappy the final result because it portrays him as nothing short of an uncouth insensitive lout the la motta of the movie is man of extreme appetites who is driven base bestial impulses paranoia jealousy and blind rage sex and violence are inextricably linked the title is apt la motta is raging bull in the ring he is terror not just beating his opponents but destroying them outside of it he is no less vicious or more easily controlled the two people who spar him on lifes canvas are his wife vicki cathy moriarty and his brothermanager joey joe pesci these are the two who mean the most jake and who as result of his inability trust himself or others he loses he beats vicki mercilessly because he suspects her of infidelity and when he inaccurately believes that his brother betrayed him his lets loose an explosion of violence raging bull opens in when la motta an upandcoming fighter is battling his way into the upper echelon of the middleweight class over the years he wins several key bouts including one against his archrival sugar ray robinson johnny barnes but his unwillingness capitulate the local godfather keeps him from an opportunity participate in championship match meanwhile away from the ring la motta falls in love year old vicki who he marries after discarding his shrewish first wife vicki becomes jakes greatest prize wife in his view is not companion but possession and the source of his most extreme pain his own insecurity is so great that he cannot accept that woman as beautiful as vicki could be faithful him hence he is constantly haunted belief that she is sleeping someone else perhaps even his brother this leads the famous line parodied in waiting for guffman and elsewhere are you king my wife in the late la motta gets his first shot at championship fight but one huge condition he must take fall he does it so badly that an investigation is launched and he is almost thrown out of boxing two years later he wins the championship only lose it in subsequent bout sugar ray the late and early when the ends jake has become pathetic figure broke overweight loser who has spent time in jail for corrupting the morals of minor has lost his wife and children and is trying earn few bucks doing cheap standup routine raging bull is the other side of rocky sylvester stallones tale of boxing triumph was released great critical acclaim in it won the best picture oscar and sequel arrived in theaters before raging bull went into production but where rocky romanticizes boxing raging bull takes cold unflinching look at the violence both inside and outside of the ring while scorseses primary aim is present riveting deconstruction of la motta the man he never backs away from showing the seedy ugly underside of sport where gambling greed and organized crime force fighters throw matches continue working rocky shows boxing at its noblest raging bull shows it at its most diseased there is little can say here that has not already said about de niros performance in career that has included many fine roles this is his most outstanding the level of intensity de niro brings la motta is unwavering and although there is lot of travis bickle de niros character in taxi driver in la motta scorsese and de niro go great lengths make sure that if we never fully sympathize him at least we understand the forces that drive him this is complete characterization and perfect example of acting as the younger jake de niro is trim and fit as the fat older man de niro gained pounds and turned his body into grotesque parody of its normal form how many actors would go that far the best oscar statue is only one testimony the lasting power of the performance cathy moriarty and joe pesci both earned nominations for their supporting work although neither won their portrayals have the same raw energy that infuses de niros pesci who has basically recreated the same personality in two other scorsese films goodfellas and casino presents joey as slightly more intelligent version of his brother the misogyny and violence are still there only better concealed but when joey snaps as he does in one scene where he pounds on mobster frank vincent it is startling behold moriarty on the other hand must play the temptress virginal qualities the only kind of woman who would ensnare jake later she is called upon portray the battered wife and mother whose love has turned into fear scorsese and cinematographer michael chapman elected shoot the bulk of raging bull in blackandwhite few home movie segments are in color the choice is perfect for the movie giving raging bull unique look in an era when blackandwhite approach is almost unheard of one important recent exception schindlers list eschewed color for some of the same reasons that raging bull did in blackandwhite especially considering scorseses choice of shots and use of slow motion the violence is stark and disturbing there is no room for romanticism in the ring inky black blood staining the canvas during fight sequences the director also uses number of pointofview shots designed show the world however briefly from la mottas perspective scorsese could have chosen end the la mottas loss sugar ray where he surrendered his middleweight crown after that his career was all downhill yet the director allows the run for thirty minutes after this pivotal moment stretching more than decade into la mottas future the reason is obvious scorsese is not as interested in boxing as he is in the character following his retirement la motta is still as violent and volatile as ever but he has lost the arena in he can legally unleash those tendencies we see the results of this beast let loose on society and how the consequences of his actions reduce him parody of his former self who cannot feel surge of pity for la motta as he quietly recites marlon brandos speech from on the waterfront coulda been contenda perhaps raging bull is indeed the best of the and if not it is certainly perilously close the zenith

much ballyhoo has been made over this new version of lolita made in time when one would think that faithful adaptation of the infamous novel could be made over its use of pedophilia and as such it is important address it straightforwardly before any other ideals such as goodness and themes can be discussed as this has been in limbo for number of years lying around in vaults san distributor and having critics waiting either hail it masterpiece or call it anticlimactic horseshit when seeing this after all the hoopla keeping in mind that there are people namely me who are fans of the novel who have been eagerly awaiting this flick since its creation well you just have wonder why no one really picked it up for distribution what is even worse is that seeing this lolita especially the first time and if you are familiar anything lolita is admittingly very anticlimactic this is real pity because when you really sit down watch this ignoring all the crap that has preceeded it it is really quite perhaps the best director adrian lyne although really look at its competition flashdance fatal attraction and indecent proposal at least besides jacobs ladder have seen this lolita twice the first time was not so blown away it seemed overly dramatic and surprisingly unaffecting the second time not really thinking about how have waited for what seems like forever see it and how am seeing it on tv set on premium cable channel and not giant movie theatre it really affected me emotionally the story itself is surprisingly heartbreaking one is why it is such good novel and why this is such good the story of pedophile obsessed young year old girl named dolores k lolita is great because it is not trash for the perverted but because it is about human obsession things that are out of ones reach its protagonist the comicallynamed humbert humbert is not your average pedophile but seriously wounded human being who embodies how we are all destroyed our sick obsessions and idosyncrasies the
