character of lolita is almost symbol of the forbidden apple in christian mythology something that will destroy us but that we cannot live without these ideas are all worked into this nicely but done in way that is not heavyhanded at all but instead lyrical and emotionally devastating the focus of this and the reason for making it it seems was really penetrate the emotional depths of the novel and bring them life on the screen in beautifully dramatic images and scenes are blatantly overstylized the tone of the book is comical one but it is also tragic one and humbert telling the story from his perspective blows every single thing out of perspective humbert exists in fantsy world of his obsessions and desires and this reflects the way the entire has been designed we get sense that perhaps it is doing this that humbert has really trapped himself into fate that will ultimately leave him haggard and destroyed he weeps uncontrollably and never lets himself get over his original yearold love and allows himself embody her as lolita he lets his feelings for her navigate all his decisions and the end he has nothing but overlydramatic feelings for her the story recognizes the extreme of this almost out of test seeing if the readers will really sympathize someone who is socially deemed pervert and one almost wonders while reading the book if the author vladimir nabokov wrote the book as means bring into focus his own sick obsessions and perhaps bring them peace the weirdest thing about this is that the end when humbert has reached the finale of his obsessional journey we can easily sympathize and even identify him the opening and final images of the are the same and who has not done similar action that is wandering about without any sense of reality or anything else but deep sadness in us this is the second time the novel has been adapted for the screen the first time being filmed in shock stanley kubrick who could not possibly have brought the novel the screen as much faithfulness as lyne has been able do but did the next best thing he economized for everything and came up droll black comedy about obsession in general in that he used the traps of society as benefits the studio demanded the final scene that of heinous murder come first in the so portray humbert first as murderer and second as pedophile and when you see it it gives the depth of man trapped obsession the censors would not allow anymore than couple glances and subtle dialogue show the um relationship between humbert and lolita so kubrick decided play it as comedy but still allow the tragedy seep through looking at these two versions especially after reading the novel and we all know that when we have read novel and see adaptation we are bound be angered any size differences it is really impossible compare them they both go for different things and one has lot more room be as sexually frank as the novel was and although it is true that several scenes are similar and are thus up for comparison overall it is unfair say one is better and one is worse have never been one for saying the level of greatness of adaptation of novel is deemed how faithful it is and will not say that here however this is pretty amazing mostly because hey loved the book and this nearly reminded me of it it does not have nearly as much wit couple comical scenes and even lot of good chuckles but just not totally witty but it does have the same emotional toll that the novel had some of that is in the casting of the two leads jeremy irons his deep soft british voice and gentle look is an amazing humbert he is droll in very unique way and well no one can look distraught the way he does he brings wonderful sympathy the role that goes beyond pathos and really comes up as being easy identify the audience and when he looks at lolita love and she looks at him lust you know that he is her prisoner for as long as he lives and dominique swain who plays the title character is rather incredible she pulls off the tough role even better than sue lyon did in the original wonderfully balancing the qualities of seduction bratiness and selfcenteredness that marks the character it is easy see why she surrenders humbert she loves the attention and knows that she can have her way him at any time when he denies her something she blackmails him effortlessly scene involving rocking chair and little foot action is damn near classic and when he stands up her she weeps and runs away leaving humbert follow her there are two other minor characters in the one who is road block in the beginning and the other who is reappearing threat the relationship the former is charlotte lolitas mother played melanie griffith in the book charlotte is monster of woman overbearing constantly scolding her child overlyreligious and ultimately selfish and she is the one obstacle humbert has overcome obtain his goal at least in the beginning as played shelly winters in the original she represented all these qualities as played griffith here she is about half of them it is annoying watch and play game where you try see who could have done the role way better than the one on screen without mentioning the actor who played them first and even though griffith is not really bad persay she is nothing more the other is clare quilty the writer who is also trying seduce lolita and succeeds but at price langella takes totally different direction than the one peter sellars took in the original quilty was comic character in the original threat in the form of many forms popping in states of rambling german proning and eventually drunk langella takes the other route allowing all of the creepiness be unearthed and the result is character who exists in shadows and low shots and who meets wonderfully ironic ending the exact opposite of what we thought of him as you can see most of these are not improvements or mistakes done on the part of lyne and his screenwriter stephen schiff but just parts of whole new look at the novel at least cinemawise this version is beautiful and perpetually saddening the camera movements are stylized and each shot is breathtakingly rich the acting is for the most part wonderful and when we watch it we really get sense that for humbert who is telling the story the only two people on earth most of the time were humbert and lolita more importantly it takes us right up the brink of emotion then jumps right over it the end humbert sadly driving recklessly in his car following what he says is the only part of his life he does not regret we feel that we all lose something we can never have

capsule sidesplitting comedy that follows its own merciless logic almost through the end but not without providing good deal of genuine laughs most comedies these days have one flaw they are not funny they think they are funny but they are devoid of anything really penetrating or dastardly occasionally good funny movie sneaks past the deadening preconceptions of humor and we get real gem ruthless people for instance established microcosm of setup and played it out the bitter end liar liar is built the same way and is just about as funny this is one of the few movies have seen where was laughing consistently almost all the way through instead of couple of setpieces that inspired laugh think of the dismal fatal instinct the whole movie works like clockwork jim carrey playes highpowered lawyer whom lying is as natural as breathing there is one thing he takes seriously though his son and we can sense the affection that they have for each other right away but his wife is divorced and seeing another man and now it looks like they may move away together the son goes them of course the movie sets up this early material good timing and remarkable balance of jim carreys overthetop persona reality then the plot springs into action after being snubbed not deliberately his father at his birthday the kid makes wish as he blows out the birthday candles that for just one day dad cannot lie he gets the wish what happens next is sidesplitting everything turns into confrontation when cornered bum for some change he shouts no am not giving you any money because know you will spend it on booze all want do is get the office without having step over the debris of our decaying society he cannot even get into an elevator without earning black eye and what is worse he is now gotten himself into an expensive divorce settlement that requires him twist the truth like abstract wire sculpture carrey who used find unfunny has gotten better at his schtick even if it is limited one he uses it great effect in this movie there is scene where he tries test his ability lie and nearly demolishes his office in the process there is grin breaking out across my face right now just remembering the scene he cannot even write the lie his fingers twitch his body buckles like someone in the throes of cyanide poisoning and when he tries talk it is like he is speaking in tongues equally funny is scene where he beats himself pulp do not ask why tries drink water keep from having outbursts in the courtroom it fails semipredictable results and winds up biting the bullet when he gets called into the boardroom have everyone ask what they think of them this scene alone may force people stop the tape for minutes on end the movie sustains its laughs and also its flashes of insight until almost the end shame too because the movie insists on having big ridiculous climax that involves carreys character flagging down plane using set of motorized stairs then breaking his leg etc simple reconciliation would do the trick why is this stupid pentup climax always obligatory it is not even part of the movies real agenda thankfully liar liar survives it and so does carrey maybe they were being merciful on reflection if would laughed any more might have needed an iron lung

maybe the most important thing about this movie is that it is not handled like the hallmark hall of fame movie of the month because it very well could have been manipulative tearjerker broadcasted on abc on monday night starring kelly martin and yasmeen bleeth respectively because it is not handled like the greatest story ever told is precisely why it is so great underneath the todiefor cinematography the brilliant acting and incessantly wonderful direction is of modesty not sure whether or not this story is totally great but the balls run it tell it in certain original way it does not merely go from plot point plot point it goes from character character it obsesses itself the depth and the style of it all and makes the story of worldreknowned cellist who contracts ms and dies prematurely into the story of two sisters both musicians who have totally unique relationship it is that their relationship is the center of the story that makes this transcend any cornball shamelessly tired tearjerker qualities it could have had and makes this unlike patch adams effortlessly emotional and real in short this movie is just awesome it merely tells its story really well and that is something that just has be commended these days when most stories are botched because they are not told great storytellers director anand tucker tells this story well he overdramaticizes everything but still keeps it real the tells the story of hilary and jacqueline du pr rachel griffiths and emily watson respectively two sisters who are first seen in childhood played auriol evans and keely flanders respectively as the very best of friends they are also both musicians hilary flutist and jackie cellist and when it all begins both are considered child prodigies but hilary is seen as the better of the two jackie bit jealous works and works at her playing skills and soon the tables are turned when they both hit adulthood hilary strives for comeback while her sister is playing in famous halls around the world but instead of fame captures the heart of hapless joyful conductor kiffer finzi david morissey in semistarmaking turn they marry after short courtship and move lovely country house making jackie incredibly jealous since her cello playing becomes symbol of her current life when she plays she has the eyes of the world but when she stops she is alone she enters into shallow relationship an equally famous pianist daniel barenboim james frain in hopes that she may overcloud her sister but she eventually begins lose it and runs away hilarys country home where she hopes gain admittance hilary sleep her husband since no one she sleeps gives her any pleasure it is all terribly melodramtic as you can see and the time jackie has contracted ms in brilliantly edited scene that surpasses the breakdown scene in the semismiliar shine in technical and emotional devastation it would have been the time that could easily call the sign for melodramatic overload if it had not been handled in such way the key thing here is that it is not about her gradual death and slip into insanity but rather that it is about her tumultuous relationship her sister might add is perfectly realized their relationship is the most downtoearth complex entity of the year they love eachother more than anyone else in the entire world but they are also completely jealous of one another when young jackie surpasses her playing abilities she tries in vain make comeback but cannot and almost seems marry get back at jackie for her success when jackie lands on top and sees her sister marry wonderful man she is jealous of her lifestyle the most extensive brinks that have ever seen in only two sisters who truly love eachother would dare share the same man and the whole time their love for eachother is never doubted or even tested another thing really liked is emily watsons performance usually make it note never overpraise an actor for playing either drunkard or lunatic or someone mortal disease or any combination of the three my reasoning for this is that it is fucking easy job the worst case for this very year may be thandie newton in beloved sure she is good but what is so tough about playing woman who stumbles around slurs her words together and acts like three year old inside year olds body hell could play that if had pair of breasts in that same exact movie though is performance kimberly elise where she has be the rock that holds the family together as her mother slowly goes insane her brothers run off never be seen again and her mothers lover is scared off she has actually deal real emotions something much harder than mere stumbling about but the academy of arts and sciences loves loves loves overpraising performances like newtons if you do not believe me look at jack nicholsons performance in as good as it gets great performance but easy job this is not so for watson though because her insanity comes from real emotions not just plot point and thanks the opening sequence where we see her and hilary as kids we understand the motives behind all her actions and the time she actually contracts ms and begins loose her sanity and her life we have already understood that this is the last straw for woman plagued terrible neuroses rachel griffiths who would have otherwise been the understudy watsons protagonist actually matches watson stepforstep because as watson grows insane and demands unspeakable things from her griffiths holds her own and has deal what she is able give her sister who needs emotional help from her griffiths an otherwise unknown actress and watson being famous from breaking the waves and the boxer is absolutely brilliant just as absolutely brilliant as watson is and if the academy and all the other critics groups who have already deemed watsons performance the best of the year glance over hers because she is the one who does not get go insane read she gets the boring role then the scream of hysteria you hear will be from me after all griffiths has the thankless job of keeping things real the tom cruise role in rainman the one who should have gotten oscar consideration and not hoffman she does and if anyone deserves accolades from the academy this year it is griffiths together the two actresses work extremely well though and both have go through deep emotional hell the likes of have not been seen this year if it had not been for an otherwise nottotallygreat final section that deals way too much jackie and not enough hilary when the two had gotten equal treatment for the entirety would say this is one of the top ten best films of the year it is so close perfection in its structure its treatment of its subject and its beautiful technical specifications cinematography nomination without shred of doubt in my mind and maybe editing that it is nearly shame that it is not the flawless gem that it should be but hey as it is can hardly complain

as write the review for the new hanksryan romantic comedy you have got mail am acutely aware that am typing it on computer and sending it billion miles away on the internet am also aware that have just spent the last hours watching the worlds biggest paid commercial for america online and wonder is that so bad well the commercial part is as for the movie well as long as can watch tom hanks and meg ryan think will be okay paraphrase james berardinelli whose reviews admire very much tom hanks and meg ryan can act they are both wonderful but for all of hanks glorious work in serious films such as his magnificent performance in saving private ryan and his glorious triumph in philadelphia like him best when he is suitably obnoxious tom hanks is wonderful when he is obnoxious in romantic comedy when he is going get the girl the only question is how meg ryan americas high school sweetheart can act she is had handful of memorable performances including the great scene in the diner in when harry met sally must not mention what she does due the well um you get the idea and if you do not get the movie fantastic but like her best when she is well perky she is so adorably perkycute that together hanks they are the most amazing onscreen duo in my short lifetime some people have them going back really old classic romantic couples but do not really know all know is that just like them both they have such wonderfully kinetic chemistry that is really hard resist and am not going even try they are just really really cute sweet and charming hanks and ryan collaborate once again nora ephron who directed them in the megahit sleepless in seattle here the setup is little different kathleen kelly ryan owns small childrens bookstore her mother founded years ago and passed down her she is successful beautiful and dates wellknown columnist very radical idea kinnear she is also having an affair of sorts you see kathleen the handle shopgirl is secretly emailing ny they have strictly undetailed relationship there are no specifics and they have no idea who each other is ny happens be joe fox hanks multimillionaire bookseller who is the heir the fortune of the fox chain of megabookstores run his father coleman fox books has decided open store on the west side right across from little childrens bookseller named shop around the corner run perky girl named kathleen kelly every morning these two email each other silly and every day they fight the death it is charming premise and one that works nicely balancing the immense troubles kathleen is in the romance she wants have it also has the great sense of being classic romance there is no let us have sex tonight mantra if you will excuse my bluntness this is solid romance built around that vague concept of love hmm well the movie goes through twists and turns having some sad moments and happy ones until at one moment tom hanks and meg ryan hook up use modern terminology and kiss their way into happiness you know it is going happen the question is now thankfully ephron has wonderful supporting cast posey kinnear chappelle and host of others including great scene involving brothers aunts and two sweet kids it is all cute and wonderful and for all of the idealism it makes me feel good hanks is as obnoxious as ever on the outside and as warm on the inside as he always is he is believe americas greatest actor does he show it here nah but he is still tom hanks and she is still meg ryan is what this movie boils down it is pure confection all the bits about the godfather the jokes the superb script it is all really sweet there are some immense flaws like pacing the last third of the movie really does not work as well as would have liked and for romantic comedy it is slow once hanks knows the secret it gets really slow even looked at my watch couple times make sure ephron was going deliver the big onscreen kiss was waiting for so that could get home at reasonable hour the other problem is that this movie is shaping up be really dated email when my kids are my age do not know what we will be using but hanks can do more one eyeroll than anybody and meg ryan just loves dive into pillow better than anyone in movie history they just work together and it is nice see it gives you well smile the script helps some great lines that are absolutely hilarious and that always come at the exact right time keep the audience awake was arguing my father on the drive back home on what the purpose of movies was have always believed that movies are very powerful very powerful indeed you see mankind has three abilities he needs survive the ability think entertain and procreate movies can definitely do the first two and as for the third well would rather not think about that always thought films that made you think enlightened you and made you see something from another viewpoint and that films that entertained you were good because you forgot about your troubles and thought about something nice for night and was thinking about how incredible year tom hanks has had hanks was the driving force behind one of the years best films in saving private ryan is one of those thinking films that truly made someone wonder about the world he is also half of the glue behind the years best example of pure entertainment tom hanks and meg ryan are magical as is this movie it is sweet lovely affair technology twist it may be long commercial but it gave me pretty big smile on my face

are we victims of fate in life or can we create our own destiny directorwriter brad anderson seems be saying yes both questions in his witty next stop wonderland the two main characters alan and erin spend the entire movie in each others orbit catching glimpses of one another yet not quite connecting until the inevitable conclusion is it fate that keeps them near each other and ultimately puts them together does this predestination carry over all aspects of life as the starts erin castleton hope davis melancholy year old late shift nurse is ending her livein relationship her boyfriend hoffman rather he is ending it her arriving home from work erin finds her boyfriend parked in front of their apartment car packed his belongings in fumbling amusing and self deluding ramble he instructs erin watch videotape he is made detailing why their relationship is doomed fail and why he is leaving it is obvious he lacks the courage confront her directly as he rails on about accomplishing something his life and taking stand all the while backpedaling his way out of their relationship he then flees the scene the grace of an inept thief erins mother holland taylor in surprisingly effective small role fearing that her daughter will be without man in her life takes out personal ad for erin erins embarrassed horror the ad describes her as frisky cultured carefree professional zest for life eventually erin responds the tidal wave of responses makes for some of the most humorous telling moments of the movie as she meets prospective suitors and poseurs alan plumber and aspiring marine biologist first spots erin as he is cleaning the inside glass of fish tank at the boston aquarium wearing wet suit and goggles he follows erin from window window separated the glass as erin oblivious his gaze enjoys the fish later we see him on train as she sits on platform outside mere feet away the movie spends it is entirety having their paths circle each other without crossing there are several subplots involving alan one concerns his attempts get on the job track at the boston aquarium thereby escaping his apparent fate carry on the family plumbing business another subplot involves his fathers desperate attempts force fates hand gambling away his life at the dog track distracting focus is put on alans debt loan shark and the manner in he pays it off the movie tries too hard make alan likable guy thankfully his dream guy persona is counterbalanced erins distant yet fundamentally hopeful personality the moves along at an unhurried pace albeit too much so in the latter third as we wait for the two meet cowriters anderson and lyn vaus throw couple of possible red herrings into the mix as the two find other possible relationships the films shifts into much slower gear as we wait for these romances blow over when alan and erin eventually do meet we see that perhaps they both were destined for each other as they share lingering almost subliminally knowing gaze it is sweet measured moment the disappointment comes in the fact that we have come know the pair yet we do not get view their impending romance the films inherent belief in the subtle persistence of fate and the wonder it can bring ones life makes next stop wonderland quiet pleasure in cinematic landscape littered explosions shallow characters and overdone special effects

i am an avid fan of the alien saga so this review is obviously tad biased at least admitted it of course that does not mean that am gonna be giving this fourstar review or something because alien resurrection the fourth in the coolashell series is not an absolutely amazing much like the first two were however it is very good never fails entertain and consists of yet another mutation in the style of the series in short had good time alien resurrection leaves off years after the last one where our heroine protagonist ellen ripley sigourney weaver the science fiction genres answer job had killed herself after discovering that an alien was inside her body waiting pop out like it did john hurt in the first one of course the last one was not very great or anything liked it though not as much as the first two and more importantly it was not financially successful tawdry million bucks so back we are ripley back as clone means we get another little satirical look at cloning not that that is bad thing but it is becoming cliche so she is cloned aboard an even more futuristiclooking ship called the auriga some doctors including the necessary bad government guy dr wren played e freeman as well as the littleseen dr gediman played none other than brad douriff mainly because they have version of her the alien still inside her once you get past the fact that you cannot figure out where they got her blood although think it might have been from the blood samples taken charles dance in the third one the films okay also on board are band of mercenary pirates including michael wincott ron perlman kim flowers raymond cruz dominique pinon jeunet sytable and winona ryder who plays analee call who turns out have bit of secret will not state it but unless you have been shacking up salinger for the past two years you probably know all about it although it is nicely covered up there is bit of nonsexualyetslightlyhomoerotic relationship between her and ripley but it is never really deepened enough oh well well as you might have guessed the alien and its spawn escape and run around the ship and it pretty much does away most of the people on the ship including some shocks dan hedaya for instance who is death is comical yet sad since well he is dan hedaya and the remaining people about or are left try and escape and stop the aliens from doing any major harm since the ship is heading quickly towards earth of course the plot is all balderdash and just an excuse for some good old alien brand fun the real focus of the series seems be on style not really substance although there is always bit of it most notably in aliens the relationship between ripley and the little girl what is interesting about the series is that each is stylistically different in its approach alien is claustrophobic exercise in quiet frights aliens is wild tense thriller alien is bleak moody piece of seminoir alien is kind of like an offbeat french filled lots of humor and cool scares jeanpierre jeunet without his usual directing partner marc caro creates ship filled the kind of scares films like das boot has echoes hinting at possible threat the chills in the are really cool especially the music is sometimes turned down completely for certain scenes there is the most tense surgery scene since faceoff towards the beginning and not every chill turns into bloody mess or anything like that this all combined some good old humor makes this as interesting visually and stylistically as the others there are even couple scenes just stick out afterwards as being brilliantly executed one is the aforementioned surgery scene another one takes place between call and ripley is just awesome the underwater chase scene and the ladder scene afterwards is one of the most tense thrilling and jawdropping scenes in the entire saga small allusion jeunets earlier delicatessen and the way they do in the final alien is hysterically cool lovely allusion goldfinger but the best scene in the entire am sure am not the first mention it takes place when ripley sees all the variations on her as they cloned her she has an tatooed on her arm it might be the most emotionally stimulating scene in the entire saga the screenplay joss whedon is not great piece of work as it never really deapens lot of the characters however it does make us care about most of them so that when there is very little of them and it looks like one or more of them may become alien chow we are pretty scared and yeah there are some very funny lines ripley who do have fuck get off this boat johner well can get you off but not this ship the acting is good all around standout performances from ron perlman as the male chauvenist pig johner and leland orser the poor bastad in seen who performed the lust sin as an anxietyridden wannabe woody allen who has an alien inside him winona ryder is good but not amazing like she usually is although she meshes well the of course and as usual sigourney weaver steals the show playing variation on the ripley character less emotional and more rude and bitter she pulls it off while still being utterly lovable she is not going get an oscar nomination like she did for aliens but she is just awesome overall it is thrilling entertaining does not really amaze like the first two but is much more amazing than the third installment the style is the best part of the is not really bad thing but it being the best part takes away from lot of the depth the occasionally tries apply but it is entertaining as hell and it is definitely fit for the alien series

it may seem weird begin about glam rock sequence that includes spaceship green ovular pin and the birth of oscar wilde but if one really strains they can see that perhaps maybe these connections are not half off wildes philosophy was that everyone should be true their own human nature and the result of his following this philosophy was that he was imprisoned loosing his family and his career the glam rock movement in the early in england had similar take and came similar demise the main difference was placing makeup on their face and acting out on their deepest fantasies and inquiries about life mostly dealing androgony and sexuality they became less and less like themselves and more and more like everyone else and that is why the movement seemed end as soon as it began it is been said that todd haynes velvet goldmine the that chronicles what it was like be part of the movement not only from those who experienced it but those who created it steals lot from citizen kane and that is true in the british journalist in the arthur stuart christian bale is asked go back and find out what happened glam rock star brian slade fictitious rock star who faked his own death on stage bringing the end not only his career but the entire glam rock movement structurewise this totally steals from kane not only from the setup he interviews three people and the story is result of their flashbacks but in other things like the beginning death then newsreel and smaller details like the bitter exfriend in wheelchair and the bitter exwife as washedup lounge singer found in bar after hours this is no kane and it really does not aspire be it does not attempt be the deep outlook of something gone like kane did and it does not really uncover anything poignant about humanity instead it uses the flashbacks as form of contrast between the magic that was the glam rock era and the boredom that was life after glam rock for those who were participants the scenes are dry and deliriously melancholy equipped performance bale that is perhaps appropriately dull and unengaging but the scenes are engaging though not mention addictively campy they radiate gorgeous cinematography that nicely accentuates all the vibrant colors of the era and feel that is so eerily lighthearted that when combined the thenfootage they become not only symbol of decadence but of times when everything seemed so simple instead of creating the world the way it was haynes paints their own world as if it were narcotic fairy tale the glam rock movement was full of so much freedom and liberation that after you have experienced it everything else seems so mundane there is no outside world speak of secluding these people inside protective globe that will eventually crack haynes focuses his story on the tale of blade and the other fictitious rock hero curt wild and their relationship that created molded and then brought down the movement reducing everyone else who contributed it as merely that contributors blade played reserve the pouty jonathan rhys meyers and wild played anarchic wildness ewan mcgregor are little more than thinly disguised recreations of david bowie and iggy pop respectively complete the creation of ziggy stardust persona named maxwell demon and the confirmation that the two rock stars may have very well not only have been onetime partners in music but also partners in bed through discussions slades exmanager cecil michael feast exwife mandy toni collette reinventing herself as an american blonde dish who fakes british accent when slade and finally expartner wild journalist stuart begins remember his own experiences in the era like his discovery of his rebelliousness cum conformity including the moment when he began questioning his own sexuality when he opens up his first slade record he finds naked and green slade lying on crimson blanket and finally running away from home be part of the london scene finally resulting in leading boring job in america haynes demonstrates that he is quite the visual auteur molding scenes that are like long heald breaths such as seemingly long sequence juxtaposing sladewild concert of them performing brian eno cover babys on fire scenes from decadent drug party and the films most wowinspiring sequence the first concert scene of wild his band the ratttz where mcgregor lets loose so much anarchic steam that his wild iggyesuqe movements including stripping naked and screams that the captures that perfect moment when one discovers major talent and another slade discovers his idle even the brief music videos spoofs of bowies have rare visual flair that is pure camp and would cause ken russell drool the best sequence though may be the beginning following the prelude sequence acts as the middle ground for both the actual being of the movement and the postmovement era in it stuart and his mates are going the infamous slade concert where he fakes his own death where he kills off his alter ego maxwell demon in what appears be real assasination brought about the end of the era in one swift fake bullet brian enos famous needle in the camels eye playing in the background the scene has detached exhileration the song does not seem be played in quite the same way the other songs are it has distance that is hard put finger on and it seems represent that all this is coming quick and sad ending and when one sees slade in the dressing room before the show docked in silver frock wings and blue hair depressingly staring into the mirror it comes off as nonetooobvious prophecy of the finale in the beginning of the this movies not so much about plot but more about the way it is presented making this one of those films is classified as being style over substance statement prompts many critics line up for attack however for the most part the engaging part of this is not the story but rather the way in haynes creates this world using his sets costumes cinematography and especially the music play as characters in his the music is especially notable the soundtrack is wall wall consists of old school glam rock tunes the likes of brian eno trex and roxy music as well as covers slades band vocals thom yorke and occasionally rhys meyers himself and even newer music shudder think that sounds uncannily bowielike the cast is rather impressive but no one really walks away the and no performances are extremely good although eddie izzard as slades manager who challenges slades first manager an armwrestling match see who gets control of his career and michael feast as the first and tragic manager come off greatly and collette and mcgregor have their moments rhys meyers and bale are noticably subpar neither putting lot of effort into their respective roles some of it is at fault the actual construction of the haynes rhys meyers brian slade remains merely metaphor for the glam rock era dying when he turned into retrogarbo resorting life of salingerism and found in the mids be lying around sniffing coke off the ass of party girl in fact no one in this is really seen as person rather than just as symbol or composite of type who thrived during the era bales character is an especially tough sell bitter and depressed flashbacks his young adulthood he is not an extremely personal character and his cliched experiences being hounded the record store guys for buying record put out poof never help us communicate him nevertheless rhys meyers and mcgregor have the excuses that their characters are not really characters but rather the results of an era that has left them and others bitter part of helps the work since this is major piece of eye candy at the prime of the movie they at least look the role of fashionable leaders slade his perpetuallychanging androgonys persona and wild his topless and unpredictable image clash and fuse into an unstable union their story of how slade was so influenced wild that he adapted it into similar whocares attitude crossed camp is engaging without the personal background the story of stuart though is tougher sell because he is the everyman and when you cannot totally identify the everyman your storys in slight trouble as cultural rock piece velvet goldmine is rather good but it is merely good it never totally takes off although it has moments where it absolutely flies but then comes back down it is really nothing more than bunch of really great moments surrounded material that could really be much better the beginning is captivating but slow the middle is fantastic and the ending is not only shallow but worse than that it drags the final half hour not only does it not bring the story any real conclusion it could probably stop at any point and did anyone really figure out what the mystery is that arthur unearths it almost seems like there was no point in the entire investigation other than unearth the past is commendable but not totally so still it does what the oliver stone pic the doors did not do right becoming very insightful what happened using the visual style hit most of the right notes of contrast between what made the era so great those who lived during it and why after living through such an era that everything else seems halfassed suppose the message is live life but after you have lived it what else is the point when you will be forced live regretful memories the really superb achievement of this is that during its flashbacks it successfully creates for the audience what it must have felt like be in that era but the added perk of knowing the result of all that goes down

when first heard that romeo juliet had been updated shuddered thought that yet another of shakespeares classics had been destroyed fortunately was wrong baz luhrman has directed an in your face and visually stunning piece this it revolves around the two rival families who in this version each run multimillion dollar enterprises these rival companiesfamilies are the capulet us and the montagues the younger generation of these two families have formed gangs who despise one another as the storylines goes romeo montague played leonardo dicaprio and juliet capulet claire danes meet at fancy dress party and it is love at first site never believed love at first site was possible until saw this the scene in romeos eyes meet juliets through the fish tank is one of the most memorable of course they cannot publicly reveal their love for their families are arch enemies so they marry in secret this is where things begin go wrong the story as all good shakespeare ends in tragedy the cinematography is spectacular say the least and the soundtrack provides the perfect atmosphere in lay our scene as the says there is very little criticise the performances are convincing and several of the films younger stars may find that it provides launch for their careers the modernisation of the script is ingenious and clever despite the well known storyline this latest version still manages cause tears among many members of the audience especially the younger generation and this is certainly great credit the

krippendorfs tribe is formula comedy done poorly formulaic comedies might seem signify the downfall of american cinema however every now and then one emerges like krippendorfs tribe that actually works professor james krippendorf richard dreyfuss the renowned anthropologist is in trouble his university gave him hefty grant discover lost tribe in new guinea however he found nothing his wife has recently died and he has spent the remainder of the grant money in raising his three kids shelly natasha lyonne mickey gregory smith and edmund carl michael lidner tonight he is expected lecture on his newfound tribe rather than break the news and face the consequences of misusing his funds he invents tribe the shelmikedmu named after his kids however one lie begets another as he is not only required deliver filmed proof of the shelmikedmu but his research becomes popular phenomenon soon professor krippendorf is caught up in an elaborate ruse in he films mockumentary footage starring his children as the shelmikedmu tribal members his efforts are hampered the boasts of an overeager colleague veronica micelli jenna elfman and the intense scrutiny of rival anthropologist ruth allen lily tomlin krippendorfs tribe does seem require little suspension of disbelief no one seems question the way his field documentaries seem be shot multiple cameras or that his newly discovered tribesmen have startlingly blue eyes luckily as the builds momentum that suspension of disbelief is easy come though there is some mild humor in the krippendorf family trying pass themselves off as lost tribe the real humor of the is in how james gets trapped in his ever increasing snowball of lies the double meanings many of the shelmikedmu appearances are enjoyable and the comic timing required for some of the films latter scenes is superb richard dreyfuss is terrific as the hapless professor who soon loses control of his own imaginary tribe jenna elfmans position as romantic lead seems bit forced at times but she plays the part extreme affability even the kids who in films like this tend be bit on the precocious side are endearing and humorous yes the does veer occasionally into some rather lowbrow humor but it has the best excuse of all it is funny it may not go down as an alltime classic but it certainly delivers what you expect from comedy plenty of laughs

not since shine starred geoffrey rush as pianist david helfgott has movie so defiantly laid bare the lives of worldclass musicians in fact if one were watch these films together it would almost certainly stand as convincing argument that life of music naturally leads all varieties of social ills yet hilary and jackie the sophomore effort from director anand tucker has something more say it softly but strongly explores the complex relationships of sibling rivalry and love in very compelling tale emily watson and rachel griffiths are the leads in this tale playing the sisters du pr both musicians from childhood hilary griffiths is renowned flutist while jacqueline watson is easily as skilled on the cello the two comepete for and win many honors as children and as young women both together and seperate their careers as musicians surpass and then bow one anothers and although their lives take very different paths hilary settles down marriage and family while rachel skips across the globe on world concert tour they are bound together their deep family love the performances of watson and griffiths are excellent in style and substance they contrast each other wonderfully and while watsons portrayal of jackie du pr is at times eccentric and perhaps unsympathetic both characters are charged emotion the frank cottrell boyce script is based on the book hilary and piers du pr brings great deal of depth these characters as well the script is also be commended for its wellpolished dual nature cottrell boyce adopts style one might expect see in mystery thriller was in fact the case david koepp and robert townes script for mission impossible and skillfully molds it the story of two rising musicians on different courses fame the latter parts of his script are controversial say the least and the rather depressing ending takes the wind out of an envigorating story some will leave this movie feeling disenfranchised nevertheless hilary and jackie is movie that reaches an upper echelon of contemporary cinema through solid fundamentals and is decent watch all around

luckily some people got starship troopers some people knew it was supposed be silly for those of you who did not how could you miss it from the very beginning when we see an interactive internetlike promotional video for the armed forces of the future it should be obvious this is be taken lightly guess without blatant oneliners and home alone style slapstick some people just do not recognize such goofy humor such dry approach such intentionally campy humor must have left some disillusioned first thing do before seeing this movie lighten up meet the equivalent of beverly hills meets mighty morphin power rangers four close friends are now graduating high school and are ready join the armed forces in the future means fighting for the whole galaxy and not just your country johnny rico casper van dien is ready join the infantry mostly because his girlfriend carmen ibanez denise richards has enlisted be pilot dizzy flores dina meyer has enlisted as trooper and it is possible she is joining merely follow rico whom she is always had eyes for if you saw these three on the street you would automatically start searching for the fashion designers and photographers for never has movies cast looked so much like the cutout cover of seventeen magazine the lone nonsupermodel carl jenkins played doogie howser himself neil patrick harris is the brainiac who gets into the military intelligence division the top secret department that pretty much leaves doogie er carl out of the picture good call now we can put all our drooling efforts into only the most deserving of characters right off the bat rico becomes the star of the show far surpassing all the other soldiers and becoming squadron leader in short period of time but horrific accident during standard training exercise follows all closely his breakup carmen leaves rico ready call it quits his bags packed and his civilian clothes back on johnny is ready walk off base and catch the next flight home well sorry rico suave but there is no place like home especially after gigantic alien insects have destroyed it that is right the planet is being attacked colony of arachnidlike alien beings that can of raid just is not going destroy sudden change of heart and clothes rico is back in the game following his fellow starship troopers off fight mean group of daddy long legs what starship troopers really is is spoof of all that it even remotely touches on the soap opera like love affairs of high school the love for scifi and thirst for gore shared this same age group etc nothing is taken seriously it is almost as much satire on young adults as clueless but its sly and futuristic approach it is not as recognizably so it is spoof so subtle that many will not recognize the spoofery if you deem this as scifiaction you are wrong it is scifiactioncomedy the comedy being on the level of such cult favorites as evil dead starship troopers just may be on the road cult status as well gore is factor heavily brought up in reviews of this but the gore too is meant be cheesy yes it is graphic but it is also brutally phony and that is what makes it such great fun watch not since the old mr bill skits on saturday night live has torture and mutilation been such joy watch people were laughing out loud every time body was severed in half or head was viciously decapitated perhaps it brings back fond memories of the severities we inflicted upon our sisters barbie dolls as young children the actors resembling ken and barbie so closely it is good chance this is the case whether we are fully aware of it or not starship troopers has it is slow parts but it is truly an alternative your typical scifiaction flick or lame juvenile comedy aside from the intentionally cheesy gore the special effects are quite astounding when the spaceship passes meteor it is quite an awesome spectacle visually crisp and captivating if you are looking for brainless fun this is the epitome of your search beautiful cast awesome special effects fastpaced action campy acting and whole lot of gore this is brainless heaven just remember not think

the happy bastards second review notting hill cute romantic comedy from the writer of the hit comedy four weddings and funeral notting hill stars julia roberts as anna scott very popular actress million asking price for movies one day she wanders into travel book store owned simple london resident played hugh grant and sparks somehow begin fly sure there are points of turmoil such as putting up grants slightly disgusting but very hilarious roommate spike annas pesky exboyfriend alec baldwin in humorous cameo and on top of all that those damn press it is fresh sort of complexity see in romantic comedy very different from say stubborn father or not the right time like as seen in usual flicks roberts is terrific as the astonishingly beautiful actress and grant is surprisingly good as the straightforward guy still trying get hold of what has actually happened this girl in short sweet romantic comedy that has lot of good laughs particularly provided spike one teeshirt really says it all about him in an attempt turn on woman he shows the front of the shirt says you are the most beautiful woman in the world on the back fancy f

first am not big fan of the xfiles tv series have nothing against it particularly just do not happen watch it having said that can now say that liked the xfiles pretty well for us nonfans there is nothing big going for it but there are lot of little things the movie opens on an ice cave in north texas in c two protohumans enter the cave and find space alien cocooned inside the alien breaks free and kills one man in struggle while the other is seemingly captured the bloody ooze from the alien the movie jumps the same cave today where boy lucas black from sling blade is captured the same black ooze we then cut fbi agents scully and mulder gillian anderson and david duchovny who have been pulled off of their previous assignment investigations into the paranormal and put onto the bomb squad detail caller has threatened federal building in dallas texas on hunch mulder checks out the building across the street and would not you know it he turns out be right the fbi finds the bomb in time evacuate but not in time defuse five people die in the blast and when mulder learns who the victims were light bulb goes on over his head the two agents team up investigate against fbi orders the links mulder has made their search leads them back the north texas cave all across the country and even antarctica as they get closer and closer the truth the plot and the truth are uninspired got the feeling that what learned was supposed shock and amaze me it did not the possible existence of aliens on earth has been explored so many times before in movies that one could hardly count them but the point of the xfiles is not what the truth is but the extent it has been hidden it is slightly more interesting angle but it still raises expectations about that truth too high if this were the whole would say the movie was mediocre perhaps even boring but there are other qualities that make me like this movie well enough recommend it the pacing of the was brisk enough hold my interest before the audience can get tired of one location the agents follow hot tip another location and so on and so forth the locations are not all computergenerated sets either there are some artificial settings but the desert night of nevada the edge of suburbia in texas and the endless fields of snow in antarctica actually somewhere in north america make this fantastic feel more real ward russells cinematography is very good the overall look is dark and ominous appropriate the intended tone of the films plot russell is able make something as innocuous as cornfield look foreboding when the movie is set in darkness the picture quality is still rich and detailed finally and specifically there is an incredible shot at night in the camera crosses the tracks in front of fast oncoming train do not know if the shot is faked in any way but it looks dangerous and it looks great the movies soundtrack is also used convey the dark tone of the skip the next paragraph if you have yet see the movie there is spoiler in the following sentences during the opening prehistoric sequence howling wind dogs the soundtrack never giving the characters or the audience an escape from the lonely terrible sound in one of the movies most effective sequences metallic doors suddenly slam open release cloud of buzzing bees the visuals of the scene are good but what makes it so surprising and frightening is the sound there was no question as who the movies stars would be even so duchovny and anderson are an interesting pair of actors and good combination both are easy on the eyes and together they have some good timing banter and energy there is hint of chemistry between them but it never gets in the way of their professional relationship they are like couple of kids out exploring the empty lot at the end of the street there might be some romantic interest but for now they are more interested in their environs than they are in each other no single element really makes this movie outstanding not even the sense of paranoia that makes the tv show so popular but enough things were done right that the xfiles is one of the more interesting summer adventures come along

many people will not find much like in what dreams may come the new visionary director vincent ward most will come see the computer animated landscapes and vibrant colors but little do they know as so plainly found out that this has quite complex story tell walking out of the theater could see the audiences disgust one member even had be awakened after the ended do not believe the previews that you see this is definitely not for everyone this is quite possibly one of the most adultoriented films come out in recent years kids will get bored the slow plotting and the complex storyline the plot is just as fluid as the heaven that ward presents us it goes back and forth in time as if it has no boundaries think of the city of angels now add more complex screenplay and more unique vision both films deal the afterlife but doubt what dreams may come will do well at the box office costing around million make the would have do extremely well in order make it is money back but due it is story doubt it will for everyone who thought titanics story was too simple and cliche here is proof that if james cameron had written more complex screenplay it may not have done nearly as well but do not get me wrong hope the does do well it is vision of pure visceral enjoyment that hardly ever gets put the screen doubt most of us could have thought of this place even in our own mind what dreams may come is the second best of the year when it comes visuals the only that surpasses it is dark city full of rich shocking colors we get see heaven that most of us would probably die get but do not do that because you will end up going hell what dreams may come begins two boats colliding on lake chris christy nielsen robin williams is startled the sudden jolt but is even more startled the beauty of the woman in the other boat annie annabella sciorra spies chris as well and both eventually bond and get married annie is an artist whose paintings are colorful lush and surrealistic chris is doctor and loves annie more than life itself they also have two children marie jessica brooks and ian josh paddock but one day the two children are killed in car crash and it almost destroys annie she tries commit suicide but fails and is then put in an institution chris copes the problem realizing they are not around anymore and nothing will change that just as annie gets her life back in order chris is killed while trying save the life of car crash victim chris goes heaven or his version of heaven rather guided albert cuba gooding jr chris explores his new surroundings pure delight and joy that is until he realizes how miserable he is without annie prior heaven he would try comfort annie but the more he was around the more pain she felt chris decides leave her alone little does he realize what will happen next am not about say because the plot point is crucial the rest of the story many critics however give it away certainly chris dying is crucial the plot but they tell you that he dies in the previews story is not necessarily important for this movie work because it deals the afterlife however strangely virtually nothing is heard of god or the devil couple of comments here and there but the story maintains its focus on chris and his search for the love of his life we are soul mates chris exclaims heaven in movies is almost always depicted as glowing city of white purity and love usually it also looks like it rests among the clouds but what dreams may come goes different route it shows us heaven that most of us have never seen before chris heaven is his memories brought life his thoughts can make anything real and he makes the paintings annie drew become his heaven have never seen anyone use real paint before albert says equally good as the depictions of hell cast away the normal stereotypes of fire and brimstone instead it is state of being in one gloriously horrific scene chris and his tracker max von sydow arrive at sea of faces thousands of heads are stuck above ground their bodies somewhere else mostly dead silent some quips are made almost as if lighten the mood it is truly frightening sequence production designer eugenio zanetti is definitely going be up for an oscar nomination using state of the art computer technology worlds are created for exploration sometimes some scenes play out as if they are only there for the visual impact it is not necessary be there but we appreciate seeing it costume designer yvonne blake who also appears in the has done an incredible job providing some interesting and colorful costumes cinematographer eduardo serra whose work was last seen in the luscious wings of the dove has difficult job as most cinematographers do working special effects but serras entire universe is computer generated image and he does masterful job writer ron bass adapting from the novel richard matheson provides very fluid screenplay no real set plot the story is extremely vague in its details allowing viewers think for themselves about the meaning and director vincent ward puts it all together into his final vision what dreams may come is good example of german expressionism may just turn off good portion of the audience your average movie goer more than likely is not used expressionistic techniques the will also definitely draw attention from religious people but they should not take it too far it is after all just movie robin williams has continuously impressed his dramatic performances while his comedic roles have been suffering his comedy is perfection when he makes up his own stuff but when is confined screenplay he is not quite as effective but drama is really his strong point and you can see that here it is doubtful he will get another oscar nomination but would not really mind if he did the real surprise here is annabella sciorra who impressed last year cop land this may be her breakout role and may garner her some much needed attention it is also quite possible that she could get an oscar nomination however the academy does not like award performances for these types of films cuba gooding jr has been better but he is certainly not distracting max von sydow is underused as are jessica brooks and josh paddock treat for some movie goers is see werner herzog appear if they even recognize him as chris father lost in the sea of faces it is not hard see why herzog would be attracted this considering he thinks that audiences are starving for great images overall it is williams and sciorras what dreams may come is rated pg for thematic elements involving death some disturbing images language and some partial nudity the is definitely aimed at more adult audience some will find the plot distracting some will find the visuals absolutely glorious and some will find both the only real problem the that could see was that it slows down considerably during the midsection just after we have been immersed in the visuals and before the search for annie begins the way some controversy even surrounded the title was mistaken for sexual term what becomes wet and you should understand in actuality the title is from soliloquy in hamlet just thought should let you know

when was growing up in boys in my school used divide into two groups based on their action movies preferences the first one myself included liked movies that featured spectacular car chases lots of machinegun fire and huge explosions the latter one preferred hong kong martial arts flicks probably because they could or be more precise thought they could imitate its stunts in the real life decades later while refining my own cinematic taste began appreciate and actually like those movies probably because of overexposure shootemup idiocy of ramboids yes most of the kung fu and other martial arts flicks were cheap they had predictable and formulaic plot and asked very little of production values aside from martial arts skills but in the same time those movies had their own rules and in the hands of capable director could become terrific guilty pleasure and source of relaxation the best of those movies one that passed the test of time and managed keep its own cult status after quarter of century was enter the dragon made in in joint hong kong venture it was intended bring bruce lees skills and kung fu philosophy the western audience it succeeded but it is still debatable whether its own merit or the unfortunate and mysterious death of bruce lee that immortalised the myth about that actor lee plays quiet shaolin monk who is martial arts expert he is approached interpol official who asks him join triannual martial arts tournament that is held on remote island owned and controlled han renegade shaolin monk interpol suspects that the martial arts business is just cover for narcotics gunrunning and prostitution operations and lee must find the evidence necessary for authorities intervene lee accepts the mission because of personal reasons oharra hans brutal bodyguard was responsible for the tragic death of lees sister years ago the island is also destination of two colourful martial arts experts from us williams played jim kelly is black activist running from the racist police and his friend roper wants make money in order pay gambling debts the plot of enter the dragon was in many ways influenced james bond the franchise itself would return favour using kung fu elements in the man the golden gun two years later the main hero was faced against powerhungry megalomaniac on remote island alone against whole army of bad guys on the other hand lee was more believable hero than bond deprived of guns and supertech gadgets he had rely only on his personal skills in order survive in the same time the plot although extremely thin allowed him even some internal battles between the natural instinct avenge his sister and his own antiviolent philosophy the latter provided some opportunities evaluate lees acting skills and some new elements his impressive screen presence although two other main actors john saxon being the obligatory good white guy and jim kelly being the obligatory black good guy were intended share top spot lee they served as nothing more than comic relief it is real shame see kelly definitely the worse actor than saxon steal the scenes from him only because his lines being the worst possible blaxploitation cliches sound so damn over the top other actors not including shih kien who turns han into typical although not very convincing bondian villain are nothing more than fist fodder for bruce lee among them is young jackie chan fighting scenes are still impressive today as they were years ago although they mostly lack gore associated that genre in many way they are also more realistic they were personally staged lee himself demanding only blow or two incapacitate or kill the opponent am not martial arts expert nor the martial arts fan but comparing those scenes typical scenes today simply cannot avoid appreciate the difference from todays movie fights when masses of bloody pulp manage get up from the floor and win in the end so despite all the obvious flaws that preclude this movie of being top of all times enter the dragon is incredibly entertaining piece of cinema and the martial arts flick that can be enjoyed even those who do not like that particular genre

one of the sweetest tales ever be made it is wonderful life is not perfect but its good natured charm and beautiful performances light up the screen glorious results probably the greatest feelgood of all time it is wonderful life aims for the heart and strikes golden arrow on christmas eve george bailey stewart is being prayed for many in the small town of bedford falls you see george is in trouble and he has always helped others who needed it this one time however god answers his prayers and sends down the lovable guardian angel clarence travers try and save george clarence has got his own problems however clarence is an angel without his wings and each time the bell rings the wings pass him the bailey case is way for him earn those magical wings and become true angel but before clarence can save george he first has go through cliffs notes version of george baileys life we see george sacrificing his hearing save his brothers life sacrificing his college education save the family business sacrificing his dream of living far away support his brother and even sacrificing his life make sure his brother is happy working somewhere else when the bank his family owns is in trouble george gives away his honeymoon money make sure the bank is not sold the evil mr potter barrymore who wants nothing less than get the baileys out of bedford falls one christmas potter gets his chance uncle billy bailey mitchell loses of the banks money without the money the bank must close down george is stuck in tremendous bind and contemplates suicide clarence the faithful servant is there just pick him up and show him what bedford would be like without george this is all leadin the very famous last scene where george finally sees what true happiness is about it is wonderful life does have its faults the movie is beginning feel dated in the details especially in the treatment of women and men the sex roles in the are weirdly out of place in the like something out of revisionist look all the men drink too much and slap their wives too much during some portions of the there are however endearing moments in all of this capra puts in just enough humor mocking the sex roles of the make the movie remarkably enjoyable the story is hackneyed and the ending feels well little too sugarish there is this uneasy feeling of sugar over everything especially the sequences where george is either in trouble or helping somebody it is little too nice for my liking at times there is however enough humor enough wit and enough of jimmy stewart get the movie through the middle part would be the most difficult but watching it is wonderful life is never boring or difficult it is always interesting right until the finale for all its sugar makes delightful sense and is beautifully done capra does have his monumental cliches but the actors relish them and overplay everything perfection donna reed is perfect as the loving obeidient wife and lionel barrymore is gloriously grump as mr potter everyone else is magnificent including bert and ernie ward bond and frank faylen there is general sense of goodness as if everyone in the knows that they are making great and they relish that stewart however is the king of all of this he is sometimes awkward especially when saying merry christmas all objects animate or inanimate but he is james stewart and he is lovably delightful throughout the have complained should not have this is really good movie no this is great movie better yet this is phenomenal movie there is reason classics are invented make sure that people will always have great movies aid them in their quest for living life this is one of those films it is feelgood movie something people complain little too much about but capras reworking of christmas carol is the greatest christmas movie of all time there have said it have admit the first time saw this saw it my family including my year old kid sister they all loved it they loved george his wife his troubles and the beautiful ending is it little too sugarcoated maybe no matter this is that should be watched time and time again families around coffee table and eggnog on the plate it is that just makes you feel good about life family and hope it is the perfect christmas flaws and all it is frank capras greatest acheivement and that really does say lot for about out of minutes this movie is flawless the rest can be excused no is perfectly flawless cannot get over how much love this movie and how much you will after watching it digesting it and sitting your family appreciating how special life really is

of circumcision psychic wounds and the family sitcom the opening segment is something of foretaste of this there is guys voice telling us how he tries imagine what his biological parents look like and on the screen we see images of variety of oldish men and women as his imagination plays n he and we picture these motley characters in mixandmatch shuffle of unlikely marriages businesswomen bums matrons paint salesmen the images coming on in faster and faster frenzy it is not just witty funny summing up of the themes you might not guess it yet but it sets the pattern for the way the story goes on what starts out as step in fairly sensible direction gets taken on road trip put through detour or two and finds itself freewheeling towards an immin ent crash that may not sound so different from the average family sitcom and the general idea of the does not at first seem so wildly distant from standardissue comedy man who was adopted as child ben still er sets out on journey meet his real parents along his wife patricia arquette his baby and pretty psychologyresearcher tea leoni in tow various mixups shenanigans oddball characters and yup disasters follow but if you think you have been here before the dialogue and the direction david russell who made spanking the monkey take it into another dimension the dreaded tname seems an inevitable reference point what drug overdose scene and the casting of arquette from true romance but really the point is that the footmassage master has not got monopoly on plot twists and fast funny irreverent lines or on the absurdities of ordinary speech whether it is about circumcision psychic wounds oral sex carjacking the beauties of the armpit area or ronald reagan the script never seems run out of hilarious invention the best thing is how these words are not just there for the punchlines but are great precisely because they are said in character like tea leonis neuroticallycharged psychobabbler who is able say under assault it is understandable if you find this threatening the cast is excellent throughout and rather than singling out anybody kudos are due the fine ensemble acting the sometimes frenetically overlapping dialogue and the sense of dozen different reagents colliding the point of fission there are some elements of woody allen in this not mention the handheld camera and loose improvisational feel of some scenes like allen russells interests are in the volatile sexual politics of couples and the neurotic obsessions in both pare nts and children and everybody really still if you are expecting privileged moment of revelation and emotional outpouring la murphy brown frasier fillintheblankamericancomedy well it will not happen the sets up expectations like these the lead characters search or his origins and his hopes of selfhealing only knock them down if the conventional sitcom structure is put slightly loopy family in catastrophic conditions only rediscover their essential lovey oneness flirting disasters charact ers embark on journey seek that essential state but find themselves only plunging into more weirdness and dysfunctional chaos the further they go and that the suggests is the essential family state and you better learn love it somehow this is perversely feelgood cinema right up its manic end

nosferatu the vampyre germany review mike watson copyright mike watson this extraordinary retelling of bram stokers dracula german filmmaker werner herzog deserves the most prominent of places in cinematic vampire lore inspired w murnaus silent of the same name herzogs is work of exquisite bleakness an oddly touching tragedy beautiful and uniquely haunting quality that lingers long afterwards the original fulllength english and german language versions of nosferatu have at last received video release s distributor anchor bay entertainment and in gorgeous widescreen prints until now only shortened english language version of the was available on video and only in europe both of these rereleases restore the its full length but viewers should still be wary of the english version due its often stilted dialogue apparently the english dialogue coach herzog had on the set during filming was incompetent and some of the voices also seem be dubbed the german version english subtitles remains the definitive one everyone knows the story of dracula or do they his story has been so bastardised on over the years that brief reminder of the basic plot certainly will not hurt jonathan harker is young lawyer sent the gloomy castle dracula in transylvania do business creepy count played klaus kinski who wants buy house in harkers hometown upon seeing photo of harkers wife the radiant isabelle adjani he instantly falls in love her locking harker up in his castle he sets off on long journey meet this woman whose beauty so bewitches him upon divining his identity as vampire adjani seduces the count and lures him his death one morning as the sun rises that is story familiar millions but herzog has elevated stokers tale into the realm of and use this term tad reluctantly cinematic art nosferatu is as much meditation as it is shot through blueish and white filters and peopled characters who perform as if they were half hypnotised the films surreal dreamlike quality is utterly mesmerising there is much enjoy but will limit my praise few key points holding the together is kinskis remarkable performance as count dracula past screen portrayals including bela lugosis famous turn have largely been one dimensional and tended towards camp but kinski oh boy this is something far more compelling aided startling makeup job he portrays draculas vampirism not simply as pure evil but as some sort of loathsome disease this man is dreadfully lonely he lives in utter solitude shunned the locals for his hideous appearance and reputation for bloodlust kinskis portrayal of the count is both creepy and deeply affecting when he dies you almost feel as if this mans tortured soul has been freed at last then there is the unforgettable soundtrack largely composed german group popul vuh it is so eerily beautiful and evocative that it is quite impossible imagine the without it popul vuh are longtime herzog collaborators and play an ancientsounding kind of spacemusic using piano chants and exotic instruments when first saw this some years ago was so impressed tracked down and bought number of their albums the one still listen the most is tantric songs from most of the music in nosferatu is taken it is testament the musics depth that it is as powerful without the pictures as it is them the album is still available on the highly respected ambient and world music label celestial harmonies this is timely rerelease anchor bay after francis ford coppolas unscary and woefully overblown version of bram stokers tale in it is joy go back herzogs and see the amazing things he has done what is now centuryold story some aficionados nosferatu is quite simply the greatest vampire ever made without doubt it is an unmistakable classic of the genre do not miss it

even if did not know that director and cowriters james wong and jeffrey reddick of the creepy final destination helped create the hit television show the xfiles would have inevitably made connection the similarities are very apparent from the inexplicable phenomenon like plot the mysterious characters the overall dark ominous settings it would have been perfectly fitting see fbi agents mulder and scully investigate this case they witness stuff like this on weekly basis in fact mulder and scully would have been much more welcome change the bland one dimensional fbi agents seen in this movie another more important similarity is that both succeed in entertaining and thrilling at the same time this is great accomplishment for teen horror movie especially when compared some of the trash of the same genre released in the last couple of years urban legend and still know what you did last summer are classic examples from the bunch what helps final destination is its unique premise unlike
