your average horror flick in some invincible psycho knife chases blonde cheerleaders the villain presented is unusual it is the grim reaper this being already has predestined when and how you will die according the brief history lesson given in this everyone was meant die at certain time some people at others at whatever death chooses what is unique about death is that it is already dead so you cannot really kill it the only way defeat death is cheat it the question is how do you do that this dilemma is what faces alex and group of teenagers alex has been having some dreams that the airplane will take his class on trip paris will crash leaving no survivors alex begins realize that his dreams are little too real and eventually gets himself and six others kicked off the plane right before it takes off shortly after the plane does indeed crash leaving some of the seven survivors confused and others feeling immortal however death is not through them yet it gradually kills off the seven one one leaving those currently still alive frantically trying trick death again the plot allows for some of the most creative original death scenes have seen in while some scenes build up the perfect amount of tension until an elaborate climax others are so unexpected they will leave your jaw wide open in shock creativity and originality are two adjectives lacking in most horror films nowadays but final destination is not like most horror films sure it has your traditional share of jerks and outsiders ali larters character is particularly annoying but the shocks from the beginning the end are extremely entertaining also director wong has the sense not take the movie too seriously he knows its just another entertaining guilty pleasure that will not win any academy awards not even golden globe the myriad of inside jokes and gags the characters are named after famous horror directors one character who plays jerk is named carter like xfiles creator chris carter and song john denver who died in plane crash plays whenever death is near show this movie is bunch of guys having good time making movie and from this had great time watching the movie

take number fill out form and wait your turn starring kati outinen kari n nen sakari kuosmanen elina salo written directed aki kaurism ki cinematography timo salminen it might be possible call drifting clouds satire or black comedy but that would imply sense of anger of vitriol of energy drifting clouds is what you get when the rage and vitality are gone it is the sad slow story of lauri and ilona married couple caught between the wheels of capitalism as it grinds inexorably onward he loses his job as tram driver because everyone drives cars nowadays within couple of months she loses her position as head waiter when her restaurant is bought out chain and the entire staff replaced conversation early in the reveals lot about their situation lauri has surprised ilona buying her tv she greets little enthusiasm she notes that they have not finished paying for the bookshelves or the couch yet he says that in four years the payments will be done and then they can buy some books for the shelves it would pass as deadpan humour if it was not spoken such resigned weariness this sets the tone for the rest of the movie there is humour and idiosyncracy at the periphery but at the centre there is frustration and futility and sorrow for the ways in the logic of profit reduces people until their worth is equated solely their earning capacity there is an element of political commentary in this critique of the mechanisms of capitalism and the stultifying social environment it creates but in drifting clouds the political is subsumed the personal the movie is about two people and what happens them and nothing else matters lauri and ilona live lives starved for friendship respect culture passion they go the movies and walk out past old posters for latalante and largent but the movie they have just seen is pointless violent unfunny comedy their house and workplaces are uniformly unpleasant painted and upholstered in lifeless colours ugly greens dull reds insipid blues full of inelegantly functional objects and appliances the art design is impeccable in its tawdriness and director aki kaurism ki often matches the colour of characters clothes the background colour andor lighting so that it seems as if they are almost physically fading into the environment there is no suggestion of sexuality in the relationship ilona and lauri sleep in separate beds and their gestures of affection lack the heat of desire their lives are now bound something more complex and desperate than love their downward downsized downtrodden lives have momentum that is almost comic as one setback succeeds another bottoming out when lauri stakes all their remaining money on the spin of roulette wheel it must have been tempting play the story for more laughs more farce more deadpan wit but the films great strength is the sober empathic manner in it observes lauri and ilonas misfortunes irony would be an injustice situations and settings are broad and exaggeratedthis is not realismbut they are not distorted the emotions are authentic if it is difficult laugh at anything that happens despite the droll performances the laconic humour that is because kaurism ki brings such compassion and understanding the manifold indignities that are suffered he shows us how humiliating it must be for woman of thirtyeight who has worked long and hard win respectable position be forced accept job as dishwasher in twobit restaurant how humiliating it must be for man nearing confront his wifes former employer demanding the rest of her wages only have the crap beaten out of him unable land single punch when the employer and his cronies refuse give him the money all this is observed keenly great economy every cut every line of dialogue is judicious if most films are novelistic in their telling this one brings the focus and concentration of short story bear but what is gained in nuance and acumen is rather undermined the sense that the material barely accommodates the minute running length have seen many movies far less profound less humane less necessary than drifting clouds but they filled me an urge watch them again and this one did not it does not need be seen twice its every detail and implication can be absorbed in one viewing it is not movie that will be seen large audience because it cannot be pitched one there is no selling point it is all understatement restraint melancholy the characters are unremarkable their best years behind them their dreams dissipated it takes all the effort they can muster just pay the bills this does not make them less fascinating merely less marketable is shame because this is movie should be seen precisely because it pays attention people and emotions that most movies prefer ignore it engages us and touches us and resolvessurprisingly and movinglyinto something resembling happy ending the only thing greater than the illluck that governs the characters lives is their refusal give in despair their persistence is rewarded what might be called feelgood ending elsewhere but not here because this ending differs in kind from most such endings this one has truly been earned

ingredients london gal fate true love running joke about monty pythons spanish inquisition synopsis american actress gwyneth paltrow dark hair playing londoner believe it sliding doors is love what if story the gimmick is that it is really two stories the follows the life of helen gwyneth paltrow down two directions in the beginning likeable gal helen gwyneth paltrow gets unexpectedly fired from her advertising job so she goes into the subway train station meaning return home early her apartment and her sleeping livein lover gerry john lynch helen does not know it but she is at fateful junction in life if she enters through the sliding door of london subway train her life takes one path one future if she stays on the platform her life takes another path different future the shows what happens in both paths switching back and forth between intertwined parallel stories in story one helen meets charming and talkative monty python fan named james john hannah on the train arriving home early she discovers that her livein gerry john lynch is having sex his former lover lydia jeanne tripplehorn this leads life where helen moves out helens winsome new friend james helps her recover from broken heart and encourages her start her own business in story two helen experiences different fate she misses the train never meets james and does not get home early enough discover gerrys infidelity in this new life helen takes up odd menial jobs and faces the constant sneaking suspicion that all is not right her relationship gerry will the truth of the heart finally work its way through number of problems and setbacks in both scenarios opinion rejoice all ye monty python fans gwyneth paltrow fans and watchers of quirky romance flicks at last heres proof that there is still creativity in filmmaking sliding doors is refreshingly different from anything this year not only is it wellacted heartwarming but it is also easily gwyneth paltrows best recent performance when helen paltrow screams that her unfaithful boyfriend is shagging wanker british phrase better left untranslated she sounds like she knows what she is talking about nor does sliding doors go overboard formulaic true love or other stereotypes nobody scrambles around in danger screaming will find you no matter what my darling when helen finds herself on boat in the starlight james she does not take the easy way out and leap into his arms since she is supposed be recovering from heartache and handsome livein boyfriend gerry is not the stereotypical screen hunk either stud or snob instead he is nervous and indecisive almost helpless hunk another example when one of the protagonists lies wounded in hospital sliding doors gives us neither the hospital miracle nor maudlin tragedy but surprises us third variation in other words all of the characters seem nonstereotyped human and local there are minor inconveniences since sliding doors switches back and forth between two possible fates it is occasionally difficult distinguish between the two distinguishing between the two stories is not problem in the scenes containing paltrow who sports two different hairstyles but in scenes containing only lydia and gerry who look the same in both stories it is slightly confusing also quite few snappy comebacks referring american pop culture seinfeld woody allen etc are spoken the british characters but these seem slightly forced given that the remaining dialogue is predominantly british slang possibly an attempt the screenwriter balance the british so that american audiences can feel more comfortable sliding doors is charming quirky original happy romance little philosophy of fate thrown in monty python and the meaning of fate anybody

sick the life and death of bob flanagan supermasochist fernando vallejo starring bob flanagan and sheree rose interviews kathe burkhart kirby dick and rita valencia produced and directed kirby dick running time mins this is not rated the central themes of sick the life and death of bob flanagan supermasochist are pain and love and its subsequent effect on persons life its protagonist bob flanagan who died at the age of suffered from cystic fibrosis mortal disease debilitates the lungs saturating them thick coats of mucus preventing him from normal breathing the movie is about much more than recouperating or attempting from this disease an audacious fabulously triumphant docudrama sick chronicles the life of flanagan and his vicious unthinkable acts of sadomasochism conducted his mistress of years sheree rose who amazingly provided much of the footage for the flanagans idelogy crosses the realms of rebelliousness and becomes transcendental similar terry zwigoffs brilliant crumb also explored the dysfunction of an artist painting not sympathetic portrait but realistic one both crumb and flanagan revelled in their defects but flanagan was not only man content on enduring the pain via lungs he inflicted acts of pain on himself at very young age courageously defying god he was an irish catholic and turning his body into work of art he unraveled in museums and lectures behold these works of physical art among them is metal ball inserted inside his anus and the most disturbing scene of the decade nailing his penis board flanagan was man of great intelligence wit and humor as well as adopting sense of candidness scarcely seen in modern filmmaking not only did he approach his disease humor peforming burlesque acts in front of an audience he was also revitalized his approachment most cystic fibrosis do not make it past their earlier twenties there is also subplot involving female devotee who knew death was awaiting her but the most outstanding thing about sick is flanagans relationship sheree brimming honesty sensual stimulation and unapologetically sad moments of pain their powerful bond lifts sick into rare cinematic high where we forget we are in an auditorium and become part of these people the last scene where we see the hero murmuring the last words his wife in hospital bed as he struggles for his last moments of life is raw tender hideous it goes step beyond cinematic intimacy

studio expectations must not have been high for great expectations the films release date was pushed from late december late january at what appeared be the last minute therefore putting any academy awards chances it has off until this time in it is actually smart move because while this updated take on the charles dickens tale is not quite oscar fodder it is strong enough be distinguished from the cinematic dumping ground that usually makes up the first five or six weeks of any given year great expectations also demonstrates how modernize classic story right especially after the excruciatingly wretched excesses of baz luhrmanns william shakespeares romeo juliet great expectations opens somewhere in florida the original story is set in thcentury england as eightyearold finn jeremy james kissner meets trio of people who will have profound effect on his life in the future there is icy yearold estella raquel beaudene pseudoplaymate of finns ms dinsmoor anne bancroft estellas auntie who is quite offkilter over past romance that never took off and mysterious prisoner robert de niro whom finn saves the life of finn who lives his sisters affable boyfriend lone stars chris cooper fancies himself an aspiring artist and proves his prowess whipping up an unusual portrait of estella using only ms dinsmoors lipstick eyebrow pencil and the wallpaper from her dilapidating mansion flash forward into the after brief stop in the and finn now played ethan hawke despondent over strange hotandcold relationship the elusive estella gwyneth paltrow receives quite bit of money from an unknown benefactor it is enough cash send him new york focus on career in art there finn seems gain everything he could ever want wealth prestige and high place in the glamorous art world when estella resurfaces albeit an aloof fianc hank azaria finn also sees the chance renew their mutual attraction but she is not the only ghost from finns past that is going be paying him visit comparisons the aforementioned romeo juliet seem inevitable since these films are the only ones in recent memory plop classic drama into current setting great expectations is much better venture though because it treats its source evenhanded respect where romeo was never quite sure whether be spoof homage or both the movie is visual banquet thanks emmanuel lubezkis sexy cinematography notably he captures revisited fountain kiss between the two leads luscious erotic charge that is steamier than the films surprisingly muted love scenes the eclectic rock soundtrack compliments the onscreen action beautifully especially new songs tori amos mono and duncan sheik acting credits are firstrate often hiding the screenplays occasional slipups hawke is sincere and solid as leading man something we also learned from gattaca and his finn is quite likeable guy paltrows estella on the other hand is rather underdeveloped while the actress is at her icily seductive best we are not told very much about her character and as result it is often hard understand why finn would appreciate her beyond physical level but oh what physical level sometimes we root for finn although we do not quite understand why she is fueling his fire robert de niro is nice and sophisticated in the benevolent kind of role he rarely gets play on the other end of the acting spectrum is bancroft macabre throaty delight who mambos and sucks down cigarettes an eerie enthusiasm that would make norma desmond jealous alfonso cuarons visually elegant direction helps distract from the dry moments that pop up more frequently around the movies climax another problem is predictability you can guess your way through the plot even if you are not familiar the story despite its script flaws though great expectations is undeniably romantic without being corny or gloppy and frankly it is nice see that embraces softened sensuality other than explicit sexuality perhaps that renovated release date awfully close valentines day will end up helping great expectations seemingly average box office chances after all

seen december at m at the crossgates mall cinema guilderland ny theater matt perreault and my sister jena for free matt paid using prepaid passes if there is ever been an exception the perils of excessive cliches and non stop action the james bond films are it and if there is ever been james bond that not only proves this but does so pushing it the extreme tomorrow never dies is it opening sequences almost always make or break action films when done properly not only are they actually exciting but they foreshadow things come this starts off on the right foot establishing the kind of atmosphere that could only be found in an action movie but sense of the selfaware enclosed universe where james bond movies take place in first there is hightech slightly complicated scene involving british warship crossing into unfriendly chinese waters there is definite tension as there seems be an unknown but certainly hostile third party involved who is manipulating both sides when the scene ends in tragedy it is clear there is some kind of powerful conspiracy going on and who else call on for such case but james bond the uses good judgment in the way it introduces us bond brosnon as the enemy was portrayed as evil and mysterious bond is clearly and obviously depicted as an outandout hero he singlehandedly takes out small army of terrorists and then must escape in the nick of time flying away in fighter jet while the copilot tries strangle him and terrorist in another jet tries shoot him down this might sound like the kind of cliches films like this are notorious for over using but it works here because the knows how get our attention quickly it is not about the payoff because it is obvious bond will escape instead it is the way it processes the action sequences going over the top and not apologizing for it all the while creating for witty hysterical comedy it seems less emphasis is placed on the villains in thrillers anymore because of political correctness and just plain coppingout on behalf of the filmmakers even the term villain sounds passe what the deserves kudos for is its ability create villain as heinous as they come yet making him seem completely plausible jonathon pryce delivers perfect performance as the arrogant cunning elliot carver media mogul whose goal is take over the world that is through his massive media empire not through nuclear weapons through some interesting detective work bond and the english ministry of defense believe carver is behind the trouble brewing in the southern asian seas as way create and accurately cover his own news not only is that an original idea for conflict but one could carry over into reality surprisingly this is about as detailed as the story allows the specific plot become the films hook is the action and of course those cool gadgets and we get plenty of that here as bond goes out investigate carver and finds himself in jam or two along the way the story works much like bond himself always on the run and concentrates more on the individual conflicts than any general plot somehow chinese agent wai lin yeoh bumps into bond few too many times and they find themselves working together the chemistry between brosnon and yeoh is rigid but also works because of this not in spite of it the two are constantly on the run from carver and his goons yet the manages balance the stunts and special effects its clever story although tomorrow never dies is far from perfect it is quite an impressive in terms of its ability be so cliche and cartoony and not make plausibility an issue

james jones one of the major novelists from the middle of the twentieth century has written number of fictional works about the effects of war on the individual veteran of world war ii and witness the pearl harbor bombings his novels are not only grounded in realism but poetic in nature they are reminiscent of stephen crane in their blunt eloquence trait lends itself razorsharp focus but perhaps none matches the scope of his autobiographical novel the thin red line now cinematic masterpiece from director terrence malick the books principal cast some thirty characters has been trimmed down for this rendition but it still retains its most endearing value each of the roles has an everyman quality emphasizing jones examination of world war ii on the american soldier there is definitive chain of command present and this also plays on the motivations of the cast but most importantly and perhaps intrinsic the novel but not the movie dynamic and effective voiceover is used malick has several characters relating their thoughts giving the viewer greater perspective of the issues at stake the issues at stake are many and one told from limited thirdperson perspective as opposed topdown omniscient view the movie entails the struggle of an american infantry company cforcharlie take hill during the conflict at guadalcanal the south pacific island is seen the top brass as the key position for american armed forces hold if they want win the war and want win the war they do in an excellent performance nick nolte plays cforcharlies commanding officer lt col gordon tall he is an aging soldier who embodies the winatallcosts mentality if only impress his superior john travolta in questionable cameo this philosophy is opposite that of captain bugger staros elias koteas who dearly values the life of each and every one of the men under his command at the front are the privates and corporals adrien brody james caviezel ben chaplin et al lead st sgt welsh sean penn who must actually execute the suicide orders handed down them the thin red line is filled intense visual poetry but it is nearly three hours long although the interest level is high throughout the first two hours the climax comes fortyfive minutes before the end of the movie it goes without saying that the movie drags on the back end the thin red line will doubtless be compared other masterpiece of war saving private ryan countless number of times but do so is belittle both films for although similarities abound so do differences director malick has story tell and for those interested in listening this can be very outstanding movie

an energetic visually stunning but intellectually hollow recreation of the mysterious life of jeanne darc in history jeanne darc is lost in an ocean of mystery and controversy creates the perfect launching pad for talented and creative directors who can basically alter the story as they wish she came in time where people desperately needed saint hero that could rescue them for misery and deliver peace and happiness directorwriter luc besson nikita leon portrays his version of the peasant girl who commanded the armies of france and was burned at the stake for witchcraft besson tries recreate the person behind the legend he tries not show her as saint or villain he shows her as human being in time where blood was almost pouring from the sky and the air smelled of rotten flesh it is hard keep your sanity the only support and hope is in god at the age of jeanne milla jovovich watches her own sister murdered and raped the english soldiers this terrible event makes lasting impact on jeannes mind god is no longer her support he has become her obsession she starts seeing visions and signs that command her raise an army and free france from the siege of the english tyranny the help of the wise yolande daragon faye dunaway and charles vii john malcovich whose grand royal ambitions and life are at stake jeanne raises an army and marches towards the english walls after this the stays mostly on the battlefield where besson demonstrates his ability direct amazing action sequences only occasionally resorting calmer tempo the movie is filled dreamy symbolic images of pure artistic craftsmanship that create surreal and occasionally paranoiac atmosphere the is lost in time and space hysterically jumping back and forth in jeannes thoughts imagination and conscience bessons visual style permits the audience enter the medieval age feel the smell of fresh blood and the adrenaline pumping in your body in the heat of battle but the is far from being flawless the script needs lot of polishing except for jeanne there are no real characters and although grand star cast is assembled their characters are nothing more than props not more alive than the costumes that they are wearing as for the maiden of lorraine herself she is portrayed as simple girl too small for her divine task in the latter part of the we see her as hysterical confused and on the brink of madness her past purity and innocence for ever lost jovovich handles the part more panache than one might expect but though her screen time is incredible excessive both malcovich being john malcovich and dunaway titus surpass her rather overacted and simply unprofessional performance and even hoffman manages breathe some life into his dreadfully small part besides casting jovovich bessons only mistake is his extreme sense of patriotism that in the end ruins his so gloriously crafted painting there are some viscously evil englishmen that murder pillage and betray smile on their faces and some incredibly brave and noble frenchmen represented the three musketeers of this story the brave gilles de rais vincent cassel the wise aulon desmond harrington and the strong la hire richard ridings though all those actor perform well their characters are nothing more than symbols banners that proclaim the glory of france and thus there is no sense of realism in this the messenger has muscles instead of brains there is some relief in the end where besson lays down his armor and starts thinking dustin hoffmans appearance helps and the ends elegantly and surprisingly effective climax worthy of praise jeannes character is unlocked but whether god was in the picture or not is never quite explained was she confused peasant girl driven her own hunger for revenge or was she truly messenger of god the poses as many questions as answers and nothing is completely obvious bess messenger is nothing more than fairly good it is not much that you remember of it after you leave the theater maybe the sound the dreamy sequences but certainly not the dialogue it is an elegant and adrenaline pumping history lesson for the mtvgeneration that although presents some interesting material works better when it is on the battlefield

i am not quite sure what say about mars attacks is obviously the work of deranged genius when tim burtons twisted alien invasion comedy really works it is breathtaking and hilarious in equal measure and when it does not work it is just dull am not even sure it works more often than it does not but where it counts that is when this gleefully evil invading force from the red planet gets down the business of blasting us kingdom come mars attacks is brilliant mars attacks is based on rather unsavory series of trading cards released topps in the and it takes its cues from the same sources as this summers independence day old alien invasion flicks disaster movies and bigbudget special effects extravaganzas but unlike independence day was painfully middleoftheroad appeal the hearts minds and wallets of america mars attacks has fully developed and very personal sense of wonder about it the big difference is that while independence day celebrated the resilience of human beings mars attacks portrays us as the greedy and hapless schmucks that we are the title sequence is just splendid an incredible swarm of flying saucers rises out of the canals of the red planet and then storms earthward through the solar system in formation the spinning metal saucers are dead ringers for the invading forces of movies past and their first appearance on the big screen in combination danny elfmans thundering theremindriven score is absolutely jawdropping it is so overwhelming that swear you had trouble breathing the movie lays low for the next minutes we get glimpse of the alien leader resplendent in purplesequined cape when television message is broadcast the people of the world naturally the only way communicate earthlings is preempt our regularly scheduled programming but mostly the first act is spent developing characters setting up mildly comic situations and drawing quirky but dishearteningly drab picture of america according tim burton it is good thing that the most compelling personality in the movie belongs the aliens because burtons just not interested in making more than caricatures out of his human stars anyone who comes mars attacks expecting see lot of one favorite actor is bound be disappointed few exceptions these characters are dispatched as the progresses jack nicholson is lot of fun as the president of the united states but fizzles as sleazy las vegas hotel developer rod steiger does an amusing enough take on dr strangeloves buck turgidson glenn close brings some star power the role of the first lady and martin short is presidential aide who meets the martians in the white houses kennedy room secluded nook where he unwittingly tries seduce an alien dressed up as bighaired pointybreasted sexpot lisa marie the burton flame who played vampira in ed wood in an earlier scene it is made clear that the aliens studied human sexuality in the pages of an old issue of playboy sarah jessica parker hosts her own tv show and michael fox is her newsman husband the octogenarian sylvia sidney has funny part as the old woman who cackles they blew up congress and plays decisive role in the defeat of the alien menace jim brown and tom jones are the films vegasbased heroes and director barbet schroeder reversal of fortune has funny cameo as the unfortunate french president also on hand and underutilized are annette bening pierce brosnan pam grier lukas haas and natalie portman the latter two also show up in woody allens everyone says love you the real stars of course are the computergenerated martians and they are fantastic bare brains glistening atop their grinning skullfaces round eggeyes red pupils darting this way and that these animated invaders are malevolence incarnate joe dantes gremlins are the closest equivalent in recent memory but burtons little monsters are more inventive the films raison detre are the scenes of crimes against mankind the most famous monuments of the world crumble under the alien assault easter island is turned into bowling alley and the nasty little buggers perform hideous medical experiments on captured humans the sheer level of mayhem is staggering especially when the aliens make their first attack blasting human beings into iridescent skeletons parents are urged pay special attention the pg rating it is earned the special effects vary from charming astonishing deliciously cheesy and at least couple of shots of mass destruction seem have been engineered specifically in response independence day although mars attacks was in production long before that films release cinematographer peter suschitzky who makes the most of wynn thomass wildly imaginative production design thomas helped define the spike lee style actually took time off from his mars attacks regimen shoot crash for david cronenberg cronenbergs movie will almost certainly be more somber it will not be released in the s until early next year but mars attacks is surely similarly elegant nightmare this is not nice movie and studio executive was duped into giving burton million make it setting the films final scenes in the nearly empty holocaustravaged america that independence day conveniently avoided burtons invasion epic suggests that the world we have got may not be worth saving until many of the people on it are dead the victims of his invasion are naive greedy or disastrously selfabsorbed and good thing too since the movies wicked charm is dependent on our ability take this invasion partly as wishfulfillment fantasy the surviving cast members are the innocents and the entertainers who triumph determining that the alien invaders the ultimate elitists are actually susceptible the kitschiest strains of american pop culture ultimately this messy masterpiece is the years funniest comedy and weird winking affirmation of the power of the people

capsule trippy hyperspeed action machine from hong kongs accomplished tsui hark van damme and rodman have nice chemistry the stunts are eyepopping and stuff gets blowed up real good what more do you want admit was all set loathe double team it reeked of cheapjack timingoriented marketing stick dennis rodman in movie quick while he is hot and do something about jeanclaude van dammes flagging career while we are at it surprise double team transcends its dumb roots and turns out be mess of fun bring some friends get some pretzels and have blast van damme is jack quinn an exagent who is brought back in for one last mission you would think any spy worth his shoe phone would run like hell when he hears those words but van dammes character has pregnant wife who is also sculptor and some unpleasant pressure gets used get him come through on this mission he is been assigned take down an old enemy terrorist named stavros mickey rourke looking oddly subdued who may be back up his old tricks in the first showdown between quinn and stavros the movie wears its ambitions proudly on its sleeve nonstop action an amusement park hospital private retired spy retreat most of rome various houses planes cars and other modes of transport and the coliseum all become arenas for some of the most bonerattling shootouts and punchouts filmed they are better seen than described and are reason enough see the one jawdropping scene has van damme taking on man who uses switchblade his feet van damme is good dextrous athlete and fighter but he is often upstaged there are other nice touches stavros and quinn both want the same thing retire in peace their families that ambition ties them together in various ways and also humanizes them bit one of the things about hk action movies is that there is always some form of human element and that is carried over into this movie as well it gives weight scenes that would otherwise be forgettable also good is dennis rodman playing weapons dealer named yaz character who sticks out like fistful of broken fingers and who is funny just standing there rodman is natural on screen he is fun watch especially when slinging bad guys like basketballs and deserves get movie of his own based on what is seen here lightweight fastmoving entertainment that showcases all of its pieces excellently

the heartbreak kid reviewed on aug th starring charles grodin cybill sheppard eddie albert in the heartbreak kid charles grodin plays one of the most unbelievably obnoxious characters have seen on screen in long time he is guy who spends virtually the entire running time of the movie bullshitting his way from one situation another doubt he ever expressed any genuine feeling at all during the as the opens he has just gotten married and is on the way miami beach for his honeymoon halfway there he begins resent his bride the time he arrives at his hotel and has met the cybill sheppard character he is ready divorce his wife as played grodin this character is the type of person that nothing will ever be good enough for him the phrase the grass is always greener on the other side of the fence was practically written him in mind however if he finds something he really wants he will pursue it for as long as it takes the only problem is once he has it he immediately loses interest the end of the heartbreak kid is both hilarious and sad for that very reason charles grodin is at his smarmy best here and sheppard is quite appealing as the object of grodins desire however the real scene stealer is jeannie berlin daughter of director elaine may as grodins whiny bride she owns every scene that she is in and makes you almost want root for what the grodin character is trying do the heartbreak kid was written neil simon and it shows simon loves deconstruct and analyze human relationships and he is at the top of his game here as maddeningly obnoxious as the grodin character is he is the type of guy that everyone knows the character of george costanza on seinfeld seems have been modelled after him the only problem the is that it is not that funny and it is billed as comedy as much as could see the realism in the characters it would have been nice have chuckle here and there the heartbreak kid is not date movie it has an extremely negative view of relationships so seeing it girlfriendboyfriend could be hazardus your health

it is curious thing have found that when willis is not called on carry the whole movie he is much better and so is the movie even though in the sixth sense he is the name he does not have the pivotal role that honour goes haley osment who plays cole sear cute pun seer year old boy who can see ghosts if osment was cute or precious the director going for the maudlin this would be nothing more than movieoftheweek thankfully osment is not only better than that but in some instances blows everyone else off the screen in bravura performance we get see his fears vulnerabilities strengths and intelligence makes the sixth sense one of the best movies have seen this year the whole cast matches him in quality willis giving fairly low key performance that matches the subject matter one thing about this movie its target this is not sfxfest like the haunting or gorefest this is more what would call supernatural drama more interested in characters than in dazzling you makeup one caveat there is lovely twist in the movie something like the usual suspects where you end up replaying the movie in your head rethinking what you have just seen was extremely lucky see it as sneak preview in toronto before any hype or critical reviews were out so went in no biases if anyone want talk about the movie before you see it do not let them let the director explain on his own pace and you will enjoy the movie vastly more

i will be the first admit did not expect much from the emperors new groove more celine dionesque songanddance numbers cuddly characters that become crosspromotion devices in mcdonalds happy meals and stars trying gain credibility adding voiceover job their resume was dead wrong about all of those things the emperors new groove is funny damn funny and the cute characters in the are the dangerous ones the script is fast and furious no singing and dancing the animation is clean and would give walt warm feeling all over the humor is dry and aimed at both the cynicism and the goodness in all of us the story is ridiculously weird and comes off as strange acid trip involving talking crossdressing llamas and schizophrenia heres the plot try follow along set in mythical kingdom the follows the adventures of kuzco david spade an arrogant and egocentric emperor when kuzco fires his powerhungry advisor yzma eartha kitt she and her assistant kronk seinfelds patrick warburton change him into llama kuzco then gets stranded in the jungle and must rely on pacha john goodman llamaherder whose home was be replaced kuzcos water world theme park save him then the fun starts for the next sixty minutes the audience is treated something unheard of in disney films these days imagination yzma voiced the talented singer eartha kitt looks like cross between norma desmond joan crawford and really old vegas showgirl the dialogue between her and her oblivious assistant kronk is quick sharp and feels like an episode of seinfeld would make sense david spade and john goodmans character interactions make you feel like you are watching an old hopecrosby spade is beyond dry his humor and shoots below the belt on several occasions and laughed out loud several times needless say that is an extremely rare thing in disney screenings these days the best part about the emperors new groove is how audacious the is the sheer weirdness factor is very high crossdressing schizophrenia duality of soul people being turned into every animal on noahs boat llama cpr homoerotic tendencies an emperor his own theme song and singer michael jackson dance moves and guy that can communicate squirrel are only few of the oddities that make the true orginal simply put the emperors new groove is one of the best childrens films out for this holiday season kids will enjoy the adventures and parents will enjoy the story and dialogue that is tough thing pull off in single package but this emperor manages do it

before even seeing single frame of the it would be easy snicker at deep impact in comet on collision course earth threatens the existence of all life on the planet it is the latest entry in this decades dubious revival of the disaster and the first of two the sky is falling flicks hit screens this year the other being this coming julys armageddon in meteor is the threat its tagline oceans rise cities fall hope survives is not as cornball as that of the utterly ridiculous collapsing tunnel thriller daylight they came in alone the only way out is together but it is every bit as treacly the opening moments of deep impact offer more snicker at the cheesiness is not confined the disaster movie conventions such as the usual opening roll call in all the major characters and their personal problems are introduced the most prominent of the personal stories is that of ambitious tv news reporter jenny lerner tea leoni who is distraught that her father maximilian schell left her mother vanessa redgrave for younger woman rya kihlstedt what is just as snickerworthy is how this coventure between paramount and dreamworks skg aggressively pushes another highprofile corporate collaboration microsoft and nbcs cable news network msnbc employs jenny who is the films ostensible main character in the vision of america presented here msnbc is the television news source of choice in every home when in reality it only reaches fraction of the country the initial signs point toward something along the lines of volcano or dantes peak but there is one thing about deep impact underestimated the skills of director mimi leder she won an emmy for her helming work on nbcs smash er is essentially weekly disaster movie each episode featuring new set of guest stars their own personal and medical crises the challenge presented this format the director is twofold make the audience care for these guest characters regardless of how briefly seen or thinly written they are and powerfully tug at the emotions without being heavyhanded or overly melodramatic having passed the er challenge in numerous episodes and showed flair for creating suspense in the peacemaker leder could not be better fit bring michael tolkin and bruce joel rubins rather formulaic disaster screenplay screen as the countdown impact progresses the ominous feeling of doom is palpable leading the final act take on surprisingly convincing and affecting emotional dimension there is nothing here that will profoundly move anyone but the fact that anything manages touch the heart is high achievement in genre generally more concerned effects situations that initially feel contrived such as jennys familial crisis and the teenage romance between sarah hotchner leelee sobieski and comet discoverer leo biederman elijah wood achieve some poignance and even the more vaguely drawn characters including s president tom beck morgan freeman astronaut spurgeon fish tanner robert duvall and his rather faceless crew ron eldard jon favreau mary mccormack blair underwood and alexander baluyev aboard the cometbombing spacecraft messiah have their share of touching moments the latter fact owes debt the actors who all do solid job and are wellcast the possible exception of leoni she delivers decent performance but her trademark unconventional speech rhythms and line delivery make her somewhat hard buy as star news broadcaster although its catastrophic theme and impressive special effects work the giant ocean waves are particularly spectacular place deep impact in the same category as the likes of twister it is the first of the disaster films successfully marry the advanced technology emotions that ring truea that makes genuine impact even if it is not as deep as hoped

the heist of flawless carat diamond fixed bare knuckle fights irish gypsies and dog are just some of the goings on in director guy ritchiess sophomore feature snatch lock stock and two smoking barrels introd helmerscripter ritchie hyperkinetic in your face underworld comedy that grabbed the viewers attention from beginning end his protagonists were innocents set adrift in see of sharks swim or be eaten alive snatch the director does not remake his first work but he does delve more deeply into the criminal underbelly of london mining rich collection of characters in the process from the very beginning snatch tosses you into the action the theft of the fabulous diamond the desire of new york gangster avi dennis farina en route from antwerp diamond thief and courier frankie four fingers benicio del toro stops in london make separate deal avis partner and cousin doug the head mike reid frankies addiction gambling tempts him into making bet on an illegal boxing match for boris the blade rade sherbedgia ruthless russian mobster the bet turns out be setup for robbery trio of bumbling incompetents vinnie robbie gee sol lennie james and portly tyrone ade that goes miserably awry meanwhile couple of young toughs turkish jason stratham and tommy stephen graham are trying break in the boxing game the help of local villain brick top alan ford who also owns pig farm when their first fighter is put out of action one punch wild irish gypsy named mickey oneil they figure put the loose canon in as the contender in fixed fight mickey proves less than reliable and goes against turkish and tommys deal brick top impressed mickeys performance decides gives them another chance after calmly explaining that it takes pigs about eight minutes completely devour corpse when avi does not get his precious rock he jumps on plane for london and hires local legend bullet tooth tony vinnie jones find frankie and the diamond things spiral out of control as all these forces head on collision course of doublecross and doubledeals and dog that ate squeaky toy guy ritchie mr madonna some is an extraordinarily talented auteur who has wonderful knack for pulling together his unique collection of cast and crew and feeding them funny and gritty dialog that spews out of the characters mouths like machine gun fire the helmer marshals his large ensemble actors in frantically paced caper comedy that makes you laugh and feel queasy at the same time the above description brick top being just one example the assemblage of actors and nonactors in roughandtumble settings gives snatch an earthy feel in its depiction of londons criminal underworld the cast of characters is too large credit here but two of the performances first among equals you might say are worth noting alan ford is brilliant as the ruthless evil brick top when he refuses sugar in his tea because am sweet enough it makes you shiver even as you laugh his is one of the best gangster characters have seen in years the other outstanding perf is given none other than brad pitt the name actor the movies popularity may hang upon at least initially pitt as mickey oneil is hard drinking hard fighting highly unreliable and nearly incomprehensible unique irish brogue and dialect of the pikers the irish travelers of europe this gypsy brigand would steal the fillings from your teeth especially if it would benefit his beloved mum sorcha cusack when brick top threaten the safety of mickeys family he makes an enemy that cannot be stopped pitt puts credible spin on his character and does some incredible physical stuff too as bareknuckle boxer the production team behind the camera includes ritchie alumni producer matthew vaughn and lenser tim mauricejones and other talented technical artist that bring the hyperactive imagination of the author visual life there is patent feel the look of snatch and lock stock and two smoking barrels that reeks of signature for ritchie but am not sure how this will translate in his future works there is so much talent in the filmmaker that would like see him branch out in other directions nonetheless snatch is terrific sophomore effort darn good action comedy and hoot boot give it b

tbwp is probably the single most profitable ever not surprising considering its tiny us budget date it has earned in excess of us million that is shocking times profit rumours have it that smart internet marketing ploy was so successful in gaining cultlike fanatics word of mouth coupled strings of excellent reviews the just exploded in the boxoffice raking in millions on its opening weekend shot in mm and video suspect the chronicles the forays of students who go in search for the legendary blair witch audiences are put in the firstperson perspective in the entire misadventure often wobbly and blurry at times it takes bit of getting used in the beginning this is supposed be the material they discovered in the woods where the disappeared edited and put onto the screen for the benefit of our audiences tbwp is simply smart filmed look as if it was really stockshoot bunch of students in search of the blair witch as school project one may suspect like yours truly that its simply lazy but smart approach filmmaking simply amazing in that respect must say talk about impact oh yes tbwp does have quite bit in fact most audience will find it deeply disturbing did especially the last bit but am not revealing more you have see it for yourself cannot help but feel tad cheated after knowing how commercially successful this has become could it be that finally an indiefilm has unwittingly found formula for commercial appeal or was it all simply ploy the big players right from the beginning well guess the fact stays tbwp is highly original clever and will most definitely leave most something dreadful talk and think about for weeks prior watching this no gore no special effects just cannot get over how terribly smart this is

i am starting write this review before going see strawberry and chocolate cubas oscar nominee for best foreign directed tomas gutierrez alea who also directed the sometimes and in some circles critically acclaimed memorias del subdesarrollo memories of underdevelopment saw memorias as part of cuban cinema class back in the late it merged the politics of the cuban revolution mundane elements of the human condition knew then that memorias was probably statesanctioned political missive and now expect strawberry will follow suit fellow internetters primarily in the newsgroup dedicated cuba soc culture cuba have mentioned that strawberry is harsh criticism of the revolution and its current state of affairs have jumped the conclusion that strawberry is nothing more than veiled attempt at espousing the party lineit probably looks like political criticism but it as not so having some first hand and extensive anecdotal knowledge of castros repressiveness cannot conceive of his tolerating honest and adversarial criticism of the revolution and cannot imagine his letting anyone even suggest his failure as leader of failed movement as kids say these days duh the revolutions current state needs no criticism its physical and spiritual crumbling is self evident the proper questions put relate castros legitimacy bet the takes castros power for granted and that this or any other movie produced under cubas state control cannot question his right run cubas political show ongoing now for more than years that is why just cannot believe strawberry is an honest criticism of the regime let us see what happens after the room goes dark and the screen lights up saw the filmtwice was right castro remained intact strawberry negotiates the relationship between young dialectic materialist as he describes himself and homosexual photographer diego in cuba the young man david is the son of peasants symbol of the revolutions reason for being grateful the revolution for the opportunity receive university education he studies political science instead of literature his avocation because he perceives it is his duty therein lies likely unintended irony since cuba has no need for political theoreticians cubas government is castro diegos lifestyle is the antithesis of revolutionary life he enjoys the finer thingstea opera art he does not do voluntary work for the revolution his small apartment is sensual oasis the moniker bourgeois figuratively hangs over his head during the early parts of the movie however he is revolucionario in his own way the supporting roles are filled an aging busybody heart of gold and troubled psyche davids roommate who rally takes the communist party line its expected extreme davids exgirlfriend who dumped him for another guy yet wants bed him before she leaves for italy her husband german gay sculptor whose work diego is attempting exhibit and who strikes faustian pact the government gutierrez alea and codirector juan carlos tabio do fine job at almost showing that homosexuals can be revolutionaries too heck towards the end of the you begin think the guy deserves medal for his patriotic fervor he really loves the revolution as supposedly does everybody else in cuba and wants make it better exposing and correcting some of its flaws real criticism is missing though this movie is political window dressing luis aguilar leons op ed piece on fresa in the miami herald march at did not color my judgment it presaged my intuition aguilar leon expressed my sentiment about this films political angle best like many artistic manifestations in cuba strawberry and chocolate sprang from totally manipulated environment as art critic ivan de la nuez well states in the latest issue of the magazine postmodern notes the silenced artists are those who refuse accept the charade in artists can provoke up point while the institutions legitimize themselves forbidding them go beyond that point although terrible propaganda this is otherwise fine

capsule this is s or style heist set in the present robert deniro stars as riskadverse safecracker who wants retire form crime but takes one last job at the request of personal friend played marlon brando edward norton plays hotshot young sharpster who is also in on the crime the plot is mostly straightforward suspense little nonsense am sure must have seen almost the identical plot before this is heist made for an adult audience who probably wanted crime like they had seen in theaters when they were teens there are no superhuman acrobats taking nosedives off of buildings like in entrapment there is no rock score there are no ballet like martial arts this is just basic heist decent and distinctly credible and unflashy script nick played robert deniro is safecracker who has managed be successful never taking risks if job is not safe bet pun intended he backs out sometimes even the safe bets turn out not be so safe when one job very nearly goes wrong nick is unnerved enough decide that it is nature telling him that it is time get out of the game he returns his home in montreal where he owns jazz club and decides manage it full time he proposes his girl friend diane angela bassett she has one condition he must stay retired from crime but before the deal can be cemented max montreal kingpin and personal friend has one last supposedly easy job for nick nick wants no part particularly because the heist will be right in his hometown of montreal more and more details seem complicate the job nicks partner in the crime is be smart but uncontrollable young crook jack edward norton jack treats locked front door like welcome mat even at his associates homes the young crook is knowitall who seems good at everything he does but at avoiding rubbing people the wrong way together they plan steal priceless historic artifact from the montreal customs house the script kario salem lem dobbs and scott marshall smith works like an episode of the old mission impossible television series we see pieces of the heist being put together last minute changes and things that go wrong much like good episode of mission impossible this team might not be bad choices write scripts for the tom cruise mission impossible films the complications are however no more and no fewer than are needed make the story believable the telling is cold and noirish is just what it is supposed be director frank oz the voices of yoda and miss piggy proves surprisingly good at directing serious crime the score has more than adequate cast little flashy or scenestealing acting edward norton probably has the flashiest role and even that is lowkey todays standards he plays what is nearly double role jack pretends be brain damage victim be hired for job in the customs house one nice character have not mentioned is stephen jamie harrold stephen is master hacker who lives in his mothers basement in house lot of screaming in both directions he seems like the last person the risk adverse nick would want depend upon the itself remains lowkey up until the time of the climactic heist then the pace really picks up before that the plot even stops twice for jazz interludes though oz never lets the music steal time from the story the way woody allen does in sweet and lowdown on the subject of music the score of the score is howard shore it adds tension the suspense scenes but never seems have much of melody angela bassett is the one misused celebrity in totally minor role that should have been played less famous actress who needed break she has nothing do in the but demand that nick give up crime and look like an attractive reward if he does speaking of being attractive the score seems be attracting an older audience who learned appreciate much the same sort of in the and it does the job rate it on the scale and on the scale

do not let the following quirks of this review fool you into believing that this movie is anything short of an ultimate labour of love but one can see the humour of roberto benigni when you see that life is beautiful even though am short ugly looking man an obnoxious laugh life is beautiful even though have not amounted much in life except working out the finer intricacies of waitering am lucky sort of guy especially when beautiful woman strips away my venner of superficiality find new age sensitive guy the biggest heart in the entire world underneath life is beautiful am jew but life can still be beautiful the nazis put me in concentration camp but life is still beautiful love my son very much and that is what matters and that is what makes life beautiful my ability entertain somehow convinces my son that living in concentration camp is somewhat beautiful get shot for my efforts and the woman love but hey that is life and that is still beautiful thing so jove do not give me any crap about it far the movie the biggest heart this decade and well deserves every nomination and award that it has achieved well done there should be more directors and actors like you roberto benigni

getting it right is far far cry from the teenage sex comedy you might expect from summer movie about male virginity the was directed randal kleiser who brought us such bubblegum classics as grease and the blue lagoon but thanks kleisers surprisingly good direction and an intelligent script getting it right is pleasantly quiet moving and memorable filmone geared strictly toward sophisticated adult audience getting it right stars jesse birdsall emily lloyds boyfriend in wish you were here as gavin painfully shy yearold hairdresser who lives at home his parents and whogaspis still virgin gavin has no problem whatsoever making small talk the elderly women who clamor for his services at the hair salon but expose him single yearold beauty and he is mess much gavins surprise the woman who finally brings him out of his shell and robs him of his virginity is joan lynn redgrave rich married and lonely yearold getting it right is the simple story of gavins awkward and haphazard efforts get it right that is find the right woman fulfill his life getting it right is one of those rare movies that devotes itself entirely indepth character development gavins selfconscious voiceover narration of his experiences firmly thrusts us into his psyche we observe his fascinating metamorphosis from shy and passive introversion assertive and selfconfident maturity birdsalls superb understated performance as gavin is the real backbone of the he seems convincing and authentic throughout the charm of getting it right also lies in the wide array of people who inhabit or invade gavins life despite her limited screen time redgrave makes quite splash in the movie as gavins middleaged seducer for supporting character joan is unusually and impressively complex thanks in large part redgraves magnificent performance gavin is also pursued or perhaps plagued minnie the totally neurotic daughter of rich aristocrat after minnie and gavin meet at party she takes great pleasure in disrupting his safe and simple life helena bonham carter is delightfully pathetic and kooky in the role and sir john gielgud his tongue in his cheek embodies the height of arrogance as her father gavins eventual loveinterest is jenny the adorable twentyyearold single mother who assists him at the beauty salon london stage actress jane horrocks fine performance yields touchingly sweet character peter cook the great british satirist appears briefly in the as gavins uptight employer the scenes of gavins home life his parents are also treat gavins overprotective mother pat heywood whom even woody allen would find overbearing almost steals the movie her life seems limited just two activities treating gavin like yearold and preparing exotic but inedible meals such as scalding hot curry and baked chicken chocolate sauce gavin and his fathers attempts avoid eating her meals are extremely amusing getting it right for the most part is very wellcrafted except for two minor shortcomings first the movie is about minutes too long and consequently it loses momentum at times second the includes an altogether extraneous subplot about the domestic problems between gavins best friend harry and his unfaithful lover winthrop overall however getting it right is quite memorable for its humor depth sophistication and outstanding acting director kleiser and screenwriter elizabeth jane howard adapting her own highly acclaimed novel deserve praise for finding just the right tone for this tale of growth maturation and selfdiscovery

no matter what you suspect this is not your usual action thriller the usual suspects is an intelligent crime mystery story from upandcoming director bryan singer it is one of those movies that after everything is revealed rapidfire at the end you immediately want rewind and watch again because earlier scenes take on new light plot twists agogo are what you get here gave up trying figure out the mystery of keyser soze after awhile and just sat back and waited for them reveal it me keyser soze is name you will hear at least hundred times if you watch the usual suspects and for good reason it is not only the name of the mysterious and possibly even mythical crime boss in the movie it also sums up the movie keyser soze in latin means an intelligent crime mystery story from upandcoming director bryan singer or maybe should not have bought foreignlanguage dictionary from the same company that makes those cent encyclopedias sold in supermarkets at the movies opening group of known criminals are brought in for police lineup including mcmanus stephen baldwin keaton gabriel byrne fenster benicio del toro buckney kevin pollack and verbal kevin spacey winner of the best supporting actor academy awardsymbol times new roman for his performance in the movie verbal is sonamed because he frequently rambles on about anything or nothing he also earns his name as the movies narrator spouting memorable lines like the greatest trick the devil ever pulled was convincing the world he did not exist although obviously he does exist what else could explain kris kross having comeback in while being interrogated police detective chazz palminteri any actor multiple zs in their name is okay in my book we see the story unfold as spacey retells it the five felons upon being released from the lineup get their revenge on the police exposing corrupt taxi service whereby elite criminals pay be smuggled through town in cop cars and stealing all the money and drugs in the car it is definite case of male bonding for the five criminals who later find out they were brought together the unseen keyser soze who sends minion them an offer they cannot refuse namely they have destroy sozes main competitors in organized crime infiltrating ship shooting bunch of people burning all the drugs and stealing million cash spacey does terrific job of bringing his seemingly unintelligent cripple character life and baldwin byrne palminteri and the rest make for good supporting cast the usual suspects is one of those movies that deftly mixes scenes of violence and explosions an underlying sense of mystery and suspense keeping the viewer guessing until the very end and then still leaving few details open for scrutiny and discussion suppose all that would be cleared up if really had rewound the movie and watched it again instead of changing the channel and wondering in disbelief what the hell kris kross was doing on mtv different mystery guess may turn into _murder_ mystery if that video ever comes on again

dangerous beauty is really nothing more than grandiose soap opera set in venice circa it is beautifully filmed wonderfully acted and certainly nothing short of entertaining but it lacks any true fundamental seriousness dealing themes of forbidden love religious intolerance subordination of women sexual freedom and the roles of pleasure and sin in highcultured society it still feels like brightly lit fluff the director marshall herskovitz does not want follow the dark and dangerous trail this story could lead down so he opts for more genial livelier and relatively shallow interpretation the takes place during the renaissance time when venice was the pleasure capital of europe at this time venice was its own republic and it thrived on being the central juncture of eastwest commerce the is told almost entirely through the viewpoint of the aristocracy and the bourgeoisie of venice so we rarely get see how the rest of the society lived however there is an abundance of detail concerning the lives and livelihoods of the upper classes their hedonistic lifestyles and constant merriment the story centers on veronica franco catherine mccormack lower class woman who falls in love marco venier rufus sewell the son of wealthy aristocratic parents jeroen krabb and joanna cassidy unfortunately the culture of that time period did not view marriage as an act of love rather it was more like business transaction where rich families married their sons and daughters each other in order secure power wealth and ensure that outsiders could not get in veronica despite her charm and good looks is certainly an outsider after short love affair marco breaks her heart the news that he cannot marry her however because she is beautiful and intelligent veronica has chance enter marcos world albeit not as his wife she decides become courtesan class of women who were as welleducated as they were ravishing and sold their sexuality wealthy men for the privilege of wining and dining the elite courtesan was not mere prostitute they were afforded special place in society and they were greatly revered respected and often envied at one point character mentions that some rulers obtain more political advice from their courtesans than from their lieutenants veronica goes through the transformation the help of her mother paola jacqueline bisset who was once famed courtesan herself once she enters the lifestyle veronica finds that it suits her quite well she is allowed read all the books she wants she is given the opportunity publish her poetry and she has the richest and most powerful men in the republic throwing themselves at her feet including the awestruck marco their relationship develops into playful bantering veronica utilizing her newfound power constantly rejecting marcos advances in many ways their relationship is sad because marco is married women he is unable love and veronica is consumed multiple relationships men she is unwilling love love the love not the man as her mother told her dangerous beauty was based on factual book margaret rosenthal flows along as smoothly and serenely as the grand canal running through the heart of venice it has multiple plot lines including veronicas adversarial relationship court poet oliver platt her role in obtaining frances military assistance in venices battle against the turks and even the dreaded shadow of the plague and the encroachment of the spanish inquisition yet it is never confusing or overbearing much of the films success is due the glowing performance catherine mccormack in the lead role known chiefly for the small part she played as the lover whose murder raised mel gibsons ire in braveheart mccormack shows the true gifts and inarguable talent of leading lady she has the kind of exquisite classical beauty that would be treasured in courtesan her character is intelligent witty and both sensual and vulnerable all of mccormack easily transmits single flash of her eyes the rest of the roles are also filled well including rufus sewell whose performance here and earlier this month in dark city have assured him solid place in he has the same kind of unusual good looks and charm of ray liotta and he seems perfectly at home in period dramas oliver platt plays variation of the comic relief role that he has come inhabit like second skin although the deals his character cheap blow at the end having him improbably join the inquisition and turn into the bad guy platt is good actor but he is just too hard hate jacqueline bisset proves that she is every bit as stirring as she ever was and even fred ward turns up in small but moving performance as marcos uncle dangerous beauty is marshall herskovitzs sophomore directorial effort after the overlooked jack the bear partnered edward zwick herskovitz has spent most of his time as producer on television thirtysomething my socalled life and in the movies legends of the fall his directing style can be best described as transparent it never gets in the way of the story yet it has no discernible flourish or particular distinctions he could have approached the in any number of ways including overdosing on the sexual aspect he wisely avoids dangerous beauty contains just enough bare flesh and ribald sex make it appropriately erotic but not so much that it seems exploitative herskovitz is also aided strong supporting crew including the luscious photography bojan bazelli whose previous efforts include the highlystylized thriller kalifornia and abel ferraras dark scifi body snatchers bazelli captures the in strong bold colors and be brings sixteenthcentury venice life in wide panoramic shots that are often enhanced digital imagery however the real details are found in the production design norman garwood brazil the princess bride and the costumes gabriella pescucci the age of innocence the only problem dangerous beauty is that it does not stick you it is good story welltold interesting characters but it is easy shrug off once you have left the theater the only sequence that has the chance be truly indelible is veronica being pulled in front of the hypocrisy of the inquisition and threatened the death penalty for her transgressions but it never quite comes off because it is simply too melodramatic and conventional herskovitz tries all his might make it nailbiter but somehow its outcome is foregone conclusion and like the rest of the it carries no real weight despite the potential severity of the subject matter

imagine this scenario you and any of your family members are scudding through one of those long excruciating crosscountry car trips far from the city and into the deserted rural routes so far the trip is idyllic when abruptly your car malfunctions and you are stranded in the middle of nowhere it is not an easy situation but perfectly plausible one the panorama in breakdown musters it is throbbing suspense and skillfully executed tautness it is not easy cobble distinct and gripping thriller nowadays but breakdown does not bungle into rudimentary plot holes or cliches and it derives masterful titillating climax that it is finale engrosses viewer total absorption the plot is somewhat reminiscent of the vanishing kurt russell and kathleen quinlan respectively play jeff and amy taylor massachusetts couple en route california for brand new job when they stop for gas somewhere in the arid southwest jeff is confronted pugnacious driver who later will be an important player in the plot department minutes later after that their brand new strikingly red jeep grand cherokee unexpectedly stops jeff cannot detect the cars problem so he allows amy take ride red t walsh heedful truck driver who will convey her the nearest town where jeff will meet her at local diner it is facile for the turn into pseudosuspenser but instead it opts for maximum fervor jeff manages restart the car himself but when he arrives at the diner she is nowhere in sight disconcerted the coffee shops bartender informs jeff where search for his wife town about twenty miles from here there trouble arises and shall not reveal anything else since that would be spoiling the fun of what is head there are many involving tight scenes in breakdown but the final climactic period includes magnificent chase three cars and huge truck will have you feeling as if your legs are made out of pure foam it is pleasure be part of classic confrontation of good vs evil and rooting for the good guys in this case jeff kurt russell is one of the few topnotch actors does not overblow his acting and gradually gains reliance on his role as it progresses so you can assume his alteration in breakdown is letterperfect suffice it is say he undergoes transformation from jolly man guy frantically pursuing loved one not many wellpaid actors can deliver these type of performances but russell is one of them as an everyday man he pulls it off extremely convincingly what also surprised me more was his rigorous physicality he effectively practices almost all throughout the films minutes although the is blotted couple of portentous action sequences very well done yet the tightness is generated the subtle circumstances this man is presented faced an enigma about his wifes whereabouts the movie succeeds conveying us in realistic territory veritable characters including the cryptic villains who in essence make the movie what it is what is most impressive however is the feature debut writerdirector jonathan mostow mostow hitherto directed the showtime thriller flight of black angle alleviates the contrivances and generics of the script gingerly pursuing the trajectory of the plot efficiently letting the tone and the mood of the story generate that nailbiting suspense sought for in well made affair contrary most american thrillers he does not rely on visual flair but on aesthetics and substance after breakdown he should gain vast notoriety the villains in the movie are not your routine outofthisworld idiosyncratic psychos that are harming for no particular objective the baddies in breakdown all well acted are normal seemingly inoffensive townspeople who beneath their trustworthy layer conduct an amoral business of corruption and murder the movie smartly portrays these men as loathsome rednecks and of all things in the world it is becoming rather easy root for villains jon voight in anaconda in todays movies worth special mentioning is t walsh who previously worked kurt russell in executive decision as the leader of the gang he renders deliciously wicked performance temporarily stepping out of the minor roles he is known for alfred hitchcock used suspenseand action not only stimulate but as way of aiding his audiences fascination in his stories were slowly realizing mans biggest fears breakdown yields exactly that it magnificently taps into the psyche of an ordinary man acting like an ordinary man looking like an ordinary and some sort of superhero despite one or two iffy moments even hitchcock think would approve of breakdown

steve soderberghs sex lies and videotape won the grand prize at the cannes festival in arguably began the resurgence of independent films made on shoestring budget of million then relatively unknown actors it is provocative thoroughly original drama the mostly focuses on the four central characters all in their late searly ann andie macdowell an unfulfilled housewife is married john peter gallagher an insensitive lawyer who unbeknownst her is having an affair her younger sister cynthia laura san giacomo complicating matters even worse is graham james spader who won best actor at cannes johns old college buddy who comes stay at their house ann is absolutely won over him even though she clearly has stated that she has very little interest in sex that is the setup for the last hour of the picture and since the is entitled sex lies and videotape it is best keep the rest of the story developments at bay so that they will come as genuine surprise director steven soderbergh has proven be wildly offbeat filmmaker ranging from the independent the mainstream out of sight the downright kafkaesque schizopolis he is the type of director who obviously takes lot of chances and believes in the work that he does and sex lies and videotape is probably his most confident and maybe even best date the performances are superb from all four leads but macdowell stands out in what is probably the main character she is always very winning actress but this is probably her most threedimensional role that she has had close second being altmans mosaic short cuts the other parts are perfectly cast as well from spaders ominous graham gallaghers selfinvolved john giacomos outspoken cynthia the final act of the especially comes right out of left field and turns out be both shocking and oddly
