touching and it would be criminal give away the films secrets suffice say that through one powerful sequence ann is able somewhat come out of her shell and john learns valuable lesson about honesty as well as deception the has one fault however the characters are almost all emotionally cold and isolated from one another and often unlikable if there had been few extra scenes gallagher it probably would have helped since his relationship macdowell is not quite as explored as would have liked sex lies and videotape although minorly flawed is still easily brave and adult motion picture that is far more mature and honest about its subject matter than the usual soderbergh clearly knew what he was doing while he was making it and the final product certainly proves this

synopsis private detective tom welles is hired wealthy widow uncover the origins of snuff owned her late husband after uncovering the authenticity of the welles descends into an underground world of perverse pornographers seeking vigilante revenge on the filmmakers comments mm is one of the more disturbing mainstream movies have seen in long time though it does not present snuff movie documents persons murder for real usually during or after some form of sexual act as explicitly as the cult classic mute witness and violence as shockingly as say natural born killers mm stays in your head long after you see it it is not fun watch see something else if you get upset realistic sadistic violence this films violence and perverse sexuality skirts closely into nc territory for those strong stomachs however mm is an intelligent worthwhile thriller especially during its second hour nicolas cage after couple hohum movies returns material allows him utilize his strong acting abilities as tom welles private detective and caring family man wife and newlyborn daughter cage skillfully and convincingly portrays decent man whose unwavering energy slowly transforms into obssession and violence as he is pulled into nightmarish world of underground pornographers and brutal sexual deviants serving as guide this world is joaquin phoenix who plays struggling songwriter named max california california despite his name is surprisingly intelligent and complex character and phoenix does very good job at slowly pulling the audience sympathy for the character the real star of the movie though must be peter stormare stormare played the really really evil guy in fargo and his character dino velvet in this movie seems about ten times more evil and unpredictable his performance is very chilling mms success may hardly be surprising it was directed joel schumacher who hopefully saw this as an apology for the absolutely dreadful batman and robin before directing the last two batman duds however schumacher was responsible for several wellmade horror flicks lost boys flatliners and falling down mm certainly joins the rank of these minor classics and is perhaps most reminiscent of falling down in that both films present an average man who selfdestructs before the audiences eyes mm was written andrew kevin walker who also penned the academy awardwinning thriller seven few years back like seven mm is full of dialogue haunts you well after leaving the theater welles is searching for answers how could anyone possibly drug and then slowly methodically sadistically kill teenaged girl make when confronting one of the perpretrators at the end the murderer responds that there are no reasons he just enjoys it that walker seems suggest is where the real terror lays not in the crime itself but in the fact that rational motives do not exist couple minor faults led me my fourstar rating five stars is the highest rating give one found it little difficult early on accept the fact that hardened private detective would get physically disgusted when first seeing snuff yes snuff is horrible thing but detective of welles caliber has probably encountered awful things before second some of the clues welles gathers are too convenient he discovers for example the victims diary in her private bathroom despite the fact the the police the fbi and her own mother have all investigated the room before finally the closing scene seemed trite and improbable considering the rest of the despite the above criticisms mm is an engrossing story one of the best scenes in the occurs toward the end as crazed welles who no longer seems like hero brutally beats one of the pornographers responsible for the snuff he pulls gun on the man and for relatively long amount of time struggles decide whether or not kill him he then leaves the building and calls the victims mother in the middle of the night basically see if she would support the action the entire scene is tense unpredictable and emotionally charged rarely anymore do horror films or thrillers provoke suspense in me as mm scenes like this did mm is most certainly not for the faint of heart this is graphic oftentimes unflinching look into the darkness resides in both ordinary and extraordinary people if you are prepared for of this nature give it an enthusiastic recommendation

me nicolas cage sounds like an ideal choice for the lead role in martin scorsese despite the rantings that sean penn so rudely expressed the actor remains gifted and versatile screen presence ever since the big success of the actionthriller faceoff in the road has been rocky one for mr cage the perpetually awful assassination thriller snake eyes was one of worst films mm was disappointing lost cause but who better than scorsese match cages wit and intensity he does in miraculous fashion bringing out the dead cage delivers one of his finest performances as frank pierce new york city emergency paramedic who is running on fumes from daytoday after five years of the stressinducing job frank basically just staggers onward relying on heavy doses of caffeine and booze until his shift finally ends he also begins seeing the ghosts of past patients who died under his care namely young girl named rose who stares back at him pale features at every street corner in new york frank desperately wants be fired but his boss needs him scour the city and help those in need i will fire you tomorrow he promises frank is accompanied fresh face every night in the ambulance the first is larry john goodman who always has food on the brain the second is marcus ving rhames deeply religious black man who incorporates the power of jesus into regular rescue operation and finally tom tom sizemore is deranged sociopath hungry for blood found it unique how scorsese used each of these characters for single shift frank but they never figured into the actual plot each is merely colorful presence help develop franks character because bringing out the dead is predominantly study of his mind and detailed personality the one character alongside frank that truly comes into play is mary patricia arquette the daughter of newly admitted patient who suffered from severe heart attack arquette who recently received the wounds of christ in stigmata performs well around reallife husband cage it is unfortunate that after such intriguing character trials and tribulations the relationship between frank and mary slips during mishandled ineffective finale the movie belongs the onetwo punch of cage and scorsese who were born collaborate their efforts in an arrangement similar bringing out the dead although it certainly lacks the grit and hardedge of something like goodfellas scorsese manages hit nerve his latest picture the incredible camerawork and photography represent stunning flashes of brilliance in an otherwise unspectacular conglomeration fans will be pleased find the director has returned his abrasive darkly humorous roots after somewhat of departure kundun does bringing out the dead rival scorseses finest work only occasionally some of the feels surprisingly limp but there is enough energy in it is interesting material and breathtaking visual appearance suffice those expecting grisly risqu product may be somewhat disheartened at the fairly straightarrow approach but it is still solid admirable effort bringing out the dead was written the acclaimed paul schrader who collaborated scorsese on such classics as taxi driver and raging bull schraders script is full of moments wonderful sharply defined moments that are sorted throughout the remainder of his meandering screenplay the exceptional aspects of the are it is astounding technical credits and the amazing cast goodman and sizemore are both electric well mainly sizemore but it is the phenomenal ving rhames who deserves second look watch the actors deeply inspired dedication as he resurrects gothic band member and you will understand why he won golden globe bringing out the dead is raw and electrifying often enough mask it is certain flaws scorsese and cage for that matter have done better but their intentions are certainly admirable

at first glance daylight would seem like your typical disaster movie on second glance it looks that way too although as typical disaster movies go daylight is not that bad admittedly it seems rip off great deal of its plot devices from disaster flicks of days gone think poseidon adventure but the decent dialogue and surprisingly good acting make up for the have not seen this scene somewhere before feeling that creeps up all too often during the sylvester stallone stars as the recently fired head of new yorks emergency response team sheer luck he is in the right place at the right time when disaster strikes the unaware inhabitants of this little what disaster is that you ask as you inch ever closer the edge of your seat glad you asked through whole sequence of entirely probable events about as probable as hitting the lottery large explosion takes place in the lincoln tunnel running under the hudson river in new york city the explosion results in the tunnel collapsing at both ends causes not only massive loss of life but traps dozen people inside the wreckage of the tunnel good old sly who is only feet away from entering the tunnel when it collapses offers his services the rescuers who gladly accept it sly then enters the tunnel through vent shaft think judge dredd he can only go in and not out off and proceeds try rescue those trapped inside so begins the fun but the fun has be quick because this tunnel has started spring leak the acting is about what you would expect of stallone movie not superb any means but far above some of his other films think judge dredd again daylights acting is probably average or little above in terms of this sort of genre starring this particular star amy brenneman is the only actor of any note and she does pretty good job as stallones reluctant helper oh yeah stallones real life son sage is in this too sage nice name guess it could be worse he could have been named nutmeg or parsley note sage you are still young go school and get good education you do not have future in acting the plot runs along the same lines as the acting interesting but predictable mostly due the fact that it was pretty well recycled from dozen other action flicks the biggest problem of this nature is that they try cram too many things into the movie as soon as the cast clears one seemingly impossible hurdle another one seems pop right up even worse than the last one realize that it would not be much of movie otherwise but it does make the movie bit predictable adding the predictability is the cast of characters of course has include at least one or two difficult people who want do things their own way and think the qualified guy in this case stallone does not know what he is doing why is it in disaster movies we can never have everyone agree each other and all work together would this be too much ask cannot we all just get along special effects were not bad but have certainly seen better some of the scenes while fun watch were such blatant ripoffs that you had wonder if scripts from old movies were just copied verbatim especially all of the scenes that involved anything underwater the tunnel of course starts flood really expected gene hackman roddy mcdowell and ernest borgnine appear at any minute was not sure if was watching daylight or the poseidon adventure suppose if you have rip off movie for good ideas the poseidon adventure is good one use the underwater sequences aside from the deja vu were very well shot and worked fairly well they were the best part of the movie long shot better than average stallone flick realize that is not saying much when the man has judge dredd on his resume but certainly not up the standards of cliffhanger daylight is fun movie and as long as you are not expecting whole lot you might even be pleasantly surprised

after the simple looking little spacecraft lands in automobile wrecking yard out steps steelgray humanlike creature aquamarine eyes and clad in muscular suit spencer the boy who observes this having seen his fill of science fiction flicks figures this thing must be robot from outer space the exception of disney and few others most studios view childrens films as way ship cheap and unimaginative product and thereby make quick profit star kid stands out as that rare kids that is undoubtedly lowbudget but is also highly imaginative remember the robot it was not one at all but rather phase one assault cyborsuit the cyborsuit is actually prototype combat enhancer developed the trelkins and jettisoned for latter retrieval when they are under attack from the invading broodwarriors the significant twist in the story is that spencer gets go inside the cyborsuit and the cyborsuit nicknamed cy has plenty of spunk cy keeps questioning the kid about everything including words like cool upon hearing that command cy starts rapidly decreasing the temperature in the cyborsuit until spencer screams for him stop and when cy speaks we see spencers view the backside of cys lips and eyes as yearold spencer joseph mazzello from the jurassic park series gives remarkably good performance as wimpy and initially tonguetied kid even when enclosed in his powerful new cyborsuit he has his fears but he learns overcome them if you run away things do not get better whether it is bullies spiders or girls his science teacher advises him after he has difficulties dealing all three turbo joey simmrin the schools chubby bully beats up on him spiders frighten him and most embarrassing of all he cannot speak when in the presence of his wouldbe girlfriend his cyborsuit on he learns some bravery that transcends his time inside cy spencer lives his dad and his older teenage sister stacey played smartmouthed ashlee levitch who looks like younger sarah jessica parker stacey derides her brother whom she barely tolerates referring him only as the fungus this whole setup for spencers downtrodden and delightfully funny life makes his acquisition of some superhuman powers source of mirth and empowerment the beauty of mazzellos performance is that you can vicariously experience his fear and share in his enjoyment when he goes after the bully teach him lesson he will not soon forget the ensuing mayhem has some of the home alone antics but the slapstick is kept tightly under control writer and director manny coto so that one never feels embarrassed be laughing the romantic angle is handled ever so delicately when cy wishes know if spencer wants mate the object of his desire michelle lauren eckstrom his eyes open wide in revulsion mate her spencer exclaims pllllleeeeease just like her that is all the show has many funny twists in one cy sees man in barneylike costume and begins firing at him thinking he is an alien lifeform soon things get way out of hand and cy and spencer have beat hasty retreat as proof positive of the show is class it actually contains tasteful bathroom humor thought that was an oxymoron in kids picture did not you cy cannot allow spencer leave the cyborsuit and what happens when he needs urinate becomes both sweet and hilarious the directors staging of this sequence is one of the films more charming moments oh and eating is pretty funny too spencer whose idol is the comic book character midknight warrior gets face the challenge of lifetime when broodwarrior comes capture the cyborsuit spencers valiant battle gives him chance find his mettle and the action sequences in the battle manage be quite respectable for kids show full of inventiveness and lacking the usual repetition for family movie mixing humor fantasy and action star kid delivers although it is probably not the sort of movie you would want see without kids them you will have magical time relatively straightforward but well developed story you will be rooting for and laughing spencer and his buddy cy all the way through star kid runs it is rated pg for fantasy combat although the basically cartoonish broodwarrior might scare the littlest kids saw none of this in evidence in our packed screening so would say the show is fine for kids five and up and possibly the younger ones my son jeffrey age got really excited about the picture he called it an especially good movie and gave it when asked him tell me his favorite characters he mentioned almost everyone in it from the boy the cyborsuit the bully

note some may consider portions of the following text be spoilers be forewarned like its own opening shot from out of the darkness boogie nights triumphantly explodes upon the scene stunning authority and clarity persuasively heralding its helmer paul thomas anderson as bonafide major talent sprawling epic set in the heart of the disco era and focused upon the ascension and decline of troupe in the adult industry boogie nights is an astonishingly ambitious feature is completely effective both as an utterly entertaining joyride and as strikingly impressive piece of filmmaking the follows softspoken young man eddie adams mark wahlberg from torrance through his induction into the erotic picture business stardom and later harrowingly precipitous drop as boogie nights opens he is toiling as dishwasher in trendy san fernando valley nightclub and living at home under the thumb of tyrannical mother who denigrates him at every opportunity recruited fatherly jack horner rejuvenated burt reynolds successful porn filmmaker eddie abandons his old life in favour of new one as dirk diggler pornstar wholeheartedly embraced jacks troupe including the maternal amber waves julianne moore reed rothchild john reilly buck swope don cheadle rollergirl heather graham dirk and his one special thing are quickly propelled the top of his field fulfilling his mantra of being big bright shining star his lack of discipline however incites chain of circumstances sees dirk and his friends unravel as new decade is ushered in the element of boogie nights literally commands attention is the bravura direction mr anderson whose fascination and prowess the camera is obvious from the terrific tracking shot throughout nightclub opens the and introduces the players through the showy sequence in the camera follows female partygoer diving into pool mr andersons accomplished command of the camera is without question while novice directors often demonstrate an unfortunate lack of restraint in terms of flamboyant camerawork ultimately proves be aggravating impertinent and selfcongratulatory case in point marc roccos unforgettable perpetualmotion helming of murder in the first in boogie nights every zoom or pan mr anderson be it slow and deliberate or energetically sharp is purposeful and potent it is rarity and delight discover such confidently assured work so early in filmmakers career boogie nights is only his second feature following up his debut feature from earlier this year hard eight and although it is somewhat derivative his storytelling style is reminiscent of robert altman while in terms of visuals he is clearly influenced martin scorsese at least he is borrowing from some of the best and it is entirely effective within the context of this while boogie nights is astonishingly polished from technical perspective in terms of sheer entertainment value it is also rollicking good fun wickedly deadpan sense of humour the perfectly captures the essence of the disco period in terms of music clothes hairstyles dance idioms and culture aided immeasurably impeccable production design bob ziembicki and costume design mark bridges and boogie nights convincingly catapults the audience back this recent preaidsscare period in american history where uninhibited freewheeling lifestyles abounded while much of the films humour pertains the characters obliviousness of nowoutdated aspects of their lives then prevalent in society prime example is parttime salesman buck swopes demo of stereo system an eighttrack tape and inviting prospective customer get freaky deaky the music it is elicited an undercurrent not of ridicule but of wistful reminiscence and some the throwback elements in the are strangely wondrous giant ensemble disco dance production number in nightclub is funny be sure but oddly magical and the sequence lovingly explores eddiedirks bedroom completely adorned posters and elements of iconic figures farrah fawcett cheryl tiegs bruce lee is breathtaking ably supported wellselected collection of period music all of purportedly came straight from mr andersons personal collection there is clear affection for the era in boogie nights it is the period aspect and the playfully comic nostaligism of boogie nights has been played up in its marketing campaign in deference of the pornography element of the storyline the films promotional trailer markedly avoids any explicit reference the adult industry unites its characters after the debacle milos forman the people vs larry flynt another finelycrafted work was knocked off the market prematurely due controversy regarding its pornographyrelated storyline the new line marketing team faced unique challenge boogie nights in terms of attempting deemphasize the relatively risque erotic picture element of the story in order increase salability the general public however while boogie nights delves into the world of the adult industry of two decades ago it is hardly lurid or seamy given the subject matter there is very little nudity and virtually none of it can be construed as gratuitous and boogie nights smartly depicts erotic filmmaking not as hotbed of carnality but simply as business the glimpses on the sets of jack horners shoots reveal that while the films he makes are intended titillate there is candid matteroffactness in terms of sex his cast and crew are professionals who are merely doing job and it is refreshing that the obvious cliches of depravity and sinful lechery often linked dismissive portraits of adult filmmaking such as coercion or debauchery are avoided if anything boogie nights is more interested in the process of adult filmmaking than the adult films themselves jack horners dream is an honourable one he genuinely aspires make great and some degree boogie nights is reminiscent of ed wood albeit lacking certain wistful innocence in both films the world of quickie lowbudget filmmaking is explored and both jack horner and the version of ed wood tim burton scott alexander and larry karaszewski share similar mindsets jacks retort of there are shadows in light baby his cinematographers complaint about poor set lighting echoes back ed woods it is not about the little details it is about the big picture rant when it is pointed out that his graveyard set for plan from outer space appears patently false in boogie nights and ed wood the aspirations of the respective filmmakers prove be bemusing not in their intentions there is nothing inherently silly in the goal of making an artistic erotic picture but in the degree that they miss the mark much like the humour lacing ed wood the laughs involving jack horner are doubleedged after viewing hilarious excerpt from one of his latest films hybridizes the james bond and porn genres when jack breathes this is the best work have ever done it is genuinely funny but given his utter sincerity also possesses tinge of sadness mr anderson is at this point clearly greater talent as director than screenwriter while boogie nights shows great inventiveness in staging there really is not any clever dialogue in the though valid point certainly can be made that none of the films characters particularly lend themselves thoughtful verbal exchanges when one considers that the films protagonist literally does not say single insightful thing throughout the entire minute running time it is no wonder why the playfully inane how much can you bench banter between dirk and reed constitutes one of the films finest exchanges and while mr anderson creates rich collection of fascinating characters it is problematic that some of the the threads given the films characters are simply stale material julianne moores child custody battle is fairly cliched stuff better suited for less risque and uninspired tvmovie version of her characters story and far less interesting than the thread dealing her woefully hackneyed filmmaking ambitions still even if he does not always know what do his characters mr anderson most definitely captures their essences and his resolutely nonjudgemental affection for them is infectious misguided even aimless hopelessly naive selfdestructive insufferable loved them just the same in any case it is hard pick nits screenplay contains one of the most audacious and inspired and ultimately bestexecuted scenes of the year scene where dirk diggler and reed rothchild are dragged along their loosecannon compadre the home of drug baron rahad jackson mesmerizing alfred molina in an unforgettable performance even if it is small one in suicidal drug deal scam only find that the millionaire is crazed eccentric the part where he stops the deal listen the crescendo of night rangers sister christian on his stereo system is sheer brilliance flanked an armed bodyguard if this scene already was not tense enough these elements mr anderson introduces chinese boy that wanders through the scene who for no discernable reason is tossing firecrackers around the room pushing the scene new surreal level of delightful giddiness there are some other interesting touches in boogie nights mr anderson recycles the use of long methodical chimes on the soundtrack from hard eight here it accompanies the violent intercut sequences depict the prostration of various characters frightening effect similarly painful scene where crew member scotty philip seymour hoffman breaks down in tears in the drivers seat sobbing am so stupid after being rebuffed dirk after an awkward but heartfelt advance is strikingly played out exactly as later scene dirk in the drivers seat after particularly tumultuous and traumatic evening boogie nights is exceedingly well cast and each of the actors rise the occasion the ensemble cast is uniformly good while most of the acting accolades will no doubt go mr wahlberg fulfilling upon the sparks of promise he demonstrated in some of his earlier films and mr reynolds terrific as the father figure and stable anchor of the ringing true in every respect handful of other performances might otherwise be overlooked deem mention mr reilly demonstrates here as he did for brief glimpses in ulu grosbards georgia genuine aptitude for comedy many of his scenes in boogie nights are among the very funniest in the am not sure how much of his performance as reed was scripted and how much was done on the spot but he plays the quintessential second banana character tee mr reilly is the best part of the big disco dance production number and it is wickedly funny watch his reed join in dirk after the fact in threatening the new stud on the block during macho altercation worth the price of admission alone is the glimpse of him getting down in the recording studio while the dirk character is laying down numbingly bad and deadon period it sure sounds like bad early me demo track you got the touch in vain attempt at musical career mr reilly plays his vacant character utter conviction is convincing and effective ms graham her long dirty blonde hair innocent demeanour and huge hazel eyes looks like disney animated heroine come life or in this case disney animated heroine who came life made wrong turn and ended up on the new line lot in focused on the late early adult industry consequently it is bit incongruous see this cheery sweetfaced starlet whizzing about the set on her roller skates but in scene where she is lounging in limousine prowling the streets garish red lipstick messily smeared on giving the camera hilariously pouty comehither look all one can do is gulp her role in the sadly needs more fleshing out err in figurative sense she is essentially glorified extra but she does score impressively in her key scene is unnerving in its sheer primal ferocity if only mr anderson had filmed the scene so that we could actually see the expression of rage and anguish on her face though and cautionary tale for the strict and prudish as teen ms grahams parents forbade her take part in the twisted cult classic heathers since then her most notable roles have been as junkie gus van sants drugstore cowboy and now porn starlet draw your own conclusions perhaps the most quietly touching performance in boogie nights is that of mr cheadle who lends dignity his role as character in search of his identity and whose quest is comically manifested series of changes in his sense of fashion his relationship his cheerfully supportive new wife jessie st vincent an interesting melora walters is wholly compelling has genuine sweetness and although his general longing for acceptance from others is perceptible it is no more so than in the bank scene where his loan application open stereo store is rejected due his background in the porn industry while the scenario is familiar the wounded look in cheadles eyes makes the scene unforgettable luis guzmans most famous work is possibly in brian de palmas carlitos way and here he plays variation on the same character maurice rodriguez is hapless but goodnatured nightclub owner who is hangeron jacks group ingratiating himself into the clique and constantly hounding jack little disguise made of his desperation for part in one of his erotic pictures jacks eventual acquiescence maurices request leads one of boogie nights biggest comic payoffs boogie nights is stunning achievement due the virtuoso direction mr anderson who immediately asserts his presence in the industry as presence of note this work striking fine balance between humour and drama and exceptionally wellcrafted there is no doubt that boogie nights is among the very best films of the year

bruce willis and sixth sense director night shyamalan reteam tell the story of david dunne willis stadium security guard who has been having some problems at home that are affecting his relationship his wife and child on return trip from new york where he was trying get job dunne is in horrible train accident that he is the only survivor of make things even stranger dunne has also escaped the accident completely unscathed comic book art dealer named elijah price samuel jackson who was born degenerative bone disease that causes his bones be so brittle that they break constantly has been seeking out someone like dunne his entire life price felt that there had be someone exactly the opposite of him someone whose bones would be so strong that they would never break price contacts dunne and convinces him come down his gallery for talk where he suggests that dunne could quite possibly be something akin superhero from the comic books price used read when he was child dunne does not believe him at first but price assists him in discovering his powers and helps him hone his craft until he discovers what his true calling really is writerdirector night shyamalan had tough act follow his sleeper hit the sixth sense how exactly does one follow up on one of the biggest and most popular thrillers in recent years for shyamalan the answer must have come as easy him as nuclear physics does kindergartners does this new measure up his breakthrough box office smash though the answer that question is not very easy one either as far as pacing goes the sixth sense seemed almost interminable it was not until the surprise ending was revealed that realized the was actually intentionally and perfectly paced in order give the audience ample time reconnect all of the information they had seen once the climax had been reached for unbreakable shyamalan gave the much more satisfying pace in many ways blows away the that had come before the story moves along at steady pace and shyamalans direction is excellent the camera almost constantly moving there are tons of great shots in the not least of is conversation that opens the between willis character and another train passenger the shot seems as though it were filmed like we were watching the two talk from between the train seats and the camera steadily glides back and forth between the two actors as they speak also very impressive is the films score james newton howard who also scored shyamalans sixth sense and the similar stir of echoes as well as this years dinosaur several of the scenes are driven very catchy beat and help increase the tempo of the one of the best examples of this is scene in dunne goes into train station exercise his powers the music in combination the stellar visuals really go long way towards making this an incredible movie if there was any one soundtrack would make must purchase this year this one would be it the also boasts some great performances including precocious child actor trying vie for the oscar throne left vacant haley joel osment willis turns in great performance as the sad sack dunne who just cannot seem figure out why he is been depressed for the last few years his character almost seems pathetic when we first meet him but he eventually grows into his own under elijahs tutelage jackson is one of the better actors of our time and here he turns in yet another great performance as the ever injured elijah though his hairstyle is absurd jackson seems infuse such great deal of pain into his role that the mortar board hairdo can easily be overlooked robin wright penns role seems slightly underwritten but she still manages get across the intense hurt of her characters need for love from her husband and her desire make things work again spencer treat clark as the dunnes young son jeremy shows that shyamalan still has knack for picking young actors and he turns in one of the most competent performances in the out of all the characters jeremys is perhaps the most emotional and clark does great job the role where the does lose points though is during its surprise ending shyamalan has said in interviews that he was going do an ending that blew away the one presented the sixth sense but found myself saying that was it when unbreakable revealed its own ending it is not that the ending is bad it is just that the ending does not quite have the emotional punch that the other films did plus it almost seems like it sets itself up for sequels and will not reveal the ending here but you will understand what mean when you see it essentially what all of this means is that shyamalan has made another good unbreakable the only real problem is that the ending does not quite fill the shadow left its predecessor as long as it is not held the standard that sixth sense set it ultimately will be it should be remarkably well liked one thing seems clear though shyamalan definitely has an affinity for comic books that he would like share the world and many comic book fans will also delight the vision he presents in this

there is good news and bad news about mulan the positive is that disney has found happy medium between the heavyhandedness of pocahontas and the hunchback of notre dame and the childishness of hercules on the other hand the studio is pulling out all the stops on plot cliches and cheap laughs several steps down from the days of the little mermaid and beauty and the beast but mulan is step in the right direction and disneys best animated feature since the lion king after giving native americans turn in pocahontas disney has decided turn movie over the asians mulan is set in feudal china and features the everpopular heroine who marches different drum and wants do more her life than get married that is what we find out when young mulan voice of ming na wen screws up her appointment the matchmaker letting rogue cricket splash coffee all over her cartoons meanwhile word comes from the emporer that one man from every family must join the army and help fight the huns since mulans girl that means her decrepit old father must go she pleads the soldiers have mercy on dear old dad but that kind of groveling and desperation brings shame on her family that is chinese culture for you so imagine how embarrassed the family is the next day when they find mulan has stolen her fathers uniform and sword and run off join the army in his place the movie in nutshell is about the stuggles of being woman in the army it should have been called i chang mulan calls on her ancestors for help they decide summon the large stone dragon in the backyard protect her but mini dragon named mushu screws it up voiced eddie murphy mushu continues the tradition of cute talking animal sidekicks who do more slapstick harm than good for their human charges murphys performance is direct descendent of robin williams in aladdin lots of wisecracks and adlibs and even an introductory song about how much fun they are going have you as not never had friend like mushu speaking of songs mulan does not have too many of them is plus story like this disney songs about war probably would not go over too well heigh ho heigh ho it is off war go and the ones they do have are not memorable the best of the bunch sad say is be man the requisite basic training montage song yes even in medieval china they had run through that web of car tires before they were ready for battle sung donnie osmond bad sign if ever there was one be man accompanies footage of mulans platoon going from screwups heroes it makes me wonder has there ever been musical montage in movie that is ended badly only wish reallife problems could be solved in two minutes peppy montage for the curious mulan does pass for man in the army despite looking like girl all she does transform herself is cut her hair sexy shoulderlength talk macho and slap guys on the butt as was male custom thousand years ago in china the deception fools everyone but the audience who thinks she might be able pass for yearold boy at best but she does manage strike the biggest blows the hun army led big evileyed attillalooking monster as villain the head of the huns is menacing evil and entirely forgettable saw the movie yesterday and do not remember the mans name otherwise mulan is good movie the animation of the characters themselves is not as rich as it could and should be but there are some amazing battlefield shots eddie murphy pulls off some good oneliners as do other star voices like harvey fierstein and pat morita the quintessential asian movie star hell george mr sulu takei does voice in mulan you get the sense disney said themselves alright let us get out there and find us some chinese americans in who can you think of well there is mr myagi good and mr sulu perfect we have got ourselves movie now soon disney really _will_ be able paint all the colors of the wind

harmless silly and fun comedy about dimwitted wrestling fans gordie and sean david arquette and scott caan who idolize current world championship wrestling heavyweight champion jimmy king oliver platt when king is screwed out of his title corrupt promoter joe pantoliano gordie and sean take it upon themselves find their fallen hero and restore his glory my biggest fear about ready rumble was dispatched early on as the filmmakers are quick show that wresting is indeed choreographed but not fake mind you the hook of the movie is that gordie and sean are just too stupid realize that arquette and caan are suitably over the top their performances is exactly what movie like this requires and oliver platt one of my favorite actors is riot as the drunken washedup exchampion many have scoffed at the idea that platt should be playing heavyweight champion wrestler an unbeaten record but for me it just added the silly factor of the thereby increasing my enjoyment of it one casting complaint however rose mcgowan as sexy dancer please if rose mcgowan is sexy then am marilyn manson given the current state of the actual wcw if oliver platt were appearing as jimmy king right now on wcw programming he would be the most popular guy they have on similar note the plot line of the wresting portions of the are more entertaining than anything the wcw writers have been able come up in the last two years although one does have ask why would any wrestling promoter fire the head wrestler of company who is both unbeaten and extremely popular the fans director brian robbins you will remember him as eric from tvs head of the class just knows how make good dumb movies this movie fits in nicely his previous efforts good burger and varsity blues and screenwriter steven brill the epic mighty ducks trilogy late last night manages keep things both sophomoric and clever at the same time almost all the jokes of the getting laugh out of me the only exceptions that were scene involving van full of singing nuns and any scene involving the old woman wrestling fan those moments made me cringe andor groan as an added bonus though the audience is treated outtakes from the as the final credits roll pg

steven spielberg is now considered as one of the deities because of the rare capability deliver both huge commercial hits like jurassic park and oscar awarded critical triumphs like schindlers list however in the spielberg built his reputation creating works of art that could slip in both categories one of them is close encounters of the third kind extremely popular and influential sciencefiction spectacle unfortunately it had bad luck be released in the same year as star wars although both films have lot in common groundbreaking special effects brilliant score john williams their future was different one became an unstoppable cult phenomenon and another almost forgotten and stuck forever in its shadow when spielberg began work on that project he was already established as bright new star due his previous commercial hit jaws together other young directors of his new generation like kauffman carpenter hill and millius he exploited the great creative freedom of when even the mainstream producers dared experiment ironically it was spielberg himself whose later commercial success would established new unwritten rules of blockubuster philosophy but in the mid many things were different spielberg was young and eager use resources for his very personal and artistic movie although very personal spielbergs screenplay was partly based on the book ufo experience dr allen hynek and in many ways inspired the popular urban mythology of extraterrestrial visitors earth that began grow in the world after ww spielberg was not only inspired the mythology but his movie also gave the mythology itself huge boost unmatched until the contemporary era of xfiles and the roswell anniversary that was partly because he made the movie very realistic using the authentic uforelated incidents as the element of the plot the story begins one of such incidents team of international scientists come the sonorra desert in mexico find the s navy planes of who went missing decades ago during the famous flight such events coincide the ufo incident witnessed roy neary richard dreyfuss power company worker from muncie indiana who later becomes obsessed his experience because of his obsession he loses his job family and sanity but his loss is nothing compared the experience of jillian guiler melinda dillon single mother whose son becomes the victim of alien abduction in the meantime the scientists decipher the strange signals from outer space and s government in cooperation the french led lacombe francois truffaut begin the preparation for ultrasecret project when the news of the poison gas leak in the middle of wyoming reach neary he finally sees some sense in all his visions and begins the perilous journey toward the centre of endangered area there he is joined jillian who shared the similar visions two of them must break through military pickets and reach their destination find whatever is there spielberg here shows great mastery using the very same techniques of jaws make completely different effects the slow gradual yet very disciplined series of dramatic incidents close encounters is set in order bring the viewer the great revelation in the finale but instead of the fear and horror we had endure during the jaws we are now overwhelmed the sense of boyish wonder throughout the movie the viewer knows that something big magnificent and wonderful is about happen and great magician spielberg delivers his promise in the end the last sequence its even in this age impressive special effects the great virtuoso douglas trumbull would leave many mouths open one of the great virtues of this is its optimism aliens who almost always get portrayed as the monsters in sciencefiction cinema are here benevolent and harmless creatures and the first contact between them and humanity is beginning of something wonderful it is very ironic when we consider that the two classic sf movies that visually inspired spielberg actually told quite different story howard hawks thing and byron haskins war of the worlds presented extraterrestrials as the threat the mankind spielbergs humane approach and faith in the future also lies in great contrast the pessimistic mood of its era the only hint of the contemporary gloom is postwatergate portrayal of government as conspiratorial towards the public but even such government is much more harmless compared the murderous and chainsmoking men in black that became the stereotype thanks xfiles and its more cynical and disturbing visions there lies the main and probably the only flaw of this great picture lack of conflict and consequently lack of drama the movie has few excitements or even action scenes especially the last that may be an interesting homage hitchcocks north northwest but generally almost everyone neary jillian government aliens are the good guys despite such shortcomings the actors were good and manage bring multidimensionality their simple roles richard dreyfuss is very convincing as ordinary yet nice guy who sinks into insanity only rediscover himself in grand finale melinda dillon was on the other hand nominated for oscar as struggling mother yet she was overshadowed teri garr as nearys longsuffering wife ronnie apart from visual wonders of this spielbergs semiofficial composer john williams again excels his beautiful music this time using the simple melody both as the element of plot and as the basis for his score the aliens who are the main subject of this were visually very convincing too convincing one of my acquaintances in the uforesearching circles said according him the depiction of extraterrestrials as greyskinned little people big eyes was so accurate that it managed freak out powerful government figures interested in suppressing the truth about ufos so they later approached spielberg and ordered him make another movie alien this time designed be anything but the real life the result was t for many years the biggest commercial hit of all times yet less inspirational for ufo enthusiasts anyway whether the viewer believes in existence of extraterrestrials or ufos close encounters of the third kind remains the great movie and one of the rare uplifting experiences in modern cinema

the exception of their surrealistic satire barton fink the films of joel and ethan coen fit into two broad categories quirky and sometimes darkly humorous takes on the noir genre in crime schemes go wrong and spin increasingly out of control fargo millers crossing blood simple and offthewall comedies centered around an eccentric scatterbrained lead character raising arizona the hudsucker proxy their latest offering the big lebowski falls within the latter category though there are elements of the crimegonewrong theme and even touch of satire be found in this the main difference however is that while the protagonists of raising arizona and the hudsucker proxy had lofty aspirations and ideals but did not quite have the brains get it all together the main character of the big lebowski seems like fairly intelligent guy who is wise the world but he does not really want do much of anything besides go bowling smoke pot and generally relax that main character is jeffrey the dude lebowski jeff bridges introduced the films rambling narrator sam elliott as quite possibly the laziest man in los angeles county the dude is unemployed needless say and spends most of his time at the bowling alley his two best friends walter john goodman borderlinepsychotic who is in the habit of pulling gun when he thinks somebodys cheating in bowling match has the whole world gone crazy he shouts at suspected cheater and donny steve buscemi who is always few steps behind the conversation and is constantly berated walter for it donny you have no frame of reference here these three seem more or less live for bowling tournaments and as the begins they are anticipating an important match rival bowler jesus quintana john turturro who when we first meet him is doing dance in the bowling lane accompany spanish version of hotel california and if it is possible seems be even more of head case than walter if that does not give you good idea of this films absurdist tone then perhaps this will the entire scenario drives the story is set in motion two thugs mistakenly urinating on the dudes rug they have mistaken him for millionaire of the same name who is also known as the big lebowski david huddleston and whose nymphomaniac wife bunny tara reid owes money porn producer jackie treehorn ben gazzara the dude goes the big lebowski seeking compensation for his ruined rug he does not have any luck but when bunny is apparently kidnapped the elder lebowski asks him deliver the million ransom unfortunately walter gets involved and fouls up the dropoff and before they can try again get the money the supposed kidnappers the dudes car gets stolen along the briefcase containing the money soon the dude is being harassed not only the big lebowski himself but also treehorn and group of german nihilists who demand the ransom money even though they may not have been involved in the kidnapping in the first place the dude and walter suspect that bunny may well have kidnapped herself in order extort money from her husband repay her debts treehorn meanwhile the big lebowskis daughter maude julianne moore feminist avantgarde artist who likes make grand entrances swinging through the air naked wants recover the money for her family the plot however is really just vehicle for all these bizarre characters run wild and wreak their own unique forms of havoc the previews for the big lebowski feature creedence clearwater revivals run through the jungle and it fits the coens see los angeles as veritable jungle of oddballs and nutcases the sometimes bewildered dude left run through it and try avoid any more trouble usually unsuccessfully the does not feature quite as many oneliners and sight gags as the coens other comedies though there are few hilarious moments of visual humor particularly in the dudes dream sequences and acid flashbacks but it more than makes up for it the sheer fun of watching these strange characters interact the sometimes seems little disjointed as result you get the feeling that the coens have not only set their characters loose in this jungle but are also themselves running crazy through the jungle of their own twisted imaginations but for the most part the characterizations are interesting enough overcome the shaky plotting and what turns out be somewhat anticlimactic resolution there is also noticeable but not too heavyhanded thread of social commentary in the big lebowski incidentally takes place just as the gulf war is about begin at the beginning we see george bush on television making his this aggression will not stand speech the coens take aim at just about every elite a subculture in the book the egotistical wealthy businessman the bums will always lose shouts the big lebowski at one point the porn industry the overbearing malibu policeman who berates the dude for disturbing their peaceful beach community and so on the end we really start admire the dude who almost certainly harbors the least aggression of anyone in this story his passive resistance emphasis on passive albeit the elite emerges as something more than just another quirky characterization in overflowing quirky characters he also turns out have pretty wellfunctioning brain in his head even if he does not like use it very much his sarcasm towards treehorn and the malibu policeman shows that he knows when he is getting run around and he does manage unravel the kidnapping mystery the end the coens certainly poke fun at the dude for his laziness but they do not just treat him as fodder for cheap shots either think that more than anything is what makes the big lebowski standout comedy it manages approach characters like the dude and some extent walter genuine affection while still acknowledging that they are pretty scatterbrained audience members may find themselves surprised at how much they like the undynamic duo the end of the movie given that they seemed like nothing more than the butts of an extended joke at first it is good knowin he is out there the dude takin it easy posits the narrator towards the end dare say that truer words have seldom been spoken

the endurance shackletons legendary antarctic expedition in as the great war descended upon europe sir ernest shackleton began his third expedition antarctica this time be the first cross the icebound continent on foot men set sail on the brigantine endurance and they would not be heard from again for nearly two years director george butler using footage and photographs from the historic journey tells their remarkable story in the endurance shackletons legendary antarctic expedition the expedition started out as merely incredibly difficult quest traverse on foot the vast wasteland of antarctica as the intrepid ship and crew entered the weddell sea the entry the cold cruel continent they did not plan on the dense pack ice bringing the voyage an abrupt halt as the endurance became trapped within sight of land for months the ice thickened and compressed until the ship was crushed stranding the men on the flow propelling them away from their goal and eventually into their lifeboats for safety shackleton faced desolate situation made the decision lead the three tiny boats the relative safety of uninhabited elephant island once on this safe haven shackleton next turned his sights saving his crew and returning them civilization he and five of his men leave the island in an open boat make the mile journey on the worlds roughest sea get help from the nearest inhabited island of south georgia miraculously the six land after days at sea on the uninhabited side of the target island and are forced trek across treacherous snow covered mountains covering miles in just hours this ordeal is followed several attempts shackleton get back elephant island rescue the remaining crewmen in the end he is successful and everyone made it back home alive only be swallowed up the ravages of the war the title of this fascinating documentary the endurance is more than just the name of ship that carried the crew of brave men the edge of the world it is also the description of the stamina and ability of every one of the men who survived months of the toughest most grueling conditions on the face of the earth the name of the is tribute every member of the crew and the ship that sheltered them for many month of frigid antarctic weather it also describes the focused mental state of shackleton who never gave up on himself or his men astonishing foresight shackleton brought australian cinematographer and photographer frank hurley along on the journey the filmed footage and photos are remarkable as they capture the ordeal of the men day day life the affection all felt for their loyal sled dogs the slow destruction of the endurance and the preparations get off of the pack ice flow after the sinking of the ship the remaining stock the exception of still camera and three rolls of had be discarded so the continuing chronicle of the incredible journey gets less photo documentation as the ordeal plods on considering hurley was using relatively primitive photo technology in one of the worlds harshest environments and captured so much on is feat unto itself hurley created his own account of the shackleton expedition in his documentary south an interesting companion piece for the endurance if shackletons original idea document his trek across the frigid southern continent had been successful it would have been considered super human feat as you watch the story of the endurance unfold you realize that the disastrous obstacles the sir ernest and his men faced and overcame were even greater accomplishments than the first intent shackletons amazing mile journey in an open boat is fodder for rousing adventure story all itself there are couple of minor nitpicks this fine work though actor liam neeson narrates the story but his voice is too soft spoken and lilting for the dramatic tale the nature of the ordeal also concentrates most of the visual material both and photo in the documentarys first half as the crews adventure takes more drastic paths hurley had less and less stock available chronicle the awesome events helmer butler and his team fill in the blanks but the treasure of the endurance its footage is mostly relegated the early months of the expedition cannot think of truelife adventure that shows better the triumph of man over seemingly insurmountable odds the endurance based on caroline alexanders book is an eyeopening documentary that goes where few men have gone before and even more remarkably all survivors lived tell about it give it b

every yearevery year at the festival wait for that come along that one that just pulls me out of my seat sticks its face up next my nose and roars surprise into my bewildered visage it is almost always surprise it sure as niflheim was this time amazing grace and chuck is being advertised as modern fairy tale of boy in montana who quits his little league team for very unusual reason and in the hands of anyone less careful than the creative staff of this it might very well be nothing more than fairy tale where we roll our eyes occasionally smirk ourselves and maybe get forced tear out of the eyes and boy wish that could happen sigh out of the lips upon exiting the theater and tossing the empty pepsi cup into the trash another t another short circuit this floored me for the simple reason that while it has fairy tale concept the rest of the takes itself seriously enough and presents itself well enough make it more of an american folk tale characters who are both icons and real people at the same time america has always had its mythical heros its paul bunyans and john waynes this presents us more general but still universal ideals the honest innocent children who have their own inner wisdom the athletes who seem be amalgamations of courage honor and love for their respective sport the venerable elected official who leads kindness and understanding but has the grit get things done when they need doin does the latter sound familiar amazing grace and chuck is showcase for these characters but it never leaves you the feeling that it is artificial that it stands behind glass or that any sharp breezeor more importantly sharp thoughtwill shatter the wax facade of the panorama this is very sturdy scenario the principals are always given dialogue and always give performancesalways it just blows me away made them seem real yet enforces their particular mythic role the writerproducer david field seems literally take all the yeah but in real life this would have happen thoughts you get in your head sticks them in the movie and uses them bend the plot around his original heading in stronger way then before astounding he uses obstacles the plot enforce it am truly impressed indeed envious the skill in he wrote the story and screenplay it is so very unusual especially in do not want give too much away but the basic premise is that chuck joshua zuehlke the little league pitcher decides give up baseball because of nuclear weapons his decision begins an unlikely series of events that involve another athlete boston basketball player alex english amazing grace smith and well am leaving it at that because would not spoil this for you for the world let me just say this though am not recommending this because think it has great message or because of any political positions it might imply do not give rats ass for the political pointofview this expresses one way or another am recommending you go see this because and only because it is an excellent story told excellence no do not believe what happens in this could happen in real life while tend believe the arms control policy of this country is stilted believe in careful negotiations mutual verification etc screw what think the point is this is able suspend my disbelief and tell story that is one of the most finely crafted pieces of american dream have ever seen on the movie screen this is the natural and moreall the mythic qualities without the pretentiousness or the forced feeling of the conclusion and much better script boot it carried me into the beliefs and ideals of my boyhoodand more importantly without any bumps or jolts that would snap me out of the trance some hint of selfconsciousness special kudos both zuehlke reallife little league pitcher who was picked for the part and english forward for the denver nuggets for their seamless personification of their characters jamie lee curtis who takes surprisingly small role and makes it exceedingly memorable as amazings manager and friend william peterson in big change from his role in live and die in a as father who shows principles without having stand up and wave flag doing it and gregory peck as the guy we wish ronald reagan really was and who some numbskulls still probably think he is

oh god how many john grisham lawyer films we have been munundated in perfect world civil action would be breath of fresh air it is cynical about lawyers in way that grisham is not it is romantic in the exact opposite way grisham bookfilm is not and the capper it has no distinct ending and the law in films is that above all else you must have an ending even if it is based on true story true story has not yet ended you must supply an ending false one but an ending nevertheless hell civil action is even more sly and more witty than any of the grisham works put together and that includes the firm the only novel of his that will ever be regarded as classic yet it is also oddly and slightly unsatisfying weird this is in fact steve zallian not just the work of hack and zallian is the director of the muchadmired search for bobby fischer did not see it and writer of none other than schindlers list in short like this guy and am sucker for the way he tells his stories after all apart from the obvious it isaholocaustfilm and it isaspielbergfilm is not schindlers list just damn brilliant not so much holocaust as it is wonderful character study civil action is the same way it is narrative is split between being lawyer and being character study and it is here that the seems go bit wrong the main complaint of this is that while yes it is an engrossing lawyerly tale it has no real ending and that is not necessarily the problem the it is that it is just kind of unsatisfying if this were great it would feel complete and still end basically the same way but this just seems end and do not want be stupid and suggest an alternate ending should be tacked on imagine if you will being one of those the is about looking forward this and then discovered the truth has been through surrealistic and unpleasant filter just so the many will not bitch about what is essentially genuine but the fact that it just ends is not in all actuality what is wrong it it is rather that zallian has chosen in the last half hour adandon the traditional lawyer story and chose the other part of his story the one about the lawyer one jan schlictman john travolta who is shown in the opening and throughout most of the movie as heartless but brilliant lawyer brilliant because he is manipulative and he always wins it wishes make it all about jan in the end but the truth is his change although nicely done is not full we see him suffering from personal crisis and travolta does do pretty good job in depicting his change of heart but in the end we do not fully believe it and think that the problem is when he has made his decision the choses an odd angle go at noble one but one that gives the films conclusion that of incompleteness in the opening of the we see him doing his old schtick manipulating courts winning cases effortlessly and then discussing on heard radio interview how great he is at his job and how much he cares for his cases in short he is full of bullshit and we know it in the he takes case that is hardly desired town where several of the children have died mysteriously of lukemia and the source of the illness seems be from local factory that may or may not have been dumping waste into the river point one it is not of the usual criteria jan points out wickedly that dead or wounded children are not nearly as sympathetic as those struck down in the midst of their success point two it has been through several lawyers after turning them down jan changes his mind muddled scene he stops his car on bridge looks out is he feeling sense of overachievement and he and his team of lawyers tony shalhoub zeljko ivanek and accountant william macy head out the town do battle the towns company they spend millions of dollars examining the land test the water what have you this is where stephen fry possible oscar nominee for his brilliant performance in wilde pops up thanklessly and in the meantime question the parents of the dead children and then unsuccessfully the workers at the plant they also find themselves clashing brilliant lawyer for the company the eccentric jerome facher played robert duvall more on him later on as we progress we get so involved in the way the story is being told is engulfing everything around it including the individual and brief stories of some of the townspeople one of the best is bit james gandolfini as an employee of the plant living across the street from kathleen quinland who lost her child who begins have personal crisis things begin go downhill for the lawyers in the second half as they are up against impossible odds the judge john lithgow is not only strickler but pal of facher the employees of the plant are either afraid or loyal testify no concrete evidence is being found depsite the money spent find it and they are quickly running out of money as macy mortgages everything he can including their homes and their office he slowly loses his sanity his meatiest role since oh fargo and we the audience begin feel real loss of hope for our protagonist in fact the last half hour is such change from the rest of the and so unresolved that it has been widely panned as not being up par owen gleiberman especially criticized the for not being overlydramatic suppose like grisham novel this would not be so if the change in jan had not been handled the way it is instead of having change of heart and automatically being perceived as good he is seen as being still full of bullshit because he does not take stock in the cares of his partners and causes them all lose their money and noteriaty in the lawyer field because he wants help the people of the town he is instead seen as being of good nature but not sure how bring that out the final half tries redeem this as must have been the point of making this in zallians mind but what follows is series of scenes where we merely see him making personal stands for his beliefs and though he has changed considerably from the opening moments when he is seen speeding back and forth from the town that wishes employ him and thusly receiving two speeding tickets we still feel that the big change in his life is that he is not rich and esteemed anymore the films final title card is witty but in all actuality shallow the fault is not that there is no closure the court case it is still going on you know but that its personal story feels like it needs either another chapter or another angle in the final one it has we need feel like the character has really made big change in his life and that the story is how story of strife like the one of the town could inspire such whopping change in his personal life it only feels like half of that maybe even less and it is not travolta who does great job here though never be truly memorable performance of his but rather zallian whose final chapter needs rewrite up then though it is an engrossing drama one of the best of the year in fact and one of the best lawyer films period the reason is because it recognizes that court trial is not about those being defended or prosecuted but rather it is about the lawyers the knights who battle eachother we learn that the company is almost positively blame for the deaths in the town but the reason it cannot be blamed is because it has the best prosecution you can find and duvalls facher is such brilliant character and he does such magnificent job at portraying that man that it is almost easy overlook how subtley great he is facher is seen as an elderly man goofy eccentric carrying broken brown bag stickers on it eating lunches out of paper bags and making point take time out of his day listen the radio and scold anyone who interupts him but look deeper and you see master at work his evil and manipulative nature are hidden under the eccentricities that others don upon him and it is difficult as hell clearly generalize him in any way that is why liked this it is hard put pointer on you can never see exactly where this will land and even when the credits roll you still are not sure what make of it call it the zallian effect same thing happened schindlers list not that am comparing oskar schindler jan schlictman each is so greatly crafted that you cannot help but get involved in its broad storytelling interesting characters and most peculiarly the wit that comes along it if only it felt totally complete like say schindlers list though at this point it may be unfair make comparisons between the two it might have been one of the best films of the year and along that full breath of fresh air

the seasoned capt dudley smith james cromwell questions his new protege ed exley guy pearce about his political views when it comes police work would you plant evidence get conviction if you knew the person be guilty would you shoot man in the back if you knew that it was the only way make sure he got what he deserved exley squeaky clean innocent and pent the desire perform his new duties integrity and honesty quickly answers pointed no stunned smith pleads then for the love of god do not be detective la confidential is dandy piece of filmmaking that brings us back the classic times of in the organized crime was the biggest concern corruption existed everywhere and every cop had his own way of getting the job done there was jack vincennes kevin spacey who gets most of his information from the editor of sleazy tellallshowall tabloid sid hudgeons danny devito sporting dark sunglasses and white sports coat he is not afraid flash his tinseltown style detective bud white russell crowe has only narrowminded view of the law and he uses excessive force exact his unique kind of interrogation and brutal justice and then there is golden boy exley wideeyed and ambitious but extremely naive horrible multiple murder begins draw these three men together each of whom become inexorably connected in their search for truth action and personal vindication almost immediately an arrest is made but something does not seem quite right new developments become sinuous as the story begins draw us deeper into the labyrinth of corruption and crime within the department suspicion and questions begin mount odd alliances are created and as layers of the truth become revealed the story grows more complex and intriguing the moment when the mystery expands we see other seemingly guilty characters enter the lives of these three cops including highpriced hooker kim basinger and shady millionaire david strathairn all of the characters levels of involvement are not immediately clear we watch riveted fascination learn more about why they are there and their stake in the case we sense crosspollination of clues that brings us the audience closer the truth we hope that the three detectives can throw away their spite for one another and can pull their resources together in order untangle the intricately created web of mystery absorbing and affecting this movie has all the necessary ingredients create terrific gourmet serving of noir it boasts mysterious figures in control doublecrosses hard information from sleazy sources dirty politicians corrupt cops haunting women and hardnosed cops experiencing moral ambiguity the underlying mystery is compelling the look and feel of the movie is gorgeous the entire cast is crisp and wonderful watch would not be surprised if cromwell received an oscar nomination for his performance and the dialogue is rich and memorable the best line of the movie is spoken when key player dispenses advice one of the detectives unsure of what do do not start trying do the right thing boyo says he you have not had the practice a confidential triumphantly achieves the rare gift of complexity and coherence while satisfying our desire for good oldfashioned movie

aliens well that is what this movie is about computer generated aliens ok the movie is not just about computer generated aliens it is about computer generated aliens and secret organization known as mib if one was not green and running around the other would not exist as it is known the computer graphics in this movie are spectacular they make you want believe that aliens like the ones depicted exits since seeing this movie have agree concede that denis rodman is an alien he simply has be well in all seriousness the aliens created here are not only of the monster variety but are also of the soft squishy and cuddly kind just adds something of lighter note the movie where it could have become very dark along aliens comes the humor and in pretty decent way well soon be a smart ass cop played will smith runs down what he thinks is wouldbe villain and gets some attention from the mib and in particular aims recruit our poor but that is not the whole point of this movie the main duty of the mib is police the extra terrestrials on earth who have chosen it as home or refuge that is also the main point of this movie protect the earth from the scum of the galaxy some of the scum from space is awfully bad and just down right nasty color commentary abounds when forced deal alien scum and none other than will smith and tommy lee jones are there deliver the punch the dialogue is witty say the least this wittiness lets the movie flow well from scene scene developing the characters the extent needed for this movie tommy lee jones as and will smith as provide both the action and the comedy beautifully the characters they play do not seem be wrong in any way nor does their performance as them would have say that is more amusing than but what is one without the other both roles complemented each other very well and the script seemed be written for these two actors the story also goes deep enough provide proper background so the audience is not totally clueless altogether character development and if there was some development of the alien characters that might have added quite considerable the movie especially the evil alien he did need some work though this could have been worked on the movie was what it proposed be rather shallow and witty comedy that was achieved rather well some interesting commentary and observations movie worth view but keep in mind what the movie is and if you are not fond of will smiths form of humor then would not go originally written after original release totally rewritten december

in the opening shot of midnight cowboy we see closeup of blank movie screen at drivein we hear in the soundtrack human cries and the stomping of horses hooves without an image projected onto the screen the audience unerringly identifies the familiar sound of cowboys chasing indians and can spontaneously fill in the blank screen images of old westerns in our minds eye even without having seen cowboys and indians movie somehow the cliched images of them seem have found their way into our mental schema but do cowboys really exist or are they merely images personified john wayne and gary cooper exploring this theme director john schlesinger uses the idea of the cowboy as metaphor for the american dream an equally cliched yet ambiguous concept is the ease at salvation and success can be attained in america hallmark of its experience or an urban legend midnight cowboy suggests that the american dream like image of the cowboy is merely myth as joe buck migrates from place place he finds neither redemption nor reward in his attempt create life for himself only further degeneration during the opening credits joe walks past an abandoned theater whose decrepit marquee reads john wayne the alamo as joe is on the bus listening radio talk show lady on the air describes her ideal man as gary cooper but he is dead troubled expression comes across joes face as he wonders where have all the cowboys gone having adopted the image of cowboy since youth joe now finds himself deserted the persona he tried embody joes persistence in playing the act of the cowboy serves as an analogue his american dream he romanticizes about making it in the big city but his dreams will desert him as he is forced compromise his ideals for sustenance the end of midnight cowboy joe buck loses everything and gains nothing just as the audience can picture cowboys chasing indians on blank screen we can also conjure up scenes from pretty woman as paradigms of american redemption and success but how realistic are these ideals joe had raped and been raped in texas the scars of his troubled past prompt him migrate new york but he does not know that his aspirations be cowboy hero will fail him there just as they had in texas alongside the dream of success is the dream of salvation the ability pack up ones belongings and start anew seems be an exclusive american convention schlesinger provides us strong hints as joes abusive and abused past flashbacks of improper relationships crazy anne and granny we understand that joe adopts the fa ade of cowboy symbol of virility and gallantry as an attempt neutralize his shame he runs from his past only be sexually defiled this time his homosexual experiences in new york in the scene at the diner foreshadows joes encounter the gay student joe buck spills ketchup on himself standing up we see the ketchup has made red stain running from the crotch of his pants down his thigh schlesinger visually depicts the degeneration of joes virility
