eliciting an image of bleeding genitals signifying emasculation beyond the symbol of castration the scene may also connote the bleeding of virgins first sexual encounter reference joes first homosexual liaison the fact that the idea of bleeding virgin is relegated only females furthers the imagery of joes emasculation it is ironic that joe has trouble prospecting for female clients but effortlessly attracts men joe believes his broncobuster getup is emblematic of his masculinity new yorkers see his ensemble as camp and faggot stuff there are two predominant images of new york the first is that new york is the rich cosmopolitan city where hope and opportunity are symbolized the tall skyscrapers and the statue of liberty the other new york is travis bickles new york seedy corruptive hell on earth joe envisions new york as the former but is presented the latter mirroring the irony in joe envisions his cowboy attire as masculine he mistakenly buys into the fable that new york is filled lonely women neglected gay men joe thinks he is performing great service for new york but the city rapes him of his pride and possessions the people steal joes money the landlord confiscates his luggage and the homosexuals rob him of his dignity what has become of joes american dream schlesinger responds this question the scene at the party joe gets invited shindig of sorts and at the gathering is exposed dizzying array of food drugs and sex at the party all of joe and ratzos desires are made flesh joe flirts successfully women and ratzo loads up on free salami contrasting joes daily struggles shots of warhols crew display wanton indulgence there is an irreverence in the partygoers attitude we see shot of woman kowtowing nothing in particular orgies breaking out in the periphery and drugs passed around like party favors the party makes mockery of joe ideals joe believed that hard work and persistence were the elements for success in america scenes of the party and his rendezvous shirley suggest that it is the idle who profit from joes toils the american dream schlesinger suggests is merely proletarian fantasy for those who are content no longer dream but become indolent as joe heads miami all that was significant of the cowboy image has left him his masculinity is compromised and his morality is relinquished for joe nothing is left of the cowboy hero and commensurately he surrenders the identity tossing his boots into the garbage he returns the bus for the last leg of his journey miami the final shot of midnight cowboy shows joe inside the bus more introspective taking only few glances outside the window instead of the frequent pov shots of joe excitedly looking out of the bus on his way new york schlesinger sets up this final shot from the exterior of the bus looking in through the window at joe reflections of the palm trees ratzo so raved about run across the bus window joe hardly taking notice the scenery of miami no longer exacts the same excitement from joe as before the world seems smaller joe now the termination of his journey coincides the termination of his american dream no longer does joe aspire be the enterprising gigolo he resolves return normal job and resign basic means midnight cowboy presents two familiar incarnations of the american dream there is the frontier fantasy that if you are brave enough repel few indians you can set up ranch out west and raise beautiful family then there is the jay gatsby dream that man of humble stock perseverance can make fortune in the big city joes attempt realize these dreams robs him of his innocence in texas and morality in new york during his search for an intangible paradise joe ends up raping girl and killing man an allegory of chasing the promise of the american dream joe bucks progressive moral atrophy is warning against the pursuit of illusory icons

metro have seen san francisco in movies many times there was interview the vampire and most recently the rock now yet again san francisco is the setting for this movie eddie murphy stars as inspector scott roper of the sfpd he is their top hostage negotiator and the very best at what he does when his best friend on the force is killed joe michael wincott in terrific performance psychotic demented jewel thief roger makes it his mission capture the guy before he strikes again meanwhile roper tries rekindle relationship his british exgirlfriend veronica while helping rear new up and comer from swat who is an expert sniper and marksman michael rappaport despite the obligatory cop movie scenes does every copnew partner movie have start the same way where the sgt assigns roper partner roper confronts the sarge etc this is still one heck of an explosive ride scene involving cable car has be seen be believed and boasts some amazing car stunts eddie murphy shines in this tailormade role and for once his character shows depth and concern when confronting joe in prison you can feel the anger drip from every word michael rappaport is basically throwaway he serves no purpose except be buddy murphy and get disabled in the final reel so that eddie can save the day typical action escapist fare michael wincott offers the best performance as the crazed killer and jewel thief joe never before have seen such villian written like this where could actually believe that he was serious and take him seriously maybe just thought that this role was different due wincotts perfectly raspy voice do not know what do know though is that although metro is basically typical action retread it manages cover new ground and shed new light on tired old cliches the is triumph and an entertaining one at that it does not meander or trail off from its main character an enjoyable two hours metro is enjoyable witty actionpacked and fun and makes for great action movie that is perfect for all of us that need an escape from reality

susan grangers review of hearts in atlantis castle rockwarner bros timing is everything and the timing just seems right for this poignant psychological drama that combines the comingofage nostalgia of stand me the mystical power of the green mile based on stephen king stories adapted screenwriter william goldman and directed scott hicks it is set in in harwich connecticut where fatherless yearold bobby garfield anton yelchin lives in boarding house his resentful selfcentered mother hope davis he is devoted his neighborhood friends mika boorem will rothhaar but his pivotal relationship is strange new tenant ted brautigan anthony hopkins who opens the world of literature him after his selfish mother refuses buy him birthday gift and hands him instead library card knowing he is longing for schwinn bike ted offers pay him week read him the local newspaper and keep his eyes peeled for signs of the malevolent ominous low men who are chasing him exploit his special powers the story structure consists of one long flashback framed the present featuring the adult bobby david morse minimizing the supernatural elements while emphasizing the human drama hopkins mysterious character is genteel sensitive and benignly seductive the only explanation is that he is psychic who is wanted the fbi aid in their hunt for communists and even that seems appropriate given the inexplicable state of the world right now the production values and performances are solid particularly hopkins arguably the finest most versatile actor of our era and the children whom he forges firm bond on the granger movie gauge of hearts in atlantis is wistful enigmatic evolving subtle power an emotionally effective catharsis

note some may consider portions of the following text be spoilers be forewarned floating life australias firstever submission the academy of motion picture arts sciences for consideration in the best foreign language category its dialogue is in cantonese english and german marks special accomplishment clara law compelling at times poignant it manages maintain its truthfulness while teetering between comedy and melodrama floating life centers around hong kong familys sense of dislocation and loss of identity after moving australia in order avoid the communist takeover of hong kong and is divided into clearly defined vignettes each chapter labelled title cards pertaining houses serves emphasize the films theme of family the opens mr and mrs chan edwin pang cecilia fong sing lee and their two teen sons toby wong toby chan leaving the bustling claustrophobic metropolis of hong kong join their second daughter bing annie yip in australia their spacious immaculatelywhite new house and the vast abundance of neighbourhood greenery the chans initially find this serene new land strange and wonderous one and neurotic bing cooly remarking about the possible dangers of australian life killer dogs poisonous spiders dangerous ultraviolet rays frightening one this sets up wonderfully amusing scene early in the where the four immigrants aimlessly ambling about their new suburban neighbourhood are sent scrambling the yelps of little white puppy the tone set up early in the is broadly comic and one expects floating life depict the clash of cultures as the chans struggle acclimatize themselves the new ways of australian life as they integrate themselves into australian society scene where the two teen sons meet up sunbathing neighbourhood girl is left dangling but the suddenly veers towards an introspective and melodramatic tone floating life shifts its focus away from the exploits of the new immigrants and towards bings domineering of her newlyreunited family setting out set of stringent and oppressive rules create tremendous tension within the household and threaten fracture the family meanwhile elder daughter yen annette shun wah happily settled in germany her husband and young daughter begins suffer an identity crisis manifesting itself her claims her patiently exasperated husband that their new home is cursed bad feng shui and further exacerbated upon hearing of the familial conflict down under among the dramatic threads of floating life this is perhaps the most effective and engaging an interesting set of characters and storyline generates genuine emotional punch the one misguided vignette in floating life involves eldest son gar ming anthony wong left behind in hong kong resolve various affairs on behalf of his family and await his immigration papers before rejoining his parents and brothers in australia emotionally detatched and aimlessly drifting his is an uncompelling character and consequently subsequent attempts draw out pathos are uninvolving and ineffective his desperate search for emotional fulfillment is depicted philosopical droning on the exquisite peak of an orgasm quickly becomes tedious ms laws cheerfully embraces melodrama each of the major vignettes feature excessively emotional climaxes could not help but find reminiscent wayne wangs acutely unsubtle the joy luck club but despite the directors rather clear attempts tug at the heartstrings could not help but be touched powerful and affecting soliloquy delivered masterfully cecilia fong sing lee truly packs an emotional wallop and in dramatic terms is certainly the highlight of floating life floating life at times spreads itself too thin given the myriad of characters involved it could either stand delve into each vignette little deeper or narrow its focus select group of key characters however it is fine thoughtful and insightful screenplay clara law and husband eddie lingching fong and some superb acting cast consisting almost exclusively of nonactors special note is be made of cecilia fong sing lee annette shun wah and short but dazzling performance an actress who portrayed gar mings girlfriend from vancouver floating life is ultimately about the ties that bond family together are able withstand great distances and new environments

plot peculiar french girl grows up lonely her father and does not quite know what she wants out of life one day she falls upon something and believes that her ticket happiness may be in helping others she starts the people around her but when she suddenly falls for her own guy she cannot act strongly enough because of her shy and dreamy nature critique clever quirky original french flick set in picturesque paris featuring an endearing lead giant imagination much loneliness and little bit of love for everyone this is feelgood kind of movie fairy tale for grownups who are bummed out about life it does not pretend be deep it does not weigh itself down long expositions or intricate studies of its characters it is basically just cute movie in the same vein as chocolat and pay it forward some amazing visuals and incredibly nice intentions and if chocolat was somehow able nab an oscar nomination for best picture last year sham on so many different levels you might as well slap this up for consideration also since it is quite bit better and much more original than the former one thing that this is not though at least according me is the best of the year it was bestowed the honor of best in at least different festivals so far this year it actually managed stagnate little bit about halfway through and it just went on for way too long it is little over two hours but it felt even longer much of the second half of the movie devoted many different characters all of whom were not as interesting as the lead and lot of indecisiveness from ms amelie herself got frustrating thankfully this does not bog itself down too much of that stuff and actually goes out of its way invent new ways shoot scenes integrate moments of fantasy into its fabric and transport the audience inside the imagination of this kindhearted french girl on the whole it is lot of fun and it carries beautiful message of love and support for your fellow man the lead audrey tautou is perfect for the role and gives you enough moments of truth develop her character into someone that you care about the end of the unfortunately the rest of the cast is not as welldeveloped and even though most of them are pretty appealing couple could have been left out save time and at least one was left stranded plotwise the films end what happened the guy in the caf who was spying on his exgirlfriend the whole movie now have not seen too many recent french films will admit but if this is the kind of scene that they are developing over in le pays du vin would not mind catching more of their flicks in the future crimson rivers was another french that saw earlier this year really liked ironically that was directed mathieu kassovitz who is the costar in this granted the english subtitles got little tough keep up at times speak and understand french also but some of the local colloquialisms went over my head especially since the films visuals were so intriguing that you just could not help but constantly gawk at them but the general idea the background music the nifty french neighborhoods the very creative way of enveloping the audience into the storyline from the start were all very easy appreciate and for one was especially glad have seen this movie during these trying times in the world in fact would recommend it anyone looking for jolly ol time at the movie house particular emphasis on folks lot of imagination little loneliness in their lives and many dreams in their hearts and this guy directed alien resurrection get outta here note especially loved the way that the script detailed and showed the loveshates of everyone exact mentions in the it was very original very well shot and very nostalgic as many of us were able relate the behaviors described good stuff where is joblo coming from chocolat crimson rivers ghost world like water for chocolate brother where art thou pay it forward rushmore woman on top

eric rohmers pauline at the beach is one of those small deliberately paced but charming foreign films in not much happens plot wise but lot happens the characters emotionally the takes place during few weeks of august at the normandy coast and centers on six different characters primarily pauline amanda langlet wise beyond her years yearold who has come stay for the summer her older cousin marion arielle dombasle on the first day at the beach marion runs into an old high school flame fedoore atkine and although he wants rekindle their relationship she is more interested in an older more seductive womanizer pascal greggory who is also secretly having an affair candy vendor rosette while pauline watches as an outsider at what is happening between all of the adults she forms relationship of her own young teenage boy simon de la brosse pauline at the beach is not in big dramatic things occur and there is not clearcut tidy conclusion the story instead it is picture that simply observes its characters in every day life and the surprises come from little character details the is quite talky and slow moving and so it is pretty safe say it is not for those who are only fan of action movies but is treat for those viewers who often like venture outside of the bigbudget genre and see good art this is the first acclaimed director eric rohmer my night at mauds and claires knee that have seen but his direction is assured and intelligent as is the screenplay he also wrote pauline at the beach is worth seeing

after rather disappointing mary railly stephen frears is now officially back in business comeback worthy of praise this is one of the best surprises of this season sweet small budget comedy big heart in fact it is not even comedy it is drama or even more precise clever satire on human relationships and needs based on critically acclaimed novel british author nick hornby high fidelity is wry and likable story about mans quest for fulfillment and happiness rob gordon was dj it seems that he could make everything spin except his own life now he owns championship vinyl little musical store somewhere in new york when he suddenly gets dumped his girlfriend gorgeous blond attorney life suddenly looses every purpose decimated humiliated and on the verge of mental and emotional breakdown he starts meditating over his life and the way it could have been about what is right and what is important he starts categorizing life dividing it into top lists and the most important is the top list over the most painful breakups of his life starting th grade when he found his young girlfriend another boy though you might think that people change grow more mature age it just does not seem that way and all robs relationships were different versions of that first where did he go wrong was it he that screwed up or maybe life just stinks while he is lost in his own selfpity he must think of the top list over his needs for the future find the right elements and mix his life together clever parallels the cult of celebrity music and incredibly direct narration it addresses the average audience member in other words people like you and me although lot of this honor should be addressed the screenwriter ______ and frears the director the acting is equally important as the written word and here john cusack should absolutely be mentioned he is simply superb it is as much his movie as it is frears the would not be the same without him cusack whose character is sadder wiser and brings intelligence and warmth post mod irony most of his dialogue is delivered directly the camera not an easy task but cusack pulls it off his interpretation feels so emotionally right so incredibly realistic and precise that frears message simply cannot be ignored or overseen the other members of the cast do an equally remarkable job both ______ and jack black are fabulous even catherine zeta jones appears in role where she actually acts not just looks beautiful however the most unexpected pleasant surprises is provided todd louiso who delivers spectacular comic performance as robs coworker and friend dick this is such an impressive achievement that it is almost worth oscarnomination he is simply joy behold otherwise everyone are in their place and at the right time all part of frears colorful blend pretty much like edward nortons keeping the faith this does not follow any formula or belong any genre it is dramatic tragic sarcastic comic and even cynical but never bitter or angry it is little bit of everything pretty much like life itself nothing seems unreal or staged it reflects reality as mirror as you watch it you go through the same emotional problems as the main character you feel and think and reflect this effect has become rarity nowadays although it is primarily about the perils of love high fidelity is secondarily about pop music rob owns championship vinyl and his employees timid dick todd louiso and overbearing barry jack black are fellow music snobs music is the language in their lives the measure they define themselves and mark the significant events of their lives and so does the movie it is as much musical as anything else as robs journey is wonderfully portrayed through carefully inserted musical fragments in the end you have gained something while watching it it is not the of the century or even of the year it is not an special effects extravaganza it does not require big explosions or digital creatures succeed it is small movie about the big things and even though it does not contain heavy philosophy you feel as if you have experienced something of significance and you will experience that nice warm feeling for quite some time

plot group of asbestos cleaners get job removing the gunk from an old insane asylum as each day passes the crew members begin discover things about the place and themselves set other things in motion saying anything else about the plot would be crime have fun critique feel like shooting myself in the head are the first words that came out of my mouth after seeing this movie good indication as what kind of expect here this as not your average happy go lucky kind of picture this is deliberately slowpaced mysteryhorror drenched in atmosphere very creepy insane asylum in most of the takes place very few clues upfront and lots talk about afterwards will it bore some people sleep you bet it will is it made for the scream audiences of the day absolutely not guess you can describe this as horror movie for the cerebral crowd that patiently unwraps itself frame after frame giving away very little each step and each sound unwinding itself until its final scenes offer up world of revelations and plenty more discuss later have always loved movies that have me talking about them afterwards like the shining and lost highway and this fits right into that group in fact guess can pussyfoot around the actual word all want but the best way describe this kind of movie is mindfuck if you feel like watching movie that moves very slowly gives you handful of characters divergent backgrounds tosses few very ambiguous and supernatural cookies your way and is extremely disturbing once you put it all together well then this movie is definitely for you it is the kind of that you actually have see twice fully appreciate damn missed that whole peanut butter thing and one that will likely creep the shit out of you if watched alone in the dark brrrrrrrrr now what was that sound in the basement honey can you go check and one thing this does not have unlike its hollywoodian counterparts like the haunting is special effects in fact that is one of the greater things about this movie it feels real because it looks like it is actually taped on video very credible actors in very credible circumstances did some research and it was in fact shot on digital video ahha another great thing about it is that it is actually very gory and somewhat violent in theme and yet we rarely see anything of the sort on the big screen it is mostly implied kids and as clich as it might be say it is usually much scarier when stuff is left our imagination or implied in movies as such other films that this one reminded me of include henry portrait of serial killer and the blair witch project that same real sense of dread brooding and terror the does however move awfully slow and if you really do not get into it completely you really need concentrate here you will lose the motion of the story and the pentup tension might be released but overall this is yet another great example of the horror genre making very cool comeback this year no tight tanktops in sight and david caruso acting like the king hotshot like only he can how can you go wrong definitely not for everyone but mustsee for anyone looking throw themselves into the psyche of the disturbed count me in stanley kubrick would be proud oh yeah so where is that gun again where is joblo coming from the blair witch project blair witch the haunting the house on haunted hill lost highway the pledge the shining the sixth sense unbreakable

hedwig and the angry inch john cameron mitchell miriam shor stephen trask michael pitt theodore liscinski michael aronov andrea martin maurice dean wint ben mayergoodman animation emily hubley adapted from the stage play john cameron mitchell and stephen trask music and lyrics stephn trask written and directed john cameron mitchell minutes rated stars had hedwig and the angry inch came out in the right after david bowies ziggy stardust it likely would now be regarded as one of the most popular rock musicals of all time released in the channel sensory overload world of however the big screen adaptation of the acclaimed offbroadway musical must do battle countless other productions clamoring for attention almost missed it every august the major studios try squeeze the last few dollars out of summer moviegoers dumping all of their shakier offerings on the marketplace at once was so busy trying keep up national releases like summer catch and bubble boy that passed over any independent that looked like it would only have short local run but an email from reader asking why had not reviewed the movie prompted me make late evening trip the theater thank goodness for readers like him hedwig and the angry inch is genderbending glamrock spectacular packed great songs stylistically the hookladen tunes are reminiscent of bowie bat out of hell era meatloaf and the rocky horror show without ever seeming like imitations as tommy hedwig tells story of isolation pain and defiance but without the bloated feel of that beloved but overrated rock opera writerdirectorstar john cameron mitchell and composerlyricist stephen trask have cooked up real winner mitchell stars as hedwig singer from east berlin touring chain of s coffee shops her panslavic band the angry inch while the patrons of the rundown restaurants look on in shock and sometimes horror hedwig boldly tells the sad story of her life in song she was once boy named hansel ben mayergoodman living his mother alberta watson and listening rock and roll on american armed forces radio life is an exercise in duality for hansel wall splits his hometown into two parts mother describes love as the emotion that comes when you find your other half as hansel grows up the duality becomes more pronounced after initially mistaking him for girl gi from the states maurice dean wint falls in love hansel and wants marry him alas hansel will never pass the mandatory physical mother helpfully suggests sex change but the operation goes bad hence the references the angry inch yes know this part is squirminducing but stick me it is worth it several years later mr right is long gone and hansel becomes hedwig decked out in farrah fawcettstyle wig and fronting band made up of korean women hedwig finds new love in tommy michael pitt beatific lad unique take on christianity but tommy does hedwig wrong stealing her songs and becoming superstar cut the present tommy gnosis stadium tour is thriving and hedwig is suing him despite warnings from her manager andrea martin that she could easily be labeled stalker hegwig and her new band the angry inch continue their coffee shop tour shadowing the thief playing whatever city he is in if this sounds like bizarre premise for rock musical take few seconds and consider the plotlines of tommy and rocky horror as hedwig john cameron mitchell does magnificent job taking character that could have simply been caricature or an icon and turning her into compelling human being mitchell has worldclass style and vocal chords match even though the backstory is unusually strong mitchell never forgets that the production is first and foremost rock musical everything is propelled one terrific song after another and trust me these are fullfledged rock songs not the overprocessed fluff that passes for rock in most musicals while mitchell remains in the center of the stage throughout the there is much of interest on the sidelines miriam shor does fine work as yitzhak hedwigs lover and bandmate conveying great deal through expressions alone decked out in bandanna and surprisingly convincing beard she makes mighty attractive man as always sctv veteran andrea martin is welcome presence onscreen and michael pitt is beguiling as tommy the angelicappearing little rat artist emily hubley adds the magic string of dandy animated sequences that charm the eye while underlining the central themes of the musical hedwig and the angry inch surrounds weird funny and touching story knockout series of songs performed an exceptional cast true originals do not come along very often do not let this slip out of town without seeing it

many bigbudget science fiction films great ideas are often wasted bad scripts cheesy plot twists and terrible acting the fifth element the abyss and godzilla had great concepts squandered bad acting writing or both at first glance the matrix larry andy wachowskis scifikungfushootemup spectacular looks like prime candidate join the list of highconcept bad movies especially dopey keanu reeves in the leading role but despite high levels of cheese and gaudy dialogue the matrix works it is an uncanny blend of action and surreal fantasy that borrows from dozens of other films most obviously the terminator films star wars and total recall but remains refreshingly original and interesting throughout reeves plays neo computer hacker who stumbles into an initially bewildering set of encounters trinity carrieanne moss rival hacker who has supernatural powers and stunning good looks unseen omniscient cult figure known as morpheus lawrence fishburne and trio of creepy men in dark suits who act like irs agents from hell neo quickly learns that the world he has known all his life is not what it seems moreover he discovers that the grim bleak world he is introduced has been waiting for him save it neo is reluctant assume the role of messiah grave doubts that he is actually the one prophesized come and save the world reluctant or not what follows is mix of hong kongstyle slowmotion shootouts surreal dream sequences high speed chases and comic book kungfu fights the also raises interesting philosophical questions about reality how exactly do you know what is real and what is in your mind and if the real world were much harsher and grim than fantasy one you were living in would you want face the true world or continue live in more comfortable illusion unfortunately the matrix does not provide many answers the questions it raises but at least it puts some ideas behind all the explosions shootouts and flying roundhouse kicks perhaps stealing the entire show in the matrix is australian actor hugo weaving who plays agent smith the leader of the creepy agents in sunglasses and suits who seem capable of being anywhere and doing anything stop neo and friends from destabilizing the matrix weavings stony appearance deadpan voice and chilling comments put grim human face on the haunting evil technological force that controls the matrix like robert patrick as the shapeshifting terminator in terminator judgement day weaving is more frightening than any monstrous alien or homicidal robot because despite his power and seeming invincibility he looks ordinary even scrawny weaving embodies his role memorably chilling presence the features some truly breathtaking special effects and stylish cinematography it seems be deliberately kitchy stylized fight sequences directed hong kong stunt specialist wo ping that reportedly required months of martial arts training the actors in few scenes the posing and posturing is unintentionally funny just seeing keanu reeves engaging in serious kung fu is bit jarring however the comicbook style and tone of the you can sustain willing disbelief long enough enjoy the ride without losing patience the matrix is not classic its openended and confusing conclusion raises more questions than it answers it fails resolve many of its own plot twists and philosophical questions it also relies on some conventional sentimentality save the hero the kind of shmaltzy feelgood goo that most of the avoids reportedly the producers have high hopes for the being the first in trilogy and have already begun work on the story for the sequel unfortunately audiences deserve little more than vague sense that the story will continue in the future the matrix is an fun enjoyable diversion like big puff of cotton candy at carnival just do not be surprised half an hour later when you still feel little hungry

the deep end uses color palette of rich earth tones surrounded vast array of blues alluring attractive blues but also icy and foreboding after taking in their beauty the eye seeks out the reassuring browns and greens like tired swimmer searching for the safety of land the production works that way as well it pulls you in initially as crisp thoroughlymodern thriller clipped exchanges between defiantly noncommunicative characters but the real draw of the is the submerged humanity of two key players as the deep end gradually reveals the melodramatic core beneath its ironic candy coating spoiler alert the following reveals the basic storyline believe the plot points are incidental because the real rewards come in exploring the mindset of the main characters but still you should proceed at your own risk her husband tom naval officer often away at sea margaret hall tilda swinton holds down the fort taking care of the children beau jonathan tucker paige tamara hope and dylan jordon dorrance while her fatherinlaw jack peter donat hovers in the background always watching the story opens margaret leaving the family home in lake tahoe storm male strip club in reno it seems that beau her eldest is having an affair darby reese josh lucas disreputable sort years his senior margaret demands that darby leave her son alone only have the man smirk at her and announce he will be glad steer clear of beau for back at home she tries talk about it all her son but the kid will not even confirm that he is gay let alone discuss the issues she has his boyfriend he does however get attentive when she reveals darbys offer even as he maintains his sullen demeanor late in the evening darby shows up outside tossing pebbles at beaus window like schoolchild the two meet the water at the boathouse where something important happens will not reveal what suffice say we become aware of significant fact that margaret does not all of this happens in the first few minutes of the movie the way within day or so margarets life becomes even more complicated when suave man named alec goran visnjic turns up an explicit videotape documenting the sex life of beau and darby he and his associate are willing destroy the tape once margaret coughs up oh what is mother do end spoilers written directed and produced scott mcgehee and david siegel suture the deep end is based on elisabeth sanxay holdings novel the blank wall was also the source of the the reckless moment have neither read the book nor seen the movie but understand that the filmmakers changed some details in holdings story the scandalous relationship is between an older man and margarets teenage daughter switching the gender makes the tale seem more contemporary and it also raises questions about margarets motives many reviews of the deep end describe margaret as mother ferociously protecting her son but wonder consider this margaret lives in meticulously kept upscale home her husband is absent most of the time and seems be regarded as largerthanlife figure her fatherinlaw is constantly present almost as if he is monitoring for his son and when her husband does call margaret is careful not tell him about anything disturbing that is going on the family so is margaret mother who accepts her sons sexual orientation and is simply trying shield the young man from lover she fears will take advantage of him or is she caretaker of museum of upper middle class complacency desperate maintain the status quo so that everything will be postcard perfect when the old man returns from the sea you sort it out regardless the resonance of the deep end comes from two actors goran visnjic best known from the tv drama er is striking as blackmailer unlike any you have seen before he engages margaret in mesmerizing dance of protocol chivalry and simmering eroticism but the star of this show without doubt is the remarkable tilda swinton watch the shadings depth resource vitality and understated sexuality she gives margaret and try imagine the without her days after my second viewing of the deep end can still vividly picture her negotiating villains trying connect her son and diving into icy blue water the deep end is an exceptional and tilda swinton is the best part of it

warning may contain some mild spoilers and offensive material rated for sexual content crude and sexual humor and some nudity mild rating starring rob schneider oded fehr eddie griffin arija bareikis amy poehler norm mcdonald running time minutes deuce bigalow male gigolo is simply hilarious goodnatured comedy that may offend some but underneath all it is crude humor and sexual content is sweet little love story that is surprisingly involving it is not any kind of cinematic classic but it is very very funny comedy that keeps us entertained until the end credits themselves are funny too it has all it needs be breezy entertaining comedy the acting is up pace and some of the performances quite funny the screenplay is witty and smart and the whole story is sweet and cute deuce bigalow rob schneider is your typically average guy he cleans fish tanks for living and gets an average of bucks for it though one might call him loser deuce gets job he would never thought he would get he gets clean the tank for male gigolo oded fehr and gets offered watch over his place while he goes on trip trying be like him he hangs upside down from pole and accidentally pushes off the fishtank and burns his cabinets the thing is now he has try and find dollars in three weeks make sure everything looks right again so he decides go manwhoring and his luck gets the oddest people on earth an overweight woman who decidedly wants eat everything in site woman narcolepsy who sleeps all the time woman who has sudden screaming outbursts and woman he cannot stop thinking about he charges but he is willing negotiate from now on he is considered deuce bigalow male gigolo nonstop laughs an abundence of crude humor deuce bigalow male gigolo is sometimes like last years hit there is something about mary that is offensive but very funny the screenplay harris goldberg and rob schneider himself is smart clever and witty screenplay that seems have been written care make is so hilariously funny the characters in the are all actually likable especially jabba lady her big body but soft heart there are actually times in the movie where fell out of my chair laughing so hard that my stomach was killing me even though thought toy story and being john malkovich were the funniest of the year deuce bigalow follows right behind them the directing mike mitchell is fantastic and shows he took time on the rob schneider gives surprisingly endearing performance and when his romance develops one of his customers kate arija bareikis it is sweet romance that we get involved in and actually like being involved in it deuce bigalow is goodnatured worth all the merit it can get its not classic or masterpiece it is just comedy that we do not feel bad about watching sure it may come off as offensive and may come off as dumb sometimes but you cannot deny that it is not funny deuce bigalow male gigolo is no disappointment its fast paced entertaining sweet and hilarious comedy that may be destined become cult classic fans of schneider will not be disappointed and fans of crude but nice comedies will not either for some reason the garnered an rating but no words or extensive use of sexual content or explicit nudity was really wondering why the was a mild put it the least but even if your under or above at least this is good enough for you see do not try be one of those people who make so much of that they do not like it just sit back laugh and enjoy the movie

underrated movies are common reoccurrence in show business today hope floats was extremely underrated and was one of the best movies of the year we always get films that make big money at the boxoffice but critics and audiences pan on them this year double jeopardy is one of those films critics are calling it predictable and worthless audiences are disappointed it and think it was disappointment but as viewed double jeopardy found that it was great movie it has surprising sense of humor and big dose of heart along heartpounding suspense and twists and turns here and there it certainly is really good movie the always wonderful ashley judd plays libby parsons woman seemingly normal life great loving husband beautiful son and great friend her husband nick parsons has made surprise for her and is going buy her the sailboat she has always wanted after night of bliss libby wakes up in the middle of the night find blood all over her and all over the sailboat her husband is missing and there is bloody knife on deck of course being in shock she picks it up and coast guard comes over and sees her however she is not immediately ceased until they find out his life insurance was worth twomillion dollars and they start wonder rather she killed him for the money she pleads notguilty but is found guilty and sent prison for six years while making phone call her best friend who adopted her son for her and she hears him say hi his dad makes libbys heart stop right there she realizes she must get out and prove that he is not dead one of her cellmates tells her that as long as she has been convicted of crime she cannot be convicted of it again means she can shoot him in the middle of mardi gras and they cannot do anything about it after she gets out she goes halfway house run parole officer tommy lee jones he is man who has had his share of bad things while out for the day she breaks into school and tries track down her kid and husband leading up some jawdropping twists that are both predictable and not whatever happens the was excellent me found the writing wellwritten as well as the acting was great ashley judd is such talented and beautiful actress that she is hero in sort in this movie even if you know what is going happen in the end you do not know how this is one of those movies that you really do know what is going happen except you do not know how they are going make it happen it could be one way or another it could be this way or that way the movie is highly stylized and extremely wellmade it gets most of it is power from the two leads ashley judd and tommy lee jones both give excellent performances the characters are wellrealized and believable and we feel libbys pain when she cannot see her child for years even though lot of critics did not like the loved it the director took his time making the movie and put lot of shadowing in the movie found it not be boring at all and it is only flaw comes from some predictability it moved at fast pace has suspense humor heart and great acting it earns it is right be great movie and me that is what it was

as fairy tales go cinderella has be one of the most famous almost everyone knows it well at least in north america so it is natural that someone will try make movie out of it it has been done before varying results this version of the story is both similar the original and different at the same time the basic story remains unchanged but one thing that seems vanish this version and that is all the fantastical elements of the story there is no fairy god mother or anything even remotely of that nature after the fantastical elements are stripped away what is left is realistic believable rendition of the cinderella story and an interesting love story at the least unlike in the fairy tale the prince plays much larger part than just that of the masked ball at the end the prince who happens be the crown prince the throne of france meets cinderella known as danielle on few occasions most coincidentally and he becomes smitten her although this seems be far cry from the traditional story it allows for the main plot proceed enough room for some imaginative story telling the story takes place in renaissance setting in france leonardo da vinci providing some comic relief on more than one occasion this addition of leonardo da vinci was quite successful in that it added some color the movie since some of the roles are bit stereotypical for example the role that was scripted for the prince leaves few things be desired for instance the character seems be bit too unstable and fickle crown prince should not be anything remotely like that especially since he is portrayed be in his mid twenties at the least and almost ready take the throne the characters of danielle cinderella played drew barrymore and that of the evil step mother played anjelica huston are well developed and well played the two women although the part of danielle is bit stretched it is not too unlikely and not totally unbelievable the nuances of the character are brought out well drew barrymore and from watching the movie it seems like she had fun making the movie as contrast the part of the evil step mother is clearly seen from the very beginning and is almost clique but anjelica huston seems add certain flair the role that makes it suit the movie nearly perfectly the actual story is fairly predictable since it is after all the basic story of cinderella but there are more than enough twists in how the story is told make it interesting and enjoyable the acting is of high caliber and seems deserved of praise all in all this movie takes you back into history into seemingly magical fairy land but do not get me wrong there is nothing but reality it is just refreshing watch movie that is not based in familiar setting everyday familiar things happening so although the story is basically familiar the world it is set in is not and that adds dimension the in this humble reviewers opinion makes it worth seeing

it stands as moment one will not soon forget giant green ogre flips through the pages of cliche fairy tale narrating it every bit of dull inspiration that the story holds this leads one believe that this serves as the prologue shrek dreamworks second computer animated feature but in pricelessly hilarious bit of cinema page of this tale serves as that ogres toilet paper from this opening moment one can infer shreks defying of all expectations regarding it as standard disneyesque fairy tale although rampant moments of hilarity dot shrek the true charm of the lies in the bold elements of friendship courage and acceptance excelled outstanding direction stunning actor voice work and most importantly witty screenplay more going on than meets the eye while shrek features an abundance of humor related directly toward adults positive friendship values aimed at younger children fulfill the storyline shrek the previously mentioned ogre holds position of absolute nothingness within his community the jolly green giant meets fellow outsider known only as the donkey his species who talks and although he remains reluctant warm up him for good portion of time shrek eventually comes mutual understanding him acknowledging their common state as outcasts of the world the pair team up retrieve princess fiona from castle guarded dragon for the powerful lord farquaad learning quite bit about each other and themselves along the way their friendship exhibits the core theme of the need for someone lean on exemplifying any child who may witness the that acting as an honest companion can unquestionably affect someone shrek and donkey endure as supposed freaks of nature due only their differences from others but cling each other for support and guidance along their journey courage demonstrates itself within two major storylines along the journey rescue fiona donkeys immeasurable cowardice reveals itself whether he encounters walking over shaky bridge or living alone donkey withholds fears that he continuously puts aside without selfacknowledgment but the yapping donkey must face his phobias when presented the giant firebreathing dragon guarding fiona either he dies from terror or he triumphs courage he wisely chooses courage pretending as if no dangerous situation actually faces him allowing the donkey overcome horror that likely only continued due his insistence of them secondly upon shreks and donkeys redeeming of princess fiona the ogre finds the princess has plans for whomever saves her satisfy her desire for human knight in shining armor throughout this storyline shrek faces his deep perpetual misgivings of inhering as an ogre and struggles determine how he will reveal his true identity fiona an ongoing struggle occurs between himself and his reluctance of the truth but eventually shrek courageously conquers his fear telling the forbidden secret fiona children can realize from donkey and shrek that fear remains only as complicated as one makes it if one sets hisher mind overcoming something in particular endless possibilities exist after the friendships and courage prevail the three central characters at the heart of shrek must take one more stretch of development acceptance surprisingly fiona holds dark secret of her own due spell cast upon her years ago she transforms into an ogre night in this storyline fiona must learn hold acceptance for herself and she must realize what beauty truly means simply act as ones self upon fionas learning of shreks desire pursue relationship her fiona knowing that acceptance of herself serves as the only platform for her love shrek work gives in her inner demons of selfridicule and hatred any child can pull from fionas transformation the meaning of beauty and the meaning of selfacceptance on the technical side shrek triumphs directors adam adamson and vicky jenson pace shrek in consistent and satisfying manner evenly distributing the lessons learned the central characters these central characters spring life thanks brilliant voice work from mike myers shrek eddie murphy donkey and cameron diaz princess fiona myers creates his shrek as lovable and troubled ogre whose green color not only serves as skin color but perhaps his envy of other normal beings murphy succeeds his donkey through recreating the highstrung persona that so many know the actor have off screen cameron diaz exudes charisma and innocence as fiona giving the princessogre sense of power that many female characters in animated films lack while the direction and voice work certainly elevate shrek the ultimate factor in the succeeding lies in the screenplay written ted elliott terry rossio joe stillman and roger h schulman the script never underestimates the intelligence of the viewer combining the three previously spoken of elements humor for adults and children alike capping it off constant tongueincheek feel that pokes fun at classic disney animated features the fresh and entertaining screenplay delivers shrek dreamworks executive jeffrey katzenberg has certainly oneupped himself creating an instant animated classic that will live on for ages come the smaller children will laugh and cheer the adults will laugh even harder and leave understanding much that their children did not that breaks stereotypes and creates definite standard of its own shrek can certainly endure as one for the ages

for movie about discoera excess comes up surprisingly short on the sleazy happenings at the titular late and early manhattan dance club think of it as sort of boogie nights lite where that similarlystructured and set portrayal of the porn industry was loaded salacious goingson and skidded on destructive midpoint tone shift leaves the kinkier details your imagination it never needlessly revels in its seedy subject matter but it thankfully never resorts preaching either in fact were it not for the rampant drug use and the intermittent dark moment would be about as feathery as the time periods popular female hairstyle studio was haven for the rich famous and generally goodlooking before it closed its doors forever in inside anything went and we are told everything did the films fictional main character is shane oshea ryan phillippe the jerky jock from know what you did last summer freshfaced yearold who dreams of venturing beyond the clubs velvet rope and coming facetoface the wild decadence he can only read about in magazines his wish comes true when studio owner steve rubell mike myers spots him amongst crowd of gawkers one night in and permits him passage but not before he doffs his hideous shirt of course once inside shane becomes seduced the clubs dizzying vortex of sex and drugs he has such good time that he does not want leave so he seeks employment as busboy he quickly becomes friends greg breckin meyer and anita salma hayek married couple who work along side of him gregs fellow busboy aspirations make the big money as studio bartender while anita checks coats but desires recording contract call her own after rubbing elbows among other things renowned socialite sela ward and gaining the personal interest of rubell shane begins ascend the upper echelons of but fame does not come without price major shortcomings lie within its handling of the supporting players at slim hourandahalf the is too short take on such multicharacter focus and more than few balls are dropped in the resulting juggling act alleged lastminute edits and reshoots are more than likely blame for the occasionally rushed development and ambiguous interaction since sometimes feels like it is missing scene here or there nowhere is this more apparent than in shanes relationship soap opera actress julie black neve campbell frequent studio patron whom he is long admired from afar the romance is prodded along before it has chance transform into something special that works despite these limitations then is largely due the competence and energy it is assembled sure it is shallow slick sanitized portrait of bygone age and sure we have seen the ragstoriches story gazillions of times but debut director and screenwriter mark christopher keeps things moving lively snapshots of the studio hustle and bustle and an even livelier cast inhabit his bouncy vision the boasts some fine comic creativity the pinnacle of is disco dottie the wedding singer ellen dow an elderly dancing queen who plays the loving grandmother in public but slides up shane behind closed doors and asks for funky little treat the solid sexy cast smooths out if only while you are caught up in the any rough spots belonging their alteregos or the plot newcomer phillippe has the charisma and joisey accent down pat he and campbell as fetching as ever look so good together it is shame their subplot goes nowhere meyer exhibits the congenial appeal that made him delight watch in clueless he was the stoner the jokersmile while hayek simply sizzles especially when leading dance class the mantra one two three attitude sherry stringfield unidentifiable under big hair takes on her first bigscreen gig since she left er as rubells accountant but she is criminally underused as the droopyeyed drugaddled steve rubell myers is worth the price of admission alone when he is not playing the life of the party the ex saturday night live comedian strips away all of rubells confidence and swagger show man desperately trying fill his empty unhappy life exorbitance it is moment worthy of pity when while lounging on bed of money and vomiting from particularly heavy evening he attempts seduce one of his employees and while his performance is largely serious myers mixes the empathy delicate austin powers esque wink thus keeping consistent overall feel gaudy largerthanlife and satisfyingly ornamental not unlike giant disco ball

in an insiders look at scandalridden run for the democratic presidential nomination closely based on clintons campaign was written anonymously former newsweek writer joe klein later claimed true authorship now the book primary colors has been made into movie directed mike nichols and in light of recent presidential scandals seems be more relevant than ever but the is more than diatribe against or paean in praise of the president it is fascinating look at the political machinery and the ethical quagmire that surround modern politics jack stanton john travolta is the governor of small southern state running for the democratic presidential nomination he is charismatic but has several flaws threaten doom his campaign and strains his relationship his wife susan emma thompson the is told from the point of view of henry burton adrian lester grandson of civil rights leader who is swept away stantons ideals and helps organize the campaign he joins political strategist richard jemmons billy bob thornton looking an awful lot like james carville and campaign advisor daisy green maura tierney governor stantons past repeatedly pops up haunt him fact that his chief rival lawrence harris kevin cooney consistently uses his advantage help clean up the stanton campaign jack and susan bring in an old friend libby the dustbuster holden kathy bates the acting throughout primary colors is superb it would be worth seeing the movie for bates wild performance alone she enlivens the atmosphere energy in truly boisterous performance travolta does fair clinton impersonation as governor stanton although his accent does stray little emma thompson delivers strong performance as his suffering wife who cannot let anything show that might hurt the presidential run the problem political movies is that they tend alienate over half of their audience promoting one side or the other or else the movie is vague the point of boredom primary colors treads lightly on this issue though stanton is clearly portrayed as democrat and there are few minor barbs thrown in the way of republicans the movie touches on few actual political issues in fact most of the bad guys are fellow democrats on the same road the white house rather than issues the is primarily concerned about scandals and spin control although the strays into some obviously nonclinton territory it is difficult completely separate it from reality particularly when certain scenes seem highlight the presidents current troubles primary colors chief problem is its length it runs about minutes too long there are some scenes could have easily been cut for example midway through the the candidate gives speech an assembly of laid off machinists the scenes only apparent purpose is establish stantons character has already been done in similar scenes earlier in the the extra length is not long enough nor tiring enough be annoying but it mars an otherwise excellent republicans democrats and political agnostics should all be able find something like in primary colors it is funny and at some times shocking look at the modern political process

this movie was one of the first american films done director paul verhoeven he has done films since then such as basic instict and starship troopers all of his movies have one main thing in common they do not skimp on the violence in verhoeven movie guy does not get shot once in the chest he gets shot many times all over the body robocop takes place in detroit in the future things are pretty bleak the company ocp rules the city an iron fist and is moving in on running the police force peter weller plays cop who goes on mission his partner nancy allen peter weller goes in an empty room alone and gets killed meanwhile ocp has failed demonstration of ed model robot crime fighter someone comes up the idea of having cyborg robocop so they use any parts worth scalvaging from peter weller and make him into the robocop the movie is titled after the plot of this movie generally runs at decent pace it drags bit towards the end robocop wanting finish everybody off but plot twists keep it exciting the acting is bad from weller when he is human but very good when he is robocop nancy allen does decent job this movie does not leave itself open for sequel exactly but they made one anyway enter robocop starring peter weller and nancy allen directed irvin kershner detroit is in more bleak state than it was in the first ocp is trying develop an improved robocop that will be more than match for criminals most of the police force is on strike due ocp taking it over leaving robocop be the police force in the city this is pretty bizaare it has yearold druglord who curses as much as eddie murphy even more violence than the original and some more humor the plot of this movie is pretty large almost too much so there are three or four plot lines weaving around that do not really match up the effects are still decent though this sequel is not more of the same really just darker version robocop dealing more drugs than armed criminals if you liked the first one watch this but be dissapointed so later comes robocop starring nancy allen and robert john burke ocp is now owned large japanese company robocop joins band of rebels counterattack the evil empire mean ocp the japanese send cyborgninja deal robocop among other things this movie is easier follow than the last one means the plot is not quite as crowded this movie is not anything special though just more of robocop blasting things up in more kidfriendly way really not reccomended

eyes wide shut is not the masterpiece many were hoping see in stanley kubricks final but it is an impressive achievement mesmerizing haunting adult psychodrama about marriage fidelity and sex it is stanley kubrick from beginning end consistently exhibiting the auteurs trademark penchant for long continuous takes his unparalleled deftness behind the camera and his uncanny ability extract gorgeous performances from his exhausted cast indeed eyes wide shut attained infamy even before its release for its notoriously laborious shoot kubrick renowned perfectionist reportedly held his cast hostage on the set for nearly year in an uncharacteristic maneuver kubrick cast two bigname stars in the lead roles namely reallife husband and wife tom cruise and nicole kidman they play bill and alice harford volatile couple who during the course of couple nights ponder the validity of the idea that husband and wife must be faithful each other he is an d she is unemployed and we are introduced them as they are getting ready go fancy party at the affair they are both propositioned and both nearly succumb the temptation play around someone else when they return their lavish new york apartment kidman after smoking dash of weed inquires whether her husband had sex two models who approached him during the night he truthfully says that he did not and asks what happened that hungarian guy she was dancing they proceed argue until alice tells her spouse lustful story evidently some time ago she had thing for young naval officer she admits that she was ready give up her whole future bill and their young daughter if this guy wanted her even for one night bill is jolted alices story and we anticipate his reaction but at that moment he gets phone call and has go show his face at the house of justdeceased patient this turns out be the beginning of long and eventful night on the town the daughter of the dead patient hits on him but he wisely turns her down he almost does the dirty deed kindly hooker who approaches him on the street then through series of coincidences he winds up at gothic mansion where ritualistic and frankly creepy orgy takes place costumed people performing various public sex acts on each other erotic dread mounts as cruise who is not supposed be there wonders the spacious halls watching the action until he is discovered be an outsider much hoopla has been raised over the fact that warner bros digitally edited the orgy scene the help of computer they put in cloaked figures block some of the actual sex acts they can still be seen just not in all their glory in order avoid the dreaded nc rating european viewers will see the as kubrick envisioned it roger ebert calls the american version the austin powers version and many others have bashed the alterations am of the potentially controversial opinion that the figures only supplement the scenes mystical atmosphere the first thing one notices about eyes wide shut is how it looks this is an artful distinctively gorgeous production shot in dark moody hues and featuring some elaborate beautiful scenery from the giant mansion used in the films centerpiece the decor at the christmas party the harfords apartment this is always pleasure look at boot great soundtrack makes it more atmospheric still at the core behind the graphic controversial content and unappealing mood this is goodnatured movie that emphasizes the importance of fidelity it looks at sex as almost perfunctory portraying it as unnerving rather than erotic it is something superficial and yet something necessary achieve deeper relationship at the end it seems bills eyes are wide open the special kind of love he and his wife have for each other more meaningful than anything he could ever hope find on the streets of new york kubrick elicits wonderful performances from both cruise and kidman tom is completely convincing as dr harford man who seems guided solely destiny no control of the course his life will take nicole projects quiet intensity as the jittery yet aggressive wife and her performance is stunningly effective she is headed for an oscar nod the movie has some help from similarly strong supporting cast at the head of is directorcumthespian sidney pollock enigmatic and articulate as harfords mysterious friend eyes wide shut is not perfect the last hour could have used slightly more scissorhappy editor and both cruise and kidman are too good looking for me believe that either would have very strong temptation philander still this is an important work from great director and while it may not be on par some of stanley kubricks best it is worthy final complex exploration of jealousy and faithfulness eugene novikov

note some may consider portions of the following text be spoilers be forewarned milos formans first since the illfated valmont columbias the people vs larry flynt is vastly entertaining if not particularly enlightening biopic of hustler publisher and selfmade millionaire larry flynt who became an unlikely champion of freedom of speech rights in the united states in the late and early the unweaves its tale in chronological order we open young and dirtpoor larry flynt and his brother jimmy peddling jars of water in true entrepreneurial spirit out in the rural outback of kentucky cut forward in time where the two flynt brothers now young men are running the struggling hustler gogo clubs in cincinnati the strip clubs are in dire financial state and in lastditch effort salvage the operations flynt decides go print shop and churn out promotional newsletter this evolved into the adult periodical _hustler_ magazine creating larry flynt vast financial empire and the rest is history what sets flynt apart from other publishers is his struggles against those who would have him cease publication of his adult material and who railed and preached against him flynt spent time in incarceration and was paralyzed an assassination attempt and his driven singleminded insistence buck the system and fight for his freedom of expression regardless of personal cost the people vs larry flynt also weaves in the bittersweet story of flynts true love althea leasure whom he meets as dancer in his club and later marries and who devotedly stands alongside him throughout his trials and tribulations considering the serious nature of the films theme the importance of the united states first amendment the people vs larry flynt is surprisingly and wonderfully lighthearted and humourous much of the comedy is elicited from larry flynts outlandish stunts at his courtroom appearances some of his chosen apparel is hilarious and for the most part these elements of the work far better than some of the more dramatic points such as an uninspiring flynt monologue set at free speech rally in front of an enormous american flag dealing the subjectivity of obscenity the films focus is on the flynts many battles over first amendment rights and freedom of speech but the heart of the people vs larry flynt is the touching love story between flynt and althea larry flynt is shown as being occassionally gruff harsh and overtly aggressive his friends and colleagues but althea we see his loving affectionate side there is scene where flynt tenderly takes his ill wife on ride on his wheelchair that is heartbreaking ultimately the emotional power that the hits at its conclusion comes not from his achievements from his battles against censors but from the strength of flynt and altheas love for each other woody harrelson is entirely engaging in what must be certainly careertopping performance as the irrepressible larry flynt harrelson plays flynt the right mixture of outrageousness and confident stubborness make him endearing and entirely sympathetic the audience and very compelling protagonist for the courtney love plays althea leasure in startling turn completely raw and impulsive it is very solid performance brash and naturalistic and love is extremely compelling it is difficult take your eyes off her onscreen and her chemistry harrelson is deadon edward norton as flynts straight levelheaded lawyer is often upstaged his flashier costars in the people vs larry flynt much as his counterpart lawyer alan isaacman was upstaged flynt during many of the courtroom scenes but norton shines in his big scene where he addresses the supreme court in the climactic scene of the one can sense the frustration that nortons character feels when harrelsons freetalking flynt sabotages trial after trial on him openly speaking his mind and this results in heightened emotional punch when nortons isaacman has the opportunity sway the supreme court judges milos forman keeps the moving although it runs over two hours it never drags and his direction of the is very effective eliciting great deal of empathy for subject could be construed some as extremely sordid and unsympathetic there is also great visual technique forman uses indicate the passing of time in one shot is both clever and extremely entertaining two minor quibbles the it certainly seems like the people vs larry flynt is in rush get its main theme flynt battling against authorities and the system for his freedom of speech consequently the first thirty minutes of the introducing and setting up the characters seem unduly rushed perhaps it is merely due the fact that these characters are so interesting but felt it would have worked better if this route was taken in more leisurely fashion it also felt like there was distinctive lack of insight into the inner workings of these characters the clearly shows what flynt althea isaacman and rev jerry faldwell did and on superficial level some of their motivations but it never seemed like one could really understand the characters on deeper level for example why larry flynt was compelled ruth carter stapleton president carters sister be bornagain is mystery me then again perhaps it was him as well these two points do not detract greatly from the the people vs larry flynt is certainly among the very best studioreleased films of and works both as ringing political statement about the importance of freedom of speech and the depths larry flynt would go advance the cause of free expression and as touching love story

until saw the night of the hunter it had been long time since had gasped while watching movie forget the others and the deep end veered toward strained dramatics the night of the hunter is far the scariest movie have seen so far this year even though the movie is nearly years old and there is not drop of blood be seen luckily the night of the hunter charles laughtons first and final directing gig has been restored the ucla and television archive and is being rereleased in october so there is still plenty of time spill your popcorn all over the place robert mitchum stars as harry powell reverend nasty habit of courting and then killing widows for their cash his newest target is young mother willa harper shelley winters whose murderer husband ben peter graves has hidden somewhere powell finds out about the stash and decides court mrs harper after he is released and ben is hanged but finding the money is not easy for powell who must contend his stepchildren billy chapin and sally jane bruce who know where the money is but are not telling the hard part about seeing classic now is the pop culture monster has usually drawn and quartered and then flaunted all the memorable moments thus ruining the spontaneity and adventure when we finally watch it for the first time how many spoofs or salutes the shower scene in psycho have we seen in other movies what about the brilliant baby stroller sequence from battleship potemkin no am not blaming brian de palma entirely for this sampling problem yes there are some visual elements that other directors seem have borrowed from the night of the hunter powells love and hate knuckle tattoos obviously influenced spike lee in do the right thing remember radio raheem and powells black suit black tie and white shirt could have shaped quentin tarantinos early visual style seeing the night of the hunter for the first time was amazed at how much it crackled wicked wit and fright and how much intensity was intact you can now sign me up as president of the robert mitchum fan club he plays the role controlled malice that induces unease every time he appears he is like the senior class president an evil streak if ever need stay awake will just picture him crooning leaning leaning any actor who wants play character touch of evil should study his performance the way rabbinical student studies the torah and credit must be handed out laughton and cinematographer stanley cortez who create series of haunting surreal shadowy images over the rural depressionera backdrop it is testament both men that they are able invigorate what has become hackneyed storyline kids harassed evil guardians sticking the old maxim that we are more scared what we do not see screenwriter and legendary critic james agee does beautiful job giving shape and substance an array of supporting characters the drunk birdie james gleason who is haunted his wife and the spoons evelyn varden and walt spoon whose marriage has become verbal vaudeville act the only lapse is the movies third act when pearl and john run away from home and find home the motherly biblereading mrs cooper lillian gish her showdown powell is memorable battle done dueling hymns however the whole segment feels little rushed and underdone but it is still thrill seeing the queen of the silent era handling shotgun do yourself favor and do not miss this if it comes nearby theater note series of revealing but overlong outtakes preceded the movie the highlights included the legendary laughton who sounds eerily like mr pitt from seinfeld running winters lines mitchum and the adorable tiny bruce having trouble descending coal pile hours more of such footage exists as laughton liked keep the cameras constantly rolling screened as part of the new york festival retrospectives feature story coming soon

jamaica is hot vacation spot the exchange rate encourages delusions of wealth approximately jamaican dollars one american the sea is brilliant blue the air is warm but lacks humidity and as tourism is unfortunately jamaicas biggest trade foreigners enter and leave sense of relaxation life and debt takes brassy look at life inside this impoverished country while normal documentaries take the sally struthers approach of underlying scenes of starving children tearful music this guides the viewer sarcastic voiceover that brings the troubles home without begging tears the surface the voiceover is written acclaimed author jamaica kincaid it guides the audience along tourists journey and the story of the native inhabitants instead of telling you what you are already seeing on screen it quips you do not see what happens after you flush the toilet this engages viewer see and think about devastation instead of merely being told it is there this strong sparse storytelling approach runs throughout the stephanie black is also intelligent in how she chooses disclose the problems faced the locals this is not just another talking head show of people moaning about their horrible lot in life people are interviewed from all sectors of occupation from field factory as well as social theorists and the banking organizations that continue invest in the country the variety of discussion perpetuates compelling internal dialogue any viewer whether they are seeing jamaica for the first time or not of course as can be expected the united states is slammed owing its involvement the international monetary fund and the world bank officials look moronic as they explain why their plans for jamaicas economy will help the country back on its feet but only if they are willing follow the advice word for word the next moment we see why and how each of these initiatives has failed usually due imports being cheaper than local labor or whether or not the soil is appropriate for the next agricultural trend the s is forcing on the citizens admittedly some of the back and forth between the businessminded organizations and the failures they produce gets repetitive but it also drives home the impact ignorance can have on both sides of an international argument but jamaica is not against the united states and this documentary does not accuse the s of being the sole perpetrator of its grief if anything it begs for better understanding of the nature of jamaican society before stepping in change it based on foreign regulations

denzel washington is among the many actors this holiday season give very impressive milestone performances this perhaps may be washingtons very best date he joins matt damon and jim carrey in having the talent this season become his character copying mannerisms and personal styles perfectly his very believable performance makes the long and uninteresting the hurricane much better than it actually is when his rubin hurricane carter feels pain and is tormented racism he creates for the audience great sense of sympathy disgust and maybe even some embarrassment from the fact that this is our very own country that is breaking laws support silly prejudices the horrific true events carter suffered from all of his life are slightly more disturbing and terrifying because they only took place few decades ago the powerful expressions of denzel washington alone as his tortured carter sum up the troubles of racism in americas history he is that amazing the problem the hurricane is that when
